content.value: My stay at the Novotel Darling Harbour was welcoming, satisfying, and untroubled. The conventional reception area was jammed with everyone checking in at the same time. As I waited my turn, I was called to a separate reception area in order to alleviate the line. I was greeted

by an elegant genial middle-aged gentleman who sincerely welcomed me with more than just "Here are your keys." I got the impression this gentleman‚Äôs involvement in the process was an exception, yet it was a gesture to accommodate the advent of tired tourists. I truly felt like an appreciated guest as opposed to little more than a credit card and a signature. My room was appropriately cleaned and prepared each day. The bed was pristine, which is most important to me, with a nicely firm mattress and fluffy pillows. The view from my perfect picture window was beyond belief. When I turned out the lights for the night, I reopened the curtains to an astounding silhouette of a splendiferous sunless skyline. Unfortunately, it is not possible for everyone to be on the harbor side of the hotel, but there simply could not be a more commendable view. Lodging in a fourth-floor room may have been a factor in my very serene sleep. The architectural layout of the hotel allowed me to look out of my door, either up to or down upon impressive vantage points; circular tiers above and beneath. Although, the room was not Avant-guard, the carpet was visibly clean, the furniture was practical, with a table and two chairs near the window serving me well for meals and manuscription. A couch and coffee table were positioned perpendicularly to the window for visitors or a ‚Äúnot ready for bed‚Äù relaxation. A small refrigerator appropriately stocked with water, wine, tonics, and goodie snacks utilized the diminutive open pantry inside the larger closet area. A coffee pot or tea kettle stood by to be percolated or steeped. The other end of the extended closet space kept an iron, ironing board, regular and clip hangers with enough space to organize a several day‚Äôs wardrobe. The small ‚Äúflat-screen‚Äù TV was positioned easily for viewing from most sides of the room. I wish there had been a better selection of television channel offerings, of course one does not travel specifically to watch TV; just saying. The carpark was very convenient for those with automobiles. However, I decided to walk from the City Centre to the Novotel since it was relatively close. I crossed the nearest bridge en route to the hotel and came upon the carpark access. It was precarious finding my way to the main hotel entrance; putting it mildly. For pedestrian-guests who enter by happenstance through the carpark entry, I would suggest more effectual signage that would be more instructive for first timers. When I learned the alternative route over the Pyrmont Bridge, my entr√©e to the hotel, henceforth, was fine. What made the absolute difference for me was the courteous and competent staff that welcomed me. When a problem arose about a prescheduled tour to the breathtaking Blue Mountains, I was immediately assisted by the concierge to correct the ‚Äúpick-up‚Äù error. My transportation to the performance of ‚ÄúMadame Butterfly‚Äù at the Sydney Opera House was courteously prearranged by the hotel staff. Not least of all, was the unerring commission of a driver for an early flight check-in at Mascot Airport. Although Novotel at Darling Harbour‚Äôs location is a high tourist area, it is special to be right on the harbor. The hotel is within walking distance to countless restaurants nearby. There are museums, an aquarium, a zoo; all along the wharf, with bistros, bars, caf√©s, and canteens on the way. You can hire water taxis at certain sites in the harbor. The Sydney Opera house is only a 30-minute walk from the Novotel if you choose, before or after the evening‚Äôs entertainment. You can marvel at the late-night glistening harbor, hear sounds of the water in rhythm with your footsteps. The smells of the sea are palpable. I felt very safe walking around the hotel, even on the darker streets approaching the front entrance. Other people were quietly about. On the two-block walk to the hotel from the bridge, there is a convenient store on the corner; it can be a mite ‚Äúspendy.‚Äù Walk down the block a few yards to the grocery store and save and Australian dollar or two. The Town Hall shopping mall is a 20-minute walk and a more upscale mall is in the Queen Victoria building. Sydney proved to be a banquet of nature, natural harbors, scenic wonders, yet cosmopolitan with blushes of yesteryear. My seamless stay at the Novotel was a befitting respite. The hotel provided the comfort-factor necessary for my energized exploration of New South Wales. I would not hesitate to stay at the Novotel Darling Harbour again.

title.value: Decent hotel in top Sydney location

content.value: The Novotel comes across as a decent hotel, perhaps a little lower by TripAdvisor rating than it probably deserves. Location - Hotel is in a top location where you can access many activities and attractions without needing a taxi - pass the "foot test" - Nearby is a

connected shopping centre with some decent food outlets both economical and upmarket , convenience stores, chemists and so on. - Walking distance to the convention centre (few minutes) - tourist attractions such as an aquarium, maritime museum and more can be found - This is a great location to be based if either visiting for holiday or here on business and appreciate some close by activities when back from work Hotel Itself - Concierge and main restaurant are located on the first floor with decent views and spacious interior design - Breakfast buffet was solid, with a lot of varied choices and a great view of the harbour from most seats. (good range of healthier options) - Front desk service was helpful - Service at breakfast bit below par from top tier hotels who take coffee/tea orders for their barista and clear dishes quickly, Felt more "self-service" from a service point of view. Room - Stayed in a harbour-side room and as you can see from the photo , its a beautiful view - Room was quiet, Decor was modern though not anything wow - Bathroom modern though step in bath/shower not my favourite combination - Amenities a bit below par, no bathrobes or slippers, no complimentary water, mini-bar was not restocked the next day - TV channels come with standard free to air with a mix of pay TV. I found some of the pay TV channels losing signal at time. - As a business traveller, the lack of a dedicated desk/work-space meant using my laptop on the bed. May be worthwhile asking if there are desk options if you need to work during your stay Overall a solid hotel, not necessarily the most premium experience in this location but one where if you are travelling for business it will be comfortable.

title.value: Trevor, Leeanne and kids - Adelaide SA

content.value: Great location, Fantastic staff who were always friendly and willing to go the extra mile. Some special meal requirements were requested in Restaurant and were addressed in person by the Head Chef who really cared about the outcome. Will definitely be back !! Thank you

Excellent Bar, location,and view with good breakfast, expensive parking but considering the location can't complain. However the bathroom still needs a bit of sprucing up doesnt feel like a 4 star. will come again given a chance.

From the moment you walk through the door you know you have made the right decision. Greeted by amazing staff with a smile at reception, lovely upgraded room, and great food at the restaurant why wouldn't stay here. It pays to be a member of the "Accor" group.

item.hotel_name: Little Albion, a Crystalbrook Collection Boutique Hotel

content.value: The moment I set foot in Little Albion I felt a wave of happiness engulf me. If first impressions count this place is a winner. I have stayed in myriad accomodations in Sydney over the years...never finding " the one ". Little Albion will be my main squeeze in future. I adored

the ornate staircase, wide and inviting , and the see- through lift. Lovely touches. Our room was spacious,the staff friendly, knowledgable and loved to engage. The location is hard to top. Surry Hills is my favourite precint in Sydney, full of character and you are spoilt for choice with restaurants and cafes. And finally, what is not to like when Lindt chocolates are freely available in the breakfast/coffee area!

item.hotel_name: Little Albion, a Crystalbrook Collection Boutique Hotel

content.value: My friend and I stayed here while vacationing in Sydney. We loved this cute little boutique hotel. The staff were amazing, so kind and helpful! The continental breakfast was so fresh and delicious. I found myself going to bed at night looking forward to waking up for my
fresh bread and fruit in the morning:) The hotel is very updated and I loved the little details, such as the slippers and cookies in your room at night. You will love staying here!

item.hotel_name: Little Albion, a Crystalbrook Collection Boutique Hotel

content.value: This is a charming little hotel in historic inner city Surry Hills, about a half hour walk from the central CBD area.The building itself is a former convent which has been tastefully renovated with loving attention to detail. The design aesthetic is kind of contemporary art deco

and it's all very attractive. Our room, a King Master, was a reasonable size, cosy, well-appointed and comfortable. The marble bathroom was lovely, with a great rainfall shower and fragrant Molton Brown toiletries. There was absolutely no street noise, which allowed for a good night's sleep. Always a bonus! Hotel rates include a very good continental breakfast: juice, muesli, granola, yoghurt, fresh berries etc. Another great feature which we made use of was the honesty bar, which has a decent selection of spirits, wines, beers and snacks. Overall, staff were pleasant and helpful, the room was lovely, and the public areas comfortable and appealing. I would certainly recommend staying at the Little Albion.

item.hotel_name: Little Albion, a Crystalbrook Collection Boutique Hotel

content.value: Visited Sydney on business and had an overnight stay at Little Albion. It was like I was staying with some friends that I have known for many years. Attention to all the little details were obvious - from the high quality towels to comfy bed and internal finishes. Overall one
of Sydney's best keep secrets when it comes to Acoomodation.

item.hotel_name: Little Albion, a Crystalbrook Collection Boutique Hotel

title.value: Staying for all our Sydney trips!

content.value: Another "Mr & Mrs Smith" listing delivers again!!. Stand-out staff who were a lovely team with loads of customer service skills: genuinely welcoming & friendly, helpful, oodles of common sense, intelligent!. The open bar / snack bar / sweetie shop / trendy caf√© design had

great drinks, excellent tea, quality coffee, best brand snacks, cool design, huge variety, very inviting, trendy and innovative. We enjoyed catching up with guests in the hotel rather than going out in the cold - it was if you were in a lounge / Babington house club. Interiors throughout were great, smart design and everything considered. Rooms might be thought of as on the small side but the great design made it feel spacious. We had loft 404, and it was very comfortable. Great location city wise, parking down the street. We rarely return to the same hotel, however we would definitely be happy to return to The Little Albion. The entire stay was fabulous.

title.value: Comfortable stay just out of the CBD

content.value: We used the hotel's main Web site to book and there is a free promo code on it giving you some benefits which is good. We checked in 4 hours early and our room was ready but maybe just because of time of year? Hotel seems nice enough, our room was on the rear of the building

over looking a school field, noisy during the day but quiet at night. The gardeners decided however to cut the grass at 7.30 am and school activities start quite early so don't expect much of a lay in. Room is very compact and could use some additional shelving or storage especially in the toilet room.The king bed was massive and very comfortable though. Shower is nice and big, almost half the size of the toilet room easily big enough for two. Staff seem friendly and helpful even new staff being trained as we checked in. If you don't mind a short walk from the city and up hill this is a nice little place but not convinced for disabled/ special needs guests.

This is a beautiful old building, nicely decorated, comfortable & clean. It‚Äôs location is perfect for proximity to great restaurants. Rooms are small & basic but comfy. Had the balcony room which was nice but meant it was also quite noisy with road noise in the morning as the

city wakes up. The bathroom is very small with no real room to put your things. There is a bar fridge but no water. They provide validated parking for a park 10 min walk up the road. This is half price so good value. For the price paid ($180 per night), it met expectations.

I‚Äôve stayed with Hotel Challis before I joined TripAdvisor, so this is my first review. It‚Äôs in the best location of Sydney, often referred to as the Parisian area. The staff are always friendly and helpful, and the rooms spacious enough and clean. It‚Äôs a comfortable and
convenient stay.

Great little hotel, rooms were a little smaller then your average hotel chain but more then adequate with a decent sized bed and small little private bathroom. Staff was amazing and friendly. I would stay here again with out hesitation on my next trip to Sydney.

Firstly I must say that all of the staff are friendly, extremely polite and helpful. The rooms are beautifully decorated and kept spotlessly clean. The beds were very comfortable and in the room we had a fridge and tea making facilities. There was also a television and free air

conditioning The bathroom was very modern and roomy. The maids do a wonderful job! The outside of the building could be called "quaint" and retained it's character well. The wifi was always available and free to use in the bedrooms, downstairs in the lounge and terrace. There are restaurants and cafes nearby. The train station is an 8 min walk away but that does not take you directly into the centre of Sydney. Instead we walked each day through the Botanical Gardens which was very pleasant. I would gladly stay here again

Once again the usual high standard of room and facilities at this central Sydney location. Staff are great and the convenience of being so close to everything downtown makes this my preferred short stay location.

The Grace is a favourite hotel of mine whilst in Sydney. Old world charm with contemporary facilities. Service is discreet but always polite and genuinely interested. Location for me is a strong point as my office is only a 100 metres away.

Location is perfect for business or pleasure, style is just right if you like retro grandeur, staff are excellent from start to finish and rooms are just right -- the Grace has never let us down and we will keep returning.

Really can't fault the Grace. Large comfortable room with a blissful bed and amazing shower. The staff were friendly, helpful and efficient. The only small negative is slow wifi. The location is amazing, right in the hub of things and only a short walk to the railway station to
get to other parts of Sydney. We enjoyed the pool and the steamroll and had a great pizza in the Italian place next door. Highly recommend the Grace.

Well located, friendly good services and well priced. Booked for business trip but very relaxing and welcoming. Small hotel that went above and beyond to make our stay pleasant. Parking was convenient and all of the staff were friendly and informative.

title.value: Ideal stop over place, great location.

content.value: Fully enjoyed my stay while on a business trip recently. Excellent room that was very comfortable and the service from the team was top notch. Friendly welcoming front end staff. look forward to my next stay.

Our stay at TheRendezvous was wonderful! The room was clean, the view was gorgeous! The bed and pillows were very comfortable. Any question asked of the staff was responded to quickly and they were very friendly.

The hotel is lovely and right in the heart of the cbd. Most of the cities attractions are walkable. The rooms were bright and cheery and beds firm and comfy. There are plenty of restaurants close by and transport no problem Parking is a little tight for large cars and parking is
expensive.

For a week in Sydney this hotel could not have suited us better. You won't find a better location to enjoy everything the city has to offer whether by bus, metro or on foot. The reception staff were friendly and helpful. The room was clean with a modern shower room. The queen

suite with the kitchenette and sofa was a good size and gave us flexibility to grab breakfast and a couple of evening meal takeaways at our leisure. There are plenty of restaurants and pubs within easy walking distance. Thank you Hotel Stellar for a great week!

title.value: Good value hotel in excellent central location

content.value: The Hotel Stellar is ideal for tourists, as it has a good kitchenette in each of its spacious rooms. Right near the corner of Hyde Park in downtown Sydney, it is well-equipped and has friendly, helpful staff. If you are travelling on business, allow a little extra time to get

to that appointment, as there is only one elevator and it is very slow, especially at peak periods. Tariff is reasonable, and it is handy to buses, trains, supermarket etc. There is no breakfast included, but a fun caf√© in the building does a good job.

Second visit to Zetland and continue to be impressed. The suites are immaculate, clean, comfortable, large, have everything you need for one night or many nights. Really like that the bathroom has a huge cabinet behind the mirror doors so you can store all your toiletries
easily, unlike some places where there is no room and everything falls off the sink area! So close to shops, cafes, restaurants its just so easy. HIghly recommend

Great location as my son lives nearby. Next to golf course too. Fantastic service as staff was so friendly and eager to assist even cleaners! Car park easy to get to. Rooms very big, clean and comfy. Very short walk to shops and eateries.

The location cant be beaten, the hotel itself is fine, although the two rooms we had (204, 304) both had mould in the bathrooms, and the carpets were not that clean. I suspect the bathroom hadnt had a proper clean in some time. We didnt eat at the hotel so cant comment on that,
and the staff were friendly and helpful.

Wonderful staff, great location, a gem of a property but horribly dated rooms, disgusting carpet, mouldy showers with rusted screen hinges. The furniture is very uncomfortable. Overall the rooms are a zero out of five. There is a note that if you don‚Äôt close the shower door
the vapour may set off an alarm which may cost you a fine of $1600 plus GST. Threatening guests with a fine because they are too greedy to renovate the hotel is the ultimate insult.

A great value, quality Hotel. Very central and quiet. Room was spotless and luxurious. Staff could not do enough, a nice change from other properties I have stayed in. Treat yourself to this hotel. Well done Stellar...

I stayed at the Best Western for 1 night. Very good location and staff very friendly. The room was fine and very clean. Many french people (staff, clients), so I felt at home. The only thing is that the place wasn't very well insulated against cold and wind (bathroom window).

Staff were very helpful and we particularly appreciated being allowed an extra hour after normal checkout time. The Croft restaurant provided an excellent meal in a quiet and congenial atmosphere for us and our guests.

We found the location of the Hotel to be really useful for our activities. Public transport is close enough to walk in most conditions and there are generallt Taxis available out front. The shopping centre and restaraunts being so close is great and there is plenty of variety.

We have been staying at Meriton Zetland since they opened and it does not disappoint, it is very well situated convenient for the airport and there is a good shopping center with Coles and a bottle shop a 5 minute walk away. I think that all of the apartments are pretty good but
on this occasion we were given a corner room on a high floor, that is just the best. Nice view, good light, big and airy.

title.value: Great Location, don't stay in one of the Terraces

content.value: We've stayed here before and found the location excellent and rooms very good so thought we'd stay again. We found a great deal as well. We were given a room in one of the Terraces which is right on the street. As we living in inner suburbs the noise didn't bother us and

actually found it quiet at night. However, for the 3 nights, the wifi didn't work (even though the reception staff upgraded us), being old the floor boards squeaked terribly, the fan in the bathroom didn't work and you couldn't open the window (staff are trying to fix it but why the cleaners didn't know beats me). The worst part was the bed. It was a trampoline. Firm without any support and extremely bouncy so each time either of us rolled over or moved it not only woke your partner but yourself. One of the most uncomfortable beds I've slept in. The room was two story, downstairs was the lounge, dining, kitchen and upstairs was the large bedroom, walk through robe and large bathroom. So very spacious. Fix the wifi, change the mattress and fix the fan in the bathroom and i'd give it a higher rating.

A good quality, fairly priced facility, right in the heartland of the most historical place in Sydney. Minutes from some great eateries and also that magnificent harbor. Minutes away from the Sydney ferry hub, Opera house etc.

title.value: Love the place, love the team

content.value: Booked the hotel for our marriage anniversary. Before booking I communicated with other Sydney Central hotels via different booking platforms and did not get much response. I contacted Amora Hotel and they literally hand picked the room my wife and I wanted. It was on the high

floor, corner room with 2 windows. I love the service, details and care of the staff. I have been in travel industry since literally last century and have seen different booking systems, processes and attitudes. This process was not from the contemporary world. There was a person on the other side responding to my calls and emails. Emails were not copy-paste instruction type. When we arrived there was champaign on ice and a happy anniversary card in the room. I knew exactly where and what room we were going to have. It was great first impression that lasted up until the last second of our 5 day stay. As for location, it is probably on of the top ones in Central Sydney. 5-7 min walk to main harbours. Sydney Bridge is just a few hundred steps away. Good restaurants, bars and markets are here. The only down part was the construction that was going on in one of the streets, but the staff recommended the room on the other side of the hotel. I was made aware of the construction at the time of booking.

title.value: Great location but more like a 4 star hotel

content.value: This place was nice but didn't meet my 5 star hotel expectations. The buffet breakfast wasn't as described on the website and the hot food wasn't cooked fresh. The king bed wasn't a true king, just 2 singles pushed together, which is uncomfortable to sleep on. A good 4 star
hotel.

We decided on an overnight stay at the Amora to treat the kids, we were not disappointed in this fine hotel. From the start when the people on the doors greet you to the cleaners who have a smile and ask if you need anything else for your room. The kids loved the indoor pool

and spa. My wife wished she had the chance to take a massage at the onsite day spa but time didnt agree. Good choice of food for room service, good to see kids menu as alot of other hotels dont. The location is great a 5 min walk to circular quay. Was beyond what we had hoped for. Well done.

title.value: Great Hotel, Well worth the money

content.value: Great hotel, Great Location, will definetly stay again! Massive rooms which were absoulety spotless, staff couldnt do enough to help us. Best hotel i have stayed in in the CBD in a long time. Beds were so comfortable i wish i had one at home!

room is big, well equipped kitchen and simple good breakfast the daily housekeeping service is good. They change bedsheet every 3 nights. next restaurant just next door - italian food. happy friendly and jovial waiters. can walk everywhere to good shopping and food.

Travelling as a family of 5 can sometimes be tricky, but the Hyde Park had great rooms that slept all of us. Bonus of a well-equipped kitchenette, complimentary laundry room and really helpful staff! Very convenient for all of Sydney's sights, and close to transport networks.

Myself and Reena stayed here for 3 nights in July. This place is clean with comfortable beds, no mold in the shower, first class linen and a great view over Hyde Park. Room has a balcony so we didn't feel hemmed in. The room felt open and airy and had a small kitchen. with all

of the amenities. Its just across the road from Museum train Station ($17 ea fare and a 10 minute or so ride from the airport))The front office staff were friendly and welcoming. Reading some of the reviews here, I fail to understand how some people weren't happy and gave a moaning review. I guess that they may not be happy in life either. We went in with a smile, got a smile back and left with a smile. For dinner we walked a block up Elizabeth Street to the Crown Hotel. Cheap and well presented meals. We will now use Hyde Park Inn as our regular base when we come to Sydney. We highly recommend it. Oh! and the only niggle was that very occasionally we could hear the plumbing which sounded like someone dragging furniture in the next room but it was occasional, lasting for about 5 seconds at a time but was infrequent enough not to worry us.

Clean comfortable beds, room cleaned daily. Balcony view over Hyde Park. Buses at the door Museum Station across the road or around the corner down the escalator. Everything you could want is in easy walking. Breakfast light was included, fresh fruit juice, bread to toast, jams

etc fruit, milk fresh every day. shampoo in the shower supplied and soap dispenser. Staff at the front desk were smiling and very helpful. Complimentary washer and driers available which was great to have clean clothes after travelling. I really enjoyed our stay here and will stay again and recommend it to my friends.

Our group of nine stayed here for one night, Two rooms for multiple guests.. Rooms were well set out and bedding was comfortable. Breakfast was supplied and in refrigerator a light Continental breakfast supplied. Front desk staff were easy to talk to and gave advice without

hesitation. A short ten minute walk and in shopping area. Directly opposite Anzac Memorial and park. Great for photos or just a visit. Museum underground station is 3 minutes walk away . Purchase Opal Cards for travel. Prices are very cheap. Can get to Cruise terminal very quickly.

I stayed only one night. Very clean environment, friendly staff, been next to Sydney central it is more easy for the interstate travellers by train. Only issue I had was the doonas that supply couldn‚Äôt use. Might be they use different chemical to clean it.

I‚Äôve done a ton of traveling and this is one of the best hostels I‚Äôve ever been to. We stayed in a 10 bed dorm room and the room was spacious and clean with sockets, strong WiFi and lamps. The building throughout has everything you need to have a great stay in Sydney. The

events they hold are second to none, with something going on every morning and evening. There was a time I attended an event by myself and two staff members, Katie and Janine made sure I felt welcome and included with the nights events, couldn‚Äôt speak more highly of all the staff in general. 10/10 would recommend.

I ended up deciding to leave family friends staying outside of Sydney and decided on this hostel and everyone checking me in was extremely nice and thoughtful but I was nervous about not knowing anyone and a young girl named Rebecca made me so comfortable and made my

accommodation memorable. Especially for being alone she made me a lot less nervous about everything and became a friendly face around the lobby area!! Would come back solely because of the experience that she gave me, very hard working.

Perfect hostel in Sydney, next to the central station. The promoting team is amazing, especially Rebecca brings people together. Wakeup has a lot of events and you never get bored. Very good to socialize.

I‚Äôve been staying at WakeUp awhile now and my overall experience has been amazing. The reception crew (especially Meehna) have been exceptional, they are always willing to help anyone out and always go the extra mile. Meehna has always made me feel welcome at WakeUp and has
really made my solo travelling experience one to remember.

Currently staying at the Park Royal Darling Harbour. Despite advertising that they have a mini bar in the room, I have an empty fridge. Apparently I have to phone room service if I want something. I am then expected to pay for what I order, despite the fact that I might not
want to consume the full amount. Never experineced this before in a "5 star" hotel. By the way, paying $350/night for the priveledge.

Stayed in a darling harbour view room for one night prior to going on a cruise. Had a quiet clean room with excellent beds and pillows. The buffet breakfast is really good and can be added onto the rate . Location is a stones throw to darling harbour and a short stroll to major

city attractions such as the Queen Victoria building/quality shops. There is a reasonably priced room service menu which is always handy if you do not wish to venture out. Service by the concierge was great. When asking directions they gave us a map and explained directions as well as offering free bottled water because it was a hot day. There is also a 24 hour convenience store nearby. Highly recommended .

title.value: Parkroyal Sydney not up to scratch

content.value: It's becoming tired - the desk staff are indifferent; the exec rooms are getting shabby; things don't work properly (no hot water for morning shower is very 3rd world); and a late check-out was declined despite an offer of payment due to being "fully booked" i.e. yet another
budget tour, which really says all you need to know about this place....AVOID!!

title.value: Great location, good family feel, great customer service. Great smiles from all hotel staff.

content.value: 400 m to QVB, valet parking excellent best I've had. Porters and service desk, buffet and housekeeping all excellent. Wow an omelette chef! Got him to make me a Chinese omelette (different from others)

Friendly happy staff provided great service for a reasonable price. Excellent location easy access to Darling Harbour China town and surrounding attractions. Surprised my mum with a bottle of bubbles and cake as it was her birthday , nice touch, much appreciated :) only
negative was no water in room but once requested was provided no problem .

item.hotel_name: West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton

title.value: It's Does The Job, But Does Not Stand Out

content.value: I'll be really honest with you, this is a hard review to write. It's hard because whilst the hotel is new, in a great location (if being near Darling Harbour and the Northern end of the business district is important to you), its clean, has comfortable amenities, and has a

certain charm to its design, that is where it sort of ends. There isn't anything that stands out about the property, and that is a real shame. I've read some of the other reviews to make sure I wasn't missing something. Sometimes staff members have bad days, and sometimes you end up with an average room (even as an Honours elite member), but everything I've read all seems to add up: The service is inconsistent, the rooms are tiny, those bathroom doors are plain weird, and there isn't a whole lot to say this hotel deserves the 'Curio' branding. I look at Curio and M Gallery by Sofitel as kind of the same thing. If this were an M Gallery there'd be a quirk, a signature service, a very cool 'speakeasy' style bar concept that does happy hour, something that doesn't make it feel like an upscale Holiday Inn, which I'm really sorry to say this does. Front desk staff should get more training. They should also wear name badges (seriously?), and be more welcoming. We stayed on a quiet Sunday night when nothing else was open at that end of town and we felt like we were kind of intruding on the team. Look, you won't want to walk out in despair. This is a perfectly good standard hotel that should largely be viewed as an overnight business hotel. I wouldn't recommend it for families or luxe weekend getaways but it is absolutely fine. I'm staying again next week, so it can't be all that bad, right? :)

item.hotel_name: West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton

content.value: I stayed here a couple of times in one week and enjoyed this hotel. I normally stay at the Hilton Sydney, and am pretty loyal to Hilton hotels over many years, so thought I would give the West Hotel Curio a go. The design/style of the hotel is really excellent. All areas of the

hotel are really ascetically pleasing, and the rooms while small, are really comfortable and stylish. So I enjoyed my stays here and will definitely be back. As it is a Hilton family hotel, the staff are well trained, and service is good. It is a very pleasant and comfortable hotel to stay in. I haven't previously stayed in this part of town, and found it interesting, The Rocks and Quay are within walking distance, and immediately around the hotel are a lot of shops, bars, restaurants & mini super markets, so it is convenient for travellers. From Wynyard train station is quite manageable with a suitcase with wheels - as long as you don't have a lot of luggage. I wouldn't really expect to get a view from rooms at this hotel --- except perhaps for some rooms in the suite spot gap on the Barangaroo side. The hotel is only 8 floors and all the buildings nearby are much taller.... So if I was staying again I would just book the Atrium or Banksia -- not the other room types. While I really like this property, and will be back because I enjoyed the hotel and like a change, I still think the Hilton Sydney probably offers more amenity at a similar price, and as that hotel starts on level 20 all the rooms will have better views. For Gold or Diamond members the Hilton Sydney has an executive lounge, and you would get a minimum of a Deluxe room which has a bath tub also. Suites at Hilton Sydney are also better value as they are normally on a corner, larger, and include executive lounge access for a similar price to the West Hotel Curio suites. So I will probably still chose Hilton Sydney as my go to hotel, but will be back to the Curio also as it is a very enjoyable and a refreshing change.

item.hotel_name: West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton

content.value: Very convenient to Darling Harbor, extremely helpful staff from check-in, to housekeeping, to the restaurant. Everyone was friendly and went out of their way to be helpful. When our son lost his stuffed animal on our vacation and we had it shipped back to this hotel where we

would be at the end of our trip, they ensured it was in our room when we checked in. The staff make this an excellent hotel and the location makes it convenient for exploring Darling Harbor, the Rocks and Circular Quay.

title.value: Great hotel, great location, great room

content.value: We loved our 5 nights stay at the Old Clare Hotel. Great location; station around the corner, Spice Alley across the road. Nicely decorated, very roomy Chippendale loft with great bathroom. Excellent breakfast at the A1 Canteen across the road. Good lively bar in the Old Clare
in the evening. Very friendly staff.

item.hotel_name: West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton

content.value: Small Boutique Hotel close to King Street Wharf with handy parking station directly across the road. Staff were very friendly and accommodating. Rooms were clean and comfortable. We were a little worried when we realised we were on 2nd floor close to street level that we were

going to hear the traffic on street but were pleasantly surprised that we heard nothing from outside. Beds and pillows were so comfortable. Breakfast was lovely, still disappointing that hotels in Australia haven‚Äôt caught up to including barista coffee in breakfast and charging $5 for a tiny mocha which is gone in one mouthful. That is my only gripe. We would stay here again definitely.

title.value: What you book, may not be what you get

content.value: I had such grand expectations for The Old Clare. Unfortunately, it appears I didn‚Äôt have the same experience as others. I booked the Clare Suite... from the pictures it is a light-filled room with brick walls and wood floors. My weird and sparse loft with green carpeting has

none of the warmth or charm I paid for. To the manager‚Äôs credit, he told me people hate this room, but it was the only one left in that category. (They are recategorizing the room to a lower class next month. I‚Äôm not sure why that intel was supposed to make me feel better.) He showed me another suite, but that was simply a larger loft with the same green carpeting. I opted for less astroturf, than more. As a very frequent traveler and a Marriott Ambassador Elite, the experience is disappointing. I‚Äôm here for three nights, so at least I won‚Äôt be compelled to stay in my room... rather I‚Äôll explore Sydney instead.

title.value: The Old Clare is a nice hotel!

content.value: We stayed at the Old Clare Hotel for 3 nights. Check in was really quick. The room was kind of cozy with 3 people and large suitcases, but we managed fine. The beds were really comfy, there is hardly and noise from neighbours or the streets. Bathroom had a nice rainshower and
was comfy and spacious. The door does not close completely so you all must be family. Lots of places nearby to eat, so all in all a good experience.

Have stayed before this trip and have already booked another stay In October. The bed is very comfortable, the apartment is spacious and well furnished. Location is excellent, within walking distance of everything Coogee has to offer.

item.hotel_name: West Hotel Sydney, Curio Collection by Hilton

title.value: New digs close to Barangaroo and the wonderful precinct

content.value: This property has some serious appeal. The glossy prisms adorning the facade lend it a very NY air to a street crying out for a revamp. The shiny Barangaroo precinct next door appears to have inspired the area to lift its game. Sauntering into the dimly lit Solander bar i found

it filled with a Mad Men-sequel crowd, winding down over martini‚Äôs. Its foyer is a botanical oasis making you forget you‚Äôre so close to the hubbub.. the stand-alone bathtub in our suite is irresistible. After dropping our bags we hit the streets around Barangaroo for a late night feed. Its 8.45pm on a rainy night and the main drag of eateries is heaving with activity. This is a pocket of Sydney that has gone from zero to 100 overnight. We take a seat at a Anason, a Turkish restaurant with an imaginative menu. No need for a taxi, its a five-minute stroll along the wharf back to the hotel and we need the exercise after that meal. Breakfast is amazing and plentiful.

The suits are perfect for business travel, or an extended holiday in Sydney. Spacious enough to instantly feel at home and not cramped into a hotel room. Cooking, cleaning bathing facilities were all perfect and ability to use the gym and pool a plus!

My husband and I stayed in a Clare Room for my birthday celebrations. We normally stay at the QT so had high expectations and The Old Clare exceeded those. The location was great being slightly out of the city and the room itself was fantastic. Will definitely be returning.

A shame such a great hotel otherwise lets itself down with exorbitant mini bar prices.We all expect to pay over the odds but $9.14 for one cookie that wholesales for <$2 is beyond the pale. Yes, I should have checked the price before eating. The kicker though was the 1.6% added

to the $9 for paying by Visa. They're allowed to pass on the reasonable costs of payment by credit card but no way they're paying the bank 1.6% for every Visa transaction. The money doesn't matter, just hate being ripped off.

title.value: A Perfect base to explore Coogee

content.value: Close to shops, close to beach, close to eating places - just a great place to chill out and wander Rooms are Adina are exceptionally well fitted out to make you feel more than comfortable Just a prefect base to explore wonderful beach side Coogee

Had a lovely 5 night stay here. Clean room, staff were great. Best part was being a few hundred metres from the beach and all the cafes and restaurants at your doorstep. Never been to Coogee before would be happy to stay here again next trip.

title.value: Excellent stay at Meriton Suites Pitt St Sydney.

content.value: We stay in the 2-bed apartment. The apartment was spacious and immaculate, with awesome city view. Location is perfect, convenient for both shopping and going around the city as it‚Äôs only 5min walk to the town hall station. Meriton staff are very helpful during our stay,
most notably Raisa and Kieran.

Room did not look as portrayed in Booking.com. The room looked a little dated, but still nice and cosy in our opinion. Was disappointed with the housekeeping standards. Although they came everyday, each day is an express service. Floors were not cleaned, tables were not tidied.
Kitchen not wiped down. They basically only made the bed and changed the towels. We asked for a higher floor but our request was not granted unfortunately.

Partially satisfactory. Need to tailor Adina Apartment's service much more to individual Guest profiles & Needs. A number of issues like frequency of garbage removal and cleaning were quite poor & car parking was frankly a bit out of control. It seems very poor value

proposition for a guest to be paying a daily parking tariff then get home late from a work shift and find literally no places available in the guest car park and parking spaces in that area sold-off to commercial users with dedicated/reserved spots with signs hanging on them. You really need to fix this issue.

Great location, friendly and helpful staff. Handy to cafe's and grocer and transport. Close to a variety of walking options. The refurbished rooms, colour schemes look fresh and modern. Currently work being done on footpaths (widened) and roads. Widened footpaths will benefit
cafe patrons and pedestrians.

Very friendly front desk staff on arrival. Easy check out. Housekeepers very courteous and.. prompt when contacted , we needed extra towels. Good value for money. Central position to all venues, restaurants, shopping

title.value: Good option for a group of friends or family members

content.value: The hotel is clean, the counter staff is super nice and the room is really spacious. Marvellous location as it's quite near the Town Hall Station, and there are shopping malls, restaurants etc. in the vicinity. What I would like to suggest for the management to consider is my

concern on the security measures. During my stay, there were people smoking just outside the sole entrance of the hotel (near the sliding doors), maybe waiting for their friends. I saw several times that groups of friends were following the guests to the hotel rooms. I didn't see if there was / were staff looking after the lobby and the entrance areas. It may be good if there is one. Somebody knobbed my door one night, saying that it's room service but I didn't request. There was no peep-hole / spy-hole or some sort of anti-theft lock on the door. I was really hesitated ‚Ä¶.. After I opened the door, it's found that the staff had wrongly sent a blanket to me.

Well if you are contemplating staying at Meriton LUXURY SUITES in Sydney...reconsider!!! We stayed for 4 nights in a horrible sub standard accommodation with sub standard service....you can tell these were built on the cheap with finishing absolutely rubbish...b‚Äôroom flooding

every time you have a shower.... shower head facing shower door!! Express service!!!! Never seen this in any other accommodation!!! Anyhow crappy crappy place to stay and should not be promoted as LUXURY SUTES...

Excellent location for easy travel around the city. Short walk to good eating at Darling Harbour and China Town. The staff are very efficient and helpful and the units are well maintained and the room service is spot on

I had an amazing weekend in Sydney's CBD and one of the best parts was the view from the suite. it looked over the city and the water with a great sunset and then the lights of the city. Couldn't have asked for a better place to stay.

Absolutely fantastic lovely staff fantastic room 10 out of 10 for everything foom very clean fallacies great bed great beiw was fantastic we also used the parking and the pool and spa would highly recommend it to anyone

Fantastic spot. Felt secure for girls trip, and the service was wonderful. Two bedrooms and bathrooms terrific for two sisters. Very close to everything you‚Äôd need, and everything is clean and easy. Recommend

title.value: Luxury with a touch of home

content.value: First time I stayed with the hotel and they blew my mind. The staff gave us the biggest welcome I have ever seen. The cheese platter and wine on arrival was magnificent, the cheese was so fresh and best cheese board I have ever had at a hotel. Sitting on the roof top with the

board and wine looking at the harbour bridge and circular quay was a great way to end the day. The prices on alcoholic beverages where a little high, but it is Sydney after all. The rooms nice size and great to be able to open windows to get fresh air. It was cold on our stay and was nice to walk into a warm room. We used shared bathrooms and found the 1 st floor a little small, but the second floor bathroom very spacious. Having the elevator to all levels was ideal for us as I have a spinel injury and hubby bad knees. Although there are a lot of stairs through the hotel maze, which just adds to the character. But I would not recommend the hotel to people with serious disabilities as you do need to navigate stairs. The staff were very helpful with our bags and arranged pick up transfers for us to airport and the man that does the transfer service so friendly especially at 5am. The beds where very comfy for us two and sleepy like a baby. I am a psychic and had a encounter in the push bar and in our first room, room 12. Very pleasant experience too from the spirit family that visited. - [ ] The Russell hotel 4th August 2019. - [ ] Room 12- [ ] Had a visit from:- ] Mary-Ann - [ ] Mary-Lou - [ ] Joanne - [ ] Other names given which I suspect are surnames: - [ ] Revesby and Appleby - [ ] Visions: - [ ] Mary-Lou : most clearest and pro dominant. - [ ] Teenage years - [ ] Brown Curley wavy brown hair - [ ] Middle class - [ ] Bonet with ribbon - [ ] Brown eyes - [ ] Was a person who looked over others in her family and worked as a seamstress with a younger sister. - [ ] Was shown a small family with a female with similar wavy curly hair although blonde and was looking over all the girls like a big mother or sister. No males present. Possibly was allowing these woman to board, but got the impression family. - [ ] Mary- Lou : I believe to be the younger sister of Mary-Ann. Very similar features but blue eyes. Never really wanted to show herself, just wanted to be acknowledged. Was too busy seaming and worried about getting in trouble for not getting it done. Was not very happy, sort of sad. - [ ] Joanne: did not wish to show herself, just wanted to make sure everyone was doing what they where supposed to do. - [ ] The push bar: when sitting there was given a message from spirit saying murders. Two murders. - [ ] 1906 & 1919

This hotel is great. We caught a tour at the Holiday Inn down the street during our stay, and it was mucher finer, much sleeker, and much colder. This charming little hotel harkens back to the days when the Rocks had an edge. A real hotel for real people. Made our experience
in Sydney all the better.

There is nothing I like more than an old pub. This little gem has been renovated without losing any of the old charm. The room was clean and very comfortable. The wine bar downstairs a fantastic place for a nightcap. Can not wait to go back.

This was a return stay for me. After a late night at the Drama Theatre, it was an easy walk around the quay to find a warm room, chocolates on the bed and a hot shower. Bliss. Cold windy night outside- but I'm cocooned in a white doona. Great breakfast next morning then a ferry
ride home. I adore The Russell.

LOVED the Russell Hotel! Stayed in 3 different suites during my 8 night stay, all charming & unique. Location is fab! Took train from airport to Circular Quay and walked about a block to this hotel, smack in the middle of the cool Rocks area. The Sydney Harbour Bridge, Opera

House are practically right out the front door. Morning walks along Barangaroo were wonderful. This low key, quaint hotel has that bed and breakfast type feel. The best part was the stellar staff! Gary, Maxine & Arlene felt like family by the time I finally checked out. Will for sure be back.

title.value: The best location and great service

content.value: My husband and I have been staying at Novotel Darling Harbour many times. We always enjoy staying here because staffs were friendly and look after me so well. Especially I‚Äôm an accor plus Gold Member, I can get free parking st the hotel. Thank you so much,

title.value: Delicious food, warm and welcoming atmosphere, amazing service!!

content.value: We have celebrated my 38th birthday at the restaurant and all the staff members looked after really well. Specially Danda and Gurpreet they treated us beautifully and Chef Kibok cooked us amazing food. The service is exceptional and the food absolutely delicious. I would

I would like to thank Josh for organising the most amazing room with a spectacular view. Josh left a lovely welcome card and beautiful bottle of wine, thank you Josh, that was so nice of you. From the moment I arrived I was treated beautifully. Andrew is one of the most

title.value: Central to Darling Harbour and CBD

content.value: Attended a conference at Darling Harbour, and the organisers put me up in the Novotel. It was a pleasant experience and the room was very comfortable and spotless. The hotel was quiet and the sleep quality was very good. Even though this was midweek, there did not seem to be

Unfortunately only stayed for one night (quick work trip) however I was very impressed with all aspects of this hotel.Staff were all really friendly, from check in to concierge , housekeeping and the bar. Had a couple of drinks on a Thursday night at the bar, which is really

item.hotel_name: Q Station Sydney Harbour National Park Hotel

content.value: We were at the Q Station for my fianc√©e birthday. We stayed in the Retreat Cabins in the Isolation Precinct. Great part of the Q. We had booked Friday and Saturday nights to ensure full appreciation of the history of the location. It was eerie and we did a ghost tour Saturday
evening which was great. The guide had great knowledge of the Q as well as spooky ghost stories which left us wondering.... Totally recommend staying at the Q and taking a ghost tour.

item.hotel_name: Q Station Sydney Harbour National Park Hotel

title.value: Ghost tour great views and fantastic food.

content.value: 9 friends, 5 rooms, 2 nights 3days. We caught public transport from home to circular quay, ferry to manly and bus to Q station. What a beautiful place, very friendly staff , heritage buildings, views of the harbour. 1st day we ate lunch at manly and stocked up on refreshments.

Check in was good and a minibus takes you to your accommodation. Rooms are great we chose with ensuite. They had put us together at one end of the building so we could gather as a group on the verandah, enjoy the sun , sunset friends and some refreshments. Dinner was pizza ordered from manly and delivered to our room. Day 2 was a walk around the grounds, explored the museum,had our unlimited free tea/coffee from the barrister. That night we had drinks and dinner at the boiler house, followed by a ghost tour. I've eaten all over the world in many good restaurants but this one surprised me, the meal was fantastic with every dish varied and if such high quality. As a person who has trouble knowing my own spirit, I didn't have any ghost encounters but the tour guide was enthusiastic, maybe too many stories of why happened last tour last week.the history side of the tour was very interesting. Back to the rooms for to finish of our supply of refreshments. 3rd day we walked north head, viewed a whale in the distance. Check out was easy as our ghost and VIP package included all drinks consumed the night before. Bus to manly and a walk to shelly beach, finished of the long weekend before the ferry and train home. I loved the q station, and the boiler house restaurant. What a gem of a place.

item.hotel_name: Q Station Sydney Harbour National Park Hotel

content.value: This hotel is a rare chance to be part of Sydney's past, representative of the historical time when people were quarantined - except the rooms are comfy and modern, service friendly and professional, and the Boilerhouse Restaurant is wonderful. A true one-off experience not to
be missed.

item.hotel_name: Q Station Sydney Harbour National Park Hotel

content.value: What an amazing treasure on the north side of the city. Heritage cottages scattered across a beautiful property, full of history and amazing views. Perfect for couples, families or groups. Great food options and property tours, likely to have something to please everyone. Staff
were also extremely polite and helpful.

item.hotel_name: Q Station Sydney Harbour National Park Hotel

content.value: We spent 2 nights at the Q Station which coincided with a Christmas in July put on by Manly Spirits Co and we could not have asked for a better time as a short break. The surrounding was magnificent and the weather made it so enjoyable. We had previously done a ghost tour in

summer and this time came back to stay and did a smaller tour in the daylight. Accommodation was excellent with clean and spacious rooms that had a view towards Balmoral Beach and Sydney Harbour. You can either do nothing or we caught the ferry to Manly and walked back via North Head - somewhere we had never been before - where we ran into an Echinda near one of the Quarantine Station's old cemeteries. Recommend this as a short break if you like the bush to sit on your balcony watching the boats on the harbour or to be more active as we were and explore some of the natural beauty that was right on our doorstep as Sydneysiders. Breakfast was included and was excellent and fresh with a good variety, most of what you would expect at a hotel breakfast buffet.

The facilities in our 1 bedroom apartment were excellent, apart from very obvious mould in the shower cubicle that has clearly been there for awhile and an air con unit in the bedroom that refused to work on a higher temp. Otherwise it was very comfortable - beautiful soft

The units are spacious and well set up for two people. Clean and comfortable with good house keeping and front desk service. Close to shops and cafes for shopping to eat in the room or the cafes fora nice breakfast...

Well located to shopping & the city is just a 10min ride with Uber/Ola. Nice studio appartment, well equiped with all you need for a relaxing stay. Very good security with undergoud parking and attentive staff. Not 5 star, but neither is the price. Will be back again 4/5 stars

Booked via their website. All fine and easy. Warm and friendly communication with Andrea and Fenda before we arrived to make sure that the apt. is prepared as needed. Room: No. 4 Lotus suite. Very nice: It is good for a family of four. The two beds in the alcove are good for

people <1,80m. My teenage son was happy with it. There is a small kitchen in the apt. with dining place. We didn't used it. All was clean and tidy. Bondi beach house is a house in a nice and quiet neighborhood, divided in several rooms and small apartments. There is a central area (kitchen, large dining room) for all guests, self-serving. Arrival and departure: We just walked in late evening, found our key and the welcome letter in the entrance hall. All was prepared. Same for departure: We left the key and walked away. Location: Very close to Bondi beach. Quiet. Bus is very close. Restaurants, cafes easy to find. Breakfast: Self-serving. Fresh eggs, milk, toast, cereals, juice, coffee and a nice selection of yogurt, jam, cereals and teas are available. We enjoyed every morning, sitting at the wonderful decorated room, meeting other guests. Overall: Fantastic place to stay. The house is well decorated, maintained and serviced. We liked every bit. And we will come back!

Hotel: Needs a makeover Other guests: Chinese guests seems to flock here Staff: ‚ÄúMy life sucks‚Äù culture Rooms: Completely worn down and very gross and dirty. Breakfast: very good!... except the amount of frustrated Chinese people that couldn‚Äôt find their rice and ended up
eating jut eggs Price: Way to high, compared to standard. And they charge extra for a lot of stuff. Location: Ok, had a rental so didn‚Äôt matter

Overall, it was a lovely apartment - everything you could need. However, the window in the twin bedroom could not be locked. I was very uncomfortable with this as I kept hearing noises at night and was up several times every night, checking that the kids were okay.

Great location- cleanliness not so great as pillows had hair on them which tells me that the pillow slips where not changed - room smelt of cooking from last guest so a bit of deoderizing would not have gone astray - they also charge parking for guests.

title.value: Best please in Sydney to stay by the bondi beach community

content.value: I had a great time at the bondi beach house. I highly recommend it. Great please to access and beach for run, surf and swim, easy access to public transport, and lots of restaurants and caffe option as well as very close to yoga studios

We stayed at Bondi Beach House visiting the Bondi Feast fringe festival. The accommodation was conveniently located near public transport and Bondi attractions, but quiet and comfortable. The managers were very helpful and every detail was thought of and every need accommodated.
The Frangipani was a lovely downstairs room with an ensuite and a small closed-in verandah opening onto a leafy courtyard. Home made jams with breakfast in the back garden were an unexpected treat.

Great location, walking distance to Central Station. Quiet. Spacious room. Great swimming pool, spa and sauna. Very friendly and helpful staff. Breakfast was great with plenty of variety to choose from

Ridges central is a very central place to stay! Close to central train station, close to 7eleven, Woolworths and the brewery next door! The rooms are very modern and spacious, noisy at times but we always ask for a quiet room which is very quiet.

This was a family visit with two teenagers. The location is amazing - we walked everywhere. We had the Palm View Suite and it was very comfortable with a sunroom for the children. Each morning the sun streamed in and the room was bright and warm (it was winter outside). The

communal kitchen was great and we met some lovely travellers. Fenda and Anthea are lovely helpful hosts. The house itself is beautiful with interesting works of art and a beautiful garden with two courtyards for relaxing outside.

title.value: The best beach house in Bondi

content.value: I am conflicted writing this review because if it leads to more guests at Bondi Beach House then maybe we may not be able to secure our next booking when we want to ! Be that as it may, this place that to be shared. 1. You must want to stay in Bondi. 2. You are looking for an

Australian beach house experience. If you tick yes to both these then look no further than the Bondi Beach House. It is short walk to the main beach front strip of Bondi and from there all of Bondi is within easy walking distance, the beach, restaurants, cafes, shops, the lot The longer majestic coastal walks , both north and south, begin and end here too. The accommodation is spotlessly clean and full of Aussie beach side character. It is not an impersonal 5 star hotel but an intimate personal home of your own for as long as you stay. All I can conclude is check out their website and book. We have been there twice within the past 6 months and will be there again. Maybe I will see you ?

title.value: To many side charges not explained when booking in

content.value: Our accommodation booking included breakfast and the second day we were charged for the breakfast and did not realise till we arrived home and noticed it on the bill. My wife left early to visit her mother and told desk staff that she had put her bags in the car. I arrived at

1230 to load the car not only could I access my room as the card had been cancelled I went up and down the lift three times to get it reset , the desk staff eventually came up for me to gain access and that is when i noticed my wife's bag was not in the room there was no notifying me that she had taken the bag . Not only was this annoying I have just had major surgery on my fook and using a walking stick and swollen foot I was in pain for the rest of the day on my travel back to my residence 350 klm away. I am not impressed with the way I was treated.

Nice hotel with good pool and lovely spa, however the room I stayed was very noisy from early morning and during the day as work was taking place next door. There was a loud bang bang bang all day long. No good when you want to rest.

Great values, great service and excellent location. Clean room and great staff. Enjoyed stay here. perfect for weekend and city break. Would recommend for families too as close to everything. No noise at all from light rail roadworks.

We love the Amora Hotel Jamison. This is our third stay and it has been great each time. Love the location. The proximity to The Rocks, Opera House is wonderful. Will definitely return in the future. Thank you!

Check in quick and efficient. Disappointing when I got to my room and noticed that was hair on my pillow and bed, the main table in the room was not cleaned properly (under the glass was dirty). Surprised when I called the front desk asking for a pair of cutlery and I was told

I have previously stayed at this hotel for business which is central to many things in the city. The changes to traffic entering Jamison St, coupled with major road works makes it problematic if you are driving (would not recommend driving). Once you are there the Hotel offers

title.value: A very good hotel right in the best location

content.value: We've stayed at this hotel three times now. Each time we have found the staff to be welcoming and very efficient. The rooms are well appointed and the bathrooms always clean (unlike some we could mention). This trip was a theatre run and we go to the hotel reasonably late...to

item.hotel_name: Sydney Harbour Marriott Hotel at Circular Quay

content.value: Yes, the hotel is great. The only reason it doesn't get 5 stars is due to the outside construction seemingly never ending in Sydney. Sure, not Marriott's fault so can't blame them. Hotel itself is swarming with VERY helpful staff, rooms are very nice, and breakfast is

excellent. Book breakfast at the counter to save a few bucks vs. doing it in the morning. Lobby is often very busy with guests, conference attendees, and tourists. That tells me this is the place to be while visiting CQ.

item.hotel_name: Sydney Harbour Marriott Hotel at Circular Quay

content.value: Like a lot of reviewers before me have said the rooms are a little tired but the lobby area is fine and the rooms are clean. We had a basic room on level 10 with a typical view of nearby office blocks. If it‚Äôs your first trip to Sydney I would suggest you opt for the bridge or

harbour view rooms. The location is fantastic for tourists and it‚Äôs a quick and easy trip to train from the airport to circular quay and then walk to the hotel. The hotel was very busy so waiting for the lift and queues for the breakfast buffet were the norm. Overall ok but would not visit again.

item.hotel_name: Sydney Harbour Marriott Hotel at Circular Quay

content.value: Enjoyed the location during a four night stay in July. Close enough to Circular Quay and the Rocks. Easy walk to CBD and Barangaroo. The lounge is adequate and larger then many locations. Breakfast at Three Bottle Man off the lobby is much better and reasonable. Rooms are
clean and respectable even if your average Marriott room.

Rendezvous Rocks is in a great location right near Circular Quay, the Observatory and depending on your room location, views of the Bridge and Opera House. Comfortable rooms at a reasonable price. In need of a little refurbishment.

item.hotel_name: Sydney Harbour Marriott Hotel at Circular Quay

content.value: I've used the Marriott on a number of occasions and this was probably the most ordinary of all my stays. I had requested two rooms close together and had made a purpose phone call the day before our arrival to confirm the reason for our visit (a family funeral) and why we

required two rooms near each other. Once we got their we were on different floors and it didn't seem of much concern. So this was disappointing. One of the concierge personnel was absolutely fantastic, only I can't recall his name. He recommended places for dinner and they were great.

item.hotel_name: Sydney Harbour Marriott Hotel at Circular Quay

content.value: I was arriving early and it came out of my expectation that the room was ready. Though I am a gold member of Bonvoy but I don‚Äôt always get upgraded to a better room. Rata, the front office officer who helped checking in my room, was very kind and attentive, not only upgrading me

to a Harbour View room, but also explained in a very detailed manner the benefits I was entitled to. This was probably the best check-in experience I have had with Marriott. Hope they could keep it up.

Hotel is in good location closer to our venue to watch concert in the opera house. Friendly Staff and very helpful. Highly recommended to family an friends Shopping is closer walking distance and lots of restaurants nearby circular quay station is walking distance .

title.value: Loved our stay here; STAFF WAS AMAZING!!! <3

content.value: Okay so it was our first time ever in Australia and Sydney in general. This hotel omgomgomg was I mean GREAT for living but the staff made it GREATER AHHH THANK YOU ALL SO MUCH!!! When our luggage was lost the best of the best KAI helped us out in our toughest moments with

Nice old fashion room Quite close to every thing at the rocks Didn't eat there don't even know if there was a restaurant on site Spa out of action both days so no spa to relax in the evening but still great hotel would stay again

title.value: Comfortable and in the right position

content.value: Good hotel in a fantastic position to visit the town Near to the harbour and very well connected staff very kind and polite Room big and good equipped even if old Bed very comfy Bathroom small and old but very tidy

title.value: An Ideal Place to Stay in Sydney

content.value: With a beautiful view of the Botanical Gardens, my husband and I very much enjoyed our seven night stay at the Pullman Grand Quay Sydney. All the rooms are essentially suites with a separate bedroom, living room, well-equipped kitchen and dining area. There was even a washing

machine and dryer although the hotel did provide laundry service. The comfort level was high, the decor and furniture attractive and the location superb. This was my second time at the hotel and I will definitely return.

We were very happy with our 1 bed apartment on Macquarie St and loved the advantage of the two entrances from the two streets. So lovely to be able to walk outside to the cages near Circular Quay. Staff on reception were very good. The two disappointments were very slow

breakfast service and noisy and slow at the bar for a drink. Surprising for the quality of the hotel. We were told where to sit at breakfast and it was extremely cold near the glass. Would stay again but would not have breakfast there. There weren‚Äôt even many there on a weekday but it was painfully slow. It improved a little when we mentioned that we had an appointment in the centre of the city.

title.value: Excellent location. Staff friendly. Rooms looking a bit tired.

content.value: Very friendly and informative staff. Super harbour location. Food OK. Rooms look about 10-15 years old - pleasant, but could do with a refresh. Air conditioning doesn‚Äôt cope when full sun on windows. Bedding just OK. Bathroom scales broken and rusted up. Quiet.

Perfect location. the room was comfortable although a little out dated, needs freshening up. Check in was ok. I think the hotel needs a "quiet" place for a drink, the bar was very noisy. We did not receive our complimentary paper. Breakfast was a disaster. The service was

extremely poor. Had to ask for menus, service, we didn't receive any water. Then they lost our order...‚Ä¶.. This was handled very poorly as well. Ok, we received breakfast complimentary. On reading other reviews on breakfast a few weeks ago it seems that nothing has been taken on board to improve the service of breakfast either.On check out we were kept waiting for 10 minutes whilst one of the attendants was "doing" something behind the desk. It turned out she wasn't doing anything. Poor service again, no apologies for the wait either.I would not rush back to this hotel. This was a special weekend for me, my husband took me away as my mum had just passed away and it was my birthday so we thought we would use our points.Very disappointing Accor I wish I hadn't wasted my points on this hotel.

title.value: Great Hotel in the perfect location

content.value: We stayed in a family suite, perfect location 5 mins from the Opera House, right beside the ferry terminal to get everywhere, the room had a wonderful view of the harbor bridge, lots of space and laundry facilities, breakfast in the restaurant was always great, hotel is kid
friendly and staff were always accommodating- for a stay in Sydney this was perfect !

Close to Darling Harbour, city, train. Room was comfortable and clean but was missing moisturizer. Mini bar has been removed from room which you now just phone for room service , however no bottled water was in room. Executive lounge was good, good breakfast available.

The location was perfect for the major attractions close by. Public transport was within walking distance with plenty of dining options. Hotel staff were very accomodating, allowing for a later checkout due to participating in the City 2 Surf event.

title.value: Not enough value for the money

content.value: $238 per night- no access to gym and breakfast not included. To have breaksfast cost an extra $21 (usually $38!!!) The breakfast is nothing special and no different to any other buffet breakfast at any other hotel around the world. The room itself was very clean and comfortable.

title.value: Fabulous place to stay in Darling Harbour

content.value: We wanted somewhere convenient to stay close to Darling Harbour for a last minute visit to the Sydney Boat show. We booked the executive package with a view of Darling Harbour and had a great view of the boats in the harbour below. The room was very well appointed with

I‚Äôm staying here on Business and I must say it‚Äôs very impressive. Professional and friendly staff. Facilities are clean and tidy. The room is large and open. Close to China town and Paddy‚Äôs market. I‚Äôd recommend staying here.

Just checked out after a 3 week stay here and it exceeded my expectations. I've stayed in loads of Hostels and without a doubt this is the best hostel I've stayed in. It's really well run and very clean! There's always plenty of activities on offer in the day and night, so if

title.value: perfect hostel, seems more like a hotel

content.value: Very nice hostel! Good bar, a lot of activities, cheap alcohol at bar at happy hour, nice rooms, clean rooms and bathrooms, little bit noice from bar music but that can be solved with ear plugs, really nice environment where you meet a lot of people every day, chill lobby to

I stayed for one night in a 4 bed shared room on level 6. The whole place looks like recently renovated so the (bath)rooms were in very good condition and clean. Each bed had it's own lamp and power plug but unfortunately not a USB type. There are different free activities

Got checked in by a great girl called Maartje, she was awesome at reception, the next day I had a great tour by Alba, saw much of the city and got great some great views! Hostel was clean, met nice people, all you need in Sydney! Angelica helped me around town aswell, such nice

Really nice hostel, clean, friendly, modern, in city center. Would stay again here next time. Nice room, they Have nice activities, also free activities. Good vibe, easy to meet people. I would highly recommend it.

Location was great with good transportation. A number of restaurants and cafes in the area. Room was very small, very tiny bathroom and basin. There was a small couch in the room which was quiet dirty. Wouldn't stay there again.

The staff were always friendly and helpful. Good location near train station and not to far for a walk into the city if the mood strikes. Room was clean and well appointed, very comfortable bed. Overall a great stay.

Good value, great location and very pleasant staff. Convenient location for our visit to st Vincent‚Äôs hospital for my husband to have a procedure at the day surgery unit. Have already recommended to friends and family.

The Quay West Suites are located in The Rocks area of Sydney‚Äôs CBD. It‚Äôs a easy 5 minute walk from Circular Quay Train Station. We booked a 2 bedroom Harbour View Apartment. We were allocated a room on level 14 and the views were spectacular. The apartment had huge glass

windows with a stunning view of the harbour, Opera House and Sydney Harbour Bridge. The apartment itself was large with 2 bathrooms and king beds in each room. The decor is a little outdated, as is the carpet but it‚Äôs acceptable. The kitchen was well equipped and there was a large 6 seater dining setting. The indoor pool is a nice area, no food or drinks are allowed. There‚Äôs also a gym and sauna. The bar area is a bit disappointing, mainly because there‚Äôs no view. Breakfast was very good and included barista made coffee. Overall the Quay West is a good choice for apartment style accomodation. It‚Äôs definitely worth paying extra for a harbour view, it‚Äôs absolutely spectacular.

I stayed at Quest Potts Point for a week, and was very comfortable and happy there. The staff were very polite and friendly, and the location was very convenient. Highly recommended for anyone visiting Sydney looking for a convenient location and good rest.

Fantastic value for money right in the heart of Potts Point. Awesome 4th floor roof deck with City views and a glimpse of the Harbour and Harbour bridge. Have a wine after a work day up there, beautiful!

Great location! My room was clean, the bed was large and comfortable, and the view was amazing (had a room with views of the Harbour bridge). Unfortunately their sauna was out of order which would have been nice but that was the only downside. Would definitely stay here again.
Oh and if walking for circular quay don‚Äôt forget there is a lift on Harrington st which takes you to the hotel and you skip the super steep hill otherwise! Enjoy!

Good room and good location 5 minutes from Sydney Harbour. The staff was friendly and the room very clean. Also great view towards Sydney Bridge. The only thing I was not happy was that we had asked the reception for a power socket adaptor and they don‚Äôt have. Our chargers have
different heads and none from the room was suitable.

title.value: Great Location and affordable good accomodation

content.value: As a long time Accor member we were fortunate to be upgraded to a harbor view on the 19th floor which had a fantastic view of Sydney Harbor including both the Harbor Bridge an Opera house which we got to see at night and sunrise from our balcony. Much Appreciated I might say too
as it was the first time we have stayed there but certainly will not be the last.

title.value: Friendly staff creates homely atmosphere at Quay West

content.value: I stayed at this hotel in early Jun this year and found it to be in a very strategic location, walking distance to The Rocks, Harbour Front and walkable to the Sydney Opera House, and some shopping area. One can also take the Ferry at Circular Quay in this same area to go around

Darling Harbour. I was very happy with my stay at Quay West because the staff are so friendly, and empathizes and anticipates your needs. I would like to especially mention the Night Manager, Mr. Deepak who came to our room at close to midnight to cut the lock of the suitcase as we locked the key inside. Also, compliments to Cayla and her Korean colleague (I forget his name) who were very helpful with our requests and provided us with a lot of helpful information. The break was good and you can order a hot meal. The lady bartender at the restaurant was very cheerful and truly genuine and thoughtful, thanks for making our stay memorable. What's important is that the staff at this hotel showed genuine concern for the guests' needs. I would recommend this hotel for anyone who wants to be in the heart of Sydney.

Overall good stay, it would do good to look at the programming of the lifts. wait at the lifts @ lobby typically takes a while. Glad that the apartment is equipped with washer and dryer. pleasant experience.

title.value: Can do better for Inner City Accommodation

content.value: I love Meriton Suites and this would be the 4th location I have stayed at this year. I would also have to say this is the worst of the 4. The building is tired with patch up painting in the rooms that don‚Äôt even match the existing colours. The shower leaked water over the

Great location, spacious and tidy rooms and friendly staff. For the business executive or family looking for a break and having access to everything Sydney has to offer, Meriton Suites Pitt Street is hard to beat.

Stayed in a 3 bedroom apartment, comfortable apartment and has all you need to feel at home. The apartment is at a great location, in the middle of town and an immediate walk into the shopping area and toward the opera house.
