These suites whilst not the cheapest are nicely sized with all the amenities you need. Very good pool, Spa and Sauna. We stayed in 2br suite which is very comfortable. All rooms had individual TVs.The location is central to transport, Hyde Park , Darling Harbour and shopping.

The hotel was great and everything fresh and new. Close to the beach, a range of food outlets and transport. I have stayed in Adina Apartments in Melbourne and this hotel was was at the same high standard.

I‚Äôve already reviewed. My family had a great stay and they were looked after. My requests for them went beyond what I wanted them to have as I was paying. My other son had booked the Coogee a month before and suggested I also book them in there again.

Central. Close to all good restaurants and bars Rooms excellent. Bathrooms a bit tight but great shower. Staff very polite and courteous Clean and well positioned. Beds very good. Would recommend this property

We stayed with grown up children. Perfect 2 bedroom apartment , enough space for us all with cooking and washing facilities. Supermarket across the road. Excellent staff, and quiet residence. Right in the middle of everything with only short stroll to the beach.

Close to beach, restaurants and shops, great location. Staff friendly, One bedroom apartment was very comfortable. Transport to the city is almost at the door. Short drive to Clovelly, Bronte and Bondi Beach. Pub and clubs close by.

What a terrific hotel in an amazing location. Great friendly staff made the stay memorable. Large room with comfortable bed and nice ensuite. Just up the road from the weekend rocks markets. Short walk to train at Circular Quay station.

title.value: Charming Old-Style Shabby Chic Hotel with the Perfect Location

content.value: My new favourite place to stay anywhere! This charming hotel is perfectly located in The Rocks in Sydney. You can stand on the corner in front of the hotel in George Street tilt your head left and get stunning views of the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Two minutes walk forward from

I have stayed at the Russell for over 30 years. The experience is always fantastic, location for tourists excellent with Circular Quay & all the transport options. Lots of dinning options, scenic walks& a hop skip & a jump to the Opera House

title.value: My favourite place to Stay in Sydney

content.value: The Russell is a great spot, so close to Circular Quay and The Rocks. I am always happy with a room in a great location at a great price. Sometimes the rooms are tiny and shared bathroom only, but I don't care as the beds are good, the staff are very helpful and the location is

I stayed for a work trip and booked a queen with an en suite. As I walked up from the train station to the Rocks I was pleasantly surprised how nice and well kept it was. I had asked in advance if they could store my luggage upon my arrival (8.30am) as I was off to meetings all

Arrived late and asked for a quiet room - the gentleman on reception was really responsive and provided a great room. Will go back. Plus well located, excellent rooms and quick check out with minimum fuss.

Stayed here for four nights. On the first night, we noticed a breeze coming through one of our (closed) windows, causing a very tiresome and trying whistling noise. Notified guest services the next day and got told, ‚Äúit‚Äôs a common thing in high rise buildings‚Äù and then got

Our room was on the 47th floor, was clean, tidy with a very comfortable bed and the city views were amazing. The staff greeted us pleasantly at all times and the gentlemen who assisted with our check in (Guilly was his name I think) was very professional and helpful. The staff

We were pleased with our greeting at reception upon our arrival. The manager was very professional and provided us with all the information we needed. The location is perfect for easy access to the major sites in Sydney. It‚Äôs also close to the metro and train station. Our suite

title.value: Good position n, but a bit dirty

content.value: Good position within walking distance to main metro and bus stop. Apartments were ok but a bit dirty. Cleaning was not an issue. One day they forget to clean the room and to make the bed, they probably forget , but they couldn‚Äôt do anything because at 5 o‚Äôclock The cleaning

item.hotel_name: Harbour Rocks Hotel Sydney - MGallery Collection

content.value: I had high expectations for this apparently five star property, but it missed the mark on a number of fronts: - The first room I was given wasn‚Äôt clean. There were hairs all over the bathroom. Not to mention that the view was a wall... - I was transferred to another room, only

to find luggage from the previous guests in the room. This room also hasn‚Äôt been cleaned properly - I found items under the desk from previous guests, the carpet on the floor is stained in several places, the shade was broken, etc. The wine glasses in the mini bar were filthy, and I never managed to get them replaced - I had to walk down to the bar myself to get a clean one... - When I flagged concerns, the desk staff apologized and offered me wine, but didn‚Äôt take adequate corrective actions. - On my last full day, I returned to my room at 3pm after being out all day, and it hadn‚Äôt been cleaned. I needed a nap so didn‚Äôt bother asking for service, but I then got a call from reception saying that they had SEEN THE DO NOT DISTURB SIGN and decided to call (disturb) to ask if I wanted my room cleaned at 4:30pm... Other notes: - The area is noisy and the hotel isn‚Äôt soundproofed. You could join a conversation with the folks on the street without much effort. - Some of the bathrooms are so small you‚Äôd have to bend your body to wedge yourself between the toilet and the sink. Basically, this is a nice property that is badly managed and poorly maintained. They seem to be understaffed, undertrained and broadly underperforming. For the price, you don‚Äôt get quality, space or service you should expect for a property like this. There are better options in this great neighborhood. Skip the HRH.

item.hotel_name: Harbour Rocks Hotel Sydney - MGallery Collection

content.value: Check in and out were seamless. Nice walk down to the harbour, was super close to everything. Staff were really friendly. The room was nice, very small bathroom. The bed and pillows were very uncomfortable for me, but on a whole, was fine for the two nights I was there.

item.hotel_name: Harbour Rocks Hotel Sydney - MGallery Collection

title.value: Cute heritage character, great location - but superior room not so superior

content.value: The hotel is gorgeous, has lovely character and the staff are welcoming and helpful. The location is brilliant for getting around the city, so close to The Rocks, Circular Quay and all sorts of attractions. Unfortunately, I was very unsatisfied with my room. I paid a little

more for the "superior" room which was not at all up to that standard. Firstly, it was located immediately adjacent to the stairs for circulating up and down to the lobby, right next to the bathrooms for the restaurant/bar and of course, right next to the very noisy bar. The room had little to no sound-proofing so both of my nights' sleep were terribly disturbed. The room is also essentially internal with a french door (you couldn't open) to an internal courtyard - not at all like the superior room pictures shown on the website which are light and open and spacious. The first night I just put up with the disturbance, the second night I asked what could be done to improve the situation and the offer was to shut the restaurant doors at 10pm. I rang concierge at close to 11pm and asked for the doors to be shut. This was done promptly, however just as promptly the doors were opened again and people were coming and going. I again asked for the doors to be shut which again, helpfully they were. Sadly, people still needed to come and go to the bathrooms and up and down the stairs so the night was still terribly disturbed. I was really disappointed. On check out the following day, I discussed this with the lovely staff who were apologetic but since my room had been pre-paid could offer nothing substantial to off-set the terrible amenity of the room. I do think both staff went out of their way to provide an apology - with some free product from the in-house range of toiletries and a coffee - which was really lovely. My feedback to them was not to call that room superior for future reference.

item.hotel_name: Harbour Rocks Hotel Sydney - MGallery Collection

content.value: I chose this hotel because I was going to see Snow Patrol at the Sydney Opera House and the location was perfect. I arrived to be given the rockstar status. I was stoked. This included a breakfast and an upgrade. It made for a wonderful 24 hours in Sydney. The hotel is just
lovely and relaxing. Beautifully appointed and very quiet. I will stay there again and again. The receptionist was so accommodating I could not have asked for more.

item.hotel_name: Harbour Rocks Hotel Sydney - MGallery Collection

content.value: My husband and I spent three nights in the Harbour Rocks Hotel in April. We accepted the advice of our travel agent Trailfinders, in choosing all our accommodation, including this hotel. The Harbour Rocks is in a fantastic location, as it is a couple of minutes walk from

Circular Quay, the centre of transport for boats, buses and trains . The bridge and the Opera house are within ten minutes walk and there are many restaurants and shops in the area. The staff were really friendly and helpful and couldn‚Äôt have been more accommodating. The hotel was originally a tea warehouse and has been refurbished very tastefully. It is not modern or glitzy but is full of character. I don‚Äôt think there is a lift, which could deter people with mobility issues , but we would highly recommend this hotel and would be delighted to Stay in the Harbour Rocks should the opportunity ever arise again.

Our only issue was with smoking being allowed on the balconies. We could not open our balcony door to let fresh air in because we were getting the 2nd hand smoke from others nearby on their balconies. We could never stay there in summer (which we were intending to do in
November) as we wouldn't be able to sit outside & enjoy the lovely view. Such a shame as we really loved the unit.

Great one bedroom apartment, easy check in and check out. So close to everything. Parking very reasonable for two days. Won't stay in the Novotel or Sebel anymore, they're alot more expensive than here without the facilities. We cooked breakfast one morning and washed
clothes one afternoon. Will stay here every time.

Best place to stay in Manly. Great location, we love that there is parking downstairs (reasonable cost), the staff are always friendly and helpful. The apartments are very clean with excellent kitchen and laundry facilities in the apartment if staying a while.

I can highly recommend these apartments . They are clean and tidy. Beds comfortable and the staff are very friendly and helpful. The location is awesome and close to the shop and cafes and the ferry terminal is across the road. Excellent place to stay

Had a great girlie weekend celebrating my friends 60th Birthday. Great location and great apartment. Walking distance to lots of eateries, cafes, beautiful weather making the view even more spectacular!

Well appointed with small but efficient room design. Arriving on a Sunday at 1900 hours offered a challenge with a lock box key but not hard with instructions well explained. Gift bag with water(?) and oat biscuits was a nice touch though the tap water was delicious so don't see

the real need to add to the plastic landfill really. Bathroom is extremely small but ok for those who are not claustrophobic. Tea and coffee complimentary in the room was fantastic and appreciated. I usually have to ask the housekeeper for more sugar,coffee, etc but that was not required here. I asked for a late checkout on day three. I was told a $24 fee would be charged for two extra hours!! 10am checkout moved to 12 noon? I thought that was silly and a shame. The lady at the front desk was accommodating by calling our tour operator and was quite helpful. Overall good marks. The area is expensive for eating. I suggest exploring unless a bowl of granola and yoghurt for $15 is ok with you....

title.value: Rude and unhelpful staff. Ruined our first visit to Sydney

content.value: *I could not find my Google review so I am re-posting this here to help others. Do not book here. We had a terrible experience at this hotel. As the other bad reviews have mentioned, they have a pretty rude and unhelpful staff. My daughter used her Agoda account and paid for

this booking in full via Paypal prior to our trip. During check-in, they informed us the twin bedroom can only accommodate 2 pax, which we completely understood. So my daughter booked a room in a hotel nearby. My wife and I agreed we will stay at this hotel since it was already paid. The receptionist then asked for a credit card for the $5 security deposit. We gave my wife's credit card instead since they only accept Visa and Mastercard. (My daughter's card was EPS/Cirrus.) Once the card was charged successfully, the receptionist gave us the keys to our room. After 20 min, the receptionist called us and told us we need to modify our booking. We were told even though the room was already fully paid and we provided a working credit card, the booking name has to match the credit card's or they will kick us out. We were shocked. We can't believe they're doing this over something so trivial! They could have very easily made this edit in their system. But no, they refused to do that. They made us jump through hoops and contact Agoda ourselves to modify the original reservation. Agoda was confused too and told us the hotel could have easily done this on their end. Their lack of "common sense" or helpfulness was truly astounding to us. We've stayed in many hotels around the world and this was the first time we've been treated this way. They said in their ad they treat guests like family, but that could not be further from the truth. We've honestly never felt more unwelcomed in any establishment.

Lovely little boutique style hotel! No on site parking, which was difficult when we had so many bags, but was cheaper overnight parking available via the hotel in a secure undercover car park which we where great full for as there was a terrible hailstone storm the evening we

where in Sydney! Also no lift and lugging our bags up 3 flights was super hard! But that was my own fault for not checking! The rooms however where super spacious and comfortable; despite a leak in our room the hotel where super accommodating and moved us promptly to another room! Perfect for what we needed bar the lack of a lift and good value for money!

title.value: Great Location and clean modern decor.

content.value: Yes the rooms a small but the location for the price is pretty good. In the middle of Potts Point the location is soooo good. You can walk ( yes walk) to the Opera House via Botanical Gardens . Great places to eat and around the corner from the X and train access. Staff were

lovely . The room was very clean and really modern d√©cor. The only issue is Parking if you drive there. Only real option is to leave car at a Wilson underground Parking at $25 per hrs. (discounted via Hotel). Its about a 10 min walk.

title.value: Small Like a Cruise Cabin But Great Location

content.value: Stayed for four nights before embarking on cruise. Hotel is small and there is no elevator. Rooms are as small as a cruise cabin. It is clean. Great pillows. The housekeeping is excellent places to eat are literally at the hotel front door.

Only had an overnight stay at this old converted bank into a boutique hotel. Just loved everything about it. Lovely comfortable rooms, modern facilities, lovely continental brekkie a nice touch and friendly guy at desk. Dinner at nearby paddo inn was a hit too. Planning next
visit for longer can‚Äôt wait

Great boutique hotel right in the middle of Paddington - small bars, pubs and amazing restaurant on the door step. Mrs Banks was previously a commonwealth Bank branch so its wonderful to see that they have restored parts of it and created such a warm & stylish space. Rooms were

decorated nicely, large bathroom and super comfy bed. Breakfast was adequate but a bit of music or something in the reception area/breakfast area would be a good addition as you could hear every conversation, every chair movement and it just made breakfast a bit awkward at times. Other then that, the place is near perfect.

We enjoyed our stay here so much, the rooms are great, clean and quiet. We love returning here after a hard days touristing. The breakfast sees us through till late afternoon, and the staff are genuinely friendly, with lots of great advice about restaurants and local
attractions. We would happily return here.

I spent the weekend at mrs banks, right away the staff were super friendly and helpful giving my mates and I lots of suggestions for bars, restaurants and activities to do during our stay. The rooms were modern and absolutely spotless. 10/10 would stay again.

What a find! This hotel ticks all the important boxes for me. It‚Äôs quiet, clean, comfortable, has a friendly helpful team and is in a convenient location! On top of this though... it‚Äôs elegant, well appointed bathroom plus they offer a great little continental breakfast! Will
definitely be coming back.

We spent two nights in a lovely room which was beautifully appointed. All the staff were very obliging and very friendly. We think it's well worth the Executive Lounge experience. The food and service there is very popular and it feels like home.

I picked this hotel mainly because we are in Hilton's frequent stayer program, and it seemed like it would be quiet on one of the top floors. We went with a room that provided access to the executive lounge which had breakfast in the morning and heavy hors d'oeuvres in the

evening. I was amazed at how good the service was. Everyone in this hotel was really friendly, and I mean everyone. I was not expecting this in a business hotel in a large city. It made for a very enjoyable stay. The food in the executive lounge was excellent. We had enough for breakfast that we didn't need to have lunch, and the hors d'oeuvres were so filling we had no need for dinner either. So we never got to try any of Sydney's restaurants! This was just fine with us and we were pretty tired after walking and sightseeing all day. It was so easy to just get on the elevator and go two floors for dinner. The location worked very well. It's near the train station, so we had an easy trip from and to the airport. If you enjoy walking, you can easily walk to all the top sites in Sydney. We would definitely stay here again if we ever get back to Sydney.

Couples stay-cation in the Executive Relaxation Suite for my partners birthday. We enjoyed the warm and inviting atmosphere of Marble Bar for cocktails then ventured for a bite to eat in the Executive Lounge. The food was good and the drinks were great the service was

excellent but it had an airport lounge vibe so we promptly returned to Marble Bar for our night-cap. Loved the in-room spa bath and we will definitely be coming back a 3rd time.. even if it is a bit on the pricey side...

Stayed at the Hilton for my family vacation in Sydney. It was a great location. The hotel was quite busy, as there was a convention going on. All in all, it's a beautiful hotel and very well maintained. Staff were very helpful.

The lobby of the Hilton Sydney was very well maintained, especially when there is a lot of foot traffic. Receptionist, Soo Yeo did a fantastic job with my check in and was very informative and pleasant with our interaction. The room was of a decent size for 2 people and was

spacious when we had a couple of friends join us for in-room dinner. Relatively clean room, however, the cabinet above the minibar was highly dusty and the chromes in the bathroom had heavy visible smudges. Bed was comfortable, pillows were very flat, collateral in the room looked worn out. The minibar could have benefited with instructions on how to open it. Air conditioning control panel was difficult to operate. In-door pool locker room and pool seatings looked abit unkept. Alysium Spa was a standout, Oceane was very helpful and accomodating when making inquires. The spa treatment was very enjoyable and highly recommended. Food from room service was amazing. We ordered 4 main dishes and 4 desserts and I must say it was the highlight for everyone. Unfortunately 2 items of my breakfast was incorrect, however we didn‚Äôt have enough time so we let it pass. We were given a complimentary 12pm check out, however just abit after 11am, Housekeeping rang, knocked and opened my room door. No ones fault, better communication was needed. For a 5 star hotel, it is worth the money to stay here. Close to main locations within Sydney and the CDB. However, some improvements are needed for this 5 star hotel. 4 stars.

Clean and very comfortable. No noise in spite of close proximity to main road and trains. Lovely service at the desk. Great location, in walking distance of CBD and few minutes walk from train station. Checking in and out without any hassles.

The room was great, with particularly comfortable bed and pillows. The staff were super helpful. The buffet breakfast is always good. Rydges CBD was a great spot to rest before and recover after the City to Surf. It's a short walk to the start line !!!

I caught the train up from the country for an appointment in Sydney CBD and took the opportunity to have a little bit of me time too. Convenient to Central Station and catching the train a couple of stops to different areas within the city. Clean, modern and surprisingly

Quick overnight stop but found the hotel clean with Restaurant/Pub next door. Close to central station and price was affordable. Although we were only there for a short time would not hesitate to book again.

Couldnt be happier, clean comfortable room, helpful staff, well appointed and reasonably priced. Centrally located. Near central station and in house brewery. Good beer and the breakfast options were ample

title.value: great convenient location and amazing facilities

content.value: I had the best comfortable stay. staff super friendly and bed was so comfy. the food in room service was fast and also tasty, size of meals reasonable. I know I said the beds were comfy but they were amazing, will definitely be staying there again

title.value: City Centre Hotel by Circular Quay

content.value: The Amora is deservedly rated as 5*. It is conveniently situated within walking distance of Circular Quay where the Sydney Harbour bridge, Sydney Opera House and the Royal Botanic Gardens can be visited. Our room was clean, comfortable and quiet. Breakfast was very good

title.value: Great location and value for money

content.value: Wonderful location, close to all amenities and circular quay - would recommend this hotel, service was lovely. Great indoor pool. Only negative issue was service charges for buckets of ice for drinks being brought to our room with room service, discussed this at departure and

We had an engagement in the Rocks, so this was perfect. Nice enough. Would stay again. Views are amazing over the harbour and perfect balcony to admire. I'm just filling up space now as this program wants 200 words minimum......

Well equipped, especially comfortable beds, good service and perfect location. Easily walkable to circular quay, all of the main central areas and perfect for transport options. Loads of great eating options on the doorstep (mr Wong / long chim / grand pavilion). And the met

Great location - walking distance to so many wonderful places (Wynyard station, shops, circular quay and the opera house), cost competitive, beautifully furnished rooms and facilities. Very clean and staff were cheerful and helpful.

This is a high quality hotel with pleasant and well presented staff matched by tge accommodation that was provided at a reasonable price, and in an awesome location close to attractions, including restaurants, retail shops and the beautiful Sydney harbour. I'll be back for sure!

Renew of basic studio interitors will be appreciated mainly for shower and toilets, also the bed with weels is really unusual and unconfortable. The staff should be sure that air conditioned doesn't create noise

We stayed at this hotel in 2016 and booked here again just for the location, it cannot be beat. Just a few minutes walk to Circular Quay and lots of restaurants and shops. The front desk staff was very helpful. Would definitely stay here again. The only criticism I have is

A generous room with kitchen in the centre of Sydney's tourist area close to the Opera House, dining and a short walk to Botanic Gardens and Art Gallery. Staff went out of their way to help and always a warm welcome.

The hostel is excellent. The rooms were clean and comfortable. It‚Äôs a social place but everyone is always respectful. The bathrooms are always clean, as is the kitchen. The events are really good as they help to bring people staying at the hostel together without having to

spend a fortune going out. The staff are really friendly and always willing to listen to any queries or problems and will help in any way they can. The night manager, Martin, was particularly helpful in ensuring that the noise was kept to a minimum during the night and is a cool guy to have a chat with. I would 100% recommend staying here, with incredible views from an open rooftop looking out over Bondi Beach.

I stayed in this hostel with my friend (both of us are 20 years old) and it was an amazing experience! The place is clean, lively, and full of amazing people. I highly highly recommend this hostel. It is definitely filled with a much younger crowd (18-29 year olds). Also every

night there‚Äôs a group activity that you can choose to go to (bbq on the roof, karaoke night, going to syd to club together) so its really easy to make friends. I honestly can‚Äôt say enough good things!!!

Stopped there for 2weeks the room was great and the staff super helpful, really easy to get anywhere from the location, would highly recommend staying. One point to make tho there is limited laundry which was a pain so make sure you are on the ball if you are doing any happy
traveling

item.hotel_name: Sydney Harbour Marriott Hotel at Circular Quay

title.value: Great Location but use the restaurants in the area

content.value: The hotel is located minutes from Circular Quay, so ideal for walking to the main attractions and transport links. The room was great, clean, tidy and with Harbour Bridge views. The restaurant was a disappointment. Breakfast is expensive and adequate, but the egg station was

Stayed here for four nights last week.. this hostel is really nice with really good Wi-Fi. There‚Äôs a different social event every night which is managed by a top lad called Freddie. He makes loads of effort to make sure everyone feels welcome and is having fun. Another member of
staff is Martin - he‚Äôs a hero for dealing with the hammered people coming home from the socials. Cheers guys!!

title.value: Central hostel with a great view

content.value: I stayed for six nights at Bondi Backpackers while waiting on a visa in Sydney, decided to mix up my view and get out of the CBD for awhile. Bondi Backpackers is a young hostel, but very social and clean, with an incredible view of Bondi beach across the street. As of August

3, the hostel is still under construction (as it is being fully updated and remodeled) but the final work is mostly cosmetic, such as painting. Unfortunately, the workers do still start early (7am) and can be loud in the hallways but most of the really dirty obtrusive work is done. Compared to Wake Up Sydney and Wake Up Byron Bay, the hostel is snug on space, which comes with the location and view. My only issues were that the kitchen can be REAL SNUG during meal times to cook and eat, and that the food storage was never checked or cleaned out so finding a locker for dry food could be tough. As someone who is working remotely during part of my trip, I would have also liked more table seating to work. Both the downstairs common area and the 4th floor have none of that indoors, and during winter sitting at the table outside could be too chilly. Staff is nice and helpful, and the rooms have good storage and plugs/lights by each bed, a must! Overall, would stay here again and would recommend it. Once the construction work is finished, it will be a really nice hostel option in Sydney.

item.hotel_name: Sydney Harbour Marriott Hotel at Circular Quay

title.value: last minute reservation handled with respect and excellent customer service

content.value: apart from the booking the hotel staff at reception and elsewhere could not be faulted - natural and friendly and all looked like they enjoyed what they were doing - the room although not a harbour bridge view was comfortable, roomy and the shower/bathroom was a good size. The

item.hotel_name: Sydney Harbour Marriott Hotel at Circular Quay

content.value: Had a great room overlooking the harbour bridge. Bed was very comfortable. Staff at reception very efficient and friendly. Room must have only just been cleaned when we arrived in room as there was no toilet paper ion the bathroom, which is the first place you go to when you

Let me preface by stating that we travel ALOT and therefore stay in ALOT of hotels. We booked thru AMEX Platinum. The property itself is a solid walk from the Bridge and Opera House., we did not mind but you might so google it. We did not get an upgrade as is protocol with

platinum nor were we afforded anything else. We got a room with a view of the front check in area then again there is construction on the water side, spice your option. The staff while cordial, seemed to be all trainees. The concierge, or whoever was manning the desk could not recommend any Chinese or Thai restaurants. We found our own. The front desk staff had to keep referring all questions (basic) to the manager. I could not get on wifi, no one could determine why and after much ado they put me on the hotel staff wifi. The room was nice. The bathroom was nice looked like it had one new coat of paint and was awaiting the next coat. They have a candy set-up at reception if you want that. We had the included breakfast and that was more than adequate. We had drinks in the bar, great Bellini and great service. We did use the car service which was also fine but uber does come to hotel.

item.hotel_name: Sydney Harbour Marriott Hotel at Circular Quay

title.value: One of the Best in Sydney CBD

content.value: One of the best places i have stayed. I have been going to Sydney for Work and stayed at this awesome place all the time. The staff there are so helpful and one of the best customer services. I would keep going back whenever i am back there. Their Breakfast was awesome. Huge

item.hotel_name: Sydney Harbour Marriott Hotel at Circular Quay

content.value: Booked with luxury escapes. Overall satisfactory but could have been better. We would stay here again but it‚Äôs not the best place for a special occasion. Positives: - initial contact by email was very much appreciated and probably set the bar high for expectations. We booked 2

It was a great stay the rooms are spotless and comfort is amazing . The breakfast is amazing. The location is perfect, you are in walking distance of all of Sydney. The parking is cheap and the view from the rooms is amazing.

My husband booked a couple hotels for our first visit to Sydney, Australia, not knowing what the Langham was going to be like. After staying here a couple days, we wanted to cancel our other hotel! We loved our stay at the Langham, it was the best - compared to other places

we‚Äôve stayed at (to name a few...in NYC, SF, LA, LV, Japan, etc.). The service was the best from the Bellman to the Front Desk to Housekeeping and most importantly, Concierge! Gary was outstanding! Gary had an answer for EVERY single question I had about places I wanted to visit, what I wanted to eat, what item(s) I wanted to buy - also hunted down an item my husband wanted to get and he found it! If you‚Äôre looking for a very personable, warm feeling, nice rooms/comfy beds, very clean, and great location hotel...The Langham Sydney is the place!

title.value: Second visit was amazing.. will be back for a 3rd!

content.value: Every time we travel to Sydney we stay at the langham! Gorgeous hotel, lovely/helpful/efficient staff, and best location: walking distance to the Rocks and circular quay and downtown but on a miraculously quiet and subdued street of historic old beautiful buildings. The

breakfast buffet is amazing- healthy, beautiful and lots of variety. We always end up arriving to Australia early in the morning, hours before the official check-in time. The Langham encourages us to leave our bags at the front desk and head down to the spa for sauna/shower and a swim in the gorgeous pool with its dark blue ceiling sprinkled with little lights so as to resemble the night sky. The hot tub is discretely tucked in the corner and I cannot emphasize enough how good the jets feel after a 24 trip from DC! We love this hotel and have also stayed in the NYC one!!

Not the place you'd like to go. The overall experience was less than ordinary and price is high. Room was so dull, not enough light. Nothing complimentary for the price you pay. Will prefer to stay some where else.

title.value: Great place to stay in Sydney

content.value: Fantastic hotel. Great service. Great location, and good pricing. The staff are very friendly and go out of their way to help. I stay here for 10-15 nights. Family friendly and room service pricing is good value,

title.value: Best hotel I've ever stayed in

content.value: I've been in plenty of 4- and 5-star hotels, and this is my all-time favourite. Have stayed here several times and every time I'm impressed by the light and spacious rooms, comfortable beds, exceptional service in every way. If you want to feel truly welcomed and to sink into a
relaxed weekend, this is the place to be.

Loved everything about this hotel, Michael Sullivan greeted us at reception when we arrived. He was so professional, friendly and welcoming. He really made our stay a 5* experience. The reception area is so beautifully designed along with every other part of the hotel. Rosie was
also very helpful, kind and charming upon leaving.

The hotel is well positioned for Darling Harbour and all it has to offer in terms of eating out and shopping, but it is a good 30 minute walk to the Rocks area, the bridge and opera house. If you would rather not walk there is a train station nearby and you can pick up the hop

reception given us the harbour view room as its our 7th anni and cakes in our room. Breakfast at executive lounge is okay not many variety. Room is clean and near by to Chinatown and Pitt Street, . Will book with them again.

The Meritons are always reliable and the value for money so great each time, even in a place like Sydney. Meriton Pitt St is in a great location, in the heart of the shopping district and CBD for business appointments. The two bedroom was spacious, full of all the facilities

Mix up with rooms, put down as miscommunication instead of admitting their staff made a mistake, phone calls during conference, room not made up, key not working 3 times, smallest rooms for a Meriton, very disappointing.

title.value: This place is a must to stay at

content.value: After my horrific experience at Park Regis with its old rooms, narrow corridors that made for concerns during an emergency evacuation and oh yes note in the bathroom I nearly missed about low water pressure so run taps for a while, not to mention claustrobia attack and loud

FYI, hard beds and large pillows - maybe I‚Äôm too precious but housekeeping didn‚Äôt have any options for a smaller pillow and an extra underlay didn‚Äôt really help. I ended up folding a blanket inside a pillow slip. The street noise came through the thin windows - but they did

I stayed at the Meriton Suites Pitt Street during a recent visit for business. This was my first time staying at this hotel and I cannot recommend it enough. The room was large, modern, well appointed, clean, quite and comfortable. I will definitely stay here again next time I

Starting with a position walking distance to the beach and surrounded by great cafes, this hotel has it all! Modern, clean, happy staff. Not so important:This stay our shower cubicle was a little small (you bump your elbows while washing your hair). Last trip it was a different

Great service with quick check in & out. Room was spacious and clean but the shower was tight. Location is minutes away from Coogee beach, cafes and parks. A great location for a family stay. Limited parking nearby with parking at the hotel expensive. Overall a very good

Happy to stay again but would need the elevator & water pressure fixed. Loved the apartment with a lounge room but happy with the 1 room apartment although a little tight. Staff were helpful & bright.

Adina apartments Coogee was once again the perfect base for another business trip to Sydney. Great location, comfortable and clean rooms, very helpful staff. Breakfast option is excellent. Would definitely recommend.

A great location, a quick walk to the beach, plenty of places for coffee and meals or going out for dinner at night. Excellent bus services two minutes from hotel.Close to Bond beach and the Prince of Wales Hospital.

I always stay at Meriton Waterloo. Easy walk to transport and restaurants and for those with a reasonable level of fitness, CBD is within walking distance. Comfy beds, car parking, free wifi and quality amenities are a feature. Friendly and efficient staff.

Very Clean, spacious rooms, welcoming/ friendly staff. Great facilities! Comfortable beds. Daily room services and nothing is to much trouble for the staff. Would highly recommend. Close to shops and public transport. The area in general is full of history and is a pleasure to
walk around the streets taking in all of the sites.

title.value: simple, nice hotel and silent room

content.value: stay at Meriton Waterloo for 4 nights. Although the hotel is not located at CBD area but easy to access to anywhere by bus in reasonable time. However, we lost a bag at the lobby on 8/14 when we check out. If hotel can help us to check the CCTV, it would be great to know what
happen at that time.

Avery well appointed apartment with everything that is required. It is in a very convenient location although a little close to the Eastern Distributor. There are a number of cafes and convenience stores within a short walk.

This is our 2nd stay at this hotel. Our son lives around the corner so we will be back many times. The best quality about your hotel is your staff. They are amazing. So helpful and always friendly. Especially Brooke The rooms are always spotless. I love the size of the bed. The
option of a firmer pillow would be nice. Looking forward to our next visit

Stayed in this hostel at the start of March, only getting a chance to review now. Booked into a 6 bed dorm room as the online reviews were very good, ended up being disappointed. The hostel is in a good area and the staff were friendly but we felt there was a strange vibe in the

hostel. We found that the majority of the guests at the were actually living there as apposed to just passing through and as a result we felt like we were intruders in there home/ invading their space. As I said the staff are lovely but very relaxed and as a result hygiene seems to have taken a backseat. Overall, this hostel was fine for a couple nights stay but we would not choose to stay here again.

Such a lovely spot, located in the nice Potts Point area, with easy access to basically everything! Feels more like a homestay that a random place to sleep. Quiet, charming and a lovely staff, always looking after you!

I stayed at this hostel from april 11th until april 17th. I booked it threw booking apps called airbnb.i had a high good expectations for this hostel but unfortunately it wasn't what i was hoping to see.it was a nightmare experience ,I won't recommend it to my family or my

friends who want to visit sydney and who want to stays close to the city attractions .upon checkin I was asked to write down my credit card info for security deposit which was not exit on thier policy and terms and if i refused I will not be allow to stay other wise i paid them the full amount of what they were charging plus i had to pay 20 dollars for key deposit.the room i was assigned to was unclean and had filthy smell ,the carpet had dirty look and was smell bad especially at night .the windows are sealed only one left without glass and without screen to prevents bugs and fly to get in.In the day time you can hear the cars,buses,people talking laughing yelling and in the night time it become worse and you can smell the smocks that comes out of motorists,restaurants as well.i had trouble breathing during my stays because they sprays chemicals in the room to over come the bad smell .the bathroom floor's was nasty ,no vent fan to suckup the moisture ,i was not provide with towels and soup.I asked the owner,she told me we charge 3 dollars for the towels by your own soup.there is no WIFI at this hostel at all time ,the owner told me go to McDonald they have wifi which was uncomfortable for me to walk at night after i had long day travelling in sydney.i was treat it unfair during my stays and I had disrespectful staff member asked me in my second day of staying to clean behind my self in the kitchen because she saw me peeling some garlic while that person drink every midnight ad leave behind mass of unclean glasses with alchohol residue and dirty dishes with remain left over pizza.the owner is lack of customer skills.i tried to avoid them at all cost.I find alot of hostels and hotels in the same area tat they offer better services and treat people with respect and dignity but unfortunately i did not find it at the blue parrot backpackers.for me it was a nightmare hostel,if i ever want to come back to Sydney i will choose a good one. I made big mistake by staying at this one.

One or maybe the best place we stayed in Australia. A small house that make a quiet place, friendly as you can meet some people and look some Netflix series together (as we are sharing the lounge :) Friendly staff that helped us to find a nice place to eat and drink for my

birthday. We definitly recommand this place and we hope that they will add another award on their wall :) :) Guitars and ukulele in the lounge, computer, video games, Netflix on the Ps3, fridge and freezer, a large place outside to rest and eat.

title.value: An awesome stay in blue Parrot

content.value: Five stars is not enough for this Amazing team! Top-notch accommodation and an incredible team. I highly recommend this hostel, Actually I only want to go back as soon as possible, so see you soon and thank you for this great stay!

I would 100% recommend to stay here. So clean, so fresh. Amazing service by all the staff. Loved every moment of our stay. Central to everything we needed, great food and plenty of transport. Look no further but to stay here!

This place is amazing! Reception is manned all the time and the staff are really helpful. There is an arrivals lounge so you can get a coffee or water if you‚Äôre too early for checking in. We had a 2 bedroom modern suite and it was GORGEOUS. Fabulous view over city, great

We had an amazing time at the Meriton Suites in Kent St. It will become our standard accommodation option for Sydney now. Perfect location, fantastic facilities, rooms were spectacular and we really enjoyed our stay.

The staff at Meriton Suites Kent st have always provided me with outstanding service. My latest stay was no exception. I experienced a slight malfunction with an appliance in my suite and the way Manager Suchinna handled the issue was fantastic. Thank you Suchinna and Stefan for

Location Cleanliness Spacious Awesome views Just a few steps there are plenty of amenities such as food, pharmacy, convenient stores, cafes and even a cinema right behind. The indoor pool and sauna were added bonus

item.hotel_name: The Star Grand Hotel and Residences Sydney (Formerly Astral Tower and Residences)

title.value: Excellent rooms and very nice fitness center

content.value: This hotel is very convenient for any one attending conventions in Sydney. The rooms are nice and kept current. For this interested in the fitness room, would consider it first class. Lots of food options and also a short walk to Darling Harbor for even further options. I
would definitely stay there again.

item.hotel_name: The Star Grand Hotel and Residences Sydney (Formerly Astral Tower and Residences)

content.value: The check in staff were very friendly and helpful. Krizia upgraded us to the 2 bedroom suite. The room was very tidy and clean will visit again. The breakfast at harvest buffet was wonderful with lots of variety.

item.hotel_name: The Star Grand Hotel and Residences Sydney (Formerly Astral Tower and Residences)

title.value: Disgusting customer service at check in desk

content.value: Upon checking into our room we had a very unpleasant experience with one of the staff members at the front desk. His name was Justin. He did not greet us at all. Not even a hello. He then demanded to see my ID - which is fine however the way he demanded it from me was so rude.

Our room was not ready at 3pm and we had to wait until 330pm to check in. When we asked if we could have a later check out as our room was not ready on time. He said so rudely that we would have to pay an extra $55 for late check out cause they were fully booked, we stayed that our room was ready at the promised time of 3pm and he said ‚Äúnot my problem‚Äù and handed us our keys. As we walked off he sarcastically said ‚Äúoh and happy anniversary‚Äù. Having worked in customer service for 16 years, I was so shocked at this. It actually really made our stay unpleasant as we could believe they way we had been treated by Justin. The hotel should really be aware of who they are putting at the front desk and makes sure the customer has a good experience

item.hotel_name: The Star Grand Hotel and Residences Sydney (Formerly Astral Tower and Residences)

content.value: Booked tickets to the wonderful Muriel‚Äôs Wedding at the Lyric, so decided to indulge in a suite at the Star Grand. We booked last November, and opted for the Executive Lounge access package (lots of hype on the website; breakfast, gourmet chef, canap√©s etc etc). The suite was

excellent (separate lounge area, great bedroom, two toilets, big balcony). We unpacked and decided to go to the Lounge for canap√©s; swiped our entry card, and discovered the huge Lounge was totally deserted. Back to the room, and a phone call to reception confirmed that the Executive Lounge no longer operates! The Star apologised that we hadn‚Äôt been contacted, and offered a food credit and complimentary breakfasts to compensate. They also sent up a bottle of wine and some chocolates with a nice note of apology when they discovered we‚Äôd booked for my birthday. I can‚Äôt fault the stay, but wanted to caution others looking to experience the non-operational Executive Lounge. They need to remove it from their website too!

item.hotel_name: The Star Grand Hotel and Residences Sydney (Formerly Astral Tower and Residences)

content.value: The room was spectacular with a stunning view of the city. The room service meals were wonderful and the staff very responsive. We will definitely be back!! Great location and highly accommodating for groups or families

Great location and super friendly staff. The rooms are cozy and comfortable. The breakfast is good. Can‚Äôt wait to come back again. Nearby supermarkets, restaurants and cafes. Walking distance to many places

Only overnight stayed before we finished our trip in Sydney. The hotel already old in terms of design and ambiance but it was cleaned so far for Both public area and in room. We did not use any facilities. For the room, I personally felt it creepy since next to the bedside has a

huge mirror placed as closet doors LOL. Anyway, the view from the room was not bad for a standard room. No international or USB socket in the room. Big toilet and bedroom itself. If hotel in Australia can add more movie channels like Fox Premier or HBO or Warner that would be great. By the way, location is perfect since just a step to Kings Cross station. Perfect place to stay to enjoy touring in the city and go to airport.

Conveniently located in Kings Cross, walking distance to Sydney CBD, city shops and harbour, buses and trains also close by. Friendly, helpful staff and clean, comfortable rooms with relevant faciltities

Great location! The train station is literally next to the hotel. There are also plenty of shops and restaurants around. The only caveat with the location is that a couple of the streets are a bit less nice and have some homeless people, so we avoided those when walking around

with our kids. The room itself was your standard holiday inn, clean and comfortable. The staff were very nice and helpful and breakfast was really great. There's a juicing station where you can juice your own fruits and vegetables and this was a big hit with our kids. The gym is quite small but functional. We booked at the last minute via expedia and it took a little while to find our reservation. But once we got to our room we found a complimentary bottle of wine which was a nice touch. We only had dinner there one night. There were a couple of mistakes with our order and the food was just OK. I think this may have been because it was late at night and there appeared to be very little staff. But overall a very pleasant stay.

Hotel very easy to get to by train or public transport. Room was a good size clean and easy access to all facilities. Breakfast was very good . You have outside hotel supermarkets,chemist,massage and many food takeway and entertainment places .

The hotel is clean and the staff are very helpful and friendly. The accomodation is situated just a minute's walk from the centre of town and provides an ideal location to access everything you will need during your stay.

I stayed here for four nights. The hostel is very clean, and everything is modern. The location is absolutely brilliant - right next to World Square where you have all the shops you need! I also loved the beds - the pod is quite spacious, mattresses comfortable and I loved how

private it felt. The only slight downside was that there is a club/ bar either in the same building or close by. I heard the base until late at night time, even during the week. But it really wasn‚Äôt extremely bad - it is handy to have earplugs though if you are a light sleeper!

Stayed a few nights at this hostel, every bed is seperated so you get your own privac, e en though there are several people in the same room. Clean, nice bed and the wi-fi was fast. Great location, just 5 min from train station. Friendly staff.

If you happen to have a short trip to Sydney, definitely consider this place. The floor and the rooms were really quiet and the blinds that cover the bed was a nice touch. During my stay, WC and showers were very clean.

Ideal place to stay for solo traveller- whole place was clean throughout, good & comfortable mattress, staff were friendly and good location- easy to walk down Pitt street, close to central station and quiet

We were in town for a conference and needed somewhere not too far from CBD, somewhere spacious, and somewhere cost effective. Adge lived up to those expectations and so much more! The physical space is awesome, the service was phenomenal (even before I arrived there was
communication between concierge and myself), the location is right in the heart of Surry Hills which has so much, and the price was worth it!

title.value: Beyond Fabulous! My new Go-To Sydney hotel

content.value: From the moment I walked through the doors, I felt AT HOME. The staff go above and beyond to make you feel welcome, rooms are divine and special touches are exceptional. Every way you turn, something is remarkable. Awesome location- walk to city, Crown street, train station.
Perfect spot to stay.

The Adge is a little haven and many hotels could learn how to enhance a guests experience from this team. Its a pleasure to stray here and I look forward to every stay. Great staff, great service an d a good location.

title.value: A little bit of luxury in the perfect location

content.value: City of Sydney right out the front door makes it easy to access any Sydney attraction on foot, shopping and food on your doorstep. Rooms are clean, comfortable, and staff are friendly and ready to assist.

We had a wonderful 3 nights at this excellent apartment/hotel hybrid. Our corner city view unit was spacious with a great view of the hip Surry Hills neighborhood. We found it pleasantly surprising for this 2 bedroom unit to also have 2 separate toilets en suite which was very

convenient for our family. The kitchen is well equipped with all utensils and equipment. The daily cleaning and turn down services like a 5 star hotel was icing on the cake. Would highly recommend this to all business / family trips. Sergei at reception was very helpful.

I stayed with a couple of friends after a work function. We loved the modern and stylish rooms and generous living space, it was so lovely to relax in after a busy day. The complimentary cheese board was very welcome!

All staff were friendly.Checkin was quick and the bed was comfy and the room was big enough and very clean. The veiw was wonderful and in a great position .Close to where i needed to be .What else do you need. Thankyou

This is our Sydney go to hotel and it never disappoints. Very consistent. Great location, right opposite Queen Victoria Building and next to Town Hall station which is perfect if you are taling the airport train. Midtown shopping is all around you and even the Harbour is only

The Hilton still maintains its high standard even after many years. Although it is difficult to hear the receptionist at check in, the process was smooth and I was in my very comfortable room with ease. I think room service is a bit over the top with pricing. $17 for a small

Woken early by workmen above our room at 0700. Tried to phone reception using the magic button. No answer. Went down to reception who were uninterested. You would be staying at Swissotel around the corner. It‚Äôs great there.

This place is in an historic row of lodges on Springfield Avenue,Potts Point. The area borders Darlinghurst Rd and Kings Cross once the centre of Sydney night life. Little remains of the hey days when US servicemen on leave from the Vietnam war (or if you are Vietnamese the

American War) painted the town red here. The lodge has been recently refurbished but the historic bathrooms are "tight" with modern glass showers and toilet and half sink. The room is comfortable and it is all about location. It is a pleasant area to wander with many cafes and eateries of all levels. Choose carefully. There are a couple of excellent food markets in the neighborhood where we foraged rather that frequent resteraunts. The rear rooms are completely away from traffic and there is an elevator to the third floor. 4th floor must walk up the last level. Decor is tasteful. There is a cafe under Reno at the entrance with cosy foyer with comfortable chairs and also tv so you aren't confined to chambers. Staff have been very helpful and generally we wanted a place to sleep so being a bit confined in the bathroom wasn't a big gripe considering the price. Kings Cross tube station is 5 minutes max. And cab to the Quay is roughly $20. I have walked it but cab if I am in a hurry. The desk can arrange a group bus to the airport for about $15 p.p. otherwise is is appx $50+ or - to airport by private cab. Medical clinic almost next door is handy for emergencies (like a flue shot for recent o/seas arrivals). One could certainly do a LOT worse in the centre of a big city filled with many historical hotels. Sydney does Boutique Hotels very well in these classic gems. It is part of the experience for us as we visit regularly and like space where one of us can pop out for a coffee or stroll while the other recovers from jet lag.

July, October, February 2017 : + : Great services at reception, rooms specially downstairs, good laundry, website, reduction, check out, close to King cross station‚Ä¶ - : Somes rooms little small, King cross area with junkies, homeless people, Sydney expensive city‚Ä¶.

We stayed for two nights at Springfield lodge in Sydney. We could reach all the tourists interest walking distance. Danni at the front desk gave us really good tips reagarding the areas and she has Been really helpful. We really would like to thanks her about everything she did
for us. The lodge was spotless, good location, quiet at night and really comfortable.

I enjoyed my stay at Springfield. The hotel and room were clean, staff extremely friendly and helpful. There are a lot of eateries nearby as well as the King Cross train station. There are a few grocery stores within walking distance and the room is equipped with a mini fridge.

It‚Äôs within walking distance of waterfront at woollomollo and the walk to Circular Quay isn‚Äôt terrible if you are looking to get your steps in. It‚Äôs a fairly lively area at night, but things quiet down at a decent hour. They seem to be going through some renovations at the moment, looks like a cafe or lounge area are being added on which will make it that much better.

title.value: Great hotel with easy transport to the centre of Sydney

content.value: This was a great hotel in an excellent location. The bed was really comfortable and the shower was really good. There were plenty of nearby cafes for breakfast and Kings Cross station is just a few minutes' walk away - so convenient for getting to anywhere in Sydney. My only
complaint is that the only day we had to be up at 5am the shower was freezing cold.

title.value: Great budget accommodation in a central location

content.value: These small self contained units are located in the heart of Potts Point. With a Funky restaurant strip in the Ally behind the apartments and Harris Markets (for all your gourmet food needs for a self catered holiday) a few doors up. Kings Cross station is an easy 2 minute walk

away putting the rest of Sydney an easy and quick train ride away. It is noted in the web site that some of these units are fully renovated and others only partially. I booked the Deluxe Double Studio and was prepared to spend my 3 nights in a partially renovated unit. The unit I was taken to was on the 1st floor and although it was obviously freshly cleaned, had a comfy looking bed and renovated bathroom. The rest of the room looked very tired, with cupboard doors coming off hinges, Lino peeling off the floor, tired old carpet, dining chairs with wonky legs and the room was dark, lacking natural light and had a stale smell. This trip away was to recharge my batteries from a busy family life and to catch up on some well needed professional development. As I would be 3 nights alone in this room and would be self catering for my meals I new this would put a bit of a downer on my stay. A quick chat with the reception staff and I was able to pay the extra and upgrade to a renovated room. This room was on a higher level, was light, fresh, airy and fully renovated. I was very grateful for this as it made for a very enjoyable stay while attending a very intense conference weekend.

title.value: Bright, clean, comfortable with a great location

content.value: We enjoyed our short stay here- everything we needed including a washing machine. Big, bright and well fitted out rooms. Kitchen and facilities were great for travelling with kids. We could walk to most places we wanted to get to and staff were super friendly and helpful.

I rang the hotel before booking to ask about parking, twice. Both times two different people said to park at Wilson parking, and i could purchase a voucher which would make the overnight parking $30. What they never mentioned is that you cant buy that voucher if you check in or

out outside their reception hours of 9am - 5pm. I check in around 7pm and checked out around 8am. I called their number, their after-hours person didn't even know what i'm supposed to do with the key to check out, and said she would pass on my contact details to the team who would start at 9am. At 10.30am i hadnt heard anything, (i had paid $65 for parking and had to leave for work already). I called again and this time someone else tells me they dont think there's anything they can do. Wish i'd booked at Quest, just a couple buildings down the road, was a little bit more expensive per night but they have 24 hour reception and had the same $30 parking voucher deal, so would have worked out same cost and probably better, more comfortable experience. The room and amenities were fine for the price, cosy and clean and interesting buildling but staff should not mislead people about the parking and should inform them that the voucher is not available if you're not there during reception hours.

title.value: Perfect place to stay in Sydney

content.value: The location is unbeatable, right in the heart of such a beautiful suburb. Easy to book, check in/check out and the staff are the best I've encountered. Helpful and attentive. Well priced and just right for our family.

I have reviewed Regents Court before having stayed there many times during the last 5 years. Previously the wifi was a problem but this has not only been corrected but the wifi is now the best I have come across in Sydney. During my recent stay it was possible to work on complex

documents and data exchanges without having any connectivity or downloading problems. I always try to stay here when in Sydney and I do not mind that some of the rooms may sometimes need a lick of paint. The location is perfect, there is a laundry and the staff are very obliging and friendly.

Location is superb. Staff are lively and helpful. The room is clean and smells good. However, our room do not have a good view. Hotel is easy to find and near to tourist location as well as restaurant, malls and train.

title.value: Who Else Wants Great Accommodation Close To Everything?

content.value: Good size clean rooms, friendly staff at check in, on the doors, and in the dining room, very well located for business or recreation, only short walking distance to points of interest, transport, shops, restaurants and bars.

title.value: Great option for a weekend getaway

content.value: Great location, quiet, genuinely friendly competent staff and well priced. Cleaning staff obviously take pride in their work and the bed was super comfy. Walking distance to anywhere in the CBD. Will be top of my list for my next stay.

Here's my quick review for Sydney Botique Hotel: Hotel Staff and Customer Service Awesome customer service provided by our hosts during our 2-night stay. Dom and Enna are very accommodating and friendly. We were given an instant upgrade and an early check-in. They provided lots

of recommendations from transport to must-visit places. We missed checking that Australia uses a different kind of electrical outlets but our hosts are more than willing to lend use the needed adapters so we can charge our electronics. Location One of best features of this hotel is its proximity to the city's must-visit spot. A few of these tourist spots are just walking distance from the Royal Botanical Garden, The Rocks, Sydney Harbour, Opera House, etc. Transportation is easily accessible from trains and buses for public transportation and you can also use Uber, Bolt and taxis whichever is more convenient for you. Restaurants, pubs, grocery marts and caf√®s are just a few meters from the hotel and you have more than enough options available depending what you're looking for. Room Amenities Our room is small but very clean including the toilet and bath. It has a minibar, coffee tools and a TV. Considering the low price rate of our booking, I can say that this is already a jackpot! Overall, this is great place to stay in when you visit Sydney. The fact that the location is very convenient and has access to everything you need in the city for a price so affordable, i highly recommend Sydney Botique Hotel.

I booked the Amora as I was attending a seminar in the hotel. I was pleasantly surprised at the excellent location, rate and hotel services. The room was a good size, plenty of light and large bathroom. I will not only use this hotel again, but have already recommended it to

title.value: Overpriced - corners cut at every opportunity

content.value: My mother and young niece stayed for 4 nights... for the price we paid. The hotel came up short, they cut corners where ever possible, $15 to watch a movie - limited channels. $30 for the cheapest wine you could find (Yes I know hotel minibars are always excessive, but this was

Staff were friendly and helpful, room was priced very fairly and was cosy. Staff allowed me to check out late with no additional charge! Accessible to the train station. Would recommend to anyone staying in Sydney.

title.value: Very Enjoyable, easy and pleasant staff

content.value: Arrived around 8.30pm. Was upgraded free of charge and was told that if i needed anything to let them know. Room was very clean, very spacious with big TV and amazing bathroom. Would recommend to anyone staying in Sydney!

title.value: Perfect place for your stay in Sydney!

content.value: I really enjoyed staying in this lovely hotel. The room was very clean, with everything you need, and a fancy terrace. Staff is really nice and helpful (thank you Dom for your help ;) ). I would definitely recommend this place!

Really lovely little hotel right in the centre of Darlinghurst surrounded by fantastic bars, restaurants and cafes and only a ten minute walk to the CBD. Really friendly staff who are ready to help with anything you need. The rooms are clean, the bed is comfy, the shower has

good pressure and I love that they use local products in the bathroom. I was given a room with a lovely balcony on it and sitting out there with a morning cuppa before the day starts was great. The only reason I wouldn‚Äôt give a 5 star is this, the walls are extremely thin, so you can here literally everything going on in the room next to you, the couple next to me had music on at a quiet volume and I thought my speaker had accidentally turned on because it sounded like it was in my own room. (So just make sure you bring head phones or ear plugs to sleep!) Other than that it‚Äôs the perfect little spot to use as base camp while exploring the city!

I‚Äôm currently staying at Bondi Backpackers, and have been since the middle of May. All the staff are extremely welcoming and helpful, from Dave, Sarah, Jamie, Rach and Shaila on reception, to Freddie and Flo the activities co ordinators and all the house keeping team! Every

The hostel was great! Clean, safe, amazing location right on the beach, cool rooftop, free activities, friendly people and really lovely staff. I was sick and went past checkout and the staff were really kind, and even carried my bag down the stairs. The kitchen and laundry were

title.value: Bondi backpackers is a great hostel.

content.value: I stayed for three nights at Bondi backpackers. Because they where renovating (it will be realy beautiful after this) they gave me a free update to a private roomüëçüèºüëçüèº Staff (especially Rachel) was very helpfull and friendly.

I booked into this hostel fairly last minute. Whilst the twin room I stayed in was pretty basic - Bondi Backpackers does come with some big pluses. The kitchen is great, nice roof, cool atmosphere and great location being right on Bondi Beach. Nevertheless, I found them

Bed was comfortable. Amenities are modern and clean. No street noise, however the window is blocked and not able to open for fresh air. Reception very polite, quick and knowledgeable. Guest lounge comfortable and well stocked. Price very reasonable.

I‚Äôve had the most amazing experience at this hostel! Between the staff, rooms, activities, and people, it has been the best hostel I‚Äôve stayed at. The location is prime and the hostel is clean and tidy. Can‚Äôt wait to go back.

Arrived off a train and walked down to the hotel. Not easy to spot from the street, there are a couple of entrances, the lobby is on the first floor. We were in a trio room with a double bed and two bunks. The room was perfectly fine, quiet, good WiFi speed and we used the
washing machines to catch up with laundry and also the eating area with microwaves, fridges etc. Recommended for a well priced stay in Sydney.

Good hotel stay - walking distance to Central station which is pretty well connected to everywhere. Friendly staff, lively street. Walking distance to Paddy Market. Would stay here again even though the hotel seems to be located in a building that is undergoing renovation.

Terrible, but an easy fix - just don't stay here. Smoke wofting into the room is just the beginning...the room was tiny with a child sized bed. There's nothing good about it and it's a descent walk to any metro. It's really a very average two star hotel at best

title.value: cant ask for more, this hotel made my day

content.value: what i really like about this hotel: 1. receptions (all) so nice and really helpful, easy to check in and check out, and they quick responsible when i found i had lost 1 of my paper bag. 2. the location totally perfect...I can come from town hall station, central station or

museum station. central station the nearest, it took around 7-10 min to these 3 stations. 3. light train station only took 3 min walking, get out from the hotel, turn right, it took 1 stop (1 blok) away...it was the best way and the cheapest way to go around the city. 4. city market, china town and paddy's market only 5 min away...it was right behind the hotel. 5. It was very easy to find food, u can get any kind of food by walking aroun george street...it took around 5-10 min to explore china town, hay street and town hall to fond various food. 6. the facilities more than extra ordinary...pantry full of utensils...they provide refrigerator, microwave, vending machine, washing and dry machine, detergent, small dining area...also they provide iron table, iron and hairdryer in every room. 7. the price quiet reasonable, the room size quiet enough compare to room size at japan and HK

The staff here were friendly and helpful. The studio rooms I found were quite small but ok. It was good for a quick trip. Centrally located and easy to get around. The balcony was about 30cm wide which made it quite unpleasant if you wanted to go outside and look around. The

title.value: Great Place to Stay in the City Center!

content.value: Suite was nicely decorated and came with complete facilities, from a dishwasher to a washing machine. Even the kitchen utensils supplied were extensive. Two minor drawbacks: 1. Supply of towels was erratic; no towels supplied during room cleaning, with the advice that these were

Good first impression of hotel. Very good room facilities and tidying up of room every day. The Guest internet connection was very poor and it kept on dropping in and out for all the three days that I stayed there. I did contact reception on the first night and it improved after

title.value: Great location, spacious suites and helpful staff

content.value: These apartments are located near theTown Hall Station and are a short walk from Circular Quay. The Sudney Tower and main shopping areas are between the apartments and Circular Quay so also accessible. The apartments are well equipped and spacious, we had @ lounge and bedroom.

We went to Sydney for vacation. The apartment is in CBD where you can go to most famous places like Opera House on food. There were many restaurants and shops nearby and supermarkets too. We can even see the fireworks on the balcony of the apartment which was great!

title.value: It was a noisy stay in a great hotel

content.value: The hotel is really nice as you would expect at The Langham. Location is great and walking distance to several restaurants at The Rocks. However we had problems during our stay due to the restaurant‚Äôs renovation and the construction in front of the hotel. Unfortunately the noisy

If you are looking for a special weekend with someone you love, The Langham is exceptional. Step into timeless elegance, quality and the best nights sleep you‚Äôve ever had! The service we received was outstanding. The location in Sydney is fabulous and the history surrounding The

We love the Langham and come here whenever we can. The facilities and service are second to none. It is clean and beautiful, great food, wonderful pool, comfortable rooms and friendly staff. Highly recommended.

Really amazing service . Go above and beyond to make sure any issue is handled. Good location, good size rooms overall great hotel. Really top notch service . Will stay here again next time we are in Sydney

This hotel is 6 Stars the staff the room the service was a highlight of our visit to Sydney Would recommend to anyone who looks for the best of class in hotels and treatment. Great location and so beautiful.

title.value: Our family loves the suite a lot and goos spot to stay right outside CBD

content.value: The hotel staffs are really friendly and helpful, good smile of course. The hotel is located just 15 mins driving distance from CBD but a bit far to walk to the nearest train station if you are not driving. Supermarket and restaurants are in mins of walking distance, very easy

The property was great, reception was outstanding, they were very thorough and everything was explained. Will deffs stay again. It was great to have access to the street as well as reception. Everything you needed was in the room. Even ear plugs.

We had a Beautiful suite. Very well laid out appartments. We had a lovely view from our balcony on the 10th floor. Has everything you need. Close to public transport and shopping just up the road. Great for singles, couples and families.

We had a lovely time in Sydney with Meriton Suites in Waterloo! Everyone was super nice and always there to help! We would recommend the Meriton Suites to everyone looking for accommodation in Sydney!

Great place to stay with family or friends. We had a large spacious place, comfortable bed and street side outdoor area. Friendly reception staff on arrival and close walk to the shops. Would recommend.

We were looking for a hotel for an overnight stay after a show in the Opera House. The trains were off so we were looking for something with parking. There is a Wilson car park below the hotel which suited our needs. Do your homework on the car park rates and pay direct with

them - the hotel wanted $20 more. The Sofitel won our business over other establishments as they provided a roll away bed free when other places wanted $90 extra! We stayed as part of the Wintervention promotion and added breakfast for $1 each. It was one of the best hotel breakfasts we have ever had - highly recommend! Huge choice and nice quality. We walked down to the opera house but got a taxi back up as its uphill all the way! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay, thanks Sofitel.

Nothing to be picky about, great location for what we had planned. Welcomed on our arrival by the porter (don‚Äôt recall name) The guy that has a trip to Japan some time later in the year & he is by far an asset to the Hotel, Breakfast was brilliant & I liked the small touch of

returned after a day out to have the water bottles on the bed side table replenished Small thing but it‚Äôs the small things that make the difference sometimes Would return & also recommend to family and friends.

title.value: We loved everything about this hotel!

content.value: The Wentworth is in a great location about a ten minute walk from Circular Quay and a five minute walk to Martin Place. The staff were very friendly and helpful, they made us feel special. The buffet breakfast was well set out with a large range of options. We had dinner at the
restaurant one night and also dined at the Soir√©e, both were very good both food and service. The room was very comfortable and beautifully clean. We‚Äôll definitely be coming back!

Hotel is a bit dusty but location is great, few mins walk to Central station. No complimentary bottled water which is unusual as most hotels do. Convenient as there are 7-11, fast food joints and discount chemist nearby.

We love staying at the Sofitel Wentworth especially when we celebrate our birthdays and wedding anniversary. I cannot find and point of improvement for the service. staff, restaurants, Our room - prestige suite amazing with partial bridge views. My husband was unable to come

for the first night and the staff in the club room were so nice even gave me a little plate with little cakes with happy birthday on it. We have the Sofitel Club lounge access and as usual fantastic and good to see familiar faces in the staff. I must say all the staff in the Club Lounge are outstanding in their service, knowledge friendliness. We will be back again when my husband is able to join me for the 2 nights.

We love staying at the Sofitel Wentworth especially when we celebrate our birthdays and wedding anniversary. I cannot find and point of improvement for the service. staff, restaurants, Our room - prestige suite amazing with partial bridge views. We have Sofitel Club lounge
access and as usual fantastic and good to see familiar faces in the staff. I must say all the staff in the Club Lounge are outstanding in their service, knowlege friendliness

Very comfortable hotel with immaculately clean and well maintained rooms. The hotel is in a fantastic location right across from Central Station. It is also a short walk to the light rail, which makes Darling Harbour very accessible without too much of a walk.There are also
many restaurants close by and Paddys Market is just down the road. This was our 2nd stay at Rendezvous and would not hesitate in staying there again on another trip to Sydney.

title.value: Good place to stay for a short holiday But it far away from central shopping mall

content.value: Hotel is clean, staff is friendly, nice and the room is comfortable. Around the hotel has a lot of nice restaurant and nearby china town. But the hotel is far away from the central shopping mall. Suggest should put more choice for breakfast.

Handy location near to Central Railway Station. Not the best area but an easy walk to the City Centre. Rooms basic but comfortable, high standard of cleanliness . Good place to stay for a short stop over room rates reasonable.' Very friendly staff, good buffet breakfast
available.

Very good except for the comments made in the previous Survey which I will not repeat. Parking was good.. Rooms were good, Location was good and the dining room was good when it was open and cleanliness was good..

Close to the centre, no frills but all the necessary room fittings. Close to good restaurants and transport links. Staff friendly and helpful, free wifi and Menulog delivery available. Rooms clean and tidy.
