This hotel is very handy if you have appointments in Macquarie Street... Close to Martin Place and the Botanical Gardens... Well priced for a city hotel....I like the fact that there was a microwave in the room and a small sink .. Very handy...

Travel Lodge offered a lovely and serene environment for one to have a good sleep. My family enjoyed our overnight stay before we proceeded to explore the city. Overally I would say our room at 7th floor was excellent when it came to cleanliness and timeliness of checkout (@11am)

item.hotel_name: Crowne Plaza Hotel Coogee Beach - Sydney

title.value: Always my favorite hotel by the beach in NSW

content.value: I have been a frequent guest at this location for 8 years. Coogee is a wonderful town onthe beach and only 15 minutes drive from other great towns like Bondi. The hotel is top notch with a wonderful full service restaurant, lobby bar and then another fun bar on the downstairs

street side where you can have bites and sit at a table gazing at the ocean. The breakfast buffet is extensive and delicious! The hotel staff is always kind and attentive and always goes beyond to make me and any of my guests feel welcome. The rooms are very nice and also very clean. The hotel is going through a renovation now but even prior it is great. Heading back there today actually and looking forward to seeing them! Wouldn‚Äôt dream of staying anywhere else!

Tucked away but so conveniently close to Martin Place, transport, cafes, restaurants and shopping. The hotel was easy to find and surprisingly quiet at night. An easy walk to Darling Harbour for dinner as well.

Horrible ruined time away after a stressful time, disappointed, not disabled friendly, parking access bad, very noisy, lack of information about anything, noisy within the room, hearing the people in the rooms around, including right next to elevator was our door.

item.hotel_name: Crowne Plaza Hotel Coogee Beach - Sydney

title.value: Fantastic location and a warm welcome

content.value: Located close to the beach and the local bars and restaurants the hotel is a great location from which to enjoy your stay in Coogee. We checked in very early in the morning after a long flight and the reception staff were wonderful, providing a room to freshen up and making us

feel very welcome. Our room was spacious and comfortable and gave us a great base for our stay in Sydney. The staff at the hotel were excellent from reception, cleaners and restaurant staff we were always greeted with a smile and made to feel valued in our stay. Nothing was too much trouble. The breakfast buffet is good value and with a flat white and a complimentary paper is a great way to start the day. The hotel was going through an upgrade during our stay which did mean that some facilities were unavailable but this was made very clear to us before arriving and made very little impact on our enjoyment. The hotel will be spectacular when it is completed. We actually extended our stay by a couple of nights and had no regrets whatsoever. The Crowne Plaza is well worth checking out as an option if you are staying in this part of the city. I am certain that we will be back at some time in the future.

item.hotel_name: Crowne Plaza Hotel Coogee Beach - Sydney

title.value: First Class at an Affordable Price

content.value: We stayed here as a family for a Friday night and was blown away by the view from our room and balcony of the beautiful Coogee Beach. From the moment you enter the foyer at the Crowne Plaza Coogee, you feel special. The lovely aromas, the friendly staff and the efficiency of

the checking in was brilliant. The only thing that we were disappointed in was the dinner in the restaurant. We were expecting a high quality meal, however we would have had a better dinner if we got takeaway, the food was bland, salty and expensive. The service, however was excellent. We were pleasantly surprised at breakfast, as the food was fresh and omlettes were made to order, the service was excellent. The coffee was to die for. Parking was $25.00 per night. The location is just across the road from the beach, and accessible to parks, walking/jogging tracks etc. Overall, we were very impressed and will be back. Excellent value for money.

item.hotel_name: Crowne Plaza Hotel Coogee Beach - Sydney

content.value: The Crowne Plaza Hotel is a little under construction at the moment (making sure they keep their top class Sydney rating) yet they still produce a five star stay. The noise is barely audible during the day and certainly did not disrupt my work in any way. I was impressed that we

had been alerted by at least three separate sources prior to arrival that noise may be a problem. Well done for at least giving us the option of booking elsewhere! This Hotel is certainly in a prime beach location with unimpeded supreme views of Coogee Beach and surrounds. The corner suite room was incredibly spacious and well appointed with a huge private balcony overlooking the beach. The Reception Staff were very attentive and helpful at all times. Great coffee shops and restaurants within a short walk though the room service menu is outstanding in quality and price and we did utilise that! We will definitely be making this our Sydney base!

item.hotel_name: Crowne Plaza Hotel Coogee Beach - Sydney

content.value: Hubby was having brain surgery and I needed a place for kids to be nearby but comfortable as waiting around hospitals is really not great. I booked a basic room with two doubles. It was fine and had a small balcony looking out to the pool area. Staff were helpful and super

understanding about various people coming and going - as my children where looked after by my sisters etc... Parking under the hotel was great, so convenient and meant I didn‚Äôt have to worry about walking the streets at all hours as I came back really late. Kids loved the buffet breakfast and all in all it was a good place for them to stay. Nice and central to go grab food or to just talk a walk along Coogee Beach.

Had the pleasure of 4 nights here last week. Just could not have got a better place if we tried! The hotel couldn't help us with single beds these nights but were offered another room at great rates if we wanted. But stayed with the 2 rooms! Found the reception staff mega

helpful...nothing was a problem! Rooms were really tidy and clean bed was big!...shower you dream of! Haha... Close to the train and supermarket for late night snacks and mixer's for ya duty free drinks! Would definitely go back! Thank you to all the staff! Cheers

title.value: Most convinient place to visit sydeny harbour

content.value: I stayed for four nights during my visit in May 2019. It's in a way convenient place for a tourist. One can walk down to harbor, botanical garden, Opera house, CBD. It has a metro station at walking distance. Superstores are nearby, you can buy fruits and necessities. Many
eateries and restaurants are nearby. The hotel does not have its own restaurant. Its clean, small, friendly place. I will recommend the place.

title.value: Perfect for the purpose and getting a suite was worth it :-)

content.value: Thanks to Rehan - super friendly and knowledgeable front desk staff member. Thanks for helping with all my luggage too. And the exec suite was excellent, with view of the street hustle and bustle. Great location for late shopping/food and also to travel anywhere around Sydney.

Me and my hubby stayed here for 5 nights and I must say it's a very good hotel. Super friendly staff, spacious room, I took the deluxe room, and very clean. The location is superb. Trains station is nearby and also many restaurants are available. Overall I'm glad that I
chose this hotel and I will certainly highly recommend this hotel to everyone. PS : Was reluctant at first coz there were complaints and all but as for me I'll rate it 5/5.

This was my starting point of a East Coast Tour so fancied a bit of luxury after a long haul flight. So I was thrilled on entering our stylish double room! Considering the areas crazy party scene it was a lovely quiet hotel. There is a small supermarket just down the road and

plenty of reasonably priced bars and clubs in the area. The train station is literally across the street too so great for getting around Sydney. The room was very clean and the staff were very friendly. I would recommend and stay again.

The Hotel is located within a 20-25 min footwalk to Darling Harbour and Circular Quai, so whoever is happy to go for a walk is well accomodated (a taxi will cost you -depending on the traffic- around 13 AUD). The room was clean, but pretty noisy: we could well hear the family in

the room next to us as well as the elevator. The staff was very friendly and helpful. All in all I found the place a bit too expensive for what we got in return, but then, Sydney is an expensive place to be. There is a Woolworth-Mart just around the corner where you can buy food & drinks for very reasonable prices. If you do not want to pay 30 AUD (if you book a da ahead: 25 AUD) for the breakfast, there are a number of places around where you can order for a coffee and something to eat for a more reasonable price.

The Sydney Boulevard Hotel is situated in an amazing location. It‚Äôs about a 10-15 minute walk from Kings Cross, Museum and Town Hall stations. It is also possible to walk to Circular Quay and Darking Harbour in under half an hour. A Woolsworth Metro Supermarket is just situated

next door and opens till 22:00 daily. This makes it really convenient to shop for almost anything you. Iggy need during your stay. There are also several bars, cafes and restaurants around the vicinity. The hotel service is great as well. The Front desk staff were cheerful and ever willing to help. Cleanliness is also crucial and we were never disappointed in the condition of the rooms throughout our stay. Unlike most hotels, this one also have sufficient power points to charge up our multiple electronic devices (phones,watches,speakers,headphones,etc) without having to use a multi plug. Overall, I would say that this is a hotel that‚Äôs amazing both in location and amenities. I couldn‚Äôt ask for anything better.

title.value: Good Harbour Bridge view, nice breakfast

content.value: I was assigned a room with a direct view of the Sydney Harbour Bridge, which is beautiful at night especially during the Vivid Sydney. The buffet breakfast is nice with a wide array of the menu. However, I could not access the computers in the business center and the card
provided to me by the reception also did not work.

I arrived late, which the hotel were informed of the previous day. Food was ordered for my arrival. Was not told the kitchen closed at 2130. At 2300, my expected/discussed arrival, food had sat for at least 1.5 hours and then was microwaved- even after I requested it not to be.

The salad was not as decripted, contained meat when I'm vegaterian. I was unable to eat either. Hot food was reimbursed after the issue was pushed, no refund on salad.As I was using the hotel as a stop over before surgery in the morning, was very upset I was not able to eat dinner before my procedure. Other than issues with the food, the service was ok and the room was clean. Would stay again for the convenience(close to my hospital) just not order food from there!

Great Hotel friendly staff. They upgraded our room to one with views of the harbour. We had a 2 night stay in a 2 bed room. Breakfast was included. Had to pay for parking. Centrally located within easy walking distance to the city and sights. Would recommend to anyone.

The hotel is in a strategic position to reach center . Breakfast a little poor but ok. The negative points are the windows of the rooms; too small lower than standard sizes considering the square meters of the room! Otherwise The structure is clean.

title.value: Beware of the Cancellation Policy - Better not got with IBIS

content.value: I had it booked and circumstances changed, that forced me to cancel my booking 5 days before the check-in date. A few weeks later, found through credit card statement that I was charged for the entire stay, more than $500 is not great. My advice to all DO NOT BOOK in this hotel
until you are 200% sure about your stay.

We stayed at the Ibis for 5 nights in a standard room. The room faced towards the wharf (no actual view but good amount of light). The room was compact with a queen sized bed, the bed was comfortable and there were 4 pillows to pick from. We slept well with little noise from the

other rooms or street below. Even tho the room was small it was fine for 2 adults. Storage was good for bags and bits and pieces. The room was clean but could do with an update. The location is perfect for accessing Wynyard Station and the wharf/dining area. Close to 24hr minimart and a bottle store, deli plus many resturants. Breakfast was included and this was a cafe style menu. The food was good especially the pastries. All staff members were helpful and friendly. A basic, standard Ibis hotel, well priced and excellent location.

This was a very convenient location for my stay in Sydney. Friendly staff, and breakfast included. Only slight downside is its close to the motorway, so ask for a room on the Darling Harbour side. Can recommend it for brief stays.

I just had an AMAZING weekend at this hotel. The Ibis is walking distance from Wynyard Station and easily accessible from Sydney Airport. When we arrived we took the long route from the station which was straight down, the very steep, Erskine Street. We arrived before 1pm and

were told we could check-in early which was amazing. (The desk clerk also told us a MUCH faster/easier way back to the train station.) My husband had upgraded our room to a King but it was a lot smaller than what we were expecting. It contained a 'short' king size bed (ridiculously comfortable!), a bench under a narrow window with one chair, an open single closet which also had the kettle in it and a very small bar fridge. The ensuite was also small but serviceable. There was not that much space around the bed and I'm glad we only had one small suitcase each as there wasn't enough room for much more. The floors were wood grain vinyl and not that nice considering it is winter and we didn't have slippers! There is a bar downstairs in the foyer and a small cafe which is where you get your breakfast each morning. (If you've paid for it in advance) Our prepaid breakfast option entitled us to a choice of three items off the menu. This was then prepared for us and served to us in the bar. Very nice and fresh. On our last day we were leaving early so we pre-ordered our breakfast and this was waiting for us when we came downstairs. (No hot food available at the hour we were leaving.) The hotel is so close to the King Street Wharf that you probably won't spend much time in your hotel. The Ibis is located on a corner and you can see the wharf from it. You walk out the door, cross a small road, walk the length of one building, cross another small road and you're at the wharf! The wharf precinct is full of restaurants and bars and really comes alive at night. This is also where a lot of restaurant, tourist and party cruises are based. Most importantly, it's where you can catch a ferry. We didn't use the trains the whole weekend but used our Opal card to catch ferries everywhere! The staff at the Ibis are very friendly and the location is perfect for a fun-filled, relaxed weekend. Try one of the wharf restaurants for a great meal and jump on a ferry to the Opera House.

We stayed here during the busy City2Surf weekend. We couldn‚Äôt have asked for better. The position is amazing... right opposite the beach and our room had a lovely balcony overlooking the beach and activities. The room was excellent with a comfy bed, nice shower and very clean.

The staff were amazing... very helpful and nothing was too much trouble. In fact all went above and beyond with suggestions and advice on local eateries and transport. The parking was convenient too. I would highly recommend this hotel right in the middle of busy Bondi Beach.

Worse place, worse pub I've ever been. Terrible Place! Don't go if you're a foreig, they will treat you like garbage as did to me and my husband.. Don't even know how is still opened. Horrible place ever!!!

I want to make a complaint as I wasn't heard last night. I was on my table while my husband and his friends went to the bar to get a drink. When I looked up some guys had taken the heater that was on my table, without asking me. The guy that works there even helped them. When I

politely asked them to return it they were sarcastic and said no one was on the table - which isn't true. Then the manager came to me and asked me to stop otherwise they were going to call the cops. I said they could as I hadn't done anything wrong. The cops came, didn't let me explain what happened and just said that I should leave. I want to emphasise that neither my husband not myself were drunk. So I was unfairly treated and kicked out of the premises for questioning some really rude attitude. Not sire why your staff behaved like this and being asked to leave was unwarranted. When my husband came to talk to the guys the manager and 2 security guys came to us. Without asking us what happened they told us to go, to move tables and that we had 5 minutes to finish our drinks and then leave. They didn't bother questioning us, just treated us like rubbish. It was definitely prejudice towards us. They assumed we were wrong simply because we are the ones not from Australia. Ive been living here for 3 years and know how things work; I've never been so mistreated in my life

Upon our arrival the staff was very helpful in guiding us to parking. There is underground parking available for 25 dollars a day, which was worth it as it is difficult to find parking in the area. Our room was decorated in a minimalist style, which I appreciated. It felt very

calm and it was quiet. The bed was super comfortable, and was a stark contrast to the next night spent on a plane flying home. The hotel is in a perfect location right across the street from the beach and close to all of the local restaurants and cafes. This is a great place to stay if you are in Bondi Beach.

Booked in for four nights (Wed to Sat). Comfortable homely room. Efficient heating and the best hot water in the shower you could hope for - instant! Everyone on reception was efficient, friendly, and willing to help where possible - for example, slightly extended check out,

and ability to leave my car in the carpark for a couple of hours before I needed to drive off (appreciating it was a Sunday, so hotel might have been a bit quieter - but no matter, was really helpful about it).

I recently stayed here and have to say the location is perfect! Really in the heart of the city, super close to supermarkets, nice pubs and restuarants, shopping and walking distance to Darling Harbour. Bed was super comfy, small flat screen TV, and decent shower - rooms
cleaned daily as well. A little noisy early in the morning from the main road Park Street, but other than that can't fault it! Super friendly & helpful staff as well I would defs stay here again

Pros: Location, Location, Location Front office manager's customer service Bed was good, slept well, except for Church bells on Sunday and the occasional ambo or firetruck Cons: Walls are peeling and cracking, bathroom is just about adequate. Hurt myself twice on the lift and
the interiors are like I'm in some broken down horror mansion. The lock on the door was broken. Maintenance is shocking. Over all defn would stay for the location.

This hotel couldn't be closer to amenities - A very short walk from Town Hall station - An easy stroll to Darling Harbour and Pitt St mall (for my wife :)) The room was clean and the manger was welcoming

I recently stayed at this cute little hotel with my sister for an overnight stay. The location was perfect and very convenient for close access to the Woolworths Supermarket, Town Hall, Town Hall Station, the Queen Victoria building and the State Theatre as well as Sydney

Tower and other sights. I believe that the Receptionist of a hotel can either make or break their reputation and can affect your overall stay, as they are the first port of call, so to speak. Upon arrival, we were pleasantly greeted and welcomed by James, who also gave us information as to where we could go for breakfast the next morning as it understandably isn‚Äôt served at the hotel, but other meals are available in their lounge bar. As we were on the second floor in a twin share room, the lift was wonderfully quaint and old world, and despite it‚Äôs looks, worked very well. Our room was lovely and very clean, comfortable and relaxing, and no noise could be heard coming from the bar below. I was particularly delighted to see that there were tea making facilities and a bar fridge. As I have stayed in many international hotels without these facilities, it was a very welcoming sight! I rated this hotel as excellent because of the service we received, the delightful room, and also the close proximity to everything. I will definitely stay there again the next time I am in the city.

We booked sight unseen - it was our first time in Sydney - and were pleased to discover that the hotel is a stone's throw from an underground station and walking distance to lots of attractions. Check-in was easy, staff were friendly and helpful. The room and bath were clean and

the bed was very comfortable. Some nice amenities of the sort that you can't take for granted any more: in-room fridge, landline phone, plenty of electrical outlets, complimentary bottled water. More hangers and better clothing storage would have been helpful as we were there for four nights. Breakfast isn't available but there are good breakfast places nearby. There's a pub on the ground floor with excellent pub food and a good range of beers and wines.

A nice stay but not long enough. Would be happy to stay here again. Would of liked the chance to have a swim in the pool and relax in the bar. Time was short so maybe next time we can try some of these things.

Great place to stay, staff very friendly. Rooms have been remodeled and are clean and bright. Close to Central station in one direction and town hall station in the other. Plenty of places to eat within walking distance including China town. I am staying again next week for my
3rd 5 day stay. I recommend this hotel.

Title says it all. Was deciding between here and the YHA, but I'm glad I made this choice. The staff were very friendly, the price was affordable and the location was excellent. I was able to leave my bags at the desk during the day after checking out for free.

The hotels location is probably it's strongest point. I booked a room that looked very nice on the website, turns out, that is not actually the room that you will get. The free wifi is only for 24hrs, you have to pay for longer and there are no movie channels on the tv. We

stayed for 5 days, halfway through, I put the 'please clean sign' on the door handle but the room was not cleaned. I had to request that it be cleaned the next day. Breakfast is a poor selection of goods ie the fruit option was an apple. Given the choice of hotels in Sydney, I'm surprised at the poor level of service and amenities.

Overall a pleasant stay with great accommodation. The position of the hotel was very satisfactory. As stated before - eye contact is important when people are talking to you. I felt the some of the staff were more interested in their computers that"serving" the guests.

great hotel. good location. Easy to get to Darling harbour. Pleasant staff - always smiling and really attentive. Nice quiet rooms. Gym is a little small but functional. Breakfast buffet is really good - plenty of food variety available

The Amora was a great place to stay - central location with helpful reception staff. My room was nice and they accommodated my request for a quiet room. Didn't try the breakfast or the spa/pool so can't comment on those.

title.value: Close to Circular Quay, Wynyard Station and the Rocks

content.value: We had a busy weekend in town so chose to stay at a hotel that was central to our activities and a bit special. We booked a smaller suite, which was very spacious. The bathroom was huge with a deep tub and fluffy robes. The living area and bedroom are both generous with heaps of

My husband and I stayed here for the city2surf event. It is in prime location to Circular Quay and to the starting line of city2surf. Staff were very helpful and the room was clean and comfortable. We stay here every year for city2surf

Central location close to, The Rocks, Central Sydney, Circular Quay, Queen Victoria, Wynyard Railway Station and lots of other place to visit in Sydney. The room quality, view, service was excellent. Great feel!

Another fabulous stay. Introduced other interstate family members to APX snf they were most impress with service, room and location. Wonderful weekend handy to everything we wanted to see and do. Onsite Carparking a bonus.

title.value: Appalling. Room was filthy. Noise from garbage trucks all night. Walls are paper thin.

content.value: Room was filthy. These apartments are individually owned and it is hit and miss in terms of facilities, quality of furniture and cleanliness. Walls are paper thin and you can hear conversations in other rooms, doors slamming all night and garbage trucks running all night. I
would not stay here again.

Second stay at APX and another positive experience. Staff are attentive, rooms spotless and conveniently located near everything you need, shops, restaurants and transport. Thoroughly recommend for business or pleasure.

Location is ok but the smell at this hotel is something I would rather not experience again. The parking garage smelt like there was a decomposing body. I am still trying to get the smell out of my car. For the pleasure of this they discounted my parking by $10 a night from

$50 to $40. Wow ! The cleaner constantly takes the rubbish into the lift so it permanently smells like garbage. The swipe cards are a joke, we turned it into a game of how many goes it took us to get the lift or our room door to work. We requested extra pillows and the receptionist did bring them but unfortunately I guess I forgot to request that they come with pillow cases so she had to make 2 trips.. WT?? Overall I would not stay here again, the staff seems to be on the phone constantly dealing with complaints. Lots of outside noise. Better off staying elsewhere.

title.value: Excellent Service and top apartment quality

content.value: This place knows how to treat their guests, friendly smile and hellos. Full apartment style accomodation that is roomy including free wi-fi. I hope to return using the hotel app as indicated on the welcome sheet.

It was a good condition for 4 family members. Great location next to Darling Harbor. The multilayer structure has advantages and disadvantages. It was nice to have a different experience When heated, warm air rises up It was cold downstairs. Everything else was good.

Great central location, however if you are staying over the weekend with family be prepared with ear muffs as the music from adjacent pubs plays into the early morning. I am lucky im a heavy sleeper but the kids and my husband were not impressed

The two level apartment had plenty of room for my husband, myself and our two grandkids. The view of Darling Harbour from the floor to ceiling windows was spectacular and a nice surprise in a reasonably priced apartment so close to Darling Harbour. The staff were really friendly
and helpful. Our only complaint was that there was only two blankets. It was a very cold night and we didn‚Äôt realise until later in the evening when we made up the sofa bed for the kids.

title.value: Nice experience with Metro Apartments On Darling Harbour

content.value: Nice location which is close to city centre and darling habour. We have met very friendly front desk here and the room is very clean. this will be very good choice for travellers in Sydney, especially for family booking!

A nice stay was unfortunately tarnished by the poor attitude of the Shift Manager during our departure who complained about having to reprint Invoices with Company details which was totally unprofessional

item.hotel_name: The Star Grand Hotel and Residences Sydney (Formerly Astral Tower and Residences)

content.value: As soon as we arrived to check-in another guest cut in front of us at reception. We had been travelling and decided to let it go as we weren't in a rush even though we weren't too happy about it. The staff were wonderful. They noticed, apologised to us and served us first. They

item.hotel_name: The Star Grand Hotel and Residences Sydney (Formerly Astral Tower and Residences)

content.value: This hotel appeals due to proximity to Darling Harbour and the casino, but is really a bed with a separate small lounge area. Comes with coffee pod machine and stocked bar fridge..All facilities are of a high standard. .A few hundred metres to the harbour and the bars and

item.hotel_name: The Star Grand Hotel and Residences Sydney (Formerly Astral Tower and Residences)

content.value: Excellent Service from start to end. I was Upgraded from hotel Suite to a residency apartment which was beautiful. The only bummer was that I was expecting and hoping for a larger bath tub as the tub was quite small in the apartment and was a bit squishy for 2 but the decor

item.hotel_name: The Star Grand Hotel and Residences Sydney (Formerly Astral Tower and Residences)

content.value: On check in we were upgraded to a 2 bedroom residence which was a very nice surprise and very much appreciated. The room was very spacious, a big TV in each room and spotlessly clean - a job well done by housekeeping. The whole place is well lit and has everything an apartment

item.hotel_name: The Star Grand Hotel and Residences Sydney (Formerly Astral Tower and Residences)

content.value: I booked a night at The Star for my husbands 50th birthday. We arrived in Sydney early and hoped to leave our bags at reception. They surprised us by having a room ready, and it was an upgrade to a two bedroom apartment. They also delivered a box of macaroons and sparkling water

title.value: Wonderful room, excellent staff, great price

content.value: Our stay at Meriton Suites Waterloo was wonderful. Staff were so lovely and lots of great Surrey Hills eateries and shops close by. Staff were so friendly and helpful. We would definitely recommend to other travelers.

An excellent 5-star apartment stay in a very accessible location. Staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was adequately sized for our needs and had all the necessities we needed. Room was quiet and comfortable. Downside is that the gym and pool are located in another

This was my second stay here and the best so far. Room 424 which was a split level one bedroom apartment, very spacious!! Downstairs consisted of the Galleey Kitchen, dinning area and lounge room opening onto a large balcony, (which sliding shutters that you could close if you

I highly recommend Meriton Suites in Sydney Waterloo, the staff is very helpful, extremely polite, attentive and smiling all the time. The room is very comfortable, bed and pillows. Best price for greatest service. Thanks Ana Brito

Great stay everything was awesome room size location cleanliness staff etc one thing I have to say was the price in the end it kept getting higher in price I would of thought it would get a little cheaper the longer you stayed,

item.hotel_name: Adina Serviced Apartments Sydney Martin Place

content.value: Good hotel, centrally located. Great to have a kitchenette with full facilities. Spacious room and it was clean and the bed was comfortable. The shower is probably not suit for a larger person. Great for business trips

item.hotel_name: Adina Serviced Apartments Sydney Martin Place

content.value: This place is excellent and the staff are responsive and helpful. The location is superb. Many food and tourist activities are within walking distance and the train station is very close. reception is able to help with directions and advice on travel and dining options in the
vicinity. I would definitely stay there again.

item.hotel_name: Adina Serviced Apartments Sydney Martin Place

content.value: Do not stay here . The worst hotel service I have experienced. The funky smell and the noisy air conditioning. The dreadful bathroom that is so dim and old holes in the tiles. Shower rose only at half way up my back and I am on 5‚Äù9. I had to contort myself to wash my hair. Only
thing going for this tired property is the location. Over priced

item.hotel_name: Adina Serviced Apartments Sydney Martin Place

content.value: A brilliant location with easy access to the city sights, as well as the trains and buses if needed. The staff are always friendly and welcoming. The rooms are spacious, and they have access to wifi in case you are working.

item.hotel_name: Adina Serviced Apartments Sydney Martin Place

content.value: Stayed for two weeks in a premier one bedroom apartment. Good location with IGA and Woolworths Metro nearby, Pitt St Mall and Sydney Tower Westfield, and Martin Place train station also nearby. Fully equipped kitchen, just bring your ingredients. Room was clean and staff were
friendly and helpful. Only downfall was the gym. Equipment old and not working. Couldn‚Äôt do anything in there. Would definitely recommend staying there overall though.

Things I generally need when travelling for work: 1. clothes hanging space 2. ironing board 3. tea bags and kettle 4. ability to turn off air conditioning 5. extra blanket due to no.4 6. Ability to access breakfast (either decent in the restaurant or a kitchenette) 7. close to

transport or parking Holiday Inn had all these. Very pleased. Service at check in was great, got the $20 breakfast offer which I took. Glad I did too. Pretty good coffee, cereal and hot food. All good!

Jonathan was very helpful with an early check-in request. He offer to retrieve my IHG account and provide a full explanation of a daily security deposit charge that is refundable upon check-out. Kudos to Jack and the entire Shipley Staff with their outstanding service in

accommodating the guests during the extremely busy breakfast buffet hours. Aiona was very patience in providing details of the billing upon check out. The room was spacious and clean with adequate amenities. The Hotel is centrally located with many of Sydney's popular places that are easily accessible and within walking distant. There is a Cole Supermarket with a Deli and Bakery located on the lower floor of the World Square Shopping Center. Overall, the entire staff was very attentive, courteous and helpful to the needs of guests. My family and I would not hesitate to stay here again in the future.

title.value: Predictably Holiday Inn, but nicely renovated

content.value: I stayed here for a few nights recently while in Sydney on business. At first glance, I did not realise that the hotel was quite as close as it was to Chinatown, which is not the most elegant part of Sydney. However, once inside, the hotel is neat and clean. It also appears to

be recently renovated, which is welcome. I was upgraded to an executive room which had a bath which was lovely. I thought that the road noise might be an issue, but that is not the case, fortunately. It's quiet once inside. The location means that finding non-oriental local restaurants is challenging. The restaurant in the hotel provides Western food, but not nicely prepared food. It essentially a "cheap and easy" restaurant. The breakfast is served in a restaurant dedicated to the purpose. Very good coffee, but it can get crowded. Getting there early is a good idea. Back to location - there is a tram stop a block away which can lead you to central station. The hotel is approx 1km away, so sometimes it is quicker to walk. When walking downtown, the Town Hall stop is a little farther afield. Overall, I enjoyed the stay and would consider it again. It's a cheap hotel and fits the bill for a business trip.

title.value: Family friendly, exceptional staff, spacious rooms

content.value: 5 minutes walk to Darling Harbour, lots of restaurants and an awesome kids playground. Great breakfast, but get there early to miss the line! Pleasant bar/ restaurant on site, kids eat free with an adult purchased meal. Help staff, early check in was available. Local market at
the end of the street with lots of touristy trinkets and souvenirs. Close to tram stop. Had a great stay, thank you.

Visit started well. Very warm welcome at reception and offer of a late checkout. Room was available prior to stated check in time so that was a bonus. Room was comfortable, well appointed and clean. Bed was good and the mix of pillows was appreciated. First day‚Äôs breakfast

was frenetic. Clearly the breakfast space isn‚Äôt big enough to cater for the most popular breakfast times. The hotel actually has a notice stating the busy times and the potential wait times. In my view, clients should be able to have a comfortable breakfast experience at whatever time suits them rather than work around the hotel‚Äôs short comings in terms of space. The breakfast choices are good - if you can actually access them without being pushed and shoved around by other guests who apparently have no clue about waiting their turn! Second day, we went to breakfast early which was a better experience. However, at these prices, I expect to be able to eat in comfort at a time that suits me rather than what suits the hotel. We ordered room service for dinner both nights. First night was really good. Second night was a debacle. We did not get what we ordered. I called the room service manager who appeared to be well aware that this was the case. I stress, the food we got was good...... it it was NOT what we ordered. The manager agreed to take the cost off our bill. I appreciate that but I would rather have received what we ordered and would have been more than happy to pay. It can‚Äôt be that hard surely? As far as location, it was perfect for us as we were attending the boat show. The room was very quiet despite the location. We would stay again. I really think they need to look at their room service and the inadequate space in the breakfast room.

Hotel is right in the middle of the central business district, and within walking distance of everything you want to see in Sydney (Opera House, Bay Bridge, Eye Tower, etc.). The rooms were very nice, the staff was super helpful, and I would definitely stay here again on future

Handy location for Sydney Opera House. Walking distance from train station. Comfortable beds and other key spots. Efficient service. Unfortunately no breakfast option. A common room would be a welcome addition.

See earlier comment mentioned on previous sheet. The towels were dirty and someone's previous use you could see on the towel. It was red blotch and am figuring lipstick that had not washed out properly. Who knows.

We loved the Travelodge. The location was perfect for what we wanted to do while in Sydney. Staff were lovely and very helpful with directions and public transport. Our room was clean and big enough for two of us. Great shower and comfy beds.

Staying in the studio room for a 2 night business trip, room was very clean and staff were helpful Having menu of near by restaurants or in-house food as well as a channel list would have been good would stay here again

I‚Äôve stayed here a couple of times for work and would happily recommend this hotel. The rooms are a good size, clean and in a good location - just down the road from World Square and a short walk from Darling Harbour. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Only downside is there
is no onsite parking, though there is discounted parking at Capitol Theatre, which is straight across the road.

The second time this year and as always the service and professionalism of the staff makes Breakfree on George stand out. The hotel is close to everything, Paddy's Markets, Capitol Theatre, Darling Harbour and a shortwalk into central Sydney.Central and Town Hall train stations
are only a short walk away, so wider Sydney is open to enjoy.Thanks again to the staff and management, we will be back.

title.value: It made me want to break free

content.value: Bad smell, the receptionist couldn't understand English and struggle to speak english which wasn't helpful when I inquired about stuff. Room had dirty equipment. Pillow had a stain and still didn't get changed. Would never come back

The staff were very helpful and courteous, however when we booked in we were not advised that there are significant roadworks going on directly outside the hotel which operate virtually 24 hours a day. Its impossible to sleep. The hotel management would have been well informed
of the roadworks and as such had a responsibility to advise all visitors prior to booking of the situation.

We have a great stay at Breakfree Hotel. Location convenience. Rooms are clean but sorry to inform that no toothbrush provided. Staff by the name Kim and Max are helpful ,kind and provide us a good service. Max really take his time to help us upon check in . Kim really take her
initiative to find out for us where the Apple Farm . The housekeeping staff are friendly .

title.value: Day and night in the city with friends

content.value: We couldn't sleep at all, to start with, guest next door had tv on loud and you could hear through the connecting door! This was after midnight! It appears that you do not have double glazing. We could hear the noise from the street below plus this other noise which went on
all night into the early hours of the morning. It sounded like some machine boring under the street.

Stayed for a night with friends. Comfortable and clean. Great central location, easy to get around the city. Close to Barangaroo, King Street Wharf, Circular quay. Staff were helpful and friendly. Check in and check out was a breeze. We arrived early, but the rooms were
not ready so they stored our bags.

Great location for Harbour, Rocks Opera House. Close to Wynyard train station, abundance of taxis to area but short distance to walk to Circular Quay. Hotel staff exceedingly friendly and helpful. Breakfast top quality

title.value: Great location, near the train station

content.value: Met and went beyond our expectations for a convenient place to stay for a night out in Sydney. Will keep in mind for our next trip. Bed was comfortable but perhaps a bit too high off the ground for a short person, or someone with difficulty getting out of that height of bed.

Excellent, my only complaint was that the shower water pressure was terrible, and I had noticed if you stay in the lower levels you can hear the trains so we asked to be moved and it was not a bother Location is very central and the staff are amazingly helpful

Excellent location pity I had to be there during the York st stabbings and being locked out however these things happen excellent staff, pity the bar was not a little more in line with what is considered a proper bar.

Overall the accommodations were good for the value. Centrally located in Chinatown. Good walkability factor. The hotel was clean and comfortable and the staff was friendly. I would definitely recommend The Rendezvous Sydney Central.

Accommodation was comfortable. Dining was poor food was watery and lukewarm. This included breakfast and dinner. Staff were friendly and very helpful. Location is great just across from the Central Rail Station.

We are Sydneysiders and come to the Wentworth time and time again for city staycations. We brought our 6 year old daughter along again this time as she loves the hotel so much. Dinner at Soiree was delicious as always and the Club never disappoints - the selection at afternoon

title.value: The most convenient hotel in Sydney?

content.value: It may not be 5star and it may not have the best view but for convenience it's hard to beat. Across the road from Central Station, 2 minutes walk from the light rail and with buses to just about anywhere in Sydney outside the door, it's surrounded by eateries and UTS and Paddys

The reception was fine as were the rooms. The main let down was with the barman/waiter (who was not interested in anything other than the girl at the bar) and the chef who pours cold oil over mashed potato

We were booked here by a friend because of its location. We were double charged but straightened it out. The rooms a very small as were our one window. Comfy bed and pillows, shower fair and amenities ok. The lifts were totally inadequate - with most uses requires long wait

We stayed here for 2 nights and it was our first time staying here. This hotel is wonderful. From the most friendly and helpful staff, to the huge comfy bed, i loved every minute. Being an accorplus member we were very pleased to be upgraded to a suite. The room was huge,

title.value: After many fabulous stays, first time disappointed!

content.value: We know the hotel well and the high standards and services it offers. However, our recent 2 night stay was anything but that. Our room had not been serviced at all! I did have ‚Äòdo not the disturb sign‚Äô out one morning till 10:00 then left for the whole day. When we came back

Well satisfied with the hotel service. Room was quiet and well serviced. Would have liked to have a handrail under the shower. Garden Restaurant dinner was of highest quality and service good. Buffet breakfast - plenty of choices for a filling breakfast to start the day

A big plus for the fact that it has parking and is very conveniently situated to a lot of Sydney's tourist attractions and transport. The staff were very friendly and welcoming. I did not find it very comfortable in the servants quarters in the back yard but think it would be
better in summer when it's not so cold.

The service was pleasant and efficient from the start. This is a wonderful escape from large hotels. This beautiful historic hotel has recently been refurbished and all bathrooms renovated. The rooms are clean, light and airy. The beds very comfortable. We had two rooms, a

double bed in one and two singles in the other. There is a great dining room and bar area where we enjoyed some drinks before going out for dinner. Breakfast was included and enjoyed on the Terrace. There are also private and semi private areas for corporate meetings, weddings etc. I really enjoyed my stay and felt like I was in an oasis. I relaxed as soon as I arrived. To top all this off, it is dog friendly. What more can you ask for?

Highly recommend this superb hotel for clean, comfortable rooms, happy, professional staff, and best of all - pets are allowed! We took our staffy and Jack Russell with us, who were welcomed with doggie treats and lots of pats from the friendly staff. Our four-legged family were

allowed almost anywhere in the hotel except, of course, in the dining room. It was very special to enjoy an afternoon drink at the bar with our pets curled up at our feet in front of the fire. Very reasonably priced too. 10 out of 10!

title.value: A wonderful, cosy retreat with staff as warm as the fire place.

content.value: We were thoroughly impressed with the decor, the vibe and the friendly staff member. We first sat by the open fire and sipped our tumeric lattes. A wonderful night from then on. Will definitely be staying there again.

title.value: great hotel.....great location for some many places- e.g. Centennial Park, SCG, Paddo markets etc etc s

content.value: I opted for cosy room which was cosy/quite small but immaculate and with everything I needed. Great continental breakfast - Bircher muesli fruits cheese (& ham for non vegos) pastries toast - friendly efficient staff - I have no complaints whatsoever and would recommend it
and stay here again - because it was a smaller hotel it had a more personal feel - plus fabulous location for what I wanted to do and see.

title.value: Clean, close proximity to city but noisy room

content.value: I stayed in a one bedroom apartment with a city view. Room was noisy, could hear people talking, walking past, closing doors, etc. Other than that room was very clean. Easily accessible and walking distance to city and Darling Harbour.

I have stayed at the Oaks Goldsbrough many times when visiting Sydney, great location , close to Darling Harbour and restaurants. Great value for money and the girls at the check-in are super fast and willing to help. Would recommend these apartments for business and family
trips.

An interesting hotel. Great location short walking distance to circular quay. The room was nice and the bed super comfy. However, for a 6 foot 4 tall person the shower was too small and I didn't really fit under it which resulted in water going everywhere across the bathroom.
That said, the room had Foxtel and is great for the price. I would stay there again due to the location and price.

Our experience in the car park getting out ruined it for us. We paid at hotel and then secure parking tried to make us pay again and would not open boom gate for about 30 minutes. Disappointing end to stay

Great central spot. Easy walk to all major attractions and the convention centre. Very convenient as attending a conference at the convention centre and stayed an extra day to enjoy all Darling Harbour has to offer

title.value: Nice new apartment hotel in great location

content.value: Stayed here for work, very convenient close to darling harbour and not to far from town hall station. Rooms well equipped with everything you need. Great range of pay TV channels with sport and movies. One minor issue because floors are all tiled bed moves due to being on
wheels.

Beautiful accommodation The rooms were very spacious. Bedding super comfy.. Staff were great and it was nice to come back from conference and the room had been tidied Wasn't really impressed with the workers grinding and hammering before 8am but I guess that can't be helped

title.value: Great location, great service, great accommodation

content.value: I am a regular at the Meriton Suites but usually stay in Chatswood. The standards remain as high as those in Chatswood with friendly staff, spacious and well equipped apartments. My only feedback is that the gym was a bit disappointing - small, floor not suitable for the cardio
machines as there is far too much bounce. Overall, great hotel. Highly recommend.

This new Meriton hotel is great, not a bad comment to say. Great facilities and friendly staff. Great location, walking distance to everything. Will definitely be staying here on the next trip to Sydney

title.value: New property but still bugs to iron out

content.value: Staff were super helpful. However, the building is new, some issues/teething problems are: elevators would not work with room key - had to be operated by reception, we were issued room keys 3 times (it was just 1 night's stay) before they would open our room, coffee machine

needed to be replaced (it was brand new but would not switch on) and even then we only given 3 capsules (more supplied on request), same with instant coffee satchels. I also did not expect to have to pay for parking (my fault).

title.value: Location, location, location! Sydney for dinner and back to the island to explore.

content.value: Sydney Harbour Bridge was the view from our deck. In March there were tours, an historical exhibition and the best bit - when everyone else went home, we stayed to wander through rock tunnels and up steep staircases and around the old buildings. The second best bit - all of
Sydney was just a short ferry ride away.

We stayed here over the weekend for a family get together for a birthday. The accommodation was fantastic, great views, very comfortable. We did the audio tour which was very good very informative. We had a great time. Staff on the island are very friendly.

Booked the Fireman‚Äôs Cottage for one night to celebrate our wedding anniversary. It was a fabulous thing to do. We took advantage of the Summer Sunset series on that Evening & booked. Really cool sitting on the grass with a nice glass of wine/beer, listening to great music &

watching the sunset. We packed our own food for the evening meal & a top bottle of red. There are basic restaurants on the island if self catering is not your thing. We had our own deck overlooking Gladesville. Fabulous area to chill & eat. Accommodation excellent & very comfortable. Good kitchen facilities. We loved touring the island with an audio guide the next day. Highly recommend!

We have just stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment and it was spectacular! We came to Sydney to go to vivid with our preschooler and baby, and for family accommodation in Sydney, this was great value. It was also great to have outdoor space for the older one to run around and explore.

Access to the city via ferry was easy, the views were incredible, the accommodation very comfortable. It we came prepared to self cater, and were pleased to find our hosts had thought of the extras that most self contained accommodation overlooks. Things like oil for the frypan and, and cling wrap, even a coffee pod machine to make up for the fact that the cafes open quite late in the island. Can‚Äôt wait to make a return trip, it will make an excellent jumping off point for all the wonderful sights Sydney has to offer.

title.value: Sydney‚Äôs hidden treasure - an easy ferry ride away

content.value: We stayed overnight in the Fire Station Studio. It was just above the information centre for the island. The kids had a smile from ear to ear as they adventured around this place. Plenty to do and see. The accommodation was well furnished and very comfortable. The window and
balcony views were sensational. Well worth a visit!

A six night stay at the Vibe Hotel Sydney, one of many of the Vibe locations in the city, this one is close to Hyde Park and an easy walk to Haymark, and also the museums nearby. Most of the city is an easy walk actually from the hotel‚Äôs location. It was reasonably quiet, the

title.value: Nice Hotel, friendly staff is a must.

content.value: Been in Sydney for several times. This time was for a Winter escape from the Wintery Melbourne and for a friends wedding. The Vibe Hotel is situated of Elizabeth St CBD. Big Vibe sign can‚Äôt miss it. Warm entrance with mix of wood and blue grey wall. Friendly staff at the

Rate was unoffensive for a weekend in Sydney. Check-in easy. Room was basic. Bathroom satisfactory. Mini-bar was better than normal standard fare. The next day we had buffet breakfast which was okay but not good enough to go back the following morning. Good location, close to

Mattress was too soft for my liking - however slept well. Could not get the TV to start but was only there for a short while so I did not contact reception - I will next time if my stay is longer. Thank you

title.value: Very good position, quiet and comfortable rooms

content.value: Stayed 2 nights for business and added a 3rd for play. Good part of town, walking distance to Central and to some really great restaurants and coffee in Surrey Hills. Excellent staff. Room was large, good wardrobe and nice bathroom w full bath. When the light rail opens it will

Already mentioned in other fields. They didn't consider my unplanned plane delay to reschedule or refund my booking. It made me feel bad about it for two different reasons, one is that i wanted to have my stay there, especially that i chosed particular room and wanted that

I have stayed here a couple of times, it is good value for money, all facilities... funky living area with bedroom loft and bathroom. Great view of Darling Harbour, easy access to all the local eateries and walking distance to city and public transport.

title.value: How good the location of This Metro Apartments

content.value: it is very near Darling Harbour, Sydney Sealife, the Madam Tusaud .... can walk to the eye of Sydney, Townhall, Queen Victoria Building, and especially walk to tram station Wynayrd only 6 minutes or 10 minutes to Townhall station

title.value: Not great but ok for the location.

content.value: Ok location. Easy walking distance to Darling Harbour. Friendly staff . not good for those travelling with large suitcases as the front entrance only had steep stairs. Bedding very uncomfortable. Needs an update badly

title.value: Nice big 2 level room & in a good position

content.value: Near the city & Darling Harbour, the Apartments are well located. On a busy road, the apartments are double glazed which help with the traffic noise. Apartment has a small kitchen with a fridge, a small dining table, a suitable sized lounge (couch folds out to a sofa), and

We chose the Meriton Waterloo due to a) proximity tio the SCG, and b)previous good experience with Meriton. On both grounds, Meriton Waterloo exceeded my expectations. Will certainly return in future.

hi love you brand and quality of rooms its just the room was noisy from the rd . needs double glazing at least. I would stay again but only away from the rd. Broad beach was good as was there the night before

Loved our stays at Meriton Suites. Great properties, good amenities, and great suites. We enjoyed our stay very much. We loved the Kevin Murphy products in each bathroom as well, that was a nice touch. I wasn‚Äôt able to make my original check in time, as my flight to Australia

with 10-15 walks to Circular Quay & 20 mins walk Opera House, it is a nice location. However, there are not much restaurants around. The city is having new light rail constructions, Jamison road sometimes block and affected visitors having big luggages

The Hotel offers big suites with acceptable distance to the CBD . The reception guy named Rejin was very polite and helpful. The suites has full furnished kitchen and our suite had two king sizes in two separate rooms. We enjoyed our stay.

Came to Sydney to got to AFL at Sydney cricket ground. Was a 10 minute walk there and close to supermarket and eateries. The Room was great, very clean and spacious. The staff were amazing, very helpful. Lovely people to deal with. Will definitely stay here again. G rest place

The room is very clean the bathroom is huge and the BED IS THE BEST...... I didn't want to get out. I couldn't have stay snuggled up all day. the bar staff very friendly Thank you for a great stay we will be back.

We stayed at the Amora due to the location and the quality of the rooms. We were greeted at reception by Matteo and we were running late. He was very professional and made us feel very welcome and checked us in very promptly. The whole experience was fantastic from start to

Great location, being only a quick 5-10 min walk to Circular Quay. Staff were extremely helpful, especially concierge. Very comfortable beds and room. Attention to detail was great. Will be back next time in Sydney.

Stayed one night for business. Customer service was amazing and room was very comfy. Breakfast was lovely and reasonably priced. Friendly staff and make your stay a cheerful one. I would definitely stay with them again.

Stayed here and loved my stay. Brani and Zorica were very accommodating and made me feel very welcome. Rooms are well equipped with wardrobes and sinks. Great location close to the train station and good social areas to meet other people. Free breakfast was an added bonus, would
definitely recommend this hostel.

Had a great stay and wish I could have stayed a bit longer. Super cool, clean & friendly hostel. As a solo traveller, this was a perfect location for me and I will highly recommend you guys to other travellers.

title.value: Awesome place to stay & super great customer service!!

content.value: We had a fabulous experience as the staff were super friendly, the place was very clean & tidy and the location was very convenient for us as we were exploring the city quite a fair bit. Everything is walking distance and we liked it so much we have gone back there to stay
again. The kitchen was super clean to make your own breakfast and we'll definately be going back there to stay again & again!! You guy's rock :-)

We had such a great stay at this hostel. People were lovely and we were right next to the station to go straight down town Sydney. I really recommend it, great place great people, great time, to next to the airport

No matter if you're staying long term or just a few nights the place has a vibe that makes you feel welcome. Made a lot of friends there. Very clean, organized and comfortable. Quiet when you need it to be, essential when staying longer. Nice neighbourhood away from hawkers and
close to Newtown (really enjoyable and lively part of Sydney). Thank you Brani and Zorica for taking care of us all, you guys make all the difference!

I relly enjoyed staying at the accomodation. The location is perfect, and the accomodation as well. It is clean, and tidy. The people running the accomodation are nice, and helpfull. As I was staying during Christmas and newyears Eve, I got the pleasent surprise of being
welcomed with a Christmas card, and a nice bottle of sparkling wine. I would recommend this place to everybody.

The location is perfect at only 10 minutes walk from Kings Cross train station and half an hour walk from Circular Quay going through the Botanical Garden. There are numerous of nice restaurants, bars and caf√©s near by. MacLeay Lodge is a lovely hotel, the room was very cosy,
very clean and quiet, Benoit at the reception was very helpful and made me feel home. I would definitely come back and will recommend this place.

title.value: Three nights in a very comfy, nicely decorated room.

content.value: Macleay Lodge is in a great location, not far from Kings Cross railway station and also a decent but pleasant walk to the Sydney CBD. My room was clean with all linen provided plus soap, shampoo and conditioner and when I mentioned that my heater was not working properly, the
friendly staff had it fixed that day.

I stayed here for 5 nights in early June. This is a quaint and lovely hotel in Sydney. I had a budget single room on the 3rd floor. The room is small, but for the price it was very nice. Plenty of channels on the TV, wifi works most of the time, but was slow at times. The shared

bathroom is very nice and cleaned daily. The hotel is going under some renovations. Seems like new carpeting was installed recently. Check-in was very easy. There is an airport transfer available for only $14AUD, which is $4AUD cheaper than the metro cost. The hotel is about 1/2 mile from Kings Cross on the Bondi Jct line. There is a Woolworths across the street. There is a lot of great restaurants nearby. Overall, great stay for great price!

title.value: comfortable, good value and in a vibrant part of Sydney

content.value: Our room was small, but very clean and comfortable. it had a fridge, aircon, kettle and sink. We accessed the wifi easily. The loo and shower was three doors down the corridor with another in the other direction. The chap on reception was very helpful about tours etc. There were

plenty of places to eat close by and we also walked to the nearby wharf which took maybe 10 minutes (but beware of the stairs to climb coming back!), the opera house was a 30 min, very pleasant, walk.

My partner and I spent 2 nights at this hotel 26 and 27 July 2019. We were both impressed by the room and bathroom. Bed was very comfortable with nice pillows. The staff were helpful and friendly. Only one negative about our stay was the lining up to eat breakfast in restaurant.

This hotel is rated 4 star mmmm I would only just give it 3.. The hotel is large & looks lovely from the outside. Across the way from paddies market & close to many restaurants. We walked all over Sydney city from here and never felt scared or threatened when walking around at

The location is great, on the edge of both Chinatown and Darling Harbour. The room itself was pretty good. We had a double king room. Neat and tidy, good layout. Plenty of storage. What let the stay down was the buffet breakfast. The dining area is cramped and is not capable

We stayed with our grandchildren for a night. The place was clean and a stones throw from Chinatown and Paddy‚Äôs markets, so close to Darling Harbour. There was a great selection of breakfast options. The children loved the pancake machine, the waffles and the hash browns got a

My family and I stayed in the Holiday Inn this weekend. It is in a great location right in the middle of China Town, It is only 5 minutes walk from Paddy Market and Chinese Garden. There are so many places to eat near by that its impossible to go hungry, great for those late

What attracted us to this hotel are: 1) it has an uncommon room configuration - triple room with 3 twin beds. Many hotels offer queen plus sofa bed, which was not ideal for us. 2) it has a mini kitchenette in every room. A microwave oven plus plates, and mugs, give us some

simple meal options. Most of the time, only higher priced apartment-hotels offer this. There is also an additional sink which can be so useful. The location at the fringe of the central shopping area can be a plus/minus. If you like quiet, yes. If you hate walking, no. I must say Sydney feels safe. Although there are a few bars around the hotel, we did not feel threatened even when we were walking back close to midnight. Oh and yes, there is a scrumptious ramen place near the hotel at Liverpool Street called Yasaka ramen. Don‚Äôt miss it if you‚Äôre in this area!

Caters more for younger crowd. Room service is limited hours and is a pub food menu from across the road. Can not get breakfast or even a coffee to the room. Nice comfy bed but cheap, light weight pillows. Mini bar items available at reception but they will not bring to your
room. You have to go and collect.

Would not change anythink everythink is good and very well managed staff are good cleaners very well dressed as well as desk staff clean and tidy I would recommend anyone to go there to stay not far from anythink in good area to stay for holiday

Good location, good customer service although they were inflexible when we made changes due to flight cancellation - bad weather, charged extra for same number of nights because of policy üòîcleaner very personable

Great accommodation for city2surf. Neat & clean. Fabulous shampoo & conditioner for long hair. Helpful staff. Clos to all cbd shopping. Good room. Good laundry. Good heating. Smelt fresh. Comfy bed & crisp sheets.

Dated Building & Felt Dated Inside but comfortable. Reception staff were pleasant and nice to deal with. Internet should have been included in package and better TV viewing options for free. Room was clean but felt dated, got better value inner city last year. But I could
sleep in for that extra 10 minutes, but I enjoyed the 10 minute walk.

Oaks Hyde Park is a fabulous location we were there to watch Mardi Gras. We had an apartment with a balcony. The room was very clean. The beds are very comfortable. The staff are very helpful. Loved it ‚ù§Ô∏è

There was a slight mix up on booking when I went to check in reasonably late at night. Dieter was the manager on duty and his service was great. Firstly, he assured me I had a room for the night and then he resolved the booking issue. Nothing was too hard - exactly what you
need at end of a long day.

Bed uncomfortable and unsafe. It moved/rolled everytime I rolled over in bed. So dangerous. Bathroom too small and had black mould Room beautifully presented though Great location. Not good value for money. Won't stay again. Not recommended

Great spot, staff so accommodating. Beautiful views of the Hyde park. Generous room, allowing space for my child to play. Full kitchen, which made travelling with children a breeze. Walking distance to Pitt street mall, china town and world square.

title.value: A good spot in the city centre with great staff to assist you

content.value: A comfortable hotel within walking distance of a lot that Sydney has to offer. The staff in the lounge could not do any more for us and looked after us really well. The only gripe really is the parking which is not part of the hotel but privately run and we had to wait whilst

You cant sleep because of the noisy air conditioning. Turn the air con off and the room is too hot then too cold But no need to worry, it doesnt affect your sleep - that is an impossibility with cleaning staff banging around from 5:30. Now its 6am. I will go to the club for

First stay ar the Sofitel in Wentworth‚Ä¶ well located, good value for money, generous sized rooms but service standards are well below average. Had a dismal reception at the club lounge by the young lady at the front desk, ruined my experience and gave me enough reason not to

The room is spacious and has good seating. The bed was nice. The robes were soft and comfortable. Too bad they don‚Äôt have a hot tub. It was clean and well designed. The concierge were really helpful. The only thing I didn‚Äôt like was that the lobby has an extremely fragrant odor.

Great hotel in good location . Very easy walk to circular quay and lots of things nearby to do . Rooms were spacious with good range of amenities . The young lady that checked us in at reception was amazing so friendly and A1 customer service I wish I knew her name so I could

Check in and check out really good. Location is great. No complain on food but would be better if you have different menus on different date. Staff were really good both in check in or check out. Also restaurant staff were good

Our beds and pillows were rock hard and therefore very uncomfortable, and our sheets were incredibly scratchy. We didn‚Äôt sleep very well. Our shower head was broken so we were showering up against the wall.

This hotel was very conveniently located a block from Wynyard Station and central to Darling Harbour and the city centre. Rooms were of good size and clean. Beds comfortable. The service team went out of their way to support and assist us.

Comfortable room and very clean. Staff were friendly and helpful whilst the check in and check out experience was very good with quick, friendly service each time. Overall a very good experience and I would stay there again no problem

title.value: Reasonable Hotel for short term stays

content.value: Rooms are cleen and bathroom is big enough.Breakfast is ok. but could have more variety. In general it is woth the money and has a very good location. The locations is very attractive and helps a lot to a good review.

title.value: Excellent spot not far from the beach

content.value: Loving lunch on the balcony. Great view. Great staff - friendly and helpful. Good food. Good selection of cold beers and the wine list is fine and reasonably priced. The Collevento Pinot Grigio is excellent value and great on a hot Sydney afternoon. Free WiFi is fast... love the
sunshine

I have no idea how they get away with sleeping people here. The music is SO LOUD that I can feel it through the floorboards and I have the TV on right now - on loud. The windows aren‚Äôt soundproof. The place smells vaguely of smoke. They don‚Äôt serve coffee. The TV in my bedroom

doesn‚Äôt work - or at the remote doesn‚Äôt, and they guy, while super nice, didn‚Äôt really try to fix it. The furniture is old and tired. But the single worst thing is the thumping music. Awful. Great location but so not worth it.

So many things to cause frustration. Firstly, it is expensive for what is delivered. Was living in the past as I had been here many years ago and loved the location, just opposite the beach and close to Icebergs Dining where I had a booking. BUT hard to park in front of the

hotel to unload your bags and then, they advise the hotel has no parking and you have to drive around a few blocks in major traffic to the local Wilson Parking under the Mantra. Then they advise that Amex has an additional charge of 10% which is huge - used to think 3.5 or 4% was excessive but 10% is extreme. And then find that the room is on split levels with the bathroom separate to the bedroom and living - by this stage, enough was enough and we moved on to the Mantra.

Ravesis is a bar, plain and simple; their hotel effort is a joke. They have a ‚Äòpokie room‚Äô that allows smoking which permeates the lobby and reception area (nice ‚Äòwelcome‚Äô ugh), they play outrageously loud music that literally shakes the building until late at night (thank

goodness for the white noise app), and basically the staff is grossly undertrained to operate a hotel. It‚Äôs unfortunate that all of the money spent on swanky room design and smart branding is for not when you arrive to a sloppy, unmanned desk (and a grouchy bartender with no desire to help), an expensive (overpriced!) ‚Äúocean front‚Äù room that really just offers a peek-a-boo ocean view down the street and an awkward room with the bathroom on the lower level and the rest of the room above with a steep, winding stairway in between (both inconvenient and semi-dangerous). And a $50 charge for a one-hour late check out request? Um no. We couldn‚Äôt check out fast enough!! Only reason for two stars is that it‚Äôs a convenient location with lots of restaurants nearby and the beach is just a short walk. Room was nicely decorated but still overshadowed by negative energy from staff.

title.value: Best pasta ever! Dined here but did not stay.

content.value: OMG, what a find! The pasta here is truly home made and is silken with beautiful flavours. I had the open crab lasagna and what I got was so much better than expected. Silky sheets of tender pasta, chunks of crab meat with a chilli oil.....divine! Starters were shared and also
really good, husband had linguine which was also silken. My friends even went back the next night for dinner. Loved the decor, very funky. Overlooking Bondi beach. What a treat, highly recommend.

The staff is amazing here, and that's the biggest thing to me. The hotel an incredible historical building with a beautiful 1920's decor. You have complete views of Sydney, Opera House and the Harbour Bridge via the great rooftop terrace and my room. Every floor is set out
different from each other and very unique. There were only 4 rooms on my floor, each with their own privacy. I will ABSOLUTELY stay here again.

title.value: Absolutely a very convenient location and a pleasant stay at Morgans Boutique Hotel

content.value: One night stayed in Room 100 with King size bed with courtyard. The weather was wet so could hear rain water falling down on side of the building loudly from down pipe/gutter (it was loud enough to wake me up at 2:30am). Other than that the bed was really comfy. We didnt use the

kitchenette or their free wifi. The reception was helpful with info for overnight pay parking. Street parking is only free between 10pm-6am otherwise 4P & metered (if you can find one available). Secured entry to hotel after 9pm. King Cross train station is only 5 mins walk and surrounded with cafes and restaurants. Short walk to St Vincent Hospital or Darlinghurst Medical Centre. Nice stroll to many shops on Oxford Street. Absolutely a very convenient location and a pleasant stay at Morgans Boutique Hotel. We will return another time.

We stayed here for 2 nights, The rooms are a good size for Sydney although a little dated. Even the rollaway bed was very comfortable. The location is great, within easy walking distance to St Vincents Hospital, Restaurants and Cafes etc. The staff are friendly and helpful. We
would stay there again.

My husband and I spent a long weekend in Sydney and booked a self-contained apartment at Morgans. We have an annual visit to Sydney, but have never stayed in the Darlinghurst area before. The location in Victoria Street is excellent, within walking distance to the CBD, close to

King's Cross Station, restaurants, St.Vincents Hospital, the SCG, a Coles/Woolworth's supermarket, pubs and cafes. Our accomodation had everything we needed for a comfortable stay:- a large bed,TV, table& chairs, ironing board with iron, ensuite complete with lovely toiletries, fluffy towels and a hair dryer. The kitchenette had a fridge, microwave, hotplates, kettle, toaster, pots/pans and crockery etc. Air-conditioning, key card entry and good wifi, made our stay very pleasant and we will definitely plan a return visit

Highly recommended. Facilites are superb, near to the city and peace place. Good wifi connection and friendly staff. Near to train and bua station, complete traveller needed because everything are around you.

Although this was a brand newly opened Meriton Suite building, we had a few disappointments. First we had booked a 2 room or 2 bed suite. Obviously because we were two unconnected adults. We found ourselves in a room with only a King bed and sofa. When we queried, they would

Amazing accommodation just a 5 minute walk to Darling Harbour. Room was great bed super comfortable and all the mod con's you need. Staff are super friendly and helpful. Highly recommend and will definitely book again.

title.value: Good location to access the ICC at Darling Habour

content.value: The location of the place is great - less than 10 minutes to Darling Habour. The facilities were clean and the apartment came fully equipped with kitchen and laundry facilities. The only downside is the construction work taking place right next door. Once this is complete, it

Brand new suites, great space, loved the laundry facilities, kitchen and big bathroom. Walking distance to most attractions. Staff were AMAZING. Very impressed. Will return for sure. Thanks for the wonderful stay.

Lovely hotel and friendly staff. The finishings and decor were of a high standard. I did miss the balcony and bathtub found in other City Meritons but it was a great stay nonetheless. I would recommend this property

Room we refused to take had cockroaches and smelled like Indian cooking. Room was dusty and Aircon didnt work. Only good thing was the bed wss comfortable and bathroom amenities were ok. Location was close to Darling Harbour. Ok for a cheap place if you're not fussy.

Heating cooling system wasn't good, bad television reception, cold hallways, rooms were a bit out dated, pool and gym was quite good though, overall location was good being walking distance to circular quay

title.value: My stay at the Oaks Goldsbrough ApRtments

content.value: My stay at Oaks Goldsbrough Apartments was a short stay arriving at 2pm Friday and checking out at 11am Saturday. By 9amthe laneway, back of the apartment had noise from pedestrians which disrupted my sleep. The inside passage way can get noisey. Great bed and bathroom was fine.

Rang reception 3 times, rang out, rang externally and phone was picked up straight away. Not the best service, should have been compromised for inconvenience caused. Tv was not working when arrived, was told it would be fixed following day and wasn‚Äôt, we had to then follow up

Great location, room clean and comfortable. Would definitely recommend property. Got a good deal with The Oaks membership,so cost was very reasonable for a stay in the city. Stayed in a Studio and very surprised how comfortable the room was and all the facilities.

item.hotel_name: The Star Grand Hotel and Residences Sydney (Formerly Astral Tower and Residences)

title.value: Theatre and room service with a View
