We stayed in the 4 bedroom Bella Vista rooftop Penthouse apartment and it was superb .The rooms were spacious comfortable and beautifully furnished .The kitchen was amazing, well equipped and the bathrooms all were top class.The location is perfect right on the beach front

with awesome sea views and walking distance to everything Manly has to offer .Once you have parked your car in the complimentary secure car park you will not return to it until you leave .Quality restaurants,cafes bars and shops are on your door step. With the Wharf and the ferry to Sydney CBD within walking distance we were in a perfect spot to experience the delights and wonders of vivid whist staying in a spacious 5 star apartment. Another one of our highlights was the wonderful walk on the beach front to the Boathouse at Shelley Beach , this is a must do in Manly . Finally from myself and my friends I would like to thank Nicole and the Wonderful staff from manly surf side apartments we will definitely be back for another amazing stay.

1st time we stayed at these apartment, and wow it was amazing, we had an ocean view wrap around balcony, 3 bedroom 2 bathroom apartment, everything was lovely and clean the beds were super comfy, we normally stay at the Novotel but this was far superior! and we will definitely
be staying there again, the girls at the front desk made us feel welcome as soon as we arrived and we felt very spoilt. thank you Jeffrey & Tracey

From the moment we arrived at Bella Vista in Manly it was simply like coming home. With a friendly welcome from reception, ease of basement parking and the rooms prepared to perfection we finally could get down to the business of relaxing! The beach view, Manly as location and

ease to walk to everything we needed from dining, cafes, clubs and bars meant we didn't use the car once on this vacation. Everything was a breeze and I highly recommend Manly Surfside apartments to anyone either on business or pleasure as the one stop shop. We loved it so much that we are already planning our next vacation at the start of summer again this year! Thank you Manly Surfside!

The apartment was in a nice location but otherwise lacked recent tending to. The surfaces were worn down, bathrooms were of old standard and there were a lot of signs of water damage from the shower and windows that had not been properly fixed, only repainted. Extensive mould.

The worst experiences from this stay were dealing with their staff. I have travelled in most parts of the world but have never encountered a place of business more lacking in communication skills, reliability, honesty, professional conduct and decency as Manly Surfside. These ladies do not appear to have the competence or the person skills to be a part of a tourist business. My best advice is to choose any other company for your stay in Manly. But if you choose M.S, be sure to get everything important in writing up front. Double-check and ask to confirm everything important, like appointments. I wish I had recorded the conversations I had with their staff, they would go viral because of the impertinence and lack of professional conduct. They don¬¥t seem to have any limitations to how far they will go in rudeness, including harassment and plain threats (!). My encounter with Manly Surfside rates to a single star, but I give them two because Manly is the nicest place ever. As long as you avoid having anything to do with these people you will have a fantastic stay in Manly.

I stayed in a twin room with no windows but it was really fine as I was only there at night time. The room and the bathroom were quite big.The rooms were clean. The complimentary breakfast was appreciated and the staff was nice. I would definitely stay again. It is a 10 minute
walk to Central Station and the city center is about 35 minutes.

title.value: Great value for money - great location

content.value: This hotel looks nothing from the outside but it‚Äôs nice and spacious once inside. The room was big and confortable, the breakfast served in the lobby was simple but sufficient and the price was very reasonable: 368 Australian dollars for 3 nights for 2 including breakfast, even
though we booked at the last minute.

We stayed for night night but were impressed by the location, service, and cleanliness. It‚Äôs in a fun location by lots of restaurants and shops and about a 25-30 minute walk to Darling Harbour. We‚Äôd definitely stay there again in the future!

title.value: Friendly staff, but... noisy rooms, dirty sheets, poor breakfast, and more.

content.value: Firstly, the room was very noisy. The window is facing a very busy road with buses and trucks, I woke up several times every night from the noise. Spoke to the reception and was offered an alternative - a room next to the lift, with a window facing the underground parking. Not

sure it would have been better, noise-wise. Secondly, the sheets had stains on them. And finally, there was some kind of a hazard on the floor just next to the bathroom, so you can really get injured if you walk without shoes.

title.value: Worst hotel I have ever stayed at - filthy and terrible service

content.value: What a terrible hotel. By far the worst I have ever stayed in. My initial room had dirty bed linen - stained sheets and pillow cases that smelled of body odour and were covered in human hair. I asked for clean bed linen and was told by the receptionist that housekeeping wouldn't

be available until the morning. I then asked to be moved to a different room. The receptionist reluctantly agreed. The room I was moved to was even worse. A pungent sewage smell was coming out of the bathroom. This time, the receptionist claimed that she "couldn't smell anything" ... but then offered to bring me air freshener. I insisted to be moved to a room with clean bed linen that didn't smell like faeces. Apparently, "all the rooms were booked". I did a quick search on the Ryals Hotel website and proved the receptionist was lying. When I asked to speak with the manager, the receptionist begrudgingly offered to change the dirty bed linen in the first room herself. The following morning, I raised my complaint about this horrible experience with the manager. Her response was, "oh yes, I've discussed it with my staff, I hope we'll do better next time and you'll give us another chance". Absolutely not!

Our 3 night stay here was pretty good. Parking was the only potential problem with a large vehicle. Parking only available on the nearby streets, but not too far away. The accomodation was fairly basic but it was ok, rooms were a little bit noisy, they were reasonably clean.

Nice atrium area where we sat for a quiet evening drink with some friends that were staying as well. Plenty of great restaurants close by, a few really good pubs within walking distance as well. It‚Äôs in a nice area with good shopping close by as well. The breakfast was self serve cereal and bread to toast, fairly basic but it was fine. A good budget type stay near to most of the action .

Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights out of our planned 9. Had to checkout early due to unforeseen circumstances and the hotel staff were extremely accommodating, understanding and very helpful which was greatly appreciated. The room we stayed in was excellent, hotel service and
facilities excellent and fantastic location to all essentials- day hospital, chemist, boutiques, eateries and cafes. Would highly recommend and would most certainly stay again.

Situated in Double Bay a short walk from the ferry port and the T. A small hotel suitable for getting your head down during a trip to Sydney. Room was clean. Bathroom a little small and dated. Don‚Äôt bother with breakfast as there is a great breakfast joint next door. A great
budget option in a lovely area of the city

We booked this hotel due to the location as we were coming for a family function. We came with our toddler so arranged the junior retreat. Arrived and staff were friendly enough. Any extra thing we needed eg pillows or towels wasn‚Äôt a problem. Location was great as many

reviews state. Our room was a large studio with microwave, sink cutlery crockery and small table and chairs. Plenty of space. On the 3rd floor and outside with a balcony which was great as no one walked past and there was less notice. However the Saturday night the fire alarm went off at 2.30am - it rang for 15min woke our toddler and of course the rest of the hotel guests. It was an ‚Äúaccident‚Äù but we never actually received an apology which frustrated me. Our room wasn‚Äôt the cleanest the spa bath had scratches from someone else‚Äôs nail polish, there was dust and bugs in there too. Then we saw a few cockroaches throughout our stay too. Breakfast is a good option $8.50 for continental breakfast with fruit, toast, cereal and juice on offer.

We stayed for 2 nights. The hotel is in a great location in Double Bay, easy walk from the ferry station. We had a good size room and bathroom. There was a little mould on the ceiling of the bathroom. Our room faced the front of the building and found on the Sunday night

some street noise but on the Monday night it was quiet. A good continental breakfast for $8.50 each with everything you need to start the day. We did find that the reception staff not very helpful or knowledgeable about transport in the area and on check in not given directions on how to find our room. All in all a good stay and we look forward to staying again next year.

I stayed here just for a night, whilst attending an event in the city. It's a great location for easy access from the train, being about five minutes on foot from Central, and about 10-15 minutes on foot into the central shopping area around Town Hall. So perfect for easy access

into the city, without the premium price tag. With that said, I found the hotel to be clean and comfy. Staff were nice, but I had problems with them finding my reservation initially, even though it was all booked and paid for in advance with an agent. They also double booked my room, and whilst I was trying to sleep late at night, another couple had been given a keycard for my room, and tried to get in. I had the chain on the door, so they couldn't enter, but their key had definitely unlocked my door. For a budget hotel, in a good location, this is fine for a short stay. Just don't expect too much from it.

Great Southern is moderately priced. . It‚Äôs basic but clean and modest rather than flash. It‚Äôs kept some character and contrasts with most bland, generic modern places. I‚Äôve stayed here several times as it‚Äôs really well located close to Central station. Staff are really pleasant
and helpful.

This hotel is budget, so don't expect all the bells and whistles, but it has a bar with a good vibe and a restaurant that provides above average meals at a reasonable price. The rooms are good , corridors a bit off putting, but you cannot complain about the room, reception staff
or the attention to detail of the book in people.

Stayed here recently during a visit to Sydney. The hotel was clean and welcoming. The location is really great, within walking distance of the major attractions. I would definitely use this hotel again.

The hotel is in a good location from here you can walk where you want (30 minutes to the Rocks) or take the train from central station. The room was small and the bathroom as well but it was clean and had everything you needed. It‚Äôs a good place for exploring the city and if you
are away the most of the time just for sleeping. It is in Chinatown so lots of places to eat if you like Asian food.

I should‚Äôve read these reviews before booking an apartment. We haven‚Äôt stayed and don‚Äôt think we will after I asked booking.com if we could have a late checkout and received an affirmative answer. A clear email saying the hotel had said that was fine. Then the hotel followed up

and told me it‚Äôd be $50 an hour after I booked on this advice. Tried to cancel but they wouldn‚Äôt accept cancellation - plainly refused and now reading others reviews it appears the customer is always wrong. Don‚Äôt know what to do as I don‚Äôt want to give this hotel more money for a deposit... seems they have no idea about customer service and now I‚Äôm $200 in the red. Why wouldn‚Äôt you just accept a cancellation when it is clear the customer got incorrect advice? I am a single parent coming to Sydney for my daughters tenth birthday as a treat. Seems like they are deliberately difficult and upon reading others reviews they have no idea how to compete with chains like mantra etc who will do anything to help.

We were so pleased with our stay. Liv is right in the middle of Haymarket but with the directions emailed to us we got to Liv easily and accessed the car park without any issues. All staff were very friendly and helpful on check in, jurying our stay and on checkout. When getting

to our room we just were so happy with our choice to stay at Liv, apartment was massive with everything you could think you might need full kitchen with dishwasher, washer and dryer with washing powder provided. Beds were very comfortable but only one negative is they were a little short but on the last night we pushed the bed a little away from the wall so gave us a few extra inches. Location is so great close to central, the light rail, George st and Paddy‚Äôs markets. We hope to return soon thank you

Overall a great stay in Sydney. 4 min walk to Central train station. About 9 mins walk to Darling harbour and Harbourside mall. 2 min walk to Paddy's market. Lots of restaurants everywhere. 1 min away from Woolsworth supermarket. Convenient location. Perfect for families. Large
spacious apartment with full amenities. Friendly staff. We had a great time in Sydney and staying at Liv apartments made it way better. Carpark is available. Overall it was a great place to stay.

Stayed at Liv appartments last night. Walked past a piece of furniture in the room and slashed a hole in my pants. Have spent the last few hours trying to organise replacement. No help, just rude. Not to mention dangerous!!! I would rate 0 if I could.

I am absolutely disgusted with how I have been treated my Liv Apartments Staff particularly the Women named Kelly from the Darling Harbour Complex. I booked their Penthouse for an event in August via bookings.com full stop new line when I was completing my booking it gave me

the option to pay later which I selected assuming I would need to pay a deposit. when I got an email stating that they had tried to charge my credit card I rang them to find out the policy around payment to ensure our accommodation with secure. Kelly was the one I spoke to who was quite abrupt and rude and said that they only accept full payment. I explained that a Pay Later option was available and asked if a deposit could be left and I will try and sort something out and she reluctantly said she would speak to her manager and get back to me she made it clear that she would give me till Friday to pay the full amount or she wouldn't cancel my reservation. I haven't got a call back so I called this morning as she said I had till Friday. when I called the number I went through too some kind of Hotline that told me I had to email the apartment and they gave me the email address. Apparently they prefer to communicate via Email than over the phone. so because of this and the fact that every time I rang I spoke to a new person I sent a brief email explaining the situation and that I thought I could pay later and ask for someone to contact me. Kelly then rang me and rudely accused me of complaining that I couldn't pay later and demanded that I paid the full fee. I explained to her that I didn't have it at the time and I was in the middle of organising it and that if she could give me till after lunch I should be able to pay the full amount after that call ended about 10 minutes or so later I got an email saying my accommodation had been cancelled. because she called me a for mobile number I returned her call and inquired as to why my accommodation was cancelled Kelly then denied cancelling my accommodation and suggested that the manager had done it. however throughout the day when I've asked to speak to a manager there has never been one available. so I decided to send an email because by this time I was frustrated and annoyed we've had been treated and spoken to. I think got a call back from Kelly saying that it was cancelled automatically because I didn't pay by Friday being today which surprises me because originally Kelly had told me that if I didn't make full payment by today she would cancel it so that alone is conflicting enough. like I said I would I arranged the full amount to pay for the accommodation and our early check in and late check out and after speaking to booking.com and them trying to contact Kelly I also tried to call her. I found it odd that my call was being ignored and decided I try of a private number where my call was then answered the moment she heard my voice she hung up on me. I tried numerous amount of times to call and again was hung up on constantly. I also emailed and was basically called a liar in regards to how I was treated and what was said to me. We were willing to pay $ 815 for our stay for one night however now I do not feel comfortable going near the complex or ever booking in the future. I've never experienced such a poor customer service in my life and highly do not recommend this apartment. I can't believe how hard it was just to try and book a room and the fact that I was offered an additional service that apparently is not offered through the apartment there was no compassion for the misunderstanding. I would also like to point out that not all accommodation offers a Pay Later option so this is obviously something that they can choose to have on their profile when you're making a booking and they can also choose to have it removed. What frustrates me even more is in their cancellation email their payment policy is that you must leave a 50% deposit and have the last 50% paid within thirty days of your stay I was booking for the 3rd of August to the 4th of August so realistically according to their policy I should have been allowed to leave a 50% deposit and should have been allowed to pay the rest off by the 3rd of July. Very disgusting and disgraceful behaviour coming from one an adult to a hospitality professional and three someone that works in customer service if I could give negative stars I would.

Very central to everything... great location. The rooms are exceptionally small but the beds are very comfortable. A bit hard to walk around the single bed in the family room & the bathroom is small. Shower is a nice size with great pressure. It will be great when the light rail

is finished. A breakfast with coffee & a muffin, banana bread or toasted sandwich is included... order early as there could be a wait. Rooms at the front could be a bit noisy with the night life on the weekend..

We booked for 3 adults and got a separate bedroom with a queen bed and tv, and a single bed in the hall/walk through, in the corner with its own tv. You could not walk from the bedroom to the bathroom without going sideways. Toilet was so close to the walls you couldn‚Äôt put

the toilet roll on it‚Äôs holder. Shower was excellent and beds were comfortable. Staff were exceptional, nothing was too much trouble. The free breakfast was a coffee and a muffin, or toasted sandwich. Excellent location which will be even better when the tram/light rail lines are finished.

Stayed for 2 nights over the June long weekend. Price was amazing for peak time and location perfect for walking to darling harbour for our expo. Rooms are the smallest ive ever seen, but clean enough and enough for what we wanted. Staff were really nice too. Would stay again.

Nice and really friendly staff, nice location close to everything, nice and clean rooms (standard queen), and definitely nice value for price. the perfect place for a quick holiday trip to Sydney. We will be back soon

title.value: Room not cleaned and made up properly

content.value: The hotel is located within walking distances of train stations , shopping malls and Chinatown.Varied restaurants are nearby.Front Office staff especially Jeremy were very helpful and friendly.Room though small was acceptable.However our stay was marred by the poor housekeeping

in cleaning and making up the room.During the duration of our 7 nights stay, the carpet in the room was dirty and dirt and powder marks remained on the carpet.On few days, the used cups and wash basin were not washed and cleaned.The packets of coffee and tea were also not refilled.One night we came back late and were shocked to find that there were no towels on the towel rack.The housekeeping staff took away the used towels to wash but did not replace with new towels.For many days, the beds were not made up properly.The bed sheets were not tucked in properly.The sheets were loose and crumbled on the beds.

My wife and I spent 3 nights here. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was very clean. The street is safe and our room was very quiet. We had a king bed with a sheet change on the third day. The fittings, though old and un-trendy, were well maintained and functional.
The bathroom was clean and relatively new. This place is within easy walking distance of Central Station and other transport. We want to return!

Basic hotel nice rooms clean. It‚Äôs super convienient a short walk from central train station 5 min. I did it with all my bags. It‚Äôs kinda hard to find cause it‚Äôs a pseudo hotel with not a real lobby. Super easy peasy and there is a big community pool on the other side of the
train station. Quiet and clean and most importantly great location.

As part of our family holiday we booked this hotel and were very disappointed with our experience. We booked for 2 adults and one child (5 years old) and when we arrived at our room in the early evening we noticed there was not a roll away bed of any type for our 5 year old son

to use. I immediately looked at my booking, making sure it was for 3 people and then contacted reception to try and sort the issue out straight away. I was told by the gentleman on the other end of the phone that we did not have a bed for our son as part of our reservation and that none was available for us to use. This meant that he had to sleep in the same bed as us which was extremely unsatisfactory, given that we had paid for him as part of our reservation. I was made to feel this was my problem and no solution was offered by the person on the phone for that night. Thinking that we may find a roll away bed or something similar for our second night once we returned to our room after a day exploring Sydney, we were once again disappointed to see that there was nothing for him to sleep on so he had to sleep in our bed again. There was no one at reception upon our return that night so we had no one to contact. A similar scenario occurred on our third and final night and this left a hugely negative experience on our family holiday. We paid for 3 people to stay at the hotel and yet at no point were 3 people catered for in our room. Our son had to sleep in the same bed as us, which meant we had terrible nights sleep and also there was never even a 3rd towel for him to use in the shower. Wouldn't recommend or use this hotel again!!!

title.value: Good hotel close to Central Station and CBD

content.value: Stayed here for a couple of nights when we flew into Sydney. The hotel is a couple of minutes walk from Central Station and about 25 minutes walk to Circular Quay. There is nothing gltzy about the hotel frontage or reception. Our room was on the fifth floor and was set out like

a studio. A little coffee hub as you walked in, then a sitting area and bed area. The ensuite was on the other side of the entrance. The ensuite was huge with a great shower with plenty of pressure. The bed was comfortable but low to the ground. There was a "very" small TV in the sitting area and a single chair in front of it with bench type seating down one wall. All of the seating was very low. The room was clean and pretty quiet. If you are elderly be aware that the seating and bed are very low to the ground. Definitely not your average hotel but quite quirky. Would stay again and recommend as long as you are fairly flexible and can get up from low seats. The Crystal Palace Hotel around the corner does great evening meals at good prices.

My wife and I just stayed here two nights ago and it was okay overall, but a bit odd. It‚Äôs in a great location, safe and quiet and it‚Äôs a good deal, but the place is in an old office building and there are no frills or amenities, but a safe place for a night! The beds were very
hard, but it had a nice bathroom and decent size room. Just don‚Äôt expect anything special, but a cheap room downtown!

I stayed here with my adult daughter in a twin room. We were both very happy with our accommodation. Our beds were cosy and the bathroom well appointed. I was not aware of any street noise. Staff were most obliging. I would definitely stay again.

title.value: Excellent place to stay in Sydney!

content.value: This is such a great place to stay on the edge of downtown Sydney, right next to a bus stop to get you straight into town. The room was spacious with tea/coffee facilities, phone, hairdryer, a small fridge, safe,lovely comfortable bed and pillows, big TV, and big shower room

with L‚ÄôOccitane soap, shower gel, shampoo and conditioner, as well as complimentary sewing kit, toothbrushes, razor and shower cap. There is a great cafe straight across the road for breakfast (they also do wonderful lunches and sandwiches) as well a bakery, huge variety of restaurants, bar and many other shops all along the road. We loved this place and will be back again soon. It allows you to see the real Sydney, a real village experience and the hotel staff are so helpful and friendly , nothing is too much trouble. We definitely recommend this hotel!

My friend and I stayed here for one night while in Sydney for a party. I don't recall ever having been to Glebe before, but it is a nice suburb. This hotel is very close to a wide range of shops and cafes, which was great for grabbing a quick breakfast the morning after our

stay. Staff were friendly and made efforts to ask us how our room was. We asked what time checkout was, and one staff member offered us a later checkout (11:00am) free of charge, which was greatly appreciated. The room itself was a little small, but comfortable. We had a small balcony. Beds were comfortable. The only thing I can really fault is that there was a bit of wear and tear, particularly in the bathroom. I understand these things can't always be fixed right away, but they do give the appearance of the room being less clean. Other than that, the room was generally very clean.

Only hotel in Glebe, we booked to attend a wedding. Staff were fine. The cube is more like a furnished cell. Room 101 is on stair case very noisy. Door does not auto close unless slammed. We discovered this when a random maintenance? Person came into our room, we then found door

was stuck open. Very small room on corner opposite bus stop. If you choose no oxygen and close window noise is much reduced. Bed is bouncy and uncomfortable. Not a good sleep. No exhaust fan in toilet/shower made for a steamy and stinky stay. Carpet under furniture very dusty and dirty. No power points in bathroom. As Glebe is so easy to get to via bus or Uber if you stay in city or Pyrmont it‚Äôs not a big deal. We did not see the LED light display as per the photos. Too cold to go up on a roof top. Fabulous cafe Valhalla social is just up the road.

Central location only about a 3km easy walk to darling harbour. city views, room was clean and modern. Staff were friendly and there is a lift. I would recommend this accommodation. A number of cafe's and restaurants close by.

title.value: Cheap, great locations but very noisy residents

content.value: Great location walking distance to everywhere. Clean rooms with all essentials. However very noisy residents in the middle of night, disrespectful of others. Appear to be longer term rentals. Disappointing as otherwise would recommend

Good location if need to access ICC in Sydney, however the bed was sunken in the middle and lopsided making it most uncomfortable. After three nights sleeping here my back and neck are sore. I would not stay here again.

We stayed in the APX due to its proximity to the Sydney ICC and for the price, it was not worth staying there for either. The person on the front desk barely spoke English, the lift smelt like poo and when we stepped out of the lift onto our floor we were hit in the face with

the most pungent Asian cooking smell and found 2 of the guest room doors chocked open with shoes, appearing to be venting the guest rooms of this noxious smell. Returning to our room later that evening we were not only greeted with the same shoes chocking the room doors open (despite having the reassurance from the front desk that the guests would be spoken to!), there were rubbish bags and bins lined up in the hallway. Next time we will be insisting on commuting to the ICC for future conferences.

If you are driving, stay here is not inclusive of parking ($50/night). Unless you stay out of CBD area. Airport transfer is $16/pax which is cheap. Apartment is nearby to Chinatown/Darling Harbour and shopping malls.

title.value: Best location at food Sydney CBD prices

content.value: IF your trip to Sydney revolves around Darling Harbour, Chinatown and the CBD then this is the best location. You can also catch ferries to Curcular Quay and The Rocks, or enjoy a great walk there through he CBD. Sydney CBD prices are high, but APX offers good value for the same

location. Enjoy the expanded and updated Darling Harbour area with more restaurants than you can ever need! APX is clean, well fitted-out and in just the right location for most of your Sydney visit needs. Being apartments you have use of a well-fitted kitchen, ironing board and iron and space to work or watch TV.

Staff are very welcoming Restaurant for breakfast was good. Great location. Our room was very dated and had a bad smell. Very small rooms.No where to put suitcases. Bed was comfortable. Had to leave our toiletries on the ground because they had no shelves. Tv in the cupboard
made us laugh.

title.value: Across road from train from airport

content.value: I stayed here several years back when it was YMCA. This trip, when I booked there were no en suite rooms left, but when I arrived I asked for one and got one. I didn't stay for breakfast because I had a plane to catch. The hotel is fairly near the main part of town, ten or

fifteen minute walk. The hotel is diagonally opposite an underground train station - the trains to and from the airport stop here so this is handy. The en suiite room was totally fine. I was only there for one night.

We stayed at the song hotel for my son‚Äôs birthday weekend. The room was basic, but clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. Very good for families staying in the city. We booked a family room that had a separate space for parents. Breakfast included. We were able to
walk to all of our activities- the circus and the AFL game at the SCG.

Very disappointed for the price paid. Basically a bed and student desk. TV is not located on the wall but at the top of the wardrobe, next to the bed, so you would have to watch the TV with your head tilted at angle and upwards. The whole experience makes you feel like a poor
student, not a hotel guest. Room amenities supplied but in very awkward fashion.

title.value: Bad smell, needs new paint, terrible complementary breakfast

content.value: Receptionist are welcoming and very nice, we loved them. But the hotel is overall dirty. Needs a new paint job bad. It smells bad. There was a strong sewage smell coming from the restroom, very disgusting. The complementary breakfast, which is why we picked Song Hotel over other

hotels in the area, is the worst I‚Äôve ever seen. The young lady who runs it, is rude and dismissive. The breakfast selection is a joke. There was a bug stuck to my glass and when we showed the manager, she took it from my hand and sad ‚Äòjust get another one‚Äô as if it was normal there. The room we got, which is a basic double, was very small. The TV and mini fridge were literally inside the closet. The bed was uncomfortable. Location is not so bad, the train is about a 3 minute walk, and it‚Äôs two train stops from Circular Quay. However, I wouldn‚Äôt stay here again if they paid me.

The Coogee Bay Hotel is in a beautiful location surround by everything you need within walking distance. The accomidations we very good as was the conference rooms. You don't even really need to leave the complex for your stay. I would highly recommend for conferences upto 30 in
size.

Hubby and I recently spend the night at the hotel. Staff were very friendly overall cleanliness fantastic Although the room was a bit small and located at the back of the hotel clean and tidy Only thing was the furniture was a bit worn and old

This is a lovely place to stay in Coogee. The room we stayed in had bay views from the private balcony and the staff are friendly and efficient. It‚Äôs within walking distance to shops, restaurants and the beach. Very comfortable bed, full ensuite with a separate bath and we were

able to get a late checkout - 12 midday with no extra cost. The only drawbacks were no ventilation in the ensuite, instant coffee sachets, rather than plunger / filter coffee, poor TV reception & ? too thin walls eg. Could hear someone in the next room coughing ( but not any conversation, thankfully) I would definitely stay here again.

Great location, beach across the road, rooms are pretty good and clean. Food is quite good and not overly priced in the hotel, which is adjourning. There is quite a few bars to enjoy in hotel, and a good range of beers

I stayed at Coogee Bay Boutique Hotel on a business trip and have to say it was a very pleasant find and stay. The staff were courteous and helpful and the room was spacious, clean and ah, an oh so comfy bed and pillows. Just what you need when away from home. Loved my spa bath

too. Used the pub on site and Brasserie for a yummy breakfast. It‚Äôs great to have it just there but the short walk means the hotel wasn‚Äôt impacted by pub noise at all. Loved it, will use it again- didn‚Äôt know it was there until recently

Great staff at check in and dropped off bag before business conference started. Conveniently located near world square. Was pleasantly surprised a credit was applied to my name when I had to cancel a non refundable Accor red room rate when conference dates changed. The hotel was

so accommodating and pleasant to deal with. Can‚Äôt speak more highly of each interaction I had with staff. Rooms very small - glad only 1 night and did not spend much time in the room. You need to close bathroom door when showering to ensure steam doesn‚Äôt set off fire alarm! Bathroom very tight. Breakfast was not great. Couldn‚Äôt find anyone when I arrived so took a seat. Selection poor and quality not great. Can‚Äôt recommend.

Whilst the Ibis World Square was quite central and within walking distance of everything, these are the best positives I could find. The 'dining room/buffet' was very second rate and not what I'm used to with Accor Hotels. There was a picture on the lift doors of a deal for

buffalo wings + 2 beers for $22 which looked amazing, so we decided to try it. BIG mistake. They were certainly not buffalo wings and they were partially cold. Best thing about this meal was the beer. I did let them know on checking out and the staff were apologetic and gave us the meals for half price, but even then, I don't believe that was enough. The ambience (if you could call it that) was woeful. There was music, but it was terrible, so we ended up putting on the music from our phone. We had one breakfast there, which was buffet style...also not great. Was only game to eat toast. The rooms were small, but they did the job. It was a game of hide 'n' seek to find the tea and coffee making facilities in the room. For anyone wondering, it is in a tiny cupboard underneath where you sit your suitcases. You had to get on all fours to reach it. Bathroom is TINY. There was 3 of us trying to use at once. There was a little pull out mirror on the wall along with the larger mirror, but you still couldn't have 2 in the bathroom at a time. A mirror out in the actual room would have been a big plus. The beds were very comfortable, but room not soundproof. With a pub on each corner it was quite noisy when trying to get to sleep. I'd suggest earplugs. When we arrived back to our room on the first night, someone from the room next door had put their dirty dinner plate near our door and it wasn't collected by housekeeping until a day and a half later (on checkout it had been removed). When our room was made up, all they did was make the beds (and not very well). There were 2 empty beer bottles which we left on the table which were not taken away with housekeeping. Overall, I wouldn't stay here again as I believe there would be better rooms in the CBD for similar price range.

Good location, clean and tidy room. But the sleeping quality is so bad, it is very noisy during night time ever up to 3 am, due to Pub or Karaoke nearby. Check in counter staff service is excellent with warm smile.

Thought we‚Äôd give an Ibis a try for a quick over-nighter. Not the most salubrious location in Australia, but it‚Äôs still very safe and if you like East Asian cuisine, located right on the edge of Sydney‚Äôs China Town. Fairly easy walk to Central Station or Museum underground

station, reasonable walk to the Darling Harbour tourist trap, or a good healthy walk (or quick underground ride) to Circular Quay and the cheap ferries of Sydney Harbour. Hotel was clean and cheerful, as were the staff. The minimalist room was only on level four, so no view, but the street noise was still very low at night. Dinner was pretty straightforward and nothing to write home about, but enough to justify a long walk to Darling Harbour to work it off. But the big surprise was the $1 buffet breakfast (or $15, depending on your room rate). Not quite Pullman Bunker Bay, but we were really surprised at how good it was. The jovial Korean Chef made us feel most welcome at breakfast and kept us entertained; we actually enjoyed being outside in the morning watching the busy intersection two floors below, and our Chef kept checking on our welfare in the cool weather, and brought eggs to order. In all, terrific value - and really surprisingly good for a budget hotel. We‚Äôll be back.

Loved the hotel , very very friendly staff . Every thing I needed from a quick 2 nights business stay . Rooms clean and functional nice breakfast . Very central London within walking distance from loads of attractions

Booked a single room before an early morning flight and suited my purposes well. Very close to Central station and pubs/restaurants. Room basic but clean and good value for money. Thankfully had a small fan heater to warm up in winter. Bed comfy enough. Was quiet after 10pm as

the place has a strict no noise policy which was greatly appreciated. Front door to hotel is locked at all times and can be opened by your room key, good for security. Room didn‚Äôt have a towel but a call to in-house cleaner sent one up pronto. Shower/toilets clean. Recommend to bring own small body wash and shampoo etc.. All in all, a great stay and will stay again if need a night in the city at a budget price.

It was a pleasant stay. You can go anywhere in the city very easily from the accommodation. I had a single room. People were very nice. Only thing I wish it had with my room is bit more cleaning. I would definitely recommend this place for backpackers.

Affordable accomodation, you get what you paid for. I had a single room. Top location very close to the Central station and to food chains. The only thing I didn‚Äôt like are the showers‚Äîoutdated with poor water pressure, separate hot&cold. It‚Äôs hard to get a good, nice shower
after a long day of gallivanting.

I was a bit nervous about staying in a hostel but it turned out to be a very pleasant experience. The whole place was very clean - the floor mats in the bathroom even got changed every day! I was on crutches and struggled a bit with the two flights of stairs but most of the
staff and guests were very helpful, always offering to carry my bag or open doors for me. The dining table in the kitchen definitely made it feel like home.

title.value: Average hostel, close to the train

content.value: There is nothing special about the hostel, but the location is convenient because it is close to the train station. I had to be back at the airport really early in the morning. Taking the train in the morning was very easy and a quick ride to the airport.

Can you please have free bottled water and biscuits for the night to make it a perfect place to stay? Before I was told there were 2 free bottled water and some biscuits for snacks for the night.That would be a an improvement.

We arrived at 07:00 after an overnight flight. At 08:00 we were in our room. Front counter staff very helpful and considerate. Room, a little small, however, very clean and tidy. Comfortable bed. Dark room also. Great location, great price...great stay.

title.value: My experience staying at Metro Hotel Marlow Sydney Central

content.value: I have stayed at this Hotel many times over the past several years and have enjoyed the experience. The hotel is located close to where I attend my work in Sydney. The cleanliness of the hotel and the friendly service s possibly the best I have experienced in Australia.

This place was great! Staff was really nice and rooms are clean :). The surroundings are perfect for any weary traveller looking for an adventure. I will without a doubt recommend this to all my friends!

my friend have to find the place to stay in Sydney CBD for Tonight ( pretty urgent) and few more night. We was looking around few place around Haymarket. So lucky we came to Metro hotel at 9 pm!!!! We went to reception desk and ask for more information, we got such a great
costumer service from Christian. Thank you so much Christian, me and my friend really appreciate your service and we definitely will be back to this hotel again. üëçüèª

I have stayed here for the last several years for annual conference in Sydney. The staff are always very friendly and extremely helpful. The rooms are well presented, beds and pillows are comfortable. Location is fantastic for access to Darling Harbour, the ICC and China Town.
Great hotel with fantastic staff.

Lovely hostel and amazing people, would love to come here again some day. Keep up the good work. I immediately felt home and all of the staff and even the people that came to the hostel were very mindful and very friendly!

Great hostel. Very nice beach vibes going on. Staff was very nice and helpfull. Food in the restaurant is very tasty must try! The superior bedrooms have 2 chargers per person, next to your bed. It was very nice to charge my phone while in bed.

title.value: Great hostel in an amazing location

content.value: Myself and my friend check in for 2 weeks at Mad Monkey Coogee and had an incredible time. The staff at the hostel were so friendly, especially the manager Kristy. The facilities were also great; bathrooms and dorms rooms were cleaned everyday. The kitchen was ideal with plenty

of space for cooking in. Fnky Mnky Bar & Restarant had great activities on in the evenings, great way to meet people. The food and drink deals were also great value. I would definitely recommend staying in Mad Monkey Coogee and will definitely return!

Our rooms were cleaned daily. The hostel is insanely close to the beach and many great restaurants and bars. We met so many cool travelers from other countries. My sister and I had a great time staying here over NYE.

It's basic. It's cheap. It's convenient. It's comfortable. For an overnighter like a show or a shpping trip it's great. Just one block from Martin Place and Wynyard Railway Station, the windows have brick-wall "views", and there's no lift (heritage building). But at the price
it's the best option, most times. It's hard to find (one door frontage), but worth the search. Book early.

title.value: More of a backpackers than the hotel as advertised

content.value: Like a challenge to get into small spaces? Well this is the place for you! With a ridiculously small access being awkward enough to get a suitcase and backpack into on its own then the fun of getting inside is even futher increased by the only way up is via a crazy steep

stairwell as there are NO elevators at all either! Photos will be attached with review! One person of a couple that arrived as we did had to find alternative accomodation as she has a wheelchair. Well the staff didn't want to hear from the upset partner that they should advertise this place as non stairgoer friendly so as we were a group of 3 couples and only needed 1 nights stay we would give it a go anyway as we had already booked and paid! So Up the stairs we climb hoping noone needs to come back down and into our room which was right next door to the the communal kitchen facilities which by the way is Awesome if you like to be woken by people making a coffee or snacks all night with the beeping of the microwave and clunking of cups and dishes in the sink! Oh and its like having your own talkback radio stuck on with the hotel communal sitting area just outside room with your non soundproof doors. Out of the 3 rooms we as a group hired not one bathroom had a door that wasnt broken and just to top it off My mate found a cockroach near his bed so decided to take it to reception to emphasise his unhappiness with our accomodation! Funny story but they didn't want the roach at their desk either!! After an awful nights sleep i needed a wake up shower to find that our water heater was freezing and not to mention gross mould build up around the sink photos will be attached!. Also a couple of days after we left they charged non existant mini bar charges to our friends room. They were refunded after enquiry and complaints but made us concerned about what they did with our credit card details they photo copied front and back! Also a warning with the bathroom doors there are warning signs that steam from bathroom sets off fire alarms and that there will ne a $1700 fine charged to customer if they are set off! Lucky we had no hot water! For cheap and just needing a bed for the night its ok but next time would spend a few more dollars for something better. It is a good location for walking to opera house and cruise departure and central for shopping and bars.

What a brilliant hotel in the centre of Sydney. 50 metres from channel 7 studio's and The Lindt Cafe this hotel is superb value. We stayed in a twin bedded room, with TV, free Wifi, tea making, fridge & aircon, which was nice as we had cold weather. Very clean room, solid but

very comfy bed, looks like its been newly painted. Full large kitchen, cooker, fridge ect. Large sitting area with TV. The receptionist spoke English and l'm sure would be helpful if anything was needed. All in all a very good cheap clean hotel. Sorry no pics but genuine comments. Oh in case you can't climb stairs this may not be for you.

Read bad reviews of this hotel but I found it clean, comfortable and quiet - as a central city hotel could be. Bed linen and towels clean, good hot shower with jel, shampoo etc. tea and coffee making and a small fridge and a TV. There was also a communal lounge and dining room
with everything you could need to prepare a meal although there were plenty of restaurants around. The only minus was no lift so lots of stairs to climb.

title.value: Cheap but under the ground level not so cool

content.value: We stayed here some weeks ago. It was one of the last free places in Sydney. It was cheap but under the ground level wit ha small window. The room was small and ok for the short stay. The service was ok and we didn't try the breakfast. As one of the last options you can stay
here but i wouldn't recommend it really warm

Best staff in Sydney and I love the big beds they haveü§ô cozy and friendly place with events going on everyday. They have pretty damn good nacho mondays here.! Ryan the night manager is litü§ü top bananas

I found the hostel very clean and with a good mindset. The staff is very friendly and I appreciated the location (close to central station). I would recommend this hostel to my friends. If never I come back to Sydney I would enjoy staying there again.

My favourite hostel in Sydney! I‚Äôve stayed here a few times. It‚Äôs easy to meet people, great location, a decent free breakfast, there‚Äôs also free food nights which are great if you‚Äôre on a budget. Clean facilities and friendly staff and overall good vibes. Would defo recommend :)

Staying here long term and the hostel is just fantastic! The staff here are super friendly and very helpful. They provide great breakfast and awesome free dinners most days, and plus the rooms and bathrooms are always very clean! As a bonus there‚Äôs a free yoga class on
Wednesday and themed hostel nights on friday! I would definitely recommend this hostel.

Had a lovely stay here! This is by far the coziest, friendliest hostel in Sydney. Made a lot of friends here, long and short termers, and enjoyed the free events. Very clean and the kitchen is well stocked! Will definitely stay here when I'm in Sydney again

An absolute disgrace. After a 13 hour bus journey we arrive here with all our bags to be presented by squashed cockroaches at the entrance & ‚ÄòSofia‚Äô an incredibly rude receptionist, who, as we try & squeeze through the door to reception, makes zero effort to welcome us & even

though she‚Äôs located clearly infront of us consciously ignores us. We ask if it‚Äôs possibly to check in, in which she replies ‚Äúnot until 2‚Äù. I understand that this is standard procedure to a certain extent in most hostels so this is not a problem. She didn‚Äôt offer to help with any of our luggage even though we arrived 5 & a half hours before their allocated check in time, then looked at us in discust when asked if we could store our things somewhere. We walked around city to try & kill the time. We then arrive back at 1:15 wet & cold from the weather, but she refuses to let anyone check into their rooms until exactly 2oclock. After all of this they then make a mistake with our booking & we get allocated beds in two seperate rooms even though we clearly booked as a pair. ‚ÄòSofia‚Äô being the miserable, disgruntled woman that she is, showed zero sympathy towards our situation & did absolutely nothing to resolve the issue or make it any easier. In each of our seperate rooms there are spare beds still, but she refuses to let us pair up. They also refuse to give us any kind of refund. The bedrooms are dirty & dingy & the hostel has zero atmosphere. I feel like I‚Äôve been sent to military jail to serve a sentence. Every wall is labelled with warning signs of everything you are not allowed to do, all highlighted with the fines which will be imposed if broken. I‚Äôm so disappointed that this will forever be my first impression of Sydney... I‚Äôm not one to leave reviews, but after travelling all over the world for the past year this is by far the worst I have ever been treated & would advice anyone considering it to stay here to stay well away. It‚Äôs an embaressment to the company name & hostels in general & having spent $200 to stay here for the next 3nights I can‚Äôt help but feel like I‚Äôve been taken full advantage of.

You get what you pay for. Beds are basic, cleanliness is also not very high on their agenda. There were no lockers I could use to lock my stuff away as all were alrady taken by longterm staying guests on whv. If you‚Äôre a solo traveller, this is not a place to be.

The village is a good hostel , close to king‚Äôs cross station , is pretty clean , and there is a beautiful rooftop with amazing view. The only thing I didn‚Äôt like was the kitchen a bit small. The rooms are comfortable , and the staff really kind.

The village is a good, clean hostel. It‚Äôs close to Kings Cross station which is a short ride into the CBD. The rooms are extremely basic but cleaned regularly by a lovely lady, who is extremely helpful and hard working. The rooftop terrace is a real gem which gives amazing views

across the city. The main social areas are usually quite crowded but well maintained. The reception staff are ok but do not seem to enjoy what they do. Well worth a visit if you are trying to see Sydney on a budget.

This is the dirtiest hostel I've ever been to. Choosing a bathroom was a matter of where it seemed least likely to catch a disease. In comparison to that the rooms were okay. When I checked in the guy at reception didn't really speak English. WiFi and laundry weren't working.

When I asked for a place to go to check my mails the guy shrugged. Apart from the rooftop terrace, where everyone was smoking weed, there was no common area, one couch in the hallway where three people could sit was referred to as the lounge. However other staff members were nice and helpful and used google to answer questions. The free breakfast was good as well.

A beautifully clean and affordable property, welcoming atmosphere and spacious rooms. Highly recommended. Great breakfasts, everything available that you might want to eat. Will stay again when in Sydney

Stayed for 4 nights for pleasure and business. Located on good transport lines in Glebe with plenty of food options around. Host is friendly and helpful and breakfast in the morning is lovely. My room was at the front and, beside some road noise, it was comfortable and
spotlessly clean and serviced everyday. Highly recommend.

Verona Guest House is conveniently located near the centre of Sydney. You can get a bus right outside the door that takes you downtown in 20 minutes. Friendly and helpful welcome. My room and en suite were very clean and comfortable. The Villa is beautifully restored. There is a

front verandah where you can sit and relax. There is a nice breakfast in a common dining room each day - a nice way to meet fellow travellers. There are lots of cafes close by. Glebe is a good base from which to explore Sydney - Tramways, University of Sydney and a walk by the water are all nearby. Highly recommend.

Stayed here for a Sydney visit. The host was extremely welcoming, made us feel instantly at home and was filled with great recommendations about where to eat and how to get around the city. Room was very comfortable and breakfast was great. The guest house is in a great
location where it‚Äôs very easy to get into the city. I‚Äôd recommend this place to anybody visiting Sydney looking for a quiet, restful base from which to explore the city.

Lovely restored home, Excellent service, clean room, nicely furnished, close to major attractions, hostess very knowledgeable on area and very happy to help with any information regarding Sydney. All in all we would recommend this accommodation without hesitation.

title.value: Impossible to make reservation online, what kind of hotel is this.

content.value: They dont open room rate beyond 15-20 days after the current date. Make you impossible to make any reservation even for the next two months. What kind of hotel is this? Dont they reliaze how to do the business.

Great location near Chinatown, Koreatown and Thaitown with Vietnamese restaurants nearby. Close to CBD, plenty of parking handy. Easy walking to Hyde Park, to cinemas and theatres. Refurbishment nearly completed, suites are first rate. Staff are cheerful and helpful

Excellent location close to Central station and easy enough to walk in to the city or to the NSW gallery or State Library or a number of parks. Great little cafes close by also. Only there for 1 night as had a family funeral to attend. Staff were sympathetic, friendly and
helpful.

Well presented and roomy one bedroom unit, was very clean, staff were friendly and helpful.Great location comfortable walk to Central, theatres and Chinatown, would definitely recommend. Thanks Wyndham.

The good: Easy walking to attractions/city area Stove and oven with a couple of pots and a frying pan, crockery, fridge and microwave The bad: Traffic noise is LOUD all night which makes it hard to sleep No water pressure in the shower Wifi is rubbish and works best in kitchen
- move anywhere else and you get an even worse connection Limited kitchen utensils - no mixing bowls or oven trays. So you can cook, but very limited in what is easily prepared and cooked

Beautiful presented apartment in a perfect location. Spacious and comfortable enough to o stay with my girlfriends for my birthday and weekend getaway. We were lucky enough to be the first guests of the newly renovated 2 bedroom apartment.

Excellent unit. Clean and safe locations. Walking distance to many things and especially to the metro station. The bathroom was spotless! The kitchen was spotless!! This is a non smoking building/unit but I guess this is all over Sydney? Still ok, just smoked outside. The wifi
was fast!

title.value: Comfortable but could have been improved for 5 star

content.value: Room. Spacious studio room with massive super king bed. Kindly provided extra pillows upon request. Good kitchen amenities incl washer dryer, kettle toaster, microwave, oven. Had washing up liquids and Toiletries too. Plenty of kitchen space. Blackout blinds OK, but not good

that there were small openings of the blind near dressing area. At night with the lights on, and being on a main road, this wasn't very good. Location. Accessible location, less than 5m walk from local supermarket, Coles and Kings Cross Station. Not much to do in Potts Point itself, but plenty of shops close by for food and drink. WiFi. This was rubbish. Open, unsecured connection with low signals. Air con. This let us down somewhat as the unit was very smelly. The smell was worse when the unit was switched off but even when on, you could smell it. Noise. Quite noisy. There's no double glazing so you could hear everything outside, esp the roadworks which started at 8am everyday. Room service. Got better as the week went by! The first day, the cleaner didn't make the bed properly but after that it was perfect. Cleaning of surfaces incl kitchen or table areas, bathroom doesn't seem to be included. Staff. Friendly and provided useful information regarding tourist areas. We needed to print off an important document and they kindly did this too.

I stayed at Annam apartments while visiting for work. I found the apartments easy to find (in a great location), everything you could need in an apartment for a weeks stay and friendly staff. Fully equipped kitchen, ironing board/iron and washing machine and detergents and
balcony. Would highly recommend.

Annam apartments were a pleasant surprise. Clean and spacious with the added bonus of a washer/dryer. The full kitchen was great and the only criticism would be the lack of bowls for salad and use in the microwave/oven. There were only two large and small plates and bowls.

Staff were amazing. Their local knowledge was outstanding and willingness to help was second to none. Nothing was too much trouble and they made our stay even more enjoyable. It was a short walk from Kings Cross train station - which was great as we took the train from the airport. However the Annam can arrange a shuttle to the airport for $18 and we took advantage of this for our return trip. We walked just about everywhere around town, it was so easy. Coles supermarket was five minutes walk away, but there were plenty of other supermarkets on route to the city. There are plenty of restaurants and take-aways so you will never go hungry! And very reasonably priced too. I would definitely recommend the Annam and would stay again.

Excellent location for a city discovery trip. But nothing ‚Äúboutique‚Äù about this place. It‚Äôs just old. Boutique implies special charm or service, that is not the case. Plus the pictures are completely misleading about the size of the rooms. They are tiny. Still, it served the
purpose, price was ok.

Great central location, easy walking distance to Hyde Park, or down to Darling Harbour area. The hotel had a unique historical feel with lovely furnishings. The hotel was not pedestrian like some other hotels which can be quite noisy. Quiet reflective atmosphere. The staff
were friendly and helpful at all times. The price were very reasonable.

title.value: Not your boring white wall conference or meeting room.

content.value: The Cello room is not your boring white wall conference or meeting room. (I did not stay overnight). I assisted arrange and attend a Professional Development seminar for 25people. The Cello room was beautifully decorated and laid out with plenty of room for delegates to sit

and move. We booked a bigger room than was required, and I was fearful it would look empty. On arrival I was delighted at the layout. Everything including items such as a laptop we had not requested were set up and ready to go. Lovely while louvre screens were set up to separate a beautifully laid out lunch and networking area for a sit down buffet lunch. To top off a great day with eminent speakers, the food was great! We will definitely use this venue again.

title.value: Very pretty affordable hotel right in the city

content.value: Loved this hotel. The rooms were clean. The front of house staff and the cleaning staff were extremely helpful, friendly and always smiling. The bar in the hotel had happy hour (always good) Didn't get a chance to try the restaurant but maybe I will next time. It was close to
everything and probably one of the more affordable places in that area.

Stayed for my oldmans 80th. We loved the heritage. Staff were friendly and located in proximity to where we needed to go. Rooms are small but offay with that era. Only negative was room temps were set for all rooms and was to warm and stuffy

We popped in here a few days ago just because we saw the Irish Flag flying in front when we visited the Sydney Harbour Bridge. What a find! The place was really busy, with live music and a great atmosphere.

title.value: Spontaneous night in The Rocks, Sydney

content.value: What a fantastic pub! It's got the Irish grit, hospitality, sensational food, and the electrifying atmosphere was NEXT LEVEL! Great live music on a Saturday night, comfortable environment, friendly locals, just a Great night out! Highly recommendüíû

title.value: Simple, spacious and close to the action

content.value: Great characterful pub with spacious, basic rooms. Shared bathroom facilities are still a private bathroom. This is an old pub so facilities are a little dated and worn but everything was clean and comfortable.... to stay close to the key areas so cheaply I didn't expect any

more, Breakfast was continental but great choice of cereals, toasts and beverages... nice to fill up before a day sight seeing. In the heart of the Rocks which is a fantastic area, 5 minute walk to Circular Quay, 15 minutes walk into the city, 10 minute walk to the Bridge Climb.... on the doorstep for so many things without having to travel on transport. Slight noise from bar downstairs if you're around in the evenings but that's the time to go down and join in the fun!!

When we booked two rooms in this hotel, we thought our rooms would have ensuite bathrooms, so we were disappointed and upset that we had not caught the fact that the bathrooms are shared. The rooms themselves faced the front, the street, and were above the bar. As one might

expect, the noise level here was on the loud side well into the night. We kept the air conditioner cranked up to help cover the bar and street noises. There is no elevator, so if you have difficulty carrying your luggage up stairs, you may want to request a room on a lower floor or at another hotel instead. The bathrooms looked clean (considering they are shared) but we were happy we had some flipflops that could be worn in the shower. The bed and bath linens felt, looked, and smelled clean. Everything in the rooms worked, although we did not turn on the television to test that. The wifi was acceptable too. Breakfast the following morning was nothing special, but it was adequate with assorted breads, jams, cereals, fruits, and that sort of thing. The primary benefit to this place is the location. Smack in the middle of things, it makes a convenient base from which to explore Sydney.

We recently called here for a drink when we heard live music while walking past. It‚Äôs a bit of a ‚Äúno frills‚Äù kinda pub and a bit rough round the edges but there was a good old skool atmosphere and we liked it. We especially enjoyed the live band.

We stayed here for a few nights as we are from the county and have a last minute hospital visit to attend. We found the guy on the desk very helpful and he went out of his way to help us out which we appreciated a lot. As this hotel is very close to the Main Street in the Cross,

I expected it to be a bit busy and noisy. We didn‚Äôt hear hardly and noise that was out of the normal hotel coming and going noise‚Äôs, the rooms are small but clean. It‚Äôs defiantly reflected in the price. We will stay here again for sure next time we are in town.

Small rooms, people screaming and slamming doors through the night, pretty sure the walls are made from paper. Id your planning on getting drunk and passing out every night then this is the place for you.

Ibis Budget Hotel Sydney is located on William Street Darlinghurst. Good location close to Kings Cross restaurant and entertainment as well as Kings Cross Station. Comfortable and clean rooms good budget style accommodation. Staff friendly and helpful. Guest laundry available.

For budget traveller is recommended! The location near King Cross station, supermarket. The room was clean and comfortable, just low water pressure in shower head, but maybe because small toilet. Breakfast was like standard budget hotel. No complaint at all for the sound proof
as we choose budget hotel. Thank you Ibis Budget Sydney East!

Like, make your own bed up- budget. We booked and paid for 3 adults, but had to open up the sofa bed ourselves. It was stuck so we had to call the front desk (from my mobile, no phone in the room). The guy that checked us in and the guy that came up to help were both lovely, but

I really feel it would have been better to pay the extra for the nearby brand name hotel. The sofa bed was garbage, our teenager had to put the sofa cushions under him to not get poked by springs. HOWEVER the Accor $1 breakfast winter deal brought this place up a notch! Shristree I think her name was provided great service, making coffees and hot chocolates on the espresso machine (she deserves 5 stars!!), and the food selection was a bit more limited than other larger hotels, but fantastic for $1!

IF DRIVING, DO NOT STAY HERE I called the property contact number because getting into Dixon street was proving difficult due to turn off, the number was disconnected! I had to call another APX property for them to have someone contact me, when I finally got a call back the

title.value: It is really good if you like to stay there and enjoy Sydney CDB

content.value: It is a really good place to stay for 2-3 nights and explore Sydney CBD. Our room was large and really calm and clean. The TV set was something strange, I didn't like but it worked, however, my wife and I aren't TV programs fan. The bed and mattress were comfortable. The room

Have been trying different hotels in Sydney while transitioning through four times in the last month or so. Good central position in Darling Harbour with lots of great Asian eating establishments nearby. Reception staff were pleasant but only just doing the job as they seemed

I stayed for two nights at APX Darling Harbour . At first I was hesitate based on the bad reviews. But Ive never experience any of it during my stay. Infact it was a right decision to follow the good reviews. I have a very good sleep at night, my room was at level 5 , no

Our taxi dropped us at the front door in the closed street which was very good. Loved the clean room and all the kitchen items & easy access to Darling harbour. Our 2 night stay was perfect for the Vivid festival weekend and we appreciated the front desk open until 11pm as our

title.value: fantastic location, great staff, free parking, small kitchen, mayalasian cafe downstairs (entry opposite the drinks m.

content.value: A really fantastic location. Waldorf has great staff. This motel has free parking with easy access. Room had a small kitchen. There is a Mayalasian cafe downstairs (entry opposite the drinks machine).

The location is quite far from any convenient stores and restaurants. It is also a bit far distance from the Central Station. You need to walk. No reception staff on Sunday. I like the wifi and the facilities inside the room. You can find any equipment since this is apartment
hotel. If you stay for one week, the hotel staff will clean your room only twice not everyday.

title.value: Great Position but needs an urgent update

content.value: Following a week away in Mollymook (highly recommended) we needed a place for just one night before the long flight back to the UK. First impressions from the outside is that it is lacking maintenance, you will see many examples of painting over flaking paint.The reception is

non existent. You knock on a door and when is opened you enter some sort some sort of staff rest room with a desk against the wall. My wife wanted to leave! The staff are very friendly, no complaints at all. We were allocated a room in a building opposite on the third floor. Carrying two cases at 30kgs up three flights of stairs is no joke so if you are booking, request a ground floor room. The room was very clean, the sheets/towels etc pristine and it was the best bed we had slept in during our stay, sort of a Queen Bed I would guess. We did not have a car but parking is very limited and you would have to be good to get in and out without a '49 point turn'! Last tip. The key they give you does not lock the door, it only opens it. You have to push the button in on the inside door handle and then just close it. If it had a reception, and some more care it could easily move to 4/5 stars. Finally, if you were using at as a base it looked to have everything you could need for a longer stay, like a self contained room really.

I guess in its past this hotel would have been a premier hotel. Mornings with horses ‚Äòblowing off‚Äô after their trackwork, the buzz of anticipation from clockworkers, trainers, strappers and jockeys alike. The smell of potential in the air! What a great location for the horse

racing enthusiast. Currently it‚Äôs past lies hidden in the well worn carpets, the dints in the plaster and cupboards and wardrobes that fail to open due their overuse. Resurrected this could return to its former glory yet right now be aware of what you‚Äôre renting!

When the cleaner arrived to clean the apartment I was staying, the lady at the reception was extremely rude to her with no reason at all! Maybe she was just having a bad day, but no excuses to treat someone like that! Terrible service!

Great hotel. Rooms were small, the bed was comfortable, amazing views to Darling Harbor which we requested when booking. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good, the outdoor area was lovely and a nice bar area. Was perfect for our stay and walking distance
to the Sydney Tower, Chinatown and all around Darling Harbor.

I have stayed here a number of times. It is good, it is comfortable, and in a great location. The staff are really good and are very helpful. Sunita, in particular, goes out of her way to personally attend to guests. She has gone above and beyond a number of times for me, to
help, and to deliver a great guest experience. Highly recommended.

Fantastic hotel, great location,close to everything we needed. The staff were really helpful and friendly , breakfast had a great selection and clean and tidy room. Will definitely be back to stay again

Stayed overnight prior to my daughters 18th birthday party. Very nice touch as we walked into our room bottle of bubbles on ice with some divine chocolate delights for us to share. Also had some balloons delivered to our room. Hotel staff very happy to assist us. Check out

process very easy. Had a problem with the aircon which was attended to immediately and fixed. The paintwork and carpets a bit dated would benefit from an update. Beds very comfortable. Hotel next door to party venue and opp beach

title.value: August at the Ibis Darling Harbour

content.value: I have been going to this hotel for around 10 years now and I would say that this visit was one of my best. The hotel was organised, staff were polite, notifications before and after were helpful, and it just made out time in the city so much better. This is a great average

hotel. If it rates as a 3 start then its 3 stars Plus - easy to do no fuss plenty of amenities and close to everything ":Daring Harbour" Although after doing an online check in I still had to wait and fuss around when i arrived at the hotel so I think if this were to be improved I would give my experience a 9 out of 10.

This hotel desparately needs a update. Its location is good, but frankly, it is overpriced for the standard. (Eg. Showers were small, decor Spartan). On the plus side, the breakfast was hot and reasonablly priced.

title.value: Great stay breakfast not so great

content.value: Love staying at this property great location beautiful rooms and views unfortunately again the buffet breakfast was disappointing everything was cold, from hash browns to bacon it was a busy morning so not sure why it was cold.

title.value: Unhelpful staff, lack of customer service and empathy

content.value: I purchased a Groupon voucher offering an overnight stay with wine, breakfast and late check out which sounded perfect and was very reasonably priced. Before I purchased the voucher I checked several websites including the hotel to ensure a room was free and also called up to

check. After purchasing I called back and spoke with Gabreielly who told me there was no rooms available on the date requested. I went back to the websites and the company website which again all let me reserve a room to pay on arrival. I emailed Gabrielly to advised of this and was still told that I could not stay that night. they have exhauseted all of their Groupon rooms and we would have to pay full price. I had already explained the voucher was a gift for my partner and we are here from overseas so any other date is no use to us. It seems the hotel would rather have empty rooms that accomodate paying customers. This has happened to me before and I was advised that it would be no trouble that we occupy another room. I offered Novotel the additional $60 it costs to an upgraded room but was still told no. Dissapointed I have had to get a full refund from Groupon.

For a last minute beachside getaway, the Manly Paradise Motel provided value and location. It is situated only metres from the Corso, opposite Manly Beach. The rooms are clean and tidy and perfect a night or two. It has a good-sized TV and also has a bar fridge. Theer is a pool
on the roof, which woudl be perfect in warmer weather.

An excellent couple of days in Manly and our first stay at Manly Pacific Hotel. We will definitely go back for another stay. A perfect and convenient location, very good parking at the hotel, very friendly staff and lots of options at the hotel.

Stayed here for a conference for a week. The hotel is situated in a great location oposite the beach. The main shops are just a 2 min walk and the food for the week was pretty good. You also have access to gyms and pool. The negative was the room. I know i was part of a

conference and its a lucky dip of what room you are allocated. My room had no view, no balcony and a long walk from reception. The room whilst spacious lacked character and the bathroom was set up for the aged or disabled. The biggest advantage was the room was quiet. Would i stay again? Yes if i got to pick the room as this would determain a good stay to a great stay.

title.value: Everything you need in the perfect location

content.value: The location is fantastic - right on the surf beach, and loads of eateries nearby, and 2 minutes to The Corso. The room was spotless and had everything we needed. The roof terrace gives great views and the pool is a great feature. The hotel staff are very friendly and helpful.
All in all, highly recommended.

Had a very pleasant stay at the the Manly Paradise Motel recently. Staff was very friendly and helpful and went out of their way to assist. I require nearby parking because of a minor disability and they ensured that they had onsite parking for me. Plenty of advise in guiding me

to tourist destinations was given. Room was large and very clean. It had also been recently renovated. Only criticism I can give is that the windows should have some soundproofing glass in them since some of the late night revellers can be rather loud. A room on the higher floors should fix that. Strongly recommend this hotel. Less than a 5 minute walk to the Manly ferry terminal and the beach is right across the street.

We had a 2 night stay here. While our room small it was clean and comfortable. The room had a kitchenette in it. It was located across the road from the beach with a good view. The location was perfect for walking to all the eateries and ferry. We would stay here again

title.value: If you want any sleep dont stay here

content.value: Without a doubt this is Australias version of Fawlty Towers, but worse. The nigjt is continuously interupted by drunks throwing bottles and screaming and yelling as only drunks can do. As if this wasnt enough the restaurants empty their bottle bins at anytime from 5.30 am

onwards without even trying to be quite. Then from 6.00 am onwards the beep beep garbage trucks start arriving. By this stage the restaurant patrons start arriving for breakfast with their kids who decide to ride skate boards in the tunnel underpass. The noise was so bad we had to close the doors and look at the view through the glass. The aircon in the lounge didnt work so it was doors closed no aircon doors open kid cyclone of noise. Lights over the bbq didnt work and god knows what else as we gave up in frustration. We had to stay here as we were out of options as accom. Was in short supply but the charge was $400 per night for the worst accomadation since I was backpacking 45 yeas ago. Couldnt wait to check out.

Room was clean and with cupboards. Linens were provided too. Staff were friendly and helpful. Great location , quiet and not too far away from the beach area. Probably 15mins. away from the cafes and restaurants of Manly. Fair price and value for money.

title.value: Nice for a hostel, but some shortcomings

content.value: The property was reasonably good for a hostel, but I think the reviews are overly generous. I'm rating this 3, but you'll see in my review history that I rate most properties 4-5. Pros: the location is good, the property is well managed, the guests are very nice and generally
