quiet. I did have a comfortable stay overall. Wifi worked well. Cons: there is a children's daycare next door that can be very loud after 08:30. The kitchen stovetop range does not work very well (only a couple burners work) and the kitchen closes early at 9:30 pm. And while the private bathrooms were nice to have, I found mine a bit disappointing: when you shower, the whole bathroom gets wet, and in high humidity it does not dry. Water pressure for sink & shower was uneven and sometimes there was not enough hot water. I've visited Sydney and Manly several times over the years and am comparing to other places I've stayed at, with comparable prices.

Perfectly situated and spotless : Peaceful and even quiet .... Faultless... BUT ! most annoying that TV/Social indoor area, which is part of/attached to, the communal kitchen, Which is LOCKED at 9.30pm ..... Means one cannot access lounge chairs, TV or just have a chat !

Guests are NOT children. Why can't Management simply install a door to the kitchen, and close up that area only ? Understandably the cooking area etc must be cleaned and respectfully maintained, but seriously, Locking up the loungeroom seems totally unnecessary ! I met and made friends with some good people and enjoyed the "Cosmopolitan" friendly atmosphere. I highly recommend this venue, if you dont want to watch the news, TV, or have a cuppa after 9.30pm LoL 4.5 stars all round !

A very friendly and caring staff. The guests were also nice and friendly. The place is kept really well and clean. There are good facilities as well. Despite being a hostel where the guests are relatively young you actually can rest. Contrary to some other places where is

impossible to get sleep. It also gives you the impression of a very safe place. The location is great and very close to the beach. Easy access to public transport. My son and I had a very good time. I absolutely would recommend it! If it happens to be in the area I would definitely stay here again! Thank you to all the staff and the guests who made our stay enjoyable! Best wishes to you all!

title.value: Really comfortable,clean, quiet and close to many great experiences

content.value: I Am an older female traveller and I stayed in a mixed dorm - 4 of us my first time. My fellow roommates were all lovely and we all respected each other's space. It was a good experience. The room was a bit warm however the bunks were very comfortable and our own bathroom was

very clean and easy to use. The kitchen and communal area is well kitted out. The communal fridge and food area is really good.I stayed for 10 nights. There is corner shop with some really nice Italian cheeses, some cooked dishes and basic supplies. Grocery store about 15 minute walk each way. Surf beach about 6 minutes away, really good snorkelling/freediving 25 minute walk - Fairlight Beach at high tide is very good - lots of large Bream I think they are, some rays and lots of cool fish. I found Shelly Beach and the rock entry rough and not very clear as it was around Christmas - weather not settled. I took my own snorkel gear including fins. The walks are spectacular and the views just wonderful. Food in small cafes is reasonably priced. The fireworks at 9 pm New Years Eve with lots of families was a lot of fun and free! I'd stay again at Manly Bunkhouse.

Nice rooms. Excellent location. Right in China town. Beautiful food. Great shops Close to Darling Harbour. Close to Hyde Park. Great location for the annual City2Surf. Excellent stay. Reasonable price. Close to Central station therefore excellent access to public

Nice hotel with valuable price. Great location to paddy's market and chinatown. 15 min walk to QVB. Plenty of resto to choose and 3 min walk to woolies. This is my second stay in the hotel. Definitely will come back again on next visit.

have stayed at this hotel on several occasions, always clean, with great staff at a fantastic location close to Capital Theatre, central station etc. The beds and pillows were comfortable shower hot, the only problem we had was the Television reception wasn't very good. All the

Was upgraded to a family room. The hotel is a 5 minute walk to Central Station, very good location when visiting Sydney. I am a return visitor and would come back to the hotel. Everythings well looked after and you get a good nights sleep

A three night stay at this property over a weekend proved to be a good choice - the room was a decent size, well appointed (although not luxury level) and clean. There were two 'kitchen' chairs but no easy chair. The wifi was reliable but so slow. I had problems with the

title.value: Nice but need to be clearer about need to book parking

content.value: Just to clarify, I would have given 4 stars but for one thing. Allow me to suggest that you are clearer on your website about the need to book ahead for parking. There is one small mention of 'limited parking for a fee'. Everywhere else I have ever stayed, limited has meant no

more than one car per booking. I booked a hotel as I was going to a site at the Enmore Theatre that night and, having mobility issues, did not want to have to struggle with public transport. That morning I received a text saying that all parking was booked out that night but that you were just a hop, skip and jump from Newtown station. That may be all very well for people who can hop, skip and jump, but I cannot. I had to manage my bags and a walking stick and a staircase at Redfern station changing for Newtown. The pain that I was in by the time I arrived severely hampered my enjoyment of the show that evening and my sleep that night. A clear "please be aware that parking must be booked and is not guaranteed" on the website and confirmation email would have made a world of difference for me. I could have chosen not to book and left my space for more able bodied customers. Other than that, I was very pleased with the hotel. The concierges who checked me in and out were lovely and professional, and I enjoyed the inner-city industrial chic vibe. Also thought the shower could have been cleaner.

Spent 10 days here for work. Location was great as it was a few minutes walk to the train station and there was so much around food/entertainment wise. Room was kinda noisy I was in a room facing inward and could hear all the people walking through to their rooms. Great
cooking facilities but no wardrobe which sucked when staying here for so long. Staff were amazing and I loved the fruit that was always available

The location is amazing! Newtown is an amazing hub for food and vintage shops. And even better for the Enmore theatre! We were up in bed before I bet some others had left the concert. The bed was comfy and the shower was good. But the hotel left us with a weird vibe... the lobby

was nice and urban feeling but upstairs and in the rooms honestly seemed like something out of a murder movie... the blue walls made it seem old and run down and the plants on level 4 made it seem old and dirty. It was good for one night but I definitely wouldn‚Äôt stay for anything other than a concert at Enmore theatre.

I stayed here for one night on a business trip. The good: - Generally clean, though the shower in 406 could use some new grout and a good scrub - Neat and tidy - it's a very small space, but they've managed to decorate without things getting in the way - An extremely

comfortable bed - Easy check in/check out - A working reverse cycle air conditioner (yay - finally!) that heats the tiny room very quickly - Free toothbrush with toothpaste provided, as well as a shaving kit - They're obviously very aware of the noise from planes flying over, as they provide free earplugs. These came in handy - Proper coffee pod machine (no Nescafe sachets!) - They seem to be environmentally conscious (no plastic water bottles, recycled toilet paper) Some critiques: - As no one was at the desk at checkout, I rang the number provided. I needed them to hold my bag while I went out. I was encouraged to leave my bag at reception and leave if I was in a hurry - this is not safe. While the staff member arrived pretty quickly, I didn't feel comfortable leaving my bag where anyone could walk in and grab it - There was nothing in the minibar. Three cans of Red Bull were on the counter (why not in the fridge?) with a description, but no prices. Aside from those and an empty glass bottle for water, some milk, and some coffee pods,there were no snacks or drinks - I couldn't find a shower cap, which is an essential when I travel. Luckily I had one on me from the last hotel I'd stayed at

Right next to eat street in Newtown and Young Henry's brewing. Book direct and you get to knock over the whole minibar, though if you did, it'd be taking the piss somewhat. My choice each time in Sydney. Downsides: - they have taken the YH Summer Hop Ale out the minibar - went
there once and minibar was empty. Guy on counter said it applied to snack only. He eventually admitted he was wrong and managed to get hold of a supply to replenish the fridge - slow lift

We stayed for 4 nights in Arts hotel. The rooms are compact and clean but more than adequate with a kettle and tea/coffee facilities, which was much appreciated! It‚Äôs not directly in the centre of Sydney, but the buses are easy to use, so it wasn‚Äôt really a problem! The bar next

door is convenient and offers 10 per cent discount off food and drink, so it was convenient after a day of sightseeing! The bus route outside the hotel takes you into the centre of Sydney or to Bondi beach the other way! The staff on reception were particularly helpful and friendly!

Located in Paddington but an easy walk to the CBD and on a great bus route, really easy to travel around. We visited Sydney for two weeks and found the staff to be helpful and welcoming, more than happy to answer any questions and offer advice and suggestions. Laundry facilities

were great as when you're travelling around various cities you need this to be easily available. This hotel was recommended and generally I would have always stayed more in the heart of the city, however I visited areas that I wouldn't have been aware of if I hadn't been based here. Rooms where fine with good storage, a safe and a decent size. No eating facilities on site, but lots of places beside the hotel. We were advised to get an Opal card and using buses ferries and trains was no problem at all... this was suggested by the hotel staff and was a brilliant piece of advice. A great way to explore the city like a local.

Stayed 5 nights. I was in hospital and wife and son stayed over. Clean and tidy with friendly and efficient staff. Small amount of parking available.location good to Saint Vincent‚Äôs and city. Some good food places close by. Woolies not too far away.

title.value: Small comfortable hotel, big service and great experience! 5*

content.value: Our stay at the Arts hotel has been fantastic, close to everything you could need in Sydney making travelling around so very easy. The hotel room was extremely clean, comfortable bed and a great shower! The staff are very wonderful, knowledgeable and a credit to the hotel,

the reception staff so friendly and helpful with anything you could need and a fantastic knowledge of everything Sydney (and further afield!) Do pop into Arts bar next door! A wonderful little bar with great atmosphere, open fire and food and you get 10% off, highly reccomend the Schnitzel and Irish beef pie! Thank you to Mark and all his staff for a wonderful experience on our first trip to Sydney!

... have stayed at the Arts Hotel Paddington several times over the years, usually whilst taking in the HeadOn Photo Festival in May each year. The management and staff are always exceptionally pleasant and helpful ... feels like a family affair. It's in a great spot in the

middle of Oxford Street with frequent buses to town and the other way to Bondi and other beaches. The hotel also incorporates the 'Rose Shamrock and Thistle' pub next door and hotel guests receive a ten percent discount !!

Watson‚Äôs Bay Hotel is an iconic place for drinks and some food in Sydney‚Äôs East. On the weekends or when the weather is nice, the bar and kitchen seating areas are quite busy. The service here is average and some staff are pretty friendly. The biggest downside though is the

price of the food and drinks, as one cocktail is $18. One of the good things it has is the view of the wharf however. Would recommend it as a place to visit once for the experience, but definitely not regularly if you want your value for food and drinks!

title.value: Surprisingly devoid of customers at the bar

content.value: Watsons Bay was bustling with people but my friend and I wanted to try out what looked like a pub but was also a hotel. Although the restaurants and cafes were full, the bar had just 2 other customers and they only had a very small range of beers on tap. The one-page menu had

some appealing dishes and we got the delicious aromas from a couple of other customers who had ordered food. However, we had to leave to catch our ferry back to Sydney so couldn't stay and sample the food.

Great spot for some lunch etc but the owners are too greedy when it comes to prices. Total rip off. A schooner of beer is $13. Cocktails are also a rip off. Why do owners start to get greedy?? Won‚Äôt be coming back and won‚Äôt recommend. We need Fair prices for beer and food. I
don‚Äôt suppose they will change unless you vote with your feet and don‚Äôt come.

This place is a hidden gem. Rooms are very well sized and furnished. Delightful bathroom with high end toiletries supplied.the location is second to none, right on the water at one of Sydney's premium waterside suburbs. The area is well serviced by buses, Taxis/Uber and ferries.

A 25-30 minute ferry ride to CBD is a pleasant outing to access Opera House and Luna Park as well as other Sydney attractions. Direct services also run to Manly. The staff are pleasant, professional and well trained. Included breakfast was more than satisfactory for me and two growing boys; choices of pastries, cereal, fruit, toast and boiled eggs were plentiful and regularly refreshed. More substantial offerings available at additional charge. As a very frequent high end corporate traveller I found the whole experience to be first rate. At booking you can pre-order beer and wine for room at very reasonable price (6 pack premium beer at $25), other mini bar stocking via reception is small inconvenience. This is my second stay and we will be back....next time without the rental car as unnecessary, despite distance from city because of excellent public transport options. I'd be hard pressed to find any fault with accommodation experience.

Nothing boutique about this place except the price. No amount of interior design can make up for the un-prepared room, poor service, arrogant staff, very average breakfast and mini bar full of emptiness. You need to call or complete a list and hand into reception if you desire
anything. Good luck with this late at night. Utterly disappointed. Judy, your half baked attempt to call and txt after we left was unfortunately not doing the trick.

Rooms were outstanding very clean and maintained like new we booked two rooms for our group and foldaway was made up for extra guest In the heart of Sydney very short walk to chinatown and restaurants beds very comfy as well

Jade made our checkin wonderful . The apartment wasn‚Äôt ready as it was literally getting reburbished as we waited so we were given complimentary champagne in the buffet room which was wonderful for my interstate guests for our annual reunion.

We have stayed here many times over the years but on this occasion, the noise was extreme. Renovations on floor 11 - we were right above it on floor 12. Whole building being renovated next door. And, heavy street work that was supposed to stop at midnight - but went on until

title.value: Good location but very small rooms

content.value: Just in the near outskirts of the Sydney CBD. Good location. Not too busy and you can walk to a lot of what Sydney city can offer. It‚Äôs a small hotel and they were undergoing renovation when we were there. Our room was newly renovated and had new carpets. But I didn‚Äôt like the

It's been a while since experiencing walls so thin you can clearly hear whole conversations! Added to the pretty much 24 hour traffic through the intersection, sleep was very much interrupted. The front desk staff were either very busy or a bit creepy as they are always on the

This facility is more backpacker than a hotel. We booked via wotif but as it was non refundable the manager wouldn't give a refund! We arrived and wanted to leavve immediately realising our mistake of it not being a hotel but equivalent to backpacker!! The bathroom was so small

and the stainless steel basin was more like a mans urinal than a bathroom basin. The owner or manager lives above the room we stayed in and they banged and scrapped furniture till after 11.45pm. Talking kept us awake! The bed was hard! Pillows flat and pillow cases yellow! The headboard discoloured and grimy! Paint peeling off floorboards peeling! Breakfast included was a communal area with one large table and alongside owners two dogs and 7 others it was very congested and not what we were paying for!!. Very disappointed that the manager couldn't see there way to refund even one night but held the two nights prepaid for!! False advertising and photos different to actual space! Clever photography- guests bewareüò° If choosing this accommodation the nightly rate charged for so called 4star hotel accommodation is far from that level of accommodation! This place is called the Dive for good reason and appetley named!!!üò°

title.value: Dive Hotel at Coogee - home away from home

content.value: A boutique hotel that is opposite Coogee beach The location is excellent A large bus stop is opposite,with buses that can take you to Bondi or Circular Quay or anywhere in between Wylies baths is a 4 minute walk away ,where you can enjoy surf swimming in a pool The rooms at the

Dive hotel are large with a quirky bathroom and cupboards and shelves that accommodate clothing for beach or formal occasions The Breakfast is healthy with muesli intermixed with nuts and dried apricots and add to this the most delicious honey yoghurt,that would make Manu of MKR jealous The staff are welcoming and keep your bedrooms clean and tidy The handsome hotel poodle,Lucas and his co host, Ruby Tuesday , the Scottish terrier,ensure that your stay is a memorable and an enjoyable one!!!!

We spent two nights at the Dive Hotel and it was the perfect finish to our 10-day trip visiting our daughter at UNSW. Perfect location across from the beach, very chill vibe and right in the middle of some amazing restaurants. We followed the advice of others posted here and

secured a king room in the front with a small balcony. The room was very spacious with a lovely and efficient bath and fun decor. Staff are so warm , welcoming and engaging. Would most certainly return!

title.value: The hotel name is appropriate because it's a dive

content.value: This hotel looked NOTHING like the pictures on the website. First, you either have to climb a bunch of stairs to get into the hotel, OR use the very steep, cement walkway (which has a couple stairs at the top that can't be seen from the bottom). You enter a dark, creepy hallway,

that enters into a messy, dated, cheap looking "reception/breakfast area." The stairs to the guest rooms are very tight, and if you have a big bag, good luck getting up there. The rooms were reminiscent of an old Motel 6, or something similar, but the beds seemed clean enough, though. The one plus is that the hotel is DIRECTLY across the street from the beach, so if that's what interests you, this location is great for that. Staff seemed nice enough, but didn't love the huge dog who wanders the hotel. (Dog seemed nice, I'm just not a dog fan.) Also, you can smell the doggy smell as soon as you enter the building. Very, very average accommodations, and the website pictures aren't even close to reality. We were very disappointed.

title.value: WORST HOTEL SERVICE IN THE WORLD - DO NOT STAY HERE

content.value: There is no such thing as Customer Service in the vocab of the staff at this hotel. They tell you they have rooms available and you book the rooms and they never confirm the bookings and you end up with no booking. When you phone them to follow up they talk over the top of you

and are so ignorant and rude and then hang up on you without any form of explanation. Do not book here if you actually want a hotel to stay at once arriving in Sydney. Terrible service and the Manager Jandro is so dodgy and sketchy. I wouldn't let me worst enemy stay here.

title.value: Not bad if you're not really into sleeping

content.value: Picked this hostel purely on the basis of location since I was carrying around heavy sports equipment so wanted to be close to the rail station. While i knew it was close, I certainly didn't expect to be right next to the actual rail platform. If you open the blinds, people

from the platform can literally peek into the room. The place was constantly vibrating and you could hear the announcements very loudly ever 5-10 minutes. Very poor sleep due to this even though the beds and pillow were comfier than usual hostels. The other facilities were fine. Showers and toilets were clean, however there are some cubicles with large gaps in the doors so find a good one and stick with it. Kitchen looked good with lots of storage and space, but had very few sharp knives, no oven and extremely poor quality pans (and also not enough). While I wasn't there specifically for socialising because I had other plans, there seemed to be a lot of long termers there and also a lot of families or older groups so was a strange atmosphere, but they do put on lots of events, free food or cheap meals every day so I'm sure they're definitely worth checking out. WiFi is free but I found videos to buffer when using anything above 360p Even for the location, I wouldn't stay here again and looking back it was actually pretty expensive. There will be better and cheaper options around.

It was quite difficult to locate this YHA at night but once checked in, you will certainly feel it was worth the trouble. Nestled in a quiet corner of Sydney Central Station, this haven is proud to offer all amenities above standard and within reach of a budget traveller.

A tunnel connects the YHA to the railway platforms (10min walk) and the airport is only a 10min ride away. Very cool! The international ambience is a pleasant surprise! Hats off to the great staff! Cheers!!!

I went over to Sydney for a week. I am a member of Seido Karate and the organisation went over to Sydney to compete in an international karate tournament and I stayed there with a bunch of members from the Seido organisation. I had good roommates with whom I had many memorable

conversations, I got a good deal for 7 nights for $245 which included breakfast. The breakfast food was a good and it gave me energy to get through the day. There was sufficient space for breakfast, the laundry was easy to use and the place was a suitable distance from central Sydney. Sylvia was friendly and kind when making the booking and I loved how she even sent me through a list of instructions for getting to YHA after I arrived off the train. It was easy to access from arriving in the airport because I could get a quick train from the airport to Central Station and then a simple walk to the hostel. Sleep quality was average but when you're in Sydney, the place is full of energy that you want to be a part of it and to absorb all the energy which is enough reason to get out of bed in the morning.

I stayed in a female train carriage. The one I stayed in was right on the train platform. There are blinds for privacy from public train passengers, however it would benefit from being blackout blinds. It gets light very early and you can hear the trains. I was checked in by a

miserable male member of staff who didn't encourage engagement of conversation. Therefore had to find own way round. Showers are in a separate building along with toilet. It quite good order. Kitchen was clean and staff are always in there. Communal area is fine. Good Wi-Fi in public area. Good location. Activities are based around nights out drinking.

title.value: There was a 45 year old LIVING in our room

content.value: The hostel is average but when we arrived at our room (group of 3), we noticed that one of the beds was already made. We assumed it would be a late teenager or early in their 20s -possibly mid 20s. Later in the day, a MAN who was about 45 walks back in and basically lives in

this room. I went to complain at the front desk about him because it‚Äôs a youth hostel but, apparently, they‚Äôre totally okay with it. Stay at your own risk! He‚Äôs very unsocial and keeps food in the room. Comes back at weird times. Also, the front desk says there are more like him at the hostel... they basically live here, they‚Äôre not guests.

Take the stress out of getting to the airport. Right next to Central Station this is ideal.........and it's clean!. We are seniors, take a private room and are afforded all the courtesies one would hope for in any hotel. The staff members are always very pleasant and keen to

assist with any information required. For access to all city events the station offers the city circle line to get the short distance to circular quay and the ferry service. The light rail is also at Central Railway Station. Restaurants close by abound and there is also a cafe on site. All in all the perfect spot for us!

title.value: Amazing hostel that I would recommend!

content.value: I stayed here for 3 times during a period of 4 weeks while traveling Australia. All times ai stayed in a twinroom, which was clean and had good beds. The last time we were upgraded to a twinroom with ensuite. This room also had a tv, aswell as a watercooker, cups and tea. It was

a very welcoming surprise. The staff are really friendly and always willing to help when you have a question. The amenities were clean and the showers were on the best I had in a hostel. Especially the waterpressure and the thermostat tap. No fussing with hot and cold water. Since it's close location to Central station it is very easy to get there from the airport of the move around the city.

Hayley and Amy are very good receptionist and helpful, they help me when I was lost about some things in the hostal with a very good attitude, friendly, very cute and made me laugh a lot..... Also they have good music

Once finding the hotel there is no where to park to be able to check in. Found this to be an issue. Neat and tidy rooms. Nice court area and swimming pool area. Walking distance to most things required.

Got into the reception late after a long day traveling and was met by the most awesome receptionist‚Äôs called Hayley and Mereana. Very helpful and down to earth people, would recommend a stay here anytime just too meet these two lovely people.

I've been in this hostel more than once. Absolutely the best in Sydney, perfect location near Central Station, rooftop, cinema, pool it's very clean and organized. Each day there are some activities. The staff it's really friendly and welcoming, the reception it's 24H so there
is always someone ready to help you, wesley gives many suggestions about place to discover in the city :) Super recommended!

The hotel is well located and proved to be excellent for our family weekend away. Rooms were open planned and comfortably accommodated our family, which included a toddler. The only problem was the daily service - the bed was poorly made and there was no milk supplied the
second day.

A decent enough room in a quiet area, though the mouldy smell in the bathroom was a concern and needs fixing. A mouldy or mildew smell is not a good thing and the cause needs to be sorted (often the ventilation systems are partly blocked or the floor drain is holding water). The
room itself was clean and a nice enough size and layout for a studio and this room had a double door to open onto a balcony for fresh air....always a nice alternative to air conditioning systems.

Being an ex-Sydneysider, I was concerned with personal safety due to the location, but this seemed to be totally unfounded. The apartments are spacious, and the internal courtyard delightful. My only petty concern was that the TV in the bedroom showed different stations to the
one in the living area and the remote was faulty.

Location excellent however rooms need upgrading old and stale, Tv didn‚Äôt work in bedroom, air conditioning very noisy, small room for 1 bedroom apartment. Not much information given at check in re: facilities, mini bar etc. Will try again as location very good and request
different room,

This is a cute old building, atmospheric, down in the historic Rocks. The old building means it's pretty quiet, and the included full breakfast is lovely. An easy walk down to the edge of the harbour, harbour bridge and opera house are very close.

title.value: Great place close to the Rocks

content.value: This is the second time we have stayed at the Sydney Harbour B&B and would definitely recommend it. We found James extremely helpful, upgrading us at the last minute, nothing was a problem. The one bedroom unit was clean and tidy and very warm.

title.value: Fantastic Old Style B&B with great hosts and location

content.value: If you're looking for a 5 star full service hotel go elsewhere. If you want a cosy and comfortable place to stay that maintains the historic feel and looks of the rocks, go no further. The rooms are comfortable, the breakfast is great and the hosts couldn't be friendlier or
more helpful. We had a great stay and were really well looked after

kindly add more coffee rather than tea and if you knew that you're visitor will be staying for more than a week please add more dish washing soap, bathroom soap and shampoo as well as detergent for the clothes.

We found this B&B a historic building and was very authentic! We were welcomed and told were our room was! Not overly large room with view over courtyard my understanding from photos was that we had access to area from our room not so! We found it comfortable but a bit noisy

for our liking we could hear people going to shared toilet & bathroom during night & in morning as floor creaky and doors closing! Traffic from nearby Cahill motorway a bit noisy at times as well! Breakfast area small & very crowded and cooked breakfast average scrambled eggs very tough, not that edible although other breakfast okay cereal & yoghurt, fruit and toast tea & coffee Did notice that floors weren‚Äôt mopped in toilet or bathroom the week we were there or carpet vacuumed either I don‚Äôt really like to criticise or complain but other than fantastic location I probably wouldn‚Äôt stay here again just my personal opinion It seemed a busy place and we‚Äôll patronised Seems to suit people travelling from overseas

title.value: Two nights close to Sydney Harbour

content.value: I want to give this place more than 3 stars but couldn‚Äôt quite give it 4. My daughter and I arrived here early in the morning and were greeted cheerfully by an older couple who were helping their son out with the business. They are such friendly people and they really helped

make the stay a pleasant one. They were always keen to help us and were very polite and obviously worked hard. Our room was a basic double downstairs room with a shared bathroom upstairs. We were made well aware of the stairs and shared bathroom prior to our visit, so no surprises there. Our room was a good size, comfortable bed and sheets were clean. I feel the room had a few bits on the floor that could have done with a vacuum. The breakfast was nice and set us up well for the day, which was why we booked here even though we had a shared bathroom. The location is a real plus here, we could go down to the action at the Harbour and easily return to our room to rest and then go out again without too much distance. Best things. 1. Friendly hosts, 2. Comfy bed, 3. Good breakfast. 4. Location! Things that would enhance, 1. The upstairs toilet had a basin and soap, but no hand towel to dry hands, so unless we remembered to bring one, you had to open door with wet hands. 2. Some more attention to detail with cleaning and a freshen up.

Fabulous hotel just a quick walk to Darling Harbour and the CBD. We were upgraded to an executive studio which was spacious and modern with harbour views. Breakfast plentiful, staff lovely, would definitely stay again.

title.value: Lack of hot water pressure in shower

content.value: If you want a decent hot shower stay somewhere else. It took a long time to get hot water and when it arrived it was insufficient to get a decent hot shower. All other aspects of the hotel were very good. Pricing was average when compared with alternatives my colleagues stayed
at a few doors down the road.

The staff were extremely professional and friendly. Our suite had everything we needed and was clean and comfortable. Located within walking distance of the beautiful Darling Harbour. We are excited too return to see the renovations which were in progress during our visit

title.value: Good big apartment in a great location but tired.

content.value: This hotel is close to Darling Harbour, just around the corner from the Pyrmont bridge, and seven minutes walk to David Jones and Myers. We were really only there for Visual Sydney and it was a perfect position. The only drawback is that there were no restaurants in the
immediate vicinity, only coffee shops (these closed early) and convenience stores. The apartment was spacious and overlooked Kent St, if we stayed here again would try to get a view over the harbour.

title.value: Sandy should get a different jo

content.value: Have stayed at literally hundreds of hotels over the years and regard the checking in at accommodation as a routine chore filling in forms etc. we all do it and it can be made smooth by a smile or even a neutral receptionist, sometimes people go out of their way to by unpleasant

and this was one of them. Publicly dressing down a junior member of staff then bullying them in front of guests is unprofessional. being short and impolite and shouting orders across reception at your customers might be a one off bad day but I doubt it. Room is ok if a little dated.

title.value: Glad we got a good rate, very average unit

content.value: We thought we were booking a hotel but it‚Äôs more like a timeshare where your accommodation is only as good as the owners maintain it. Our 3 nights accommodation cost about $900 for 3 of us and the location was very handy to shopping, the Harbour Bridge & Barangaroo, eateries

etc. The pluses - two nice patios with harbour views, it was spacious with two bathrooms, well equipped kitchen with big fridge and beds were comfy & unit had a washing machine & dryer. Complex was very neat and pool, spa & gym clean & tidy. Downsides - the lounge was really uncomfortable, dated and didn‚Äôt look clean, carpets were stained & poorly fitting (see photos), in fact there were some industrial style mats to complete flooring in the main bedroom. We met other guests who said their accommodation was more modern so you might get luckier than us. If you‚Äôre not expecting a fancy room and just need a base where you can cook a few meals and save money while being centrally located this could suit.

I stayed at the york 10 years ago and was impressed with size and quality of that apartment however my recent stay was not as impressive. The building on the outside needs a revamp and the inside is in need of attention. Our apartment was okay with the oddest shape making it

tight in some areas and the oddest interior decorating. Not the best nor worst i have stayed in. Parking was annoying that you had to call reception to open gate everytime you wanted to enter or exit as there was no code or swipe card. Had a good view of the harbour as york is located at top end of town and price was very ressonable.

We have just spent an extended weekend at the York. we booked a three bed apartment but due to maintenance this could not be provided. Sandy, who was great put us in two two bedroom apartments on same floor which worked well. the apartments are older but clean and well

appointed.. Bathrooms are in drastic need of an upgrade. not up to standard for this level of accommodation. superb location for gaining access to Sydney and surrounds as well as having direct access from airport to Wynyard station.

I was extremely unfortunate to have selected The York for a recent business trip. I can‚Äôt recall a more disgusting experience. The room was old and the carpet was just disgusting. You couldn‚Äôt even sit on the couch it was far from acceptable. The bathroom itself was beyond

awful. The taps constantly leaked. My experience with the staff was also appalling. Unhelpful and unfriendly. This was a disastrous experience. I can‚Äôt believe this hotel rates itself as 4 star. Never again!

Too many choices. Inside, outside, upstairs or downstairs and that's even before you've had a chance to to decide what beers to have. Have a crack at a paddle, that will take care of 4 beers for a start.

I struck up a conversation with the chap across the aisle on a Qantas flight to Australia, and he said that we absolutely had to try the Australian. It has pizza and burgers, but with an Australian twist. So on a hot day in January, we hiked up to the Sydney Bridge and on the

way down found The Australian Hotel in the Rocks neighborhood. There are plenty of tables outside and lots of tables inside where it's cooler. Before looking at the food menu, I had a hard time deciding which beer to drink from the 100 bottled beers offered in the menu and the the many daily features on the blackboard. I wound up having a porter and a dark ale. For food, there was a Pizza Parm, which was incredibly good and the Coat of Arms: half kangaroo, half emu. It was good to the last crumb. And I was sl glad that the trip back to the hotel was all downhill!

Stopped in at the Australian for a drink and a pizza and enjoyed the atmosphere. The service was friendly and relaxed and the bartenders chatting added to the atmosphere. The quality of the gf pizza was a pleasant surprise too.

Staying at the Shangri La up the road we were pleased to wander down to this friendly pub and find a GF pizza on offer. Although they only had a large in GF our Margherita pizza arrived quickly and was fine. Outdoor heaters and blankets made it quite warm even though sitting out
street side. A happy vibe. Beware the parking inspectors though if parking on Cumberland street!

We have dined here nearly every visit to Sydney, but this last time was ordinary. The service was slow, I have never understood how you can stand at the bar and the bar attendant can't see you!! Care factor was close to zero, in fact the young girl serving looked underaged,
and was not very experienced. Sadly our meal was substandard also, a very greasy too cheesy pizza and overcooked dried out wedges. Lucky the beer was good. And cold!

This is a cheap hotel with small rooms and some lack of amenities in the room such as iron (can be collected from reception). It's also under Town Hall train station so you'll get a lot of muffled rumbling from the trains which might disturb the light sleeper. It's had a refit
at some stage recently so it's not that dated but the rooms are small. It's ok if you want a cheap hotel but definitely not 4 star quality that Google says. 3 star max.

Small budget hotel in a great location in the heart of Sydney, within walking distance of just about everything of interest for a tourist. Rooms were small but clean and bed was quite comfy.We were on the 5th floor and heard very little noise from outside after close of

business day. Staff were helpful and pleasant. Free breakfast was very basic (choice of hot beverage and toast with jam or peanut paste), but it was free so enjoy. Had a great stay and would definitely book again for the price.

The location is great. Check in easy. However, first room we were given smelt awful so had to go and ask for different room. They gave us another room but the second room was smaller but we were happy to be away from the smell. Shower was great. Breakfast was a bit strange

but worked okay on day one. Day two, a new person who had no ckue how to work coffee machine so we had to leave it. Day three, we decided not to bother. Overall, we liked the location very much and staff were friendly, so may rebook another time as price was good for area.

Booked this hotel and paid in full, upon arrival shown our room, had booked superior room, it was far from superior the room was tiny, bad smell, window covered by curtains when opened looked onto brick wall, asked to be moved and put bus in same room 2 floors below so no

different, bathroom so small you could sit on toilet and wash your feet in the shower !!!!! Asked for refund as had to book alternative accommodation was refused!!!! We had booked and paid 4 nights we didn‚Äôt expect full refund but as a gesture of good will would have even happy with 50% but nothing, wrote to management but have refused to budge, they even resold our room as following day we rang to check availability but told full. Disgusting hotel how anyone could possibly stay in these tools is beyond belief. After spending 3 weeks in Australia this was most expensive hotel but the worst. Room supposed to have mini bar with some complimentary items, never found them yet, also slippers provided again none in room, certainly not was described.

Came to Sydney to see Nancy and Beth cabaret. Megaboom just a small doorway on the street. Reception check in easy and friendly we were even 30 min early. The rooms are a bit small (bigger than Singapore). But well appointed. Clean and tidy. This would be the cheapest hotel in

Shane for a long time. It‚Äô was even cheaper than the backpackers for similar level. When it gets busier the price will go up. But that‚Äôs Sydney. Close to major part of city and close to public transport. Good hotel.

Last minute decision to stay overnight after change of plans. Perfect location for us after a night on the harbour, car parking was no issue. Didn't have the breakfast as we went across to harbourside for a small breakfast before function. Room was very tidy, beds comfy. A few

Stayed here for 2 nights in July 2019 for work, location was good, lobby was good, night view of the harbour was good, however that was it, room and bathroom is severely dated. The room is not four stars, if anything three, the fittings in the room are coming away and the

As soon as we looked at the rooms we said no way. Very dated rooms and not for us. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. They organised to transfer us to their sister hotel, the Novetel, next door. We were more than happy to pay the $50 extra per night. They need a

Very comfortable and very helpful staff. Good value for money considering the location and Hotel. Delicious breakfast and dinners on offer both at the hotel and closeby in Darling Harbour. Good drycleaning service.

title.value: Comfortable stay in an Amazing Location

content.value: The hotel is located within 5 mins of walking from Darling Harbour. The stay was very comfortable and the staff is very courteous. The hotel is fairly basic but considering that you spend most of your time outside, you will have no complaints.

This hotel appears to cater to business travelers, not families. I have never had a Hilton make me feel so unwelcome as Hilton Sydney in all my stays in many cities on multiple continents. As a Hilton Honors Gold member, we were given Executive Floor Privileges. When I

Approx 40 mins from the airport and can be accessed via George st or Pitt st which was very convinent. Central CBD location close to everything you need. 9am arrival and early check in was provided. Angelica from front desk was extremely friendly and helpful. Had to print and

title.value: Central location and helpful staff, small rooms

content.value: Attended a conference for two days here and stayed both nights. Hotel is what you'd expect for a city centre Hilton. Small rooms but big enough for a short stay. However room amenities are very poor. No coffee pot or machine, just a couple of sachets of cheap powdered coffee.

There are lots of great things about this hotel - the staff are very helpful; the space of the 2-bedroom apartment was great, and it was very clean. However the street noise is very loud (I was in the second floor, facing the street), even though I had requested a quiet room.

When I arrived early in the morning I was told I would be on the 12th floor but couldn't complete the check in because the room wasn't ready. When I returned I was given a room on the 2nd floor as all the other rooms had been given away which was really disappointing. If you don't mind city noise then this is a good option.

Great location in the city of Sydney... Very clean , very comfy bed , great clear TV , nice bathroom, overall very nice room without being huge. Meeting rooms very good the meals were great but the prawns were sensational. Friendly and very helpful staff

title.value: Great location in the centre of Sydney

content.value: Excellent location close to shops, Pitt St mall, and train stations. Easy walk to Darling Harbour, Circular Quay, Hyde Park. Our room was quiet and the block-out blinds ensured a nice long sleep-in. Fantastic buffet breakfast with options for all palates.

Staff extremely helpful and courteous. The rooms were so comfortable and clean. Location is perfectly central, with restaurants and a convenience store close by. Affordable and priced well for the location and room.

Great place and great location. Very nice staff and quiet at nights. Was great place to stay and would highly recommend staying there again due to the convenience of everything. Very clean and tidy and comfortable.

Nice friendly place suitable for all purposes and cost effective compared to other property in Sydney I am strongly recommending this place for anyone want to visit Sydney and enjoy accommodation Always 24 hours staff in reception are available and smiling to your face trying to
help you

Elevator not working which is forgivable but at 10am check out time, not one but TWO cleaning staff filled the one available lift with their cleaning trollies?? Stopped at each floor on the way down which is what you would expect at check out and on each level guests could not
get into the lift. Doors to the rooms close loudly. Hotel is well located and reasonably priced. Front counter staff are VERY friendly.

I‚Äôve stayed here many times. There‚Äôs some great qualities including many of the staff, but the quality of the rooms continue to deteriorate. There are countless mentions here about the Junior Suites not being up to scratch. Beware of 1515. Red wine stains on the carpet, or

blood? Tv signals not working in the lounge room. Balcony door that won‚Äôt lock properly. No coffee machine, which seems strange for a Suite. Stains and marks on most of the coloured furniture. We had a baby cot that collapsed and needed to be replaced. Why there is only a queen bed in a suite with enough room for a king is still beyond me. And as mentioned many times the coffee table is appalling - marks that cant even be scrubbed off. Most of this is an easy fix. Why it‚Äôs being ignored I have no idea.

We had a lovely stay for 2 nights. We had a little trouble understanding the English of the girl who did our check-in. Perhaps she can speak more clearly and slowly as her accent is very strong. The breakfast egg chef (Fionmy) was very friendly and remembered our orders from the

previous day which was unexpected. Staff in the buffet breakfast were a little slow clearing plates and the juicing station became very messy and needed attention quite often. The beds were great and the location is excellent. Thank-you!

We stayed for two nights and the hotel is really comfortable and convenient to so many attractions. The room service meals were delicious and the breakfast in the restaurant tasty as well the Australian Museum is just around the corner and the room had a great view of Hyde Park

title.value: Great view with a comfortable stay

content.value: This hotel is very well positioned adjacent to Hyde Park in Sydney. Just far enough out of the city to take in spectacular views. I stayed in the higher level and the views were breathtaking. The hotel staff were very helpful and attentive. The museum is very close and the
restaurants in Darlinghurst just a short stroll away. Really enjoyed my stay here and would recommend it.

This is where I stay now whenever I need to be in the city. Everything here is perfect, and they now have Worcestershire sauce for scrambled eggs!!! The staff are wonderful, the rooms are heavenly, and I'm due back there in several weeks...!!!

staff confused on check in directing us to wrong rooms and floor. Shower head very low - had to bend down to wash hair. Housekeeping forgot to make up room even though a sign was put out to do so. Apparently don't put the sign out if you want your room made up. The sign confuses

Check in staff just gave us one room but was booked for two rooms of the first booking itching bed sheets linen cannot sleep through the night staff was confused the we had to show the booking confirmation from booking.com

Hotel is super clean and a prime location. Only downside is it‚Äôs situated in a busy part of the city next to bars and a busy junction. So just be mindful you might not get a great sleep before 1am. Breakfast was ok ish.

The hotel is well situated and the price is great. Rooms are a bit tired but we were not spending much time in the room so was fine. Receptionist on both check in and check out were efficient and pleasant.

This is a great hotel. 5-10 minute walk from Central station. Love the way that the bedroom is separate from the lounge area. Great bath with hot hot water. A big breakfast buffet to accomodate all tastes. Nice and quiet. Friendly staff with super fast check in and out. This

title.value: Boutique experience in cool area of town

content.value: Beautifully fitted out, this is a different experience from staying in a generic hotel. This place has a cool vibe, obliging staff, interesting bars and restaurants down old lanes. Highly recommended.

title.value: Noise level unacceptable. Stay if you are a vampire and doesn‚Äôt like sleep.

content.value: We stayed at the Establishment on the Saturday night before City2surf. There was ZERO sound proofing in the walls and windows and we could hear thumping dance music from the rooftop club next door all the way till 2 am in the morning. We could also clearly hear the conversations

the couple in the next room were having. The hotel provides ear plugs in the rooms, we quickly realised why. We asked to be moved to another room as I was running the next morning for a good cause that I was raising money for. We were told that the hotel was full despite seeing available rooms on booking.com There was no night manager and the hotel manager only works weekdays so we couldn‚Äôt escalate the issue during the time. Upon speaking to the front desk in the morning About the difficult night we had, we were given complimentary late check out however Low and behold, they charged my card without my authorisation for it anyway! Cannot recommend to consider another hotel enough! I ended having a 3 hour sleep for a room we paid premium rates for. Absolutely the worse stay in a hotel ever. Lovely interior but what is the point if you can‚Äôt even enjoy the basic service of a good night‚Äôs sleep a hotel should provide.

Great place to stay central to Sydney. Hotel room was nicely designed. Comfortable bed, openable partition to watch tv from the bath! Recommend Google maps to find the hotel, it is tucked away down a side street. Loved the swing bar and Mr Wong for room service. As some posts

say there can be noise, it is an old building in the middle of a busy city. . Always going to be some noise. Ear plugs were provided as part of the cosmetics pack in the bathroom. Wasn't a problem for the wife and I though.

I stayed here for 1 night while in Sydney for a work trip and it was such a fantastic stay. I arrived just before midday and my room was ready. The room was huge and managed to be luxurious without being over the top. Highlights were: - the massive bathroom, the turndown

service (chocolates! fresh towels!), the comlimentary water and apples, the bathroom products, the spaciousness of the bedroom, the overall aesthetic. I'd highly recommend. Lunch in the Garden was also amazing, their soup and sandwich daily specials are insanely good.

Hard to find but once there the staff where simply superb and the ambience and old building beautifully restored , the noise from old water pipes hammering was a small annoyance and the showers are high flow and fantastic.

Sadly Disappointing Service for a Hyatt! Check-in was frustratingly slow, staff unhelpful and this experience was repeated less than an hour later by my wife. Is this what you get for Booking 3 Rooms?

Great service. The staff were really friendly. But the property is a bit dated. The rooms could definitely use an update, especially the old carpets, and low water pressure. But for business travel purposes, it's sufficient

title.value: requested to cancel 1 night but failed

content.value: Requested to cancel 1 night for Friday stay on Monday, but failed to get the 1 night fee back. "booking.com" and the hotel push the responsibility to the other party. I hope this is the last time I have to use booking.com and last time I have to stay in Hyatt. You have such
great terms, don‚Äôt have any sympathy or consider any emergency.

The Hyatt Regency is a great location right next to Darling Harbor. A short walk from the airport train. The d√©cor is as expected of a Hyatt hotel. Having breakfast on level 11 and a drink at sunset at the Zephyr bar on level 1 overlooking Darling Harbor is terrific. Also a
short walk to the Cockle Bay restaurants.

title.value: Unclean and melted mini bar chocolate!

content.value: Bathroom filthy, minibar chocolate was melted and inedible.Waited 25 minutes in line to check in. Then told room was not ready until 5.00pm . Earlier that day was told the room would be ready at 2.00pm.

On arrival we were greeted by a happy and outgoing young lady at the door and directed to the lifts to go up to the hotel lobby , once checking in we were informed that we had received a complimentary room upgrade and wished a happy anniversary , once we got to our room we were

greeted by different yet bet very classy furnishings and the cleanliness of the hotel and room was above exceptional , we had a beautiful room with a nice view of the QVB and surrounding streets , the hotel itself was quiet and private , we were informed when exiting for dinner about the activities within and around the hotel that were happening , we couldn‚Äôt be happier with our choice of Hotels and urge anyone looking for a quiet and private night away in a central location to put QT at the top of your list

My girlfriend and I visited Sydney to see old friends. I normally stay at the Park Hyatt, however I was advised to try the QT hotel. It was stylish, in an excellent location, with amazing service. I will stay there in future. Concierge could not do enough and clearly loved
their job. Well done.

What could I say! WOW what an amazing hotel. All facilities there are definitely something here for everyone. My husband had the perk of getting a haircut at Spa Q and it was truly divine. Even though we were only stayed the one night the drinks were flowing and the restaurant

food is to die for. Would definitely recommend getting one of the steaks. YUM! The staff here is what truly makes QT special, everyone makes you feel so welcomed. We didn‚Äôt get the chance to meet many people, the ones we did are just lovely. We do want to say a special thank you to Alex, Charlotte, Jay and Micha as they really set the tone for our stay.

Big fan of the QT hotels. Sydney is very Sydney. My highlights are the bed (OMG heaven), the lift that plays Young MC's 'Bust a Move' ever time you travel, the stunning art, let alone the dim lit deco cafe on the ground flloor. Heaven.

Stayed one night for a business event. The room, service and food were all fantastic. Will definitely be staying here again. The staff were particularly attentive and friendly which I found inviting. The breakfast the next morning was amazing and I enjoyed the freshly squeezed
orange juice.

item.hotel_name: Sir Stamford at Circular Quay Hotel Sydney

title.value: a wonderful place to stay in sydney

content.value: such a nice, small, authentic, friendly place to stay. wonderful location. we had a great dining experience for lunch, loved the gym, general service, super-friendly service and advice. lovely large room was nice to spread out in.

item.hotel_name: Sir Stamford at Circular Quay Hotel Sydney

content.value: Wonderful experience in this beautiful building with excellent room, amenities and very comfortable bed. The hotel is close to everything and only few hundred meters from the Sydney Opera House and Harbor Bridge. We will definitely stay again when in Sydney.

item.hotel_name: Sir Stamford at Circular Quay Hotel Sydney

content.value: Fabulously located with very helpful staff, very good dining facilities and quiet spacious rooms. The staff went out of their way to assist me even after I had checked out. Highly recommended as a place to stay for liesure or business.

item.hotel_name: Sir Stamford at Circular Quay Hotel Sydney

content.value: Very good location, very high level of Cleanliness, very spacious room with great comfort throughout . The check in and check out was a breeze with very good Staff who were courteous and friendly at all times

item.hotel_name: Sir Stamford at Circular Quay Hotel Sydney

title.value: Top spot to enjoy the best of Sydney

content.value: If you want a homely, spacious and well appointed room then this is the hotel for you. Large bedrooms, fully equipped marble bathrooms with separate shower and bath. Friendly and helpful staff, excellent in room dining service, you will feel like staying forever!

item.hotel_name: Zara Tower Hotel - Luxury Suites and Apartments

title.value: Short Family Holiday to Sydney - 7th to 12th August 2019

content.value: What more can I say. From a warm and friendly face; Tim and Saul was the highlight of our Sydney trip. They were passionate and really made us feel welcome to Sydney! They went the extra mile to suggest great restaurants and places to visit. Coming from Singapore, the space of

the room was almost as big as our apartment in Singapore!. The open plan concept is refreshing and spacious enought for my family. This hotel is great for traveller who value space and an area where you can cook / heat up food (vs a conventional hotel) The little extra touches like the nespresso machine, T2 tea and high quality toiletries shows the care and love of the mangement of ZARA. Once again thanks to Saul and Tim in making our trip a memorable one! Location is central and close enough

item.hotel_name: Zara Tower Hotel - Luxury Suites and Apartments

title.value: Nice and spacious room, good location and superb staff

content.value: Super comfy and spacious room. Location was good, walking distance to shopping district and very near to Chinatown. Would like to specially thanks to Saul and Tim, both have delivered excellent helps and make us feel so like home. Highly recommended to stay in Zara tower if you
visiting sdyney. Will be back :) keep it up :)

item.hotel_name: Zara Tower Hotel - Luxury Suites and Apartments

content.value: These apt are pure luxury. Spacious, tastefully furnished and well equipped. They are open plan. The shower was huge, shoer gel, shampoo and soap was provided along with towels. The apt was cleaned every day and the bed made. If you are used to the finer thing's in life these

are for you. They are close to the Museum train stop -approx 5min to Central Quay, however you can walk through the beautiful botanical park to the Opera house as well it takes approx 20mins. There is a supermarket approx 500m from apts. Staff are friendly and helpful. The area around the apt is not good for walking at night there are alot of homeless sleeping in doorways and I did not feel safe at night.

item.hotel_name: Zara Tower Hotel - Luxury Suites and Apartments

title.value: Look no further for a great place to stay while in Sydney

content.value: We were in Australia for two weeks, with our last week to be spent in Sydney. It was our first time in Sydney. After doing much research on the web for a place to stay, I happened upon Zara Towers Hotel and thought that I would give it a go. I was not disappointed. Zara

Towers is an establishment that has a 5 Star Staff, who are most eager to serve you and make your stay wonderful. Tim, who has an extensive knowledge of Sydney, gave us great suggestions on places to tour and restaurants to eat at. The facility is just steps from Central Station, Chinatown, and only about 35 minutes walk to Sydney Harbor, the Sydney Opera House, and the Circular Quay, where you can have a beautiful ferry ride across Sydney Harbor, to Manly Beach. When first viewing our room upon arrival, I was literally shocked at the amount of space provided, as well as the interior design scheme. The design is a comfortable "Soho" loft, somewhat modern/industrial design, with one full wall of windows. There was a full kitchen with a dishwasher, stove, microwave, refrigerator, and range hood, espresso maker, with espresso provided, and a 4 person dining area with distressed leather chairs. Our room also had a dressing area, abundant closet space, a safe, king sized bed, a fold out sofa, a leather sofa in the living room, with flat screen TV, speaker for your iPhone, or Android phone, (you provide the cable), a desk, and bath room with a walk in shower and plenty of vanity space. A Coles Supermarket is located nearby within the lower level of the World Square Shopping Centre with a Liquor Land store next door, with which to stock your kitchen, and many excellent restaurants and coffee shops (the best coffee in the world) surround Zara Towers! Needless to say, when we return to Sydney, this will be the place that we will choose for accommodations!

item.hotel_name: Zara Tower Hotel - Luxury Suites and Apartments

title.value: Great home away from home with an awesome staff!

content.value: My nephew and I stayed in a Zara Tower 2 bed/2bath apartment for our 9 day visit. Super spacious, clean and every member of the staff was friendly and helpful during our visit. Museum station and Hyde Park are a 5 minute walk from the hotel. For such a long stay, it was great to

have a living room for evenings relaxing after all of our walking. Having a kitchen and the ability to pre-stock it with items was great for us after arriving on a red-eye flight. Guaranteed to stay here again on my next visit.

Stayed here for 5 nights with family. We are lucky that we have been upgraded to 3 bedroom suites, however the view of the upgraded room has been blocked by some of the structures of the building which is a pity. However, the friendly staff (so sorry that I forgot the girl's

name, she is on duty on the night of 7 Aug) is so nice to make a follow up call to our suites. We told her the blocking of the view and she is so nice that she has helped us moved to another room and the view is magnificent. The facility of the suite is great . I had been enjoying my cooking throughout the trip. The location of the hotel is also flawless, walking distance to many great destinations and shopping place. Lots of restaurants nearby and also a great supermarket within a few minutes walking distance. The only part I am not happy about is the housekeeping service. As the daily service is not being done properly, the floor are not being vacuumed. The breadcrumbs from the morning was still there when we returned hotel. The table and also the kitchen are not being wipe at all. I would love to give it a 5 star but the housekeeping service is a disappointment.

Our stay here was enjoyable. The staff were pleasant and helpful. Our room was spacious, functional and modern. Everything was clean and tidy. The location was ideal to everything that we needed including a grocery store, restaurants and shops. Based on our stay, I would
definitely stay with Meriton again.

We stayed in 6606. The bedrooms were rather small but the beds were excellent. Charlotte, Li, and Juliana (from the reception) were amazing, they were extremely helpful. Juliana even went out of her way to help us with our heavy luggages because the porter was not in yet (we

checked out before 8AM). The only minor thing to mention was the guy that was on the night shift (16 August 2019 at around 11:50PM). He dismissed my request and completely misunderstood me. I was going to explain further but he was giving me a dead end. He probably should not do a night shift.

title.value: We stayed here for my birthday. AMAZING

content.value: The location is perfect. We could even watch the sunrise from bed, listening to the waves and sipping on our coffee. Walking distance to a ton of great restaurants and shopping, the Bondi to Coogee walk is beautiful. The room was clean (and serviced everyday), spacious, the

bed was soooo comfortable. They do have luggage storage in the basement in case you need to checkout and then run around. My only small complaint was the dryer. It took a full day to dry a small load of clothes.

everyone is friendly.. the hostel is clean and there are always lots of activities goin on. Shout out to Hailey the reception lady she is very nice and helpful and goes out of her way to ensure my stay was relaxing XD

Our stay at the Meriton was just amazing. We had an apartment on the 70th floor with a view of the Darling harbour. The apartment was spacious and was a home away from home There is a Coles next door to the hotel in addition to restuarants catering to every cuisine. Loads of

shopping outlets are just a two minutes walk . In addition the largest shopping mall Westfield is just a ten minutes walk Darling harbour is walkable from the hotel We loved our stay at the hotel. And if we ever return to beautiful Sydney again then Meriton it is for us .

Great location the rooms absolutely beautiful , it was easy to get AroundMe all areas. Berry Quite. Staff were very helpful and pleasant. Check in and check out were an easy process. Views from our room were amazing

We have picked a gem of a place to stay this year in Bondi. We stayed July and now back in August before returning home. These apartments are spotlessly clean, well preset and the view is to die for. Location excellent and staff very helpful. Don‚Äôt look anywhere else.

This was our first time visiting Bondi....and right from the beginning dealing with Vickie was helpful and welcoming. We had a kitchenette, washing machine and dryer. Bed was so comfortable. Tea and coffee/hair dryer and shampoos and conditioner all available. Room 4 was

spacious with a balcony overlooking the road and view of Bondi beach. Great location, close to so many cafes restaurants, hotels and amazing walks. Close to Icebergs restaurant and so much more. Thank you Vickie for making our stay memorable.

Yha central Is a very good clean well kept hostel,you will find that the staff are very friendly and very helpful,Katy and Weiss are both to great characters that I met from the staff big thank you to them both and all other members.i would recommend Sydney yha if your are

Really liked the atmosphere and the rooms (especially the ones for 6,5 and 4) are really worth the price! The location is obviously central so You can reach everything easily on the one hand, but on the other hand its sometimes too busy around the hostel, for my taste. The best

Stayed a week here in June and it was hard to find fault. We were upgraded to a two-bedroom ocean view apartment (thank you Vickie) and the views really were amazing. We sat at the breakfast table watching the surfers and the whales playing. The apartment had everything we

needed for a family stay and with the bus stop right outside, it was a super location to both enjoy Bondi itself as well as the rest of Sydney The apartment was serviced every day which was unexpected but a fantastic bonus. We would definitely stay again..

We were very impressed with the size, quality and amenities in the ocean-view apartment, but most of all, appreciated the sheer convenience of being on the doorstep of one of the best beach locations in the world! The view from the balcony at any time of day, in any weather was

fantastic. It was a bonus that our apartment was serviced every day, and we found it handy being able to prepare food, do our washing, or just laze about in comfort. Thanks Vicky for helping to make our stay so memorable.

I had really great stay at this hotel for many reasons: Great location,very helpful and friendly staff. Love the yoga studio. Front desk staffs go out of their way to help. Should have tried the breakfast sounded really nice

This is a 15/10. Firstly, the staff is incredible. Especially Hayley and Moey, you guys have been very nice and kind with me and very helpful . More than just Receptionist you become real friend. Secondly the location is perfect. Close to every cool bars and train, you can go

title.value: Good basic accommodation in Central, better second experience

content.value: Four years ago I stayed at the Central YHA and had an atrocious experience. You can see my old review on TripAdvisor. But, a lot has changed in that time and my second experience with Central YHA overall was much better. First, the hostel has been remodeled so it's clean,

Good value for money in a great location - love the beds in this hotel. Regular guests are welcomed with chocolates and wine and gym facilities are good in basement - good for business and good value for money

All was perfect, location, staff, rooms and recommendations by the concierge Cesar. He really made us feel at ease and displayed a passion for his job. We were advised on routes and places to visit, Thank you all for this perfect stay,

title.value: Terrace is bigger and no privacy

content.value: Terrace was bigger than bedroom itself. There is massive apartment looking at the terrace, basically no privacy No covered storage space. Bathroom is designed for 1 person only. No bath robes or extra blankets. Hard to find information on iPad. Room service menu was basic.
Rather spend that money for somewhere else. Nothing stands out apart from the location

The room are great, bed is even better, service is warm, and the vibe is probably the best I've had from a boutique hotel. walking distance to some really cool restaurants, wine bars, cafes and only a short run to the harbour and water to start the day.

My partner and I stayed for our 10 year anniversary and it was amazing! We were upgraded to a suite and the view of the bridge at night time was beautiful. The staff were so accommodating, definitely recommend and can not wait to come back!

I stayed at the Darling in one of their suites for my birthday. Worth every penny if you ask me. They weren't over and above to make my stay pleasant and even helped me entertain a handful of guests. The room and view were amazing. Can't fault it at all. Definitely stay here if
you want a 5-star stay.

Had a two night night stay here easy check in with complementary bottles of water with Nespresso machine in room.Ask for more coffee pods and was brought up promptly with excellent service throughout with service team greeting & acknowledgement throughout the hotel with doors
been opened when entering & leaving hotel

We stayed here for our 10 year anniversary. The service from everyone we encountered was so genuine and kind. Location is great, so many things to do/eat around the area. Our room was awesome which was a treat!

I had booked a Suite for my cousin on her Wedding night as a gift for the special couple. They received the most amazing service, the staff went above and beyond, they could not stop talking about it !! The staff all congratulated them throughout their stay, and they just

felt like absolute royalty. The Darling just made their night, they had champagne brought to them on arrival, the room was just so luxurious, and had an unbelievable view! My family and I just wanted to thank all the staff at The Darling for their service. Will definitely be recommending, especially for wedding stays !! I also had so much help arranging the booking over the phone, the staff made the booking process very easy and arranging the breakfast in bed, and additional touches. Thankyou again, Madeline :)

Greeted by a couple of friendly dogs at reception, we knew were in the right place. Clean, spacious, comfortable rooms. Great location and quiet, which is surprising based on the busy location. Would stay again.

Big Hostel was a very pleasant place to spend the night. As a senior I usually avoid hostels but found my private room and bath to be to my liking. Just a short walk to Central Station, Chinatown and Surrey hills restaurants makes Big Hostel well located. I found the staff to
be very accommodating and the breakfast just enough to get me started on my journey. I will stay again.,

A real shame that one member of staff ruined the experience for us. The hostel itself had everything we needed and the staff at reception were always happy to help. However, one member of staff (I think his name was John) thought it was appropriate to hug my friend while she was

sat down receiving bad news from home on her phone while his friends looked on and laughed. We are two young women travelling alone and we don‚Äôt appreciate being made to feel uncomfortable to satisfy what we presume was an exhilarating game of dares. This ruined our experience at the hostel and prevented us from booking a longer stay. Staff should know better.

title.value: Nice hostel centrally located, with breakfast and 4-bed dormitories with ensuite bathroom

content.value: I stayed there for 6 nights. I stayed in two different 4-bed dormitories. It was very nice to have an ensuite bathroom and it was cleaned every day. However the beds were a bit noisy in both rooms. It would be perfect if there were individual bed lights to read a book in the

evening and an individual plug for each bed. The basic breakfast was included (cereals, milk, bread,...), I really liked that. The hotel was quiet most of the time (this is not a party hostel!) and girls in my dorm were always very nice and quiet. I also appreciated that the reception was open 24h a day so we can check in late or check out early, and we can store our luggage for free. The staff was also very nice. I recommend this hostel if you are looking for budget accommodation in the city centre (the hostel is 5 minutes from Sydney central station and close to bus stops, perfect to visit the city using public transport).

title.value: Very Nice Hostel Centrally located for the price

content.value: I am very please with the Big Hostel. The hostel is in the perfect location. Just a five minutes walk to the Central station. Not far from the Hyde Park. The staff members ROCK!!! I met many nice travelers and staff members at the BH . Steve the front desk receptionist is

really a great guy very helpful!! The TV room is really nice. It attach to the Kitchen and tables there to enjoy breakfast with other fellows. Kitchen open up around the clock so you can enjoy getting your mid night snack stored in the food shelf or refrigerator. There is a roof top available to enjoy the fresh air and chit chat with travelers. I had an 8 bed dormitory which was fine with me. There also a locker available you just need to buy your own lock. you can buy a small combination number lock at the front desk. If you want a lock with a key you need to get it at the "Convience store" for $5AU. same price for the combination lock. I prefer the lock with key type so it easier to open and close especially at night when there others sleeping at night so, you do not have to worry using the flash light to look at the number on the combination lock. When checking in they provide you a clean sheet and pillow case you put on by your self and remove the sheet and pillow case before check out. I had a hard time putting sheet on on the top bunk bed. As far as for breakfast, Food are totally alternative. What you get is bread for toast, cereal, tea and coffee. The Kitchen have a lot of ample space for cooking and storing your food. There is a computer available if you get tired of using your laptop or your phone of courses. Location is about 98 walk score. There a 7-11 store, Convience store, Yok Yok Thai restaurant just two blocks very good thai food. Spicy I am is another Thai restaurant. Vietnamese restaurant I did not dry. Sash Japanese restaurant just one block is $$$ expensive it basically a shared type of food I had small taco sushi for $9 I had two of them total of $18 plus surchage total of $20.00 the waitress are very friendly, chef is great. Laudnry is available to do a load is $8.00 total. cup of soap $1.00 Wash is $4.00 Dry is $4.00 Totalis $9.00 Very clean Very friendly totally secure Location is great Next time I stay at the big hostel I want to get a 4 bed dormitory type with a private bathroom disabled access.

Super friendly staff, big kitchen, clean. Good if your on a working holiday. Great location. Don‚Äôt really have a bad word to say. Rooms had a tv and a mirror in a 4bed. Friendly people. Big tv room and cool balcony. Maybe a little expensive but overall good hostel!

Wehad drinks at this beautiful historic hotel in sydney. The staff are friendly and the bar is a welcoming bar that provides a great backdrop to think of the historic times since this hotel first was open. A must see in sydney

A pretty good range of house brewed beers and a couple of cider's to boot. Can get busy at lunchtime, especially if there is a cruise ship in port. You could find yourself loosing a couple of hours here.

title.value: Great place to eat and have beer!

content.value: We came to Sydney as part of our 30th wedding anniversary trip. I love to try local craft beer and heard about this place, so it became a destination spot for dinner. We were tired when we arrive here for dinner, but it was worth it. It was the best meat pie we have had since we
were in England a year prior. And the beer was great too! We also both loved the architecture. I must come back next time we're in Sydney!

title.value: My second favourite pub in sydney

content.value: The beers at the lord Nelson are fabulous, especially the lord Nelson. Always enjoy the beer and the chips are delicious too. Try to make it here for a drink at least once every visit to Sydney. Great old pub with lovely charm

We (two couples) went to the Lord Nelson after being rudely treated by another restaurant in the Rocks. This change (with no booking, of course) proved to be a huge bonus for us as the staff, atmosphere and menu at the Lord Nelson were just right. We were catching up with old
