friends from interstate and we had time to do this in an incredible venue. The fish pie on the menu was to die for as were the desserts. The prices were reasonable considering the historic location, the ambience and excellent service. I recommend this venue highly whether for just up as we did or for a drink or a meal in a relaxed atmosphere down in the bar.

Staff was most welcoming upon our arrival and continually helpful during our stay. We were close enough to the city for a skyline view from an upstairs verandah yet far enough away that the kookaburras felt at home amongst the gum trees. Room was comfortable; the kitchen was a

great place to meet other guests. Shops and restaurants were but a short distance away on Victoria Road, and transport into the city was easy by either very frequent busses or a relaxing ferry ride (passing under the Harbour Bridge). It was a refuge after each day of tripping around the city.

We booked ourselves the Treetop studio in the lodge. It was very quaint, comfortable - we chose well. We chose it because it was one of the few rooms with an ensuite bathroom, and was separate from the main building. What we liked: - shared kitchen and dining area, where you

get to meet other guests - free milk, cereal, bread and fruits. - garden - very nice place to relax - room was very comfortable - lady at the reception who received us - Brenda. Very, very accommodating and friendly What could be improved: - Wifi signal. Almost inexistent in the treetop studio, so we had to go to the main house to get a better signal By the way, for first-timers in Syndey, Drummoyne is in the outskirts and will require a 10-minute bus-ride to get to the city center. Fare is around AUD$2.00 and the bus stop is around a 5-minute walk. There isn't much to do in the neighborhood, and resos are few.

Great location close to the ferry. Lovely relaxed, homely feel. Great kitchen and supply of basic breakfast items. Friendly staff. Very clean - have referred friends! Highly recommend to other business travellers for Sydney city.

Admiral Collingwood Lodge is a great place to stay in Suburban Sydney. Staff is amazing, very friendly and helpful. Location not too far out of the city center with bus stops and a ferry dock nearby. And I will certainly remember the nice evenings with other guests outside in
the garden.

This is such a great place to stay. I booked for 14 people (3 adults and 11 teenagers) travelling for a sports tournament. It was perfect for us. The rooms were perfect, very clean and with everything you could need, many with gorgeous original features. The shared bathrooms

were no problem at all as there are several and they were immaculate at all times. The bbq was great for us and being able to use the kitchen facilities. All of the staff were very friendly, Brenda and Rupak are so helpful and always available. Location is excellent, close to restaurants, ferries/buses, the harbor and being able to park our cars out the front was a bonus. I will definitely stay here again if the tournament brings us back to Sydney.

My trip with oaks on castlereagh was very good. Hotel's room was clean and calm. Hotel's location is very good. Coles and korean supermarket is closed to oaks. My daughter enjoyed swimming in pool during 5 days.

Convenience place to stay as the hotel is near to Central Station which makes transport very accessible to places of interest eg Darling Harbour, One day City Tour, etc.Near to amenities such as Supermarket and Chinese eateries,except not many Western eateries.

The apartments were very well appointed and roomy however quite noisey in the bedroom due to outside or lift noises that went all the time. We were there for business and it was located in a great spot for us.

Poor hotel, very poor clening, small room size, not friendly service, no refill shower jell and dirty in bathroom The service of staff is very poor, not friendly, not helpful, the location is fair, not clean

The staff were very friendly and helpful with directions to places we wished to visit. Also good recommendation on restaurants. The beds were amazing to sleep on as it was the best sleep I had in a long time.

This was a business trip for us. We loved the location of the hotel. Particularly the accessibility to the city and local areas. The room was spacious and clean. Housekeeping was generally good and most things were covered. The hotel lacked initiative to further engage guests

Enjoyed my stay, relaxing with excellent facilities. Liked the upgrade but lost my Hyde Park view!!! Parking at $55 a night for a customer is filthy, as there is no reference till you get there, and careful advice to others, as you could smash your doors in some tight spots.

Stayed 2 nights for business. Room was clean and spacious. Bathroom was large with a corner spa. Comfortable bed and pillows. Bar is great for happy hour each night (gets quite busy). Great location, within walking distance to Pitt Street Mall. Pool and gym looked good, but

We stayed in an executive room, The room was spacious and the tv was a good size and modern. The rest was not good. Bathroom floor wasn‚Äôt cleaned well, the sheet didn‚Äôt cover the bed 30cm of the sheet was up the bed (like it was too small for the bed) made us feel grossed out

The hotel was clean and the room was big (room 1906) but there is so much noise. The traffic noise doesn‚Äôt bother us but we could hear the guests above and next to us and in the hallway (it felt like there wasn‚Äôt a door and they were standing in our room). The executive suite

From the helpful and friendly staff, to themed night-outs, to super clean rooms and bathrooms, this hostel is one of those places that should be on every backpacker's list of places to stay. Sadly, they're moving out of their location across the Central Station.

Bounce is located just oppesite the central tube station getting intibthe heart of the city and other areas is quick and simple. There Really nice bar next called "tipple". Free 30 min wifi every night you stay! Cleanest, friendliest dorm we have been in on our travels so far :)

Very clean and nice backpack ! The view from the terrace is stunning !! The rooms have lockers and are comfortable Great location, lovely and enthusiastic staff, big kitchen to cook and many storages Love the paintings on the walls in the stairs ! Great place to stay !

I had an amazing stay in this hostel. Location is spot on, right next to the central station, walking distance to downtown. Staff was absolutely amazing, very acommodating and helpful. Great security, great facilities, large fully equipped kitchen, comfy beds. Everything is
constantly kept spotless. This hostel also runs socialising activities every evening, which is something that I, as a solo traveller, welcomed. Thank you for an amazing stay!

Great place to stay, rooms were all clean, kitchen and rooftop terrace was awesome. So close to transport and the city centre. The staff were all friendly and helpful and we could leave our bags there on the last day and grab them on our way to the airport

Yes. We were convinced to upgrade our room just so to get our room earlier n to have a quarter of harbour view instead of the city view... at $60 per room night! Well, am grateful for the rest from a red eye flight but I don‚Äôt really need the view since we‚Äôre out most of the

Location was great however valet damaged brand new $60000 vehicle with zero marks then denied it was done within valet services even with prior photos of undamaged vehicle at time of check in. Staff disinterested. Informed manager would follow up never received call however did

As a regular business guest at Hyatt this property always meets the high standards set by Hyatt wherever and whenever I travel. Great central location ensures ease of access to Sydney‚Äôs CBD and inner business suburbs

title.value: Nice hotel, good location, not the best value

content.value: This is a nice hotel with a good lounge. Upgraded to a bigger room and lounge access. Room slightly smaller than other chains with surprisingly little storage. Possibly a Sydney thing, but price on the high side. Good standard of lounge with quality food and good selection of

Very bad - sub standard Room key did not work Twice, Luggage was lost on arrival. Also, the room had no usb connection at all. Carpet on the floor was very old and dirty. Rooms did not have any hand was or spare toothbrush etc like most hotels

item.hotel_name: Sir Stamford at Circular Quay Hotel Sydney

title.value: A great place to stay in Sydney

content.value: A wonderful night spent at the Sir Stamford at Circular Quay - close to the Quay and Botannic Gardens, rooms spacious, comfortable and clean. Staff are most helpful. We look forward to coming back soon!

item.hotel_name: Sir Stamford at Circular Quay Hotel Sydney

content.value: The Staff at the Sir Stamford are 6 STAR and I experienced some of the best service I have received in my many travels for work. The hotel is classy, intimate and delivers beyond expectation. I will be back.

item.hotel_name: Sir Stamford at Circular Quay Hotel Sydney

content.value: We found the presentation of the hotel and the attitude of the staff contributed to a delightful overnight stay. Proximity to Circular Quay with the trains, ferries and soon light rail make it convenient to the opera house and the Rocks precinct. Bar and restaurant were good.

item.hotel_name: Sir Stamford at Circular Quay Hotel Sydney

content.value: If you can get a good price for the Stamford, snap it up. Many others around the city are often more expensive and no where near as comfortable. The location is perfect - close to the Quay and the Opera House, trains, parks etc. Room spacious and well appointed, can get views of

item.hotel_name: Sir Stamford at Circular Quay Hotel Sydney

content.value: Great staff, location fabulous, helpful, huge marble bathroom with bath easy to get in and out of, no coffe but i dont drink it anyway, quality toiletries. Comfy beds, wood fire burning in winter, spa

The staff is extremely attentive and the F&B offerings around the property are simply fantastic! Would highly recommend it for those also travelling for leisure. Location is superb! Great ambient around the surrounding area.

Rooms are beautiful and the location is top notch. A little noisy with the bar below but the supplied ear plugs meant it wasn‚Äôt a problem and I still got a great night‚Äôs sleep. Staff were friendly and welcoming. Would recommend.

title.value: Staff excellent, location fantastic but actual experience a bit of a let down...

content.value: Booked a weekend getaway at the Establishment...we hadn‚Äôt stayed there before so we thought it looked good for somewhere different, it looked and sounded fantastic online. Some really good aspects: location is excellent for getting down to Circular Quay, the staff - extremely

item.hotel_name: Zara Tower Hotel - Luxury Suites and Apartments

content.value: We (4 people) stayed in a two-bedroom/ two-bathroom condo in Zara tower for a 7-day stay during the first week of June 2019. I loved the layout of the condo and the included amenities. The place was clean and the unit was cleaned daily. The kitchen was fully stocked with all

Service was amazing and the room was so hip. I love how big it is for the price and how accessible it is to everywhere. The staff were amazing and catered to our needs. I was a little lost with where my room was because the numbers were on the floor. Other than that small thing

From the staff to the decor to the small touches, this hotel was wonderful. I frequently stay in the city for work, and by far this hotel has been the best. Nothing is too much trouble. The staff could teach the chain hotels how to do discreet service. The decor simple but

item.hotel_name: Zara Tower Hotel - Luxury Suites and Apartments

title.value: Feels like home and very spacious!

content.value: We stayed at Zara Tower Hotel for 4 nights with our 4.5 year-old and 1.5 year-old boys. Checked-in to our SoHo Suites, it was so spacious! (Coming from Hong Kong, it's just amazing to see so much space!!) The suites comes with fully equipped kitchen (there is an island), which

item.hotel_name: Zara Tower Hotel - Luxury Suites and Apartments

content.value: Large by European standards. Quiet, lots of amenities and clean. Staff was super helpful and would like to thank Tim for his attentiveness to our experiencing Sydney. We walked just about everywhere as it is close to the wharf, Opera House, Sydney Bridge, museums, botanical

item.hotel_name: Zara Tower Hotel - Luxury Suites and Apartments

content.value: A great place to stay, central city, close to everything. Tim on reception is fabulous. Thank you guys for a great stay. We had a two bedroom apartment, although the rooms were a little small, they each had their own bathroom, it was awesome!!

item.hotel_name: Zara Tower Hotel - Luxury Suites and Apartments

content.value: Our week long stay at Zara Tower Hotel was great. The room (loft style) was beautiful and had everything we needed. It was quiet, even though we were on a busy rd, and in close proximity to everything. Best of all was the staff everyone we encountered was not only friendly but

title.value: Amazing service at an amazing hotel

content.value: We had a bad start of our trip when we were told at the airport our flight was cancelled going up North. Determined to still have some kind of getaway, we decided to stay in the city overnight. QT was our choice and from the moment we arrived at the hotel, we were looked after

title.value: Beautiful hotel for a Sydney staycation!

content.value: My husband and I stayed here for a Sydney staycation night - everything from the attentive staff, room decor and restaurant (Gowings) were beautiful and made for a relaxing evening in the city! We'll definitely be back!

We stayed for 3 nights. The service staff are wonderful,. They are very friendly, cheerful and cater to our every enquiry. We want especially to commend Brandon for his great personality and responsiveness as he made us feel so welcome with his sunny and helpful disposition.

title.value: Luxury with a lot of charm

content.value: I stayed at a QT for a single night. Loved the decor and the personality of the place, which carries through into the rooms, which are clean and spacious. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Would love to stay again. If you are looking for a boutique which is a little bit

title.value: This is how you run events with amazing people, splendid venue and divine dining!

content.value: Gorgeous people in the whole process from site vist, getting a quote, event details to the host of the night! I had the best 50th birthday dinner party and our guests we thrilled. Thank you for all the attention and care.

very spacious with stunning view. very good for travel with family. the staff is friendly and helpful. highly recommended. location is good. The property is well decorated and kitchen is well equipped.

Really enjoyed our stay at Meriton Towers. Such an amazing view, and great service and location, although parking is very confusing which was the only downside as it was very difficult to find it. Wifi was great and the 24 hour gym was good, amazing view.

title.value: Wonderful hotel. Terrible reservation process and customer center

content.value: The place has wonderful views, it is well located and people at the reception desk is kind. But the reservation process is a nigthmare. I reserved online but had to make a change. You cannot do ir by your own. If you write a mail they take days to answer, if you chat online thay

Starting with the staff I would say super friendly and knowledgeable about the surrounding suburbs and Sydney it's self. The rooms are a little different ,but in a nice way. My room was on the 11th floor with views you would pay more for. Amenities were on the money . I love the

Great family rooms, clean, spacious, priced very well and awesome view and location. Would highly recommend to anyone as we have stayed at a few Meriton motels and have not been disappointed yet. Thank you Meriton Suits world tower

Best location. It is very convenient! They are many kinds of food can be chosen nearby. The room is very large, best view and the facilities are full-equipped. Just the parking is a bit complicated if you are the first time to go.

My husband and I were in Sydney for a quick getaway and wanted something different to the 'usual Sydney visit experience'. We booked at the Larmont due to the location (situated at the top end of the Cross). We were so pleasantly surprised by the room, so lovely and spacious

Amazing, first time experience with this hotel but happy to say that I will be back. Location is great within the CBD, quiet room, good view of the city and close to great bars, restaurants and cafes. The cafe directly across the road had the best coffee I've ever had which was

Loved the service they gave me an early check in and late check out without charge. Great rooms with a free gym pass everyday. I highly recommend staying here. The price is affordable for a hotel as nice as this.

I reccommend this hotel, it is very clean, staff super professional and the area is nice with plenty of restaurants and 20 minutes walk to the CBD - 30 minutes to the opera house. Great minibar Very clean rooms

title.value: Deliberately provocative and unprofessional conduct by some of the staff there.

content.value: The first day I'd booked this hostel and had got my key card from the receptionist for the four shared room I had paid for had told me that there is another room available. And asked rather if I would prefer that? So I asked to see the room or else how would I know if its any

Clean hostel in a good location near Central station and about 40min walking to the bridge and the Oprah house. Reception is open 24 hours and they 2 nice clean kitchens and a rooftop area with a sauna and a pool. Rooms are clean with nice lockers with outlets inside. Giving

title.value: Updating my review from terrible to excellent

content.value: IF YOU ARE ASSIGNED A SECOND LEVEL ROOM, ASK TO BE TRANSFERRED TO ANOTHER FLOOR. So, our first night was terrible. We were assigned a second level room which was sooo hot and I am not even exaggerating. I am from Manila so I know when it‚Äôs hot so when I say it‚Äôs hot, IT IS. My

I reached very early in the morning and way before the check out time. Gina was kind enough to let me in. Hostel was very clean and also washrooms. Kitchen was big and not that busy. Thanx for an amazing stay.

I've stayed in this hostel a couple of weeks and I highly recommend it. I want to say thank you to Poli, a recepcionist staff, who is an amazing professional. He is so friendly and he helped me a lot, trying to make me feel as comfortable as possible. I hope to come back soon.

title.value: Superb location for the Sydney nightlife.

content.value: Lovely arrival to the hotel. Concierge were delightful. Checkin was good. Room was lovely and clean but a little lifeless. Fantastic location to enjoy the Sydney nightlife. It‚Äôs not a hotel to enjoy the views from your hotel room window but a hotel to enjoy the local culture.

title.value: Top hotel, with very good room service

content.value: One of the few hotels I've stayed in that offered top class service to all its guests, from the moment the cab pulls up at the door until final check out. They've never had a problem looking after bags for early or late departures, arranging transport, or suggesting a place to

eat. Rooms are a strange shape, by virtue of the remodelling of the existing building, but they are big, quiet and very comfortable. The location is not quite in the centre of anything - the streets around are the financial area so tend to be quiet after dark. But that gives you a nice quiet sleep, and it's only a very short walk to the Quay, the Opera House or the Botanic Gardens. I rarely order room service, much preferring to discover the local restaurants, but the one night I was trapped here by a late arrival and weather, the curry I ordered for dinner was superb, and the serve huge.

I was really enjoyed during my stay, the hotel is located at a very strategic location and the bed and pillow are really nice to sleep. The toilet is also very clean and all the staffs are very professional and lovely other than one of the waiter i have encountered during my

breakfast, he told me that if i need a latte from Baristas i need to pay for extra, however i can get it from the coffee machine for free during my second day stay. However, during my first day stay i have also place the same order from another waiter and he just went in the kitchen and bring a freshly brew latte made by the Baristas for free.

title.value: Quick stop over - will come again!

content.value: We were really impressed with the service we recieved. I had asked for early check in but due to flight delays was unable to utilise. The staff were very obliging in changing our booking around. The staff were also very helpful in general. Great location close to central station

More like a four star hotel not a five star hotel as advertised, good service , breakfast was average for a five star hotel , good location, clean rooms/ nice bathroom, very comfortable bed, close to train station enjoyable stay.

This is a great hotel with great service and very comfortable rooms. Every time I get a great sleep in the very comfortable beds. It is my hotel of choice in Sydney for business and pleasure. Looking forward to my next visit.

Not a bad hotel. Showing its age in some places, but overall very clean and tidy. My only issue was the bed sheets... it is like they were using sheets meant for a queen, instead of a king. This was bough up with reception after the first night, but was still bad the 2nd night.

title.value: Central easy to get to location

content.value: Stayed here for one night over the weekend the room was Large, it had modern facilities, comfy beds and was super easy to drive to. Self parking was easy and reasonably priced. Will definitely stay here again.

Spacious and functional room but lacked finishing touches to add warmth to room. Loved the comfort of the bed and pillows! Amazing! Free wifi was great. Had difficulty obtaining a jug of water and ice from bar staff at restaurant to take to my room. I tried to help rather than

Preferred brand of hotel throughout Australia for many reasons - great locations, loyalty program, helpful staff, cleanliness , amenities, room size, sleep quality, good value, etc For this stay I was allocated an absolutely fabulous room. Actually a suite. Separate bedroom with

title.value: Comfortable and pleasant stay within walking distance of Kings Cross station and Sydney Harbour

content.value: We checked in early on a Monday morning after landing in Sydney from the United States. Our room wasn't available when we first arrived, but the staff escorted us into the beautiful and comfortable sitting area, brought us a tray of French press coffee, and let us there was a

full bath where we could freshen up and even shower if we wanted to. Our room became available shortly thereafter, and we spent three nights at the property. The staff was gracious and friendly, asking us questions about our travel plans and following up each morning at breakfast--which was delicious and plentiful and featured crumpets, among other treats--about what we did the day prior and how we were enjoying the city.

Set back from the street this charming building came with a lovely knowledgeable hostess and an equally friendly breakfast host. Couldn‚Äôt fault the breakfast variety and appeal set in a comfortable setting. Our room was so comfortable - bed just perfect. Congratulations on
achieving such an inviting holiday accommodation possibility in the heart of POTTS Point.

title.value: Simpson‚Äôs of Potts Point, Sydney Australia

content.value: This is our go to place in Sydney, beautiful accommodation with a quaint B and B setup.Great location, quiet, yet walking distance to great restaurants and pubs, Finger Wharves, the botanical garden, the Opera House.

We stayed at the exact same time last year and were not overwhelmed. This time was better. The breakfast is still the highlight for me. One of the best hotel breakfast ever. The services are still limited and it‚Äôs really time for Simpsons to get a refurbishment. Great location
and the staff are great. We stay in the area a lot and we‚Äôll be back more often.

title.value: Simpsons of Potts Point Hotel exceeded our expectations

content.value: Simpsons Hotel of Potts Point exceeded our expectations. ‚ÄòBookending' our Australian adventure, (accommodating our arrival and departure dates) when it first appeared that there were no rooms available at the beginning of our trip, special effort was made to fit us in. Keith and

Ree were the most welcoming hosts. Upon arrival, we can only say that we were utterly charmed by the beauty of this boutique hotel and its staff. Rooms were super comfortable and well appointed. Our first afternoon we walked to Sydney‚Äôs Botanical Gardens and the Sydney Opera House. Situated steps away from wonderful local restaurants and cafes, this lovingly restored Victorian mansion, full of character, provided a cool shady retreat from Sydney‚Äôs hot summer weather. Breakfast was superb. Being old school diehards, we loved staying here and simply didn‚Äôt want to leave. Exactly to our taste, Simpsons is a place we will return to. Can‚Äôt say enough great things about it‚Ä¶thank you again Keith, Ree, Damien and all the staff at Simpsons Hotel. Wonderful. Sydney & Michael

item.hotel_name: Pier One Sydney Harbour, Autograph Collection

content.value: The hotel is perfectly situated to walk to the main sites with an open bus tour stop right outside if you wanted to take advantage of it! The welcome we received was warm and helpful - we were allowed to use the shower room in the gym to change as we arrived at 10am after a long

haul flight which was most appreciated. We stayed in one of the suites which had good walsh bay views and was vey spacious and clean. Breakfast was a bit chaotic with our table being frequently cleared while we were up at the buffet with one time some of my personal effects being removed! They were very friendly but seemed to either be rushed or lacking in a bit of experience. The concierge was excellent and helped us several times with different requests. Housekeeping was also a little chaotic - it took three phone calls to get an iron replaced and 2 phone calls to get the coffee and milk replaced which was a little frustrating at the time. Overall it was a pretty decent experience but a few things let them down

item.hotel_name: Pier One Sydney Harbour, Autograph Collection

title.value: How would you enjoy being treated like a liar at a five star hotel?

content.value: As a Silver Elite member of Marriott Hotels we were expecting the best from this property. The welcome was warm and the service very nice to start. The room (224) albeit small and with stained carpet and somewhat worn down furniture and amenities, had an amazing view over the

water. Something really delightful to wake up to and you could even see the sunset from there. The windows are drafty and it was a cold night in Sydney, so we had to turn up the heat to it‚Äôs maximum 26 degrees to get it comfortable in the room. The auto-closing doors are much too strong, so at 6:30 in the morning when people start leaving the doors slam so loud that the walls shake. The room next to ours was vacated early and the staff started cleaning it making lots of noise and banging on the walls with what I can only assume was the vacuum cleaner. The hallways on our floor were covered in carpet pieces that were taped together every few meters. Definitely not something I have ever seen in a five star rated hotel. We went to breakfast on a Sunday morning and it was utter chaos. There were no tables for four available, so we quietly waited at the bar. My husband and I were then shown to a table for two and we had to explain that we were waiting for a table for for four again. Once sorted out and seated with two coworkers who were staying in their own rooms paying for their own breakfasts, we were brought the wrong coffees 3 times in a row. I could see the staff wasn‚Äôt able to keep up with the crowd. The buffet stations were not refreshed and the atmosphere was chaotic. Later during the day when ordering drinks at the bar the male staff was too busy flirting it up with drunk girls at the bar to pay me and my husband any mind. One of the girls even showed me photos of how one of the bartenders had taken her on a motorcycle ride across the bridge during his break. So inappropriate for so many reasons. They also didn‚Äôt know how to make a Gimlet, an easy standard gin cocktail. We never check our bills for an upscale hotel, because we assume the staff is honest and barring any accidental mistakes all should be in order. I asked my husband to check the charge for the Sunday breakfast upon our departure and sure enough it was an insane charge of $156. How they arrived at this number I have no idea. The other days we were there they charged $30 per person for the breakfast buffet, so even if they charged us for four breakfasts, it doesn‚Äôt add up. I went to the front desk and asked the lady to have a look at the charge and to adjust it to breakfast for two. She told me she would have to check with the staff to see if we were indeed only two people. Mind that our colleagues at our table had their own rooms and their own bills for that breakfast. I was now starting to feel like I was being treated like someone who was trying to rip off the hotel for a breakfast charge. Utterly shameful in my opinion when you‚Äôve paid so much for the room, food and drinks during the rest of your stay. She eventually came around and said she would adjust the charge ‚Äúfor now‚Äù, again insinuating I might be telling her a lie. I would have gone ahead and called in a manager, but I wanted to enjoy my last day in Sydney and really didn‚Äôt want to get into any of this nonsense. When we got home we received an email with a copy of the breakfast card for the room that the staff fills out and on it was written 4. Indicating that 4 people had eaten breakfast on the charge of our room. Now this I know had been scribbled in after the fact, because when we were checked in for breakfast that space was blank. Now it has come to the point that we have to reach out to our coworkers to ask them for proof of payment for their breakfast on that day. I am utterly disgusted at being treated like a cheapskate in a five star hotel. On our next visit to Sydney we will be sure to stay somewhere else and probably not a Marriott property either.

item.hotel_name: Pier One Sydney Harbour, Autograph Collection

content.value: For someone not from Sydney it does not get much more Sydney than to stay in a hotel right next to the Sydney Harbour Bridge. The service was of a consistent standard from check in to Check out. My room had a waterside view facing west so lovely afternoon sun in the room

on arrival. The building is a converted warehouse on a pier so to some extent the rooms have to fit within that structure, making ceiling heights a little on the low side. But overall the room was well up to the mark. Comfortable bed, hot shower. You really look forward to an early morning run when you can step out the door onto the pier then run around under the bridge and around Sydney Harbour taking in stunning early morning views The location and waterside views were very alluring. I also found the breakfast to be excellent in terms of healthy and tasty options . Good coffee as well.

item.hotel_name: Pier One Sydney Harbour, Autograph Collection

content.value: I travel globally every year and have had the privilege to stay at countless Marriott and other branded properties throughout the world. I would say without doubt that this is not only one of the best Marriott properties but one of the best Marriott experiences out there. The

staff goes above and beyond -- all of them. The location is perfect and after 3 stays so far, I wouldn't stay anywhere else when in Sydney. Thanks Pier One for the upgraded room this time and for another great stay.

item.hotel_name: Pier One Sydney Harbour, Autograph Collection

title.value: Great location, close to the city

content.value: The room we stayed in was basic, and not very big. In fact the beds were very small. There was a very small window with a slight view of the Harbour Bridge. The room was just okay. I found there was no toilet brush in the bathroom, and it always perplexes me when the

designers forget to put proper mirrors, lights and power points in the most needy spots of the room. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful and breakfast we had in the morning was delicious. I ordered a cocktail and left my glass and nuts on a small table whn I left to go for dinner. Three hours later my glass and nuts were still there.!!! There were boxes and dirty plates on the bar the whole night and that did not look appealing.

item.hotel_name: Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Surry Hills

title.value: Our Home Away Home Adina, Surry Hills.

content.value: What a great time we had Staying At Adina Surry Hills, we absolutely loved our one bedroom spacious Appartment kept in an immaculate condition,clean modern decor good sized bathroom, bedroom,lounge room separate kitchen with all you could possibly need close to to everything

that Beautiful Surry Hills has to Offer Pubs,Bars,Restaurants,Fresh Bakeries,Boutiques and much much more Such a beautiful Area of Sydney Adina Surry Hills is now our home away from home we will come back too again & again.

item.hotel_name: Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Surry Hills

title.value: My place to go when in Sydney

content.value: Perfect location with access to great restaurants and nightlife. The appartments are quiet and have amenities. We particularly love the city view, and pool and spa. Staff are always friendly and very helpful.

item.hotel_name: Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Surry Hills

content.value: Clean and nice room. Comfortable beds and good wifi with access in both apartment and in the gym. Only negative was that the blackout curtains didn't keep the light out very well and we heard some noise from the street (we stayed at 5th floor and we could here people from the
street talk in the evening) I can really recommend this hotel.

item.hotel_name: Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Surry Hills

content.value: Fantastic views and incredible staff. Had a great stay here. Rooms were amazing and service too keep them clean was efficient and 'green'. The location was close to everything I needed and the surrounding restaurants were an amazing addition to my stay..

item.hotel_name: Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Surry Hills

content.value: The location was excellent, There is a coffee shop right at the hotel front door. The beds were very comfortable. Easy walk to most places. The room was very large and quiet. The kitchen is fully equipped

Ovolo has created THE perfect hotel. My husband and I had never experienced such fun, amazing service and quality product. The hotel is located in an old wharf that used to be a wool warehouse and later was Australia‚Äôs naval base. They have restored it with flair and it looks

amazing. Like a Christmas market. Our room was big, bright with a great view of Sydney‚Äôs harbour. The mini bar was free which was a great addition. Happy hour in the bar was excellent. Wines, beers, spirits, a cocktail of the day and some nibbles served by great bar staff. The vibe was also great with a DJ on both nights we stayed. We didn‚Äôt try the restaurant but we had bar food and it was fantastic. We would highly recommend this property.

We recently had our second two night stay at Ovolo and we loved it no less than our first visit a couple of years ago. It is such an impressive building, the location is an ideal place to explore the city from and the views are magnificent. We walked to Circular Quay which

took about 30 minutes along the greatest harbour in the world but taxi or Uber costs next to nothing to get to The Rocks or Barrangaroo. Probably our favourite part of Ovolo is the staff. They are friendly, courteous, professional, efficient and just do that little bit extra to make you feel welcome. 100% recommend this beautiful hotel if you want to enjoy some luxury with a fun/funky edge and we look forward to being able to return one day soon!!!

title.value: OVOLO you have impressed us yet again!

content.value: We had our second stay at Ovolo this year! This time it was for a pre show meet up for our sons 18th. We enjoyed several cocktails and our guests loved it so much they booked two extra rooms for the night and stayed! The staff were wonderful, especially the lovely Nathan! The
awesome vegan Mac and Cheese @ Alibi and the breakfast... so beautiful. It is without a doubt our favourite hotel! Can‚Äôt wait for our next stay!

title.value: The most amazing birthday surprise + overall experience!

content.value: I surprised my best friend with a stay at this Ovolo for her birthday - and we had the most AMAZING time. We started with High Tea at Alibi which was lovely, then were greeted by Nathan at the front desk. His incredible customer service and attention to detail made for an extra

incredible stay, going above and beyond to make us feel extra special. I could not rave of his outstanding customer service more! We have already told so many people about our fantastic stay and will definitely be back.

Stayed last Saturday and Sunday night, so plenty of time to experience what this unique hotel has to offer. Modern decor rooms styled with flair, free mini-bar, 5.30 - 6.30 pm free happy hour, continental breakfast included. Stylish rooms built in a building that used to be a

large warehouse e=decades ago. Common areas were a bit drafty due to the very open design. Staff were excellent, and not uniformed, so sometimes it was difficult to pick staff from guests if you needed anything. All in all a great experience.

We spent two nights at Bet‚Äôs and loved the place and its fabulous location. The studio is beautiful, historic, spacious, comfortable and well equipped. It is also private and peaceful. We loved that there is free on-street parking, and that the place gave us easy access to the
city (by public transport, although next time we‚Äôd love to do the walk), but also to great restaurants and cafes just a short walk away. We will definitely be back on our next visit to Sydney.

title.value: Perfect place to stay at Sydney/Perfekter Ort f√ºr einen Sydney-Aufenthalt

content.value: We recommend this place warmly. Great hosts, good quality of accomodation and equipment, a lot of space, lots of personal information about travelling in Sydney, great breakfast. Washing machine and dryer were very helpful for us. Just perfect! Note: The stairs are not usable
for people with disability of walking.

We chose to stay at Bet's B&B because of the convenient location and how well it was presented online. We found it to be immaculately clean, stylish in decor and the facilities were perfect for any travelers' needs. Plentiful breakfast provisions, lots of very helpful

information about how to get around Sydney on foot or by public transport. Keith was a wonderful host (unfortunately we didn't meet Bet this time) and he was very organised and friendly. We will definitely stay here again when we next visit Sydney!

title.value: Best place to stay when visiting Sydney

content.value: Keith and Bet provided a wealth of information for our 4 night stay at the studio. Maps, brochures, personal recommendations for sightseeing were extremely helpful. Received amazing hospitality from them. Location is ideal for using the bus service into Sydney, train and

light rail to Katoomba National Park, harbor ferries, etc. They allow use of their reloadable OPAL cards which saves on all public transportation. Best tip was to avoid the expensive Bridge Climb and going up the Bridge pylon with museum for $15 per person. We even got a senior discount ($5 off the price). Breakfast food provided was much more than expected. The studio itself, is extremely clean and well equipped. We did not get to explore much of Annandale and would have enjoyed the local walk Keith recommended. Next time. This studio is a great value for the cost due to being a B & B, plus having kitchen available to save on eating out.

title.value: Loved it, Loved it, Loved it.

content.value: We had an amazing stay in this lovely studio apartment. It was beautifully furnished clean, spacious and the breakfast provision provided every day was so good. Everything was catered for, all the transport links information into Sydney including a Opal card for the public

transport, maps of the surrounding area with all local information you needed to enrich your stay. Thank you Keith for looking after us so well we loved our visits to the Tram Sheds with the walk through the park, such a lovely place. We hope Bets mum is better and hope to see you again next visit to Australia.

title.value: A fantastic first visit to Sydnet.

content.value: The location was great, just a short walk to all attractions, The Opera House, Harbour Bridge etc. close to the shops and rail. The hotel was very spacious with really comfortable beds and pillows. Stella on the desk was very polite and very helpful too.

Clean and tidy rooms with good service. Near the China town and Woolworths, so convenient to shop. Train and light rail station is nearby, suitable for all travellers who want to have a city walk like fish market, opera house and darling harbour.

It's was my partner and I first time staying at the oaks. I was very pleased on how the room was big enough for my little family. The view of the city was fabulous.Our 3 nights was a fun vibe. Such a shame the lift dead on us lucky we did have our child with us wasn't fun

item.hotel_name: Sir Stamford at Circular Quay Hotel Sydney

title.value: A tranquil setting close to the busy hub of Sydney

content.value: The Sir Stamford hotel at Circular Quay Sydney cannot be beaten for quality in its decor, atmosphere, cleanliness, value for money, location and staff attention and service. It is located close to Circular Quay, the Opera House, the Art Gallery as well as shops. It is a quiet

title.value: Feel of a luxury boutique hotel

content.value: Despite being a big chain Intercontinental hotel the Intercon Double Bay (old Ritz Carlton?) has more of a boutique hotel feel. I had a beautiful room with a balcony overlooking Double Bay waterfront. The king bed could have had a better mattress, it felt like I was in a hole

even though I am not particularly heavy. Bathrobes could have used an update but otherwise I have no complaints. Everything was functional and stylish. The Stillery bar and restaurant has a nice athmosphere and is good for a quiet catchup, except on Sat nights when it‚Äôs more lively with live music. Breakfast is great and surroundings pleasant. My favourite was the rooftop with views and pool. Would be good for a small party! I‚Äôd highly recommend the Double Bay Intercontinental for anyone wanting to stay in Sydney Eastern suburbs away from the craziness of the CBD. You are right in the heart of Double Bay right by all the shops, cafes, restaurants and the beach, park and ferry.

Location of hotel is good, easy to reach underground station and move around the city. Staff were friendly and we were given an upgrade. Room was reasonable size, bathroom was large with corner bath and a step into it which made it easier getting in and out. Only one chair in

title.value: Great value for money and great location.

content.value: Excellent city location and very clean. Highly recommended. Good value for money. Convenient for country travellers arriving at Central as only short walk. Close to light rail stop and Capitol theatre.

We were in Sydney for a girls weekend away. Booked online at the hotel website, great price and no difficulties. 2 bedroom, 2 bathroom apartment. Very clean and tidy. Staff were pleasant and friendly. Great location, close to central station and about a 20 minute walk to darling

item.hotel_name: Sir Stamford at Circular Quay Hotel Sydney

content.value: A hidden gem in the heart of the tourist/business district. Escape from the concrete jungle and relax is a world gone by. Quiet, pleasant, lovely staff. You'd expect to see your Nanna here for afternoon tea after attending a concert.

item.hotel_name: Sir Stamford at Circular Quay Hotel Sydney

content.value: This hotel is just up from Circular Quay so it offers access to all that Sydney has to offer. The rooms are elegant rather than modern, but do offer all the expected modern amenities including USB charging and full minibar. Staff are excellent and the Whisky Bar is a delight.

We were invited to have breakfast in the club dining room one floor up. The have a vegetable juice extractor and a whole range of vegetables and fruit and you make your own juice. That was fun and delicious as that's what I do at home. You can ask for eggs and coffee or tea
prepared any way you want and there are beautiful fridges laden with dairy produce and juices ready made along with all types of cereals. Service was excellent and the ambiance great.

I've just had the pleasure of staying at the Intercontinental located in beautiful Double Bay. I found the hotel, facilities and staff to be exceptional. I will definitely be booking another stay at this venue in the near future. I highly recommend this establishment.

I‚Äôve stayed several times at this hotel over the last 15 years, and it has always been a great experience. The views of Sydney and Hyde Park from the city side rooms are simply superb. Rooms are large with exceptionally large bathrooms with corner baths. I‚Äôve never had any

Hotel is in a good location, walking distance to nice shops and good restaurants. When we got to our room, the room was so dusty with feathers flying around the air. My husband discovered one of the pillows with a huge hole in it. We immediately called reception to have it

item.hotel_name: Sir Stamford at Circular Quay Hotel Sydney

title.value: Wonderful Old Fashioned Style and Class!

content.value: Liveried doormen, concierges that can‚Äôt do enough, lavish breakfasts and charm, charm, charm. Our room was quite large, with a desk, couch, and King bed. Bathroom was huge and tub was deep. They said the queen had stayed here and it was easy to believe. Also a great location

item.hotel_name: Sir Stamford at Circular Quay Hotel Sydney

content.value: Nice clean place to stay. Decor is a bit dated. Overall feel of the place is quite grand. Staff are very helpful. Technology is not high in the hotel. The breakfast is very overpriced for what it is - money far better spent in a cafe. Location is magnificent.

title.value: No gym for a five star hotel!

content.value: Very disappointed that the hotel's gym has closed down. I need to stay at the hotel for 5 nights for business. This week Sydney's morning is cold and rainy, so can't even go for a jog. Gym is the only way to do some decent exercise. Not fair for customers to put up with the ‚Äùgym
closed‚Äù exercise as a 5-star hotel. Even a 3-star hotel these days has a gym.

We stayed here for two nights on the way to Auckland. The room was very nice and spacious with a balcony. We loved the marble floors and the bathroom was excellent. The location is very good in a quiet area away from the busy tourist areas of Sydney, and is just two blocks

away from the ferry terminal. We took the ferry daily to go Circular Quay from where we connected to various Sydney attractions. Breakfast was very expensive as it is not included in our booking but there are many places near the hotel. The nearest supermarket Woolworths was about 5 minutes walk. We enjoyed our stay at this hotel.

Stayed here to celebrate my sons 18th and 20th birthday, we had great time and hotel offered us complementary cake and champagne which made our celebration even more special. Great location with walking distance to malls and Opera hourse and harbour brigde. Will strongly

I booked a suite at The Pullman Hyde Park for the weekend. Every Accor hotel I've ever stayed in has a welcome gift for members, (complimentary bottled water, or chocolates). No such courtesy extended by the Pullman. The suite was booked for 2 adults and a child. No additional

Spicers Potts Point... in the heart of city, yet you feel as if you in your 'other' CBD home. We didn't want to leave. We could have easily spent another night to enjoy the space. Clean, warm, welcoming. Great service and the breakfast is lovely. Love Spicers Potts Point

This beautiful boutique hotel perfectly situated within walking distance to the city and to Rushcutters Bay is welcoming with the feeling of a comfy home. Always a delight to stay here enjoying the professionalism and warmth of engaging staff members in a relaxed atmosphere and
beautiful surroundings. All you could possibly want and more.

Stayed her for my 39th. Beautiful location and lovely building. Unfortunately the staff at Spicers soured our stay. We were often completely ignored, not given information and had to ask several times for tickets. During morning breakfast we had to locate our own menus as staff

were chatting. I asked 4 times two different staff for some water before a single glass was provided. When the breakfast finally arrived it was cold. We decided to check out first thing the next day and skip breakfast. When checking out the woman at the desk laughed when I commented that service had been sub-par. Beautiful place, great location unfortunately your staff need to lift their game.

This was our first stay at a Spicers property and we absolutely loved it. Sam and his team are friendly, welcoming and helpful and made sure our stay was fun and enjoyable. The rooms are modern and well-equipped. The home-cooked breakfast lovingly prepared by Maricar was a real
treat and a great way to start off each day. The central location makes it easy to access transportation and the CBD with a short walk to the King's Cross train station.

Has to be the best accommodation experience in Potts Point - just wonderful and would not hesitate to return. Would thoroughly recommend without hesitation. Easy walking access to local eateries and highlights.

The room was always cold, because the airconditioning needed to be constantly fixed every day for four days while froze in the middle of winter. They would continuously apologise and send someone to fix the problem but never did they suggest to move me to a different room. It

Hyatt‚Äôs location on the harbor makes for a wonderful stay. The rooms and beds are very comfortable and the stairs in the back of the hotel down to the harbor makes it easy to access ferries and restaurants. I was very surprised how soundproof the rooms are. The staff is very

Good location, comfy bed but hotel is a tad run down for Hyatt standard. However, it's value for money. Will explore other hotels when I go Sydney next time. My room is very far from the lift which I disliked it.

This is a lovely hotel, in an excellent location on Darling Harbour. Our room was exceptionally clean and very comfortable, bed a little too firm for me, but not for my husband. I look forward to staying here again on our next trip to Sydney.

Great location but be warned its very hilly to walk the few blocks into town. Close to Darling Harbours' lovely restaurants and the back stairs make coming and going from the waterfront easy. Staff were lovely at check in the room was very nice. Highly recommend !

What a great experience, from the moment we got there to the moment we left we were treated with amazing customer service. The room was great, double shower and great minibar selection. Decor was great and the magic room keys blew my mind! Great coffee downstairs and staff were

Everyone should stay at this hotel if only to simply learn to love a hotel room again! Everything is quirky but stylish, comfortable and oozing quality. Fabulous decor, warm and inviting colours and textures, and all mod cons sheathed in funky packaging - without being

QT is our favourite Sydney Hotel. The rooms are always immaculate and the service is second to none. We always recommend it as a great place to meet friends for drinks, dinner or an overnight stay. Well done QT!

A quirky, beautiful hotel with luxury amenities, fabulous food and ultra comfortable beds. Excellent location. The highlight of my stay was definitely the staff - exceptional service, particularly from the front of house staff who were constantly cheerful and helpful. I

The hotel has a dark theme going on - fine, but the rooms are legitimately quite dim. The bed was very soft which wasn't to my liking and the pillows were all the same, meaning you can't just pick one to your liking. I visited the restaurant for breakfast, but gave up after

title.value: Aging facility rescued by quality, friendly service

content.value: I stayed at the Holiday Inn Old Sydney for one night in August 2019, travelling as part of a work group. This is an older style facility that is well overdue for renovation. Rooms are pleasant enough, but bathrooms have aged badly. There is a mustiness to the place that only

years of use brings. Rooms are fairly well equipped with a decent size TV, iron and board, work desk and bed. There was a coffee machine in mine that was out of order. Wifi was fast and free. Service was genuinely very good, with a good mix of friendliness and professionalism. My IHG status was acknowledged and I was given (along with my colleagues) a room upgrade. Location is quite good, with plenty of dining options in the area around the hotel.

fab hotel. Nice room. Amazing staff. really central location would not stay anywhere else whilst staying in Sydney if I return. My husband was ill whilst we stayed here and the reception team were totally brilliant. Helped us find a walk in clinic and then housekeeping gave us
what we needed whilst my husband remained in the room recovering. They made a horrible experience bearable. Just great.

We stayed here for 10 nights in total. We are a family of 4 and initially had 2 rooms booked for the first five nights of our stay as a family room was not available until our fifth night. We had also booked the room for the night before our arrival so that we were guaranteed

check in on our early morning arrival but from reading other reviews it seems that staff were able to accommodate early check ins anyway. Sadly we were not given a room with a view of the harbour bridge or opera house, instead we had a city view and although it was pleasant enough it doesn‚Äôt come anywhere close to the harbour view which we got to experience from the roof top pool. The rooms are unfortunately tired looking and the bathrooms could do with an upgrade but if you‚Äôre just after a place to stay and not looking luxury they are decent enough. However, the location of hotel is excellent. It is next to the rocks and a few minutes walk from the harbour bridge and circular quay so definitely worth staying here for the location. When we moved rooms we noticed that the Family room was no bigger than the standard room and just had an extra twin bed in it so space was a bit limited. The staff are really friendly and helpful and the breakfast is very good with a good selection. Our children also enjoyed having dinner in the hotel and wanted to eat there every night! They also thought Nick from the restaurant was great! The kids corner in the lobby is a nice touch too. We also loved the gelatissimo place down the road. The manager was so friendly there. Overall we enjoyed our stay here but unfortunately a slight dampener was put on it as when we moved rooms, my 8 year old left her notebook in one of the drawers in which she had some drawings and songs she had written, we notified the reception staff as soon as we realised the next day as she was quite upset to have lost it, and although the staff did what they could to help, unfortunately by then it was gone, and the reception staff were unable to locate it despite looking for it themselves and speaking to housekeeping who didn‚Äôt remember seeing it, which is a shame as it must have been picked up by someone. Despite this I would recommend this hotel for it‚Äôs location, breakfast and roof top pool.

title.value: Great location, good breakfast, old tired rooms

content.value: Stayed here for 5 days. The location is great and central. Friendly staff, amazing Masala omlette (not to be missed). The kitchen and Resturant staff are great. My kids only wanted to eat here and no where else!! The rooms are very tired looking. They need serious upgrading. The

bathrooms are so old that the tap and shower are continuously leaking. Very disappointed by such a standard. Holiday inn usually gives a pretty good standard but this one is a let down in terms of room and bathroom. We were two families traveling together and our bills were messed up leaving us to sort it out amongst us!! This hotel was recommended to us by Kuoni which has been a complete let down till now in this holiday.

Disgusting. Got recommended by a friend who said this hotel was amazing but the cleanliness was appalling. After getting an early check-in, which by the way was lovely and very nice of the staff, we settled into our room only to discover that it hadn't been properly cleaned.

There were bloodstains present through the bathroom and hair on the vanity. Once we called reception, they sent a cleaner up who we believed would deal with the issue. Once looking in the bathroom again we could tell that this cleaner barely cleaned up the blood leaving stains on the toilet and floor. We called reception once again and they gave the bathroom finally a thorough clean yet there was no follow-up apology or addressing to the issue. Other then this incident this hotel was a spectacular location! So close to the Harbour Bridge, Circular Quay and many other attractions. Such a pretty view from the rooftop across the Harbour where you had a 180 view of the Harbour with the Bridge and Opera House insight. While some of the staff were blunt and not very helpful there were 2 lovely staff who helped us on our last day and were appalled by the incident and the fact that nobody had followed up.

Booked months in advance 4 nights for an important wedding event in my family. Room 1301 is next to the service room/ lift, so there are loud bumps and thumps any time of day and night. Very poor!! This room overlooks the pool and the back of other buildings.. one was being

renovated, so we got to see the flooring guy work each night till late. Nothing special about this room or service - no extras provided to acknowledge our custom. Coffee provided was powdered sachets only and UHT milk pods. Lots of places of 3 stars do better than this! Towels had a kind of smell about them like they had been dried near food servicing.. uggh. Toilet seat had lost one of its bumpers leaving an exposed molding... uggh. Main bar area on level 8 is looking tired - veneer on table tops is lifting, and the textiles on chairs and cushions look worn. A table lamp near my seat had a power cord running to under my chair which had old no longer functional gaffer tape on it. Should have taken s pic to interest health and safety inspectors .. bizzare! Our main discomfort ( other than paying closer to $1000 for our 4 nights of very medium facility) was that the A/C is such that it is VERY dry! This was even commented on by a fellow guest in the lift one morning. Really uncomfortable!! Chose this place after staying here previously for 1 night ( & was allocated a much better room) because we needed 4 nights which was proving difficult in the better star rated accommodation which we were treating ourselves to as part of the celebration. Absolutely would not return - value for money just isn‚Äôt represented here. Mid level accommodation has lifted its game so much that this was an embarrassing waste of money.

title.value: Hidden gem it‚Äôs not what it seems

content.value: Given the hotel is in the busy market st, centre of CBD first impressions when entering on the ground floor were its a drab hotel and was going to be noisy I was so WRONG You go up to the with or ninth floor and walk out into this lavish expanse with bars restaurants and

brilliant reception Service is excellent and the staff so attentive I went straigight into the resruarant and sat there reflecting in a bit of a daze at the quality of the food at a reasonable price Bloody superb I was put on level 20 with. Superb views of the city I have too say the room was huge and spotless with all mod cons and a king size bed that you just love to collapse on it looked so good The bathroom was huge with a bath and shower Mini. Bar and everything you need e.g. iron desk robes slippers etc It was a touch of luxury amd not a single sound of traffic or noise from below It takes a lot to get a 5 star rating from me and the hotel has to create a complete experience however they managed to achieve this To top it off breakfast was exceptional with a huge selection and chef available to cook something you only see in the b3st hotels Stepping outside the hotel places you in the middle of cbd Sydney with all the shopping and business really got on your doorstep This has to be the best kept secret in Sydney and given the reasonable prices a must return hotel for all my business trips Well done Swiss hotel

title.value: Glad I chose to stay here!

content.value: The hotel room was spacious and very comfortable. The minibar, bathroom and everything else was well appointed and functional. Decoration was tasteful and trendy, too. Location is great. I walked all around the city - Circular Quay, Darling Harbour, Chinatown, Surrey Hills,

Botanical Gardens, etc. It's also located next to Elizabeth St where you can catch lots of public buses, including one to Bondi, and St James train station for Airport connection. It took me only 30 minutes from check out to arrival at the airport. Overall service was great, except for one night when I called to ask if the refrigerator could be turned off as it was making an unusual noise. The service officer just kept saying there was nothing they could do till the next morning, even though I said it was keeping me awake. I asked for someone to come up to check on it, and luckily, the nice gentleman who came said it could easily be turned off till the next morning. Apart from that, the room was really quiet at night, which is great for light sleepers like me. I was really happy staying here, and highly recommend it to anyone visiting Sydney.

We recently stayed at the mariners court hotel for 4 nights, the rooms were clean and comfortable, loved the shower, water pressure was good..breakfast was fantastic, something for everyone. They also have snack machines on level 1 and 2 for those late night snacks lol All in
all we were very happy with our stay and would definitely recommend üòä

Top class hotel in a great location providing excellent service. Stayed in a club room which was generous in area and very comfortable. Food and beverage facilities were varied with quality items and plenty of choice.

Really nice property and great location. i had room 2415 these last 3 nights with a harbour view and overlooking Pitt St mall, Center Point Tower, Hyde Park and St Mary's Cathedral. The room is large and luxurious and has everything you need. Friendly staff and a nice

breakfast. Great to have a downturn service and a chocolate on the pillow which you don't see much now days :-) Only negatives, $30+$8 delivery fee for a burger from room service is a bit steep price wise,I'm tall so the shower rose is pretty low, the wifi in the room was pretty much unusable for the stay.

A very pleasant hotel with excellent location ( above Myer Department store, very close to QVB, Westfield shops and tower, new George St tram and Town Hall railway station). Stayed in an executive floor room - very modern and well appointed although a bit small for an executive

room. Bed and pillow comfort rate very high as does bathroom. Views are a bit limited, I expect the permanent apartments which share the building got the better views. Executive lounge was everything one would expect and the comfort and range of food on offer here was excellent. Staff were pleasant although not overly friendly and this stands in marked distinction to say the nearby Hilton or Westin. The only downside was that the hotel lobby is 8 floors above street level so one needs to elevator journeys to come and go. The elevators from ground to 8 are shared with the permanent apartment dwellers and there could often be an annoying wait for an elevator here. Would I stay again - yes but I think I would go for the Hilton just around the corner

title.value: Clean, quiet, and walking distance from key destinations

content.value: I was sure that the age of the building explained some of the funkiness, including the smell that greeted us every time we walked into our room (you adjust to it quickly). But the building was built in the late 1980s! It was apparently built as low income housing, and it shows.

That being said, it is very clean, surprisingly quiet, and within 10 minutes walking distance to the Botanical Gardens and about 20 minutes to the Rocks and CBD. The breakfast is a bit greasy but they have a number of options. They will hold your luggage until 3pm. Would recommend if you want to be in walking distance from major attractions without spending the money.

We visited Sydney for the first time and I booked this hotel on the recommendation of a Twitter contact. First and foremost...managers Donna and Craig are amazing! They are warm, welcoming and full of advice for first time visitors. The hotel is delightful. Not huge (almost

a boutique feel), nicely done rooms with balconies or courtyards for each room. Plus a recreation room on the second floor and a rooftop seating area. Breakfast is included in your room cost and it's a full, hot bar breakfast with the most incredible scrambled eggs you will ever have! If we are able to return to Sydney there's no doubt we will stay there again!

I was there with work as we had our National Conference. The hotel was awesome, very clean and all the food very fresh and belive me we had a lot of food as we had a lot of functions..........breakfast, lunch, morning tea and after tea. Including party food for the welcome
drinks nights. All staff very professional and very helpful.

our conference was fabulous very well organised and these are the people that went out of there way to make it happen. May went above and beyond with what ever I needed, great operator. Wilson in food was fabulous a very switched on manager, couldn't do enough for me. would like
to talk to the Director of hotel if available thank you Haydn Roberts 0418521046

Located in beautiful Woolloomooloo this hotel is very good value for its location. You an easily walk to circular quay via the botanic gardens and Kings Cross station is a 5 minute walk away. The free buffet breakfast was delicious! Lots of fresh fruit plus eggs/bacon/sausages
cereals & bread, something for everyone. Our room was at a perfect temperature without us needing the heating which was nice as its winter. I would definitely recommend staying here.

Very comfy bed, good sturdy breakfast with basic cereals, fruit, yoghurt, tea, coffee, hot chocolate, bacon, scrambled eggs, beans sausages, spaghetti, mushrooms and toast. Relatively easy access walking downhill from King's cross station, close to the Art gallery, Botanic

gardens and walking distance from central Sydney. Adequate tv (at a strange angle to view), good wifi, easy after hours access (don't forget to get your access code if arriving after 6pm. ) Common room with pool table, coffee facilities before 9pm. We had a minor air conditioning issue in that we couldn't turn the heat down, but this may have been resolved if we'd queried it the next day, we had an external door to a small balcony, so opened that instead. Shower not brilliant, but adequate. Not many restaurants in the vicinity open after 9pm. They have gone to a lot of trouble to make the whole building accessible. Very comfortable and convenient hotel for what we paid. Recommended!

Professional and friendly receptionist, trying their best to accommodate my request. Amazing! Fabulous club floor with various food choices, impressive! It‚Äôs the best hotel ever I stayed in Australia, will definitely come back next time :)

10/10 Room: spacious and clean. I love the bathroom! especially the mirrors with led light. Good comfortable bed. Location: amazing! next to the train station and hide park. It‚Äôs also next to westfield and QVB. We pretty much walked to all the tourist spots. Circular Quay and

Darling harbour is only 15 mins walk. The train line outside this hotel goes straight to the airport. Customer service: The staff is what made us loved this place even more. They were very helpful and attentive. We‚Äôd request something and they‚Äôre at our door in less than 10 mins. Special shout out to the in room dinning team for the amazing service. Last but not the least, thank you Sheraton for accomodating us when our flight got moved to a later time. These guys allowed us to check out at 0600pm which made everything easier for us. 100% would recommend and would stay here again next time.

Chose to stay in the city again to save the early morning train trip to the airport for a 6am flight. Central location, comfy bed, friendly efficient staff and a quick 8min train trip in the morning to the airport. A wise decision, especial for the cheaper price compared to

Close to Central Station, a short walk to many good restaurants. Great reception staff, seamless parking underground at great rates. Rooms clean and comfortable, views out of the rooms are very ordinary, but that didn't detract from our stay. Cheap parking, checkout no

title.value: Food on the floor, hair in the bed and rubbish in the bin

content.value: Needed a hotel for a few nights before heading back to Melbourne. So a hotel near central station was ideal. The hotel is old and needs a good renovation. The amenities are good, but when I entered the room, it the carpet was filthy, there were leftover chunks of biscuits and

Quiet,as we had a room facing atrium, cannot comment on other rooms. Because of our age( 81) quiet is very important .Occasionally some plumbing noise but this is common for hotels.Very good location, 5 minutes walk from circular quay and shops in Phillip St mall in the other

The price of $260 + $44 parking is capitalising on an event like the city2surf. The rooms are a decent size, but the seam of the 2 beds being joined together could be felt, this combined with the pub below and noisy patrons leaving with no noise proofing made for a restless

title.value: Great value for money and friendly staff!

content.value: Me and the wife stayed for a couple of nights. Arrived at 10am and was allowed to check in then eventhough the normal check in time is at 2pm! And not only that, we were also upgraded to a bigger room than we booked! All without extra charges! Breakfast was also good, with a lot

title.value: Room was spacious. Smooth and pleasant.

content.value: Been awhile since I decided to stay in a hotel for my self-sponsored trip. Spent 4 nights here. The location of the hotel is near the bridge and Opera house. Wynyard station, bus stops, ferry museums is within walk-able distance. However quite a distance from the shopping area.

title.value: Great Hotel with great staff ! Definitely first choice!

content.value: I usually stay with Amora Hotel at Jamison Street for my business trip, but my company decided to book a different hotel for me during this business trip. First impression of the hotel that I felt, front desk and concierge service is polite and friendly, greetings were given

title.value: Top notch stay in the city.

content.value: My birthday was made so special staying at the Radisson Blu. We were close to everything - the Rocks, restaurants & just an uber drive to the cinema. Everything about the Radisson Blu was superb - the food, the bar, the attention of staff from the entrance, check in to the

The Radisson Blu Plaza is within walking distance from the shopping centers and other points of interest within the Sydney CBD. The place was quiet, the towels fluffy and fresh, and the room was always clean.

item.hotel_name: Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Surry Hills

content.value: Lovely staff, great location, really nice facilities. I was with a group from work and we were comfortable, had enough privacy and there was lots to do around the hotel. Vibrant and humming but completely quiet enough to sleep.

item.hotel_name: Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Surry Hills

title.value: Lovely place to stay with a group

content.value: I was looking for a hotel where a group of 4 could stay together. The Adina offered 2 bedroom apartments for a reasonable price given the location. The room was lovely, clean bathrooms, comfy beds and plenty of space. This hotel is located on Crown St which is very busy but

item.hotel_name: Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Surry Hills

content.value: After coming off a long haul flight from Europe we were given a room in which the air conditioner and TV were faulty and would not work. These were unable to be fixed by maintenance man. Although we were offered another room it was late and we had unpacked. As we have stayed at

item.hotel_name: Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Surry Hills

content.value: We had a great stay in your Hotel , we will stay again. I have stayed in lots of Hotels all over the world and your venue is , good value and an excellent position, in the city I think a 100 characters is enough to give a review

item.hotel_name: Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Surry Hills

content.value: Sydney's secret! Adina on crown is that moment when you realise this hotel has a heart and soul. She may not be as flash or and sexy or as cheap as many other Sydney properties BUT Adina Crown has quietly built over the decade a loyal client base of cool people and companies

title.value: great except for charge of breakfast

content.value: don't offer a complimentary breakfast, then charge credit card. Ensure staff provide clear guidelines as to how this works. Otherwise it was a great experience to stay with you. Room was nice and comfy, elevators can do with a brush up

title.value: Proved to be a fantastic choice - stay here

content.value: I have just checked out after a 3 night stay. A wonderful hotel in a well connected location. c. 30/35 walk to the Sydney Opera House via the Royal Botanic Gardens and a 2 minute walk to the metro station which takes you to Bondi Junction in less than 10 minutes. I arrived after

title.value: Great Hotel, in a vibrant area.

content.value: This is a great place to stay, whilst enjoying everything Sydney has to offer. Close to shops, restaurants, pubs and public transport. Located on the fringe of Kings Cross, there is plenty to see and do, in a very colorful part of town. The hotel staff are fantastic and very

Wonderful hotel. Extremely clean. Staff exceptional. Great position to access railway, and enjoy all the sights of Sydney. Delicious places to eat close by. And room 1115 has fantastic views. Thank you for your hospitality.

You should visit Larmont Sydney Hotel each time you come in Sydney ! Me and my boyfriend stayed in the balcony suite with harbour view for few days and it was amazing! The king bed is super comfortable, you have a pillow list and you can order different kind of pillows if you

title.value: A great place for a short comfortable stay

content.value: My husband and I stayed here on a Saturday night and fully expected to hear at least some road/guest noise during our stay. Nope, nothing. The room was so quiet, we both slept extremely well. The curtains were very thick and we slept right in on Sunday morning. This was also

helped by the wonderfully comfortable king sized bed and fantastic pillows. The bed did take up almost all of the width of the room, requiring a short moment of contortionism to allow me to get to the opposite side past the TV unit jutting out a little from the wall, but it was easy and not really an issue. We absolutely loved the GIANT shower rose in the bathroom. So luxurious! The staff were friendly and informative and our stay was very nice. We enjoyed an aperitif in the downstairs sitting room (very comfortable, includes charging cubes for electronic devices, low tables and scatter cushions on comfy chairs) prior to walking to a restaurant (Firedoor-wonderful) nearby for our dinner. On walking back we were able to sit quietly and enjoy a nice glass of wine from the bar before retiring to our room. The lift is small but we didn't find any problem with accessing it. I would have like to have the option of the stairs, as we were only on the first floor, but couldn't find any stairwell. On checkout we were asked if we needed to store our luggage for the day - a great service for visitors from out of town. We were off for breakfast at the cafe next door, then on to the train station to make our way home, so didn't need it, but it's good to know they really go the extra mile to help travelers. The cafe next door was very busy and had extremely good coffee and food. Overall I highly recommend Veriu. The comfy quiet bed, the cleanliness, the location (a short walk from the city, many music venues such as the Wild Rover and the Soda Factory, the restaurants of Surry Hills and much public transport, being so close to Central Railway Station) the sitting area and of course the friendly staff all made our stay very pleasant.

The staff truly made our stay at this hotel a good one. The location is also excellent, so I cannot complain. The only downside is that our room was rather small with no storage space or waste bins. If they‚Äôre going to put you in such a small space, then they should look to IKEA
for inspiration. We felt cramped. Other than that, it was a great stay!

I absolutely love Veriu. It is well located near public transport as well as being central in Sydney. The hotel is well styled, clean and quirky with small but perfectly formed rooms with everything you need for a comfortable stay in Sydney. I travel a lot for work and have

stayed in most Sydney 3-5 star hotels and have to say this has such a homely feel, it was quiet, comfortable and staff are very friendly. Topped off with a 2 hour happy hour at the lobby bar 5-7pm with local beer just $5! And the most delicious Singapore restaurant located within the hotel it was a wonderful stay. Great value highly recommend.

Small room, but perfectly appointed and I didn't need anything more visiting a friend in Sydney for the weekend. If you are worried about the size of the room you aren't out enjoying Sydney enough. The staff were friendly and welcoming. Only take back would be that the bar were
charging full cocktail bar prices to pour a pre-mixed drink out of a bottle into a chilled glass, but if that's the worst thing that happened then I'm doing OK.

title.value: small and modern with great location
