content.value: I had a two night stay, and although the room was small, it was well set out and had a nice modern feel to it. The location is excellent, close to Central station and everywhere else. No noise in the room either, so sleeping in the big comfy bed was a dream.

property is located in the center of everything i.e train, foods and shopping. All these places are within walking distance. Staff are helpful and friendly and attentive. Taxi are easy to flag down just outside of the property.

Rooms ideal work enviroment for interstate business trips location to CBD is short taxi ride taxis in the location all the time food around the area is awesome close to Chinatown Pubs close by lots to choose from gym is excellent and pool is amazing

title.value: very friendly and supportive reception staff

content.value: First of all, the staff of reception are very very professional. They are considerate and helpful from checking -in to departing. They are certainly the treasure of this hotel. Something should be improved as their housing keeping service is a bit lousy. We stayed at the hotel
for a full week. We found that they were forgetful to add enough amenities, such as toilet paper, dish washing liquid etc. As a whole, this is a very good hotel for a family trip. Thanks a lot.

Ovolo, Wooloomooloo is perfect! Best hotel I've ever experienced. From the reception staff to the room and amenities, everything is better than expected. Quick bicycle ride to the Opera House. Highly recommend this place, great location!

Stayed here for three nights with hubby on our 1st visit to Sydney. We booked a 1BR apartment & it exceeded expectations - spacious, clean & highly functional. Particularly liked the balcony & the indoor pool. The kitchen has everything you need to prepare the meals, otherwise,

We enjoyed our stay at Fraser Suites Sydney. The room is big, comfortable and complete with amenities you would find in a well appointed apartment unit. It was close to shops and restaurants. Families or groups of friends will enjoy staying here as well.

The stuff there is the best. Check-in/Check-out is just so smooth and easy. The GYM and Sauna are great, Breakfast is really delicious. The facilities of the room are well-clean and maintain. It should be a great place to stay no matter any purpose.

Stayed here with work and loved it! Rooms were spacious and comfortable! Decor was hip! The little loot bag added a great touch ü§ó The bar downstairs was so cute! The only let down was the breakfast and food which could be improved. Would definitely stay there again!

This place was awesome. We stayed one night, just after check in they brought us complimentary cocktails and cake, they must have noticed it was my birthday from my drivers license. Apart from that, the mini bar items are all completely free! The views are amazing the rooms are

Room was truly excellent and reception staff extremely friendly, efficient and helpful. My request for a high floor and quiet room were fully delivered. Perfect. Only downside was in-room aircon control was not operating so room was hot and stuffy ! Also, Wifi connection was

The place is nice , the view was amazing . Night road works was annoying all night though and the lack of notice that parking was at an extra 45 dollar expense was a shock . Also only having 1 elevator to take guest up to the required floors was a bit painful

We stayed at this hotel for a couple of nights just for a weekend getaway with a deal. Although it is probably pricey, the location, service, hospitality and qualtity of the rooms provides some justification. Our room was lovely and the bed and pillows were super comfy. Minibar

If you was somewhere so comfy and beautiful to stay that it distracts you from the myriad of attractions Sydney has to offer then this is the place! I was torn as to whether to curl up with the paper, a coffee or G&T in one of the comfortable spots to sit downstairs or in my

title.value: Great location, lots of space, but cold

content.value: Oaks is in a great location within 20 mins walk of the CBD and right on the edge of Surry Hills and Chinatown so excellent for going to work if you're on a business trip, and going out in the evenings. The apartment is pretty basic in terms of d√©cor but has everything you need

The only got 1 lift working and going up from 13 and above. The bed actually was 2 single bed stick on together become 1 queen bed, when sleep in the middle, we felt uncomfortable, and overall was great.

Primus locates in the center of the city, really convenient to go everywhere. The bed is comfortable and I like the organic shower set. The service at the front desk was very friendly. Thanks to lovely Emily who helped us a lot and made our stay more enjoyable. Will come back
on the next trip.

title.value: Amazing gem in heart of Sydney CBD

content.value: Fabulous staff make every guest feel like royalty. Primus hotel is amazing management should be very proud of this peaceful haven with luxury finishes and cleanliness that is unsurpassed . Room service food quality and well priced amenities bespoke collection which is so good
they also have take home pack you can purchase

Great place to stay. Excellent rooms quiet comfortable excellent bath for soaking. great shower wonderful bed for an amazing sleep, light system is somewhat confusing. Great location with service to match, very good breakfast, lovely bar and the dining experience at the Wilmont
is amazing. Cant wait to go back.

This hotel is really classy and in a fantastic location in the heart of Sydney. The service at check-in and check-out was exceptionally friendly. Our niggles were minor, but in a hotel like this they were disappointing. The room had no tissues for a start. I thought I'd make a

hot chocolate one night, just to find there was no hot chocolate mix. So I resolved to have tea instead. I boiled the kettle and...there were NO CUPS!!!! There was also a very noisy heater vent in the room which was disturbing overnight, and the bed was hard and unforgiving. That said, the hotel was beautiful and we would return there for sure.

title.value: Fabulous location, immaculate presentation and great value hotel.

content.value: We enjoyed another return visit to the Primus this weekend. The location, cleanliness, friendly and professional staff make this our CBD hotel of choice year after year The breakfast is great and the service is excellent with every request being met.

The location is excellent for a Sydney visit. Buses and transport readily available. The rooms are clean and staff is most courteous. The bathroom was on the small side, although the shower was good. We would look forward to staying again.

I was lucky enough to stumble across this gem at short notice. The price was exceptional, almost too good to be true. We stayed with our 4 year old twins and the delux studio was adequate for us. We were on the top floor and had partial views to the ocean. The location is by far

the best on Coogee Beach. Not even a road to cross. For little legs having such easy access was fab. It meant a beach visit in the morning, followed by some lunch, maybe some tv back in the room and another beach session in the afternoon - all very easy. Our lunch pick is the Pavillon which is situated right next to the hotel. Great for kids, but always fully booked so be sure to get in early! We enjoyed our stay so much we have just booked for another 2 nights next week. Staff were all lovely and the parking a total bonus. Wouldn‚Äôt hesitate in recommending!!

What a surprisingly fantastic hotel. Staff were so friendly and helpful. Room extraordinarily large and very clean. Very surprised to see a microwave in the ocean view suite. Position great - overlooking beach.

A clean, efficient hotel worth considering for short stays in central Sydney that is ideal for business travellers or holidaymakers who don't spend much time in their room. Good internet access and TV service with a mini bar that provides some welcome sustainance and refreshment.

Coogee Sands Hotel & Apartments is on my recommended list. It's right on the beach. It's clean. The rooms are a great size. The staff are friendly. And it's close to restaurants and cafes. There are plenty of fantastic walks along the beaches and cliffs. Well worth staying here.

Great location, excellent pricing and free parking together with clean facilities and great staff. No better place to stay at Coogee whether going to the beach or going to an event in the city. Buses very frequent and efficient

Stayed here for 3 nights. Staff were friendly and helpful. Room was clean and modern. Location is fabulous - just a couple of blocks from the Harbour. I‚Äôm very happy to have been welcomed here and would definitely stay here again next time I‚Äôm in Sydney

Excellent service and comfortable room. Even though I was early they let me check in hours before which I was very appreciative. Breakfast was good too. Check out was effortless too. Location was also great.

Ideal accommodation, easy to find your way around Sydney from here. The Staff are very accommodating and helpful. Close to the Quay & within walking distance to Darling Harbour & train station. The rooms are compact but clean and everything you need for a good nights sleep

Clean and tidy hotel, well situated in the centre of Sydney CBD. The hotel itself is fairly basic (ie no gym, spa facilities) but has everything you need. You can access the local gym for an additional cost. The free mini bar is a nice touch. Had dinner and breakfast at the
hotel- food was ok, would have been nice to have more options for breakfast (only did buffet breakfast for $25).

The room had everything I needed. The single room is quite small, but it was clean and well fitted out. It was super easy to catch the train to the International Airport and shops/places to eat nearby. I would stay again.

Nice new hotel, clean and affordable and very close to Green Square railway station. Double glazed doors to keep the noise outside and the quietness inside. Defiantly would stay again the next time I visit Sydney.

Hotel is very close to train station. Compact and clean room with all the facilities you need for a short stay. Free morning snack and coffee a plus on the cold mornings. Easy travel to CBD either by train or bus.

Good value for the money! Location near Green Square Station very convenient for both City and Airport. I like the Nespresso coffee machine and the supply of decaf 24 Hours! Quiet although on main road. Friendly receptionists.

The front desk is helpful and friendly. The hotel is close to Green Square Station and is only 2 stations from the domestic airport, 3 stations from the international airport and 4 stations to Circular Quay station where the Sydney Opera House and ferry pier are situated.

Very convenient to everything! There is a factory outlet of a certain sport brand nearby. However, restaurants and supermarkets cannot be found nearby. The room is spacious and comfortable. The temperature in the room is good although no heater is found. The most surprising is that a variety of coffee and tea is provided for free all day in the lounge and bakery is also provided for free in the morning! The food and drinks are delicious and the lounge is relaxing. Recommend for sure!

My husband and I recently stayed here for an anniversary. Even though the room had been booked some months earlier the process of parking, reception and room allocation (according to our preferred view) were seamless and marked by staff warmth. The room was well equipped with

the best kitchenette we have encountered in a small hotel room. The cleaning and presentation of the room was excellent and the view out over Elizabeth Bay was superb. A great small hotel central to public transport and within walking distance of the CBD. Highly recommended.

We booked the hotel with a view of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House and it did not disappoint. The room itself was lovely and quite enjoyable while we were there with good wifi access and speeds. We loved the neighborhood it was in as well. Not necessarily a downside, but

it is a bit detached from downtown, with a maybe 20-30 minute walk to Circular Quay and a 5-10 walk to nearest train station to head that way. Good base for exploring Sydney and views are amazing. They were also more than happy to keep our luggage since we got in super early in the morning and weren't leaving until later on the day we left Sydney.

Ultraclean and well-organized rooms with wonderful view of Sydney. We loved the beautiful location in a lively restaurant area, and within walking distance of downtown Sydney. We stayed 6 nights, and all of the staff were friendly and extremely helpful with their
recommendations of restaurants and transportation tips. When we return to Sydney, we will stay here!

It‚Äôs a little further out that I would have liked to have stayed, in terms of public transport. But much prefer this area to central or the bit between. Sort of kings cross area. Bus stop just around the corner and train station just down the road. Nice walk round the back and

out to darling harbour eventually. Clean, tidy, welcoming and handy. Complimentary paper Friday morning and they can arrange the airport shuttle for you $16. One gripe - booked with a harbour view. Which I got but not what it suggested in the pictures when I booked. Still very very pretty

could not fault . location perfect. close to everything..there are los of places to eat staff very helpful .next ill ask for harbour view room.there are lots of places to eat near by and others just a short walk. shops and a bws across the road

I love staying at this hotel. Staff are very attentive and the rooms spacious and quiet, even by the elevator lobby. The eastern harbour view room is definitely one of the best views in the city. Downside is the bathroom was a little dated. It‚Äôs still a bathtub with a shower

curtain. The ‚ÄúClub‚Äù is also superb. Far superior than any of the North American ones I‚Äôve been in. Well worth the extra $$ to gain access just for its 31st floor with it‚Äôs virtually unobstructed sweeping view of the harbour. This is unbeatable in the city (much better than the Shangrila)

title.value: Great location, but poor front desk service

content.value: The pros: great location walking distance from the train station. Also, walking distance from the Opera House. The view from the executive lounge and harbor facing rooms is phenomenal. The service in the executive lounge is great. The cons: we had a poor front desk

experience. We had booked a room with executive lounge privileges for our 25th wedding anniversary, but we were initially given at the front desk a non- executive lounge room with two twin beds!! My wife spent over half an hour talking to 3 different employees(after a long trip) about what we booked, but they didn't want to budge. They finally seemed to begrudgingly concede that we did in fact book the executive lounge with our room, only because my wife was able to produce on her computer saved e-mails from 8 months prior. It was a rough start to our wedding anniversary celebration, and even after we were eventually given a proper room(due to a lot of work by my wife), we felt unwelcome. Whenever we left the hotel, we avoided going by the front desk area. Further, even though we told them it was our silver wedding anniversary, they did nothing special for us, even though they gave us such a rough time at the start of our stay. The hotel has potential, but we cannot give it a good grade based on our experience.

Terrible. Just terrible. Dated decorations, poor acoustics in the rooms (we could hear everything from both adjacent rooms), linen not clean. I have stayed in many rooms in Sydney for cheaper as well as much nicer. Simply not worth it. Go elsewhere

Have stayed here twice and loved the location, it‚Äôs so central to trains taxis shopping restaurants parks theatre etc. Staff are very friendly. My only comment would be the rooms are all mood lighting and can sometimes feel like you need to open the curtains to give more light.

Not entirely happy with our stay at the InterContinental, would definitely not return. GUEST ROOMS: Rooms are tired and in desperate need of renovation. I can always look past dated decor and furnishings, however, this was well and truly above and beyond that. - Wallpaper in

our room was peeling off - Lights would flicker and make buzzing noise - Taps leaked - Toilet had the old fashioned flush button that only worked sporadically - Room was stuffy and dusty - We had a room with 2 double beds. Be aware that these beds are not a standard size double, they were somewhere between a single and double. Two adults could definitely not share comfortably. I ended up sharing with my 8 year old daughter (and we are both slim people) and felt like I was sharing a single. - Mattress not great, sagged in sections ‚Äì this was evident on both beds in our room - Room was not serviced until 4pm on our second day, not great to come back from a day out and have to vacate as service staff had just arrived - Pillows terrible (not uncommon) however, no other pillows were available during our stay even though hotel had an extensive pillow menu - Other minor things that normally wouldn‚Äôt bother me, but would be nice to know beforehand: Small old TV in awkward position, shower was over the bath FACILITIES: - Female change rooms near pool/gym were small, dated, dirty and in poor condition, the showers leaked, dirty towels thrown everywhere, floor was soaking wet everywhere - didn't look like anyone had been in there to mop it in a while. - Indoor pool was fine, kids enjoyed it. Only issue is not enough seating. - Buffet breakfast was good, selection adequate and food cooked well. I did enjoy the fresh eggs to your liking as well as omelette. You can order pancakes/waffles at the table, these are not in the buffet. LOCATION: Great location, less than 5 minute stroll to Circular Quay. Around 10 minute walk to Pitt Street Mall. Taxis easy to get. SERVICE: Service and staff were good, especially check-in staff and valet/porters. The only exception is our room not serviced until 4pm on Sunday - this was not acceptable. OVERALL: I was disappointed with our stay and would give InterContinental a miss next time. I have stayed at the following in Sydney CBD and would rank them all higher than the InterContinental: - QT - Four Seasons - Westin - Sofitel - Radisson Blu - Ovolo at Wolloomoolo wharf

The Intercontinental Hotel is located close to the railway station and harbour. The staff are friendly and helpful. I had a junior suite overlooking the harbour which had everything you need to relax and also get some work done. The Club Lounge is probably one of the best in the
world with panoramic views of the harbour and Sydney.

With a busy life, full of family, work, exercise and adventure, it was a perfect time to take a night out with some beautiful girlfriends with equally busy lives. The QT Sydney was welcoming, funky, central, luxurious and sooo comfortable. QT have done a great job of

Simply outstanding, an impromptu layover, great rate, amazing room 318 where the room was spotless, fantastic bed with best pillows in town. The cafe at the entrance was next level both in the evening for a red and some excellent pasta and in the morning with a great barista and

Stopped in overnight after a flight was cancelled out of Sydney. Usually love this place - but shame about the room service! Terrific and funky room as always, bar was abuzz on a Friday night (so much that it was so noisy I had to leave!). But the room service menu (for those

title.value: Sad to see level of service has significantly dropped

content.value: I stayed here in 2016 and loved it (see my review below). My main point then was that - although too cool for school - the service was also great. Something that is unfortunately quite rare in hotels that play mainly to the ‚Äûcool crowd‚Äú. I am currently staying here again and

title.value: Good renovated hotel but still feels OLD

content.value: Staying here in room 1721, Deluxe balcony suite, ard. 1300sqft Suite. Big YES, feel Empty.. YES. Renovated YES, feeling outdated.. VERY They did renovated their room indeed, but idk who is the stylist / interior design that if u compare with hotel in asia, even Four Points is

Enjoyed your hotel, rooms very nice. Your lounge was very nice, would be nice if it would stay open another hour or so. For the most part the servers there were friendly but definately cator to the male clientele vice us women.

I've stayed here a number of times and every time it impresses me. The rooms are spacious but the view over the park is the best part! The executive lounge is also great if you have access. There are a few small outdoor tables that look over the park.

Was a amazing place the staff the best staff any hotel could have on top of a picture perfect view and room!! we stayed for our anniversary and we got treated like royalty we will defiantly be staying again

title.value: Way too expensive as a hotel and food and drinks prices are the highest I've seen in a hotel

content.value: The hotel is nice overall. But at reception waited a long time for checkin. Bonvoy express line is totally ignored by the attendants. By biggest disappointment was the price of food and drinks. The most expensive I've ever seen in a hotel. 32 dollars for a sandwich. A bootle of

Was in the area for work and didn't want to stay at Central station, so gave the Ultimo a go. It was a great hotel - very affordable, CLEAN, friendly, and in a great location. I only booked a king single room (smallest on offer), so it didn't have a desk, which would have been
helpful. Not a criticism - just a reflection on my part for next time. Thanks for a great stay!

Lovely room, super helpful and friendly staff- nothing was too much trouble. Close to everything, and very reasonable rates. Coffee was great, and service was faultless. Wish I could have stayed longer!

As far as we were concerned everything was just fine for our stay.I think the best way to travel is to have no preconceptions about what you will get so when something nice happens its unexpected.In this case we got what we thought we would.

I have stayed at The Ultimo a couple of times now - it's well priced and a great location but a few things let them down. The basic rooms are really nice with the exposed brick, but this time I was 'upgraded' to the Courtyard rooms, which in comparison are incredibly sterile and

bland. You also have to drag your suitcase up a large flight of stairs. They look out onto a rooftop, but I had a lot of trouble getting the courtyard door open, and in the middle of winter a rooftop terrace is not entirely enticing. It is also pretty bleak - just some fake lawn and the back of a bunch of airconditioners. Really not worth the 'upgrade'. Also, I was charged for the bottled water in the room - I searched the entire room looking to see if there was a charge for the water, but failed to find anything so I assumed that they were complimentary. I travel a lot for work, and it is very standard to advise on the price of any consumables in the room (if there is a cost). If it's for sale, there really needs to be a price to let people know! All in all, probably won't stay here again or advise my colleagues to stay here (as I did on this trip to my regret!).

On the bright side.... Well located, lovely decor, great bathroom. Our little family had a nicely appointed family room (big bed and two singles in one room). We were a little disappointed to be ‚Äúupgraded‚Äù from a trio room as we were hoping for our five year old to have an

alcove away from us (she‚Äôs a light sleeper and we like to have lights on/go to bed later than her!). As it turned out, we were all so exhausted from sightseeing that we would have slept through an earthquake and the family room worked out OK. Beds comfy. Linen nice. Laundry facilities good and inexpensive. Toiletries provided were nice. We got free tea/coffee/hot chocolate during our stay - I think we booked direct and that was one of the rewards..... you may find an offer for free brekkie! The stay was good value. Short walk to Darling Harbour - don‚Äôt miss the Chinese Garden, it‚Äôs lovely. On the downside..... A large group of teachers and young students were booked into rooms around us and the teachers shouting up and down the corridor woke us up rather early. Note, the students were wonderful. Twice the teachers knocked on our door to wake us up to get ready to go!!!! This was not the hotel‚Äôs fault but perhaps we should have been given an option to move rooms to allow them to be together? The location is rather bustling - which means you shouldn‚Äôt expect silence at night. Possibly not the best hotel if you are a light sleeper. Front desk staff could do with looking up and smiling when you go in and out - it‚Äôs the small things that sometimes make the experience!! WiFi VERY frustrating - kept logging us off and had to rejoin whenever we wanted to use the internet. We would stay again - but ask for the quietest room available!

Location was great, very close to walk to town and right next to the main train station. Nearby supermarket is useful. Rooms are large, clean and tidy and the bathroom was nice. Staff are nice and breakfast was alright.

Stayed in a family room.. great space ...comfy beds... great breakfast..car park on site $44..easy walk to central station... staff very friendly..very quite location...this is our go to hotel when in Sydney

Me and husband like a good dog walk in the wilderness and they how better to relax than swing a few clubs followed by a cold one on the 19th. Well presented like a chiseled Greek god yet nimble like a tree frog. Beds are well sprung so you can have a good jump. Staff drift

title.value: Amazing location. Lovely staff. Great rooms

content.value: Location was perfect, lots around in the area food and bars. Bed was very comfortable and staff friendly. The bar next door was great! Happy hour, try the Sydney Cider. Buffet breakfast at the hotel is recommended. A large range of options and all very tasty. Only in town for a

Rooms were clean & tidy. Customer service at front were always nice, however breakfast‚Äôs service was not. Coffee was terrible, tasted like hot dirty water, so we ordered a coffee instead. 2x skinny flat whites. They both had that much froth on the top, could‚Äôve passed as a extra

Love the design of the hotel. They renovated old shop become artistic hotel. Thats why the room is quiet small, but all has great function. I read before they serve free coffee and pastry for bfast, but no more when we visit. My suggestion, better the hotel to raise the price

Visited recently and although we have stayed here before this stay was disappointing. The hotel is an atrium design so any noise in foyer and bar areas drifts up to the rooms. Our second night was extremely noisy with a large group of people in the bar area. I had to call

My room was tiny but the bed was huge and super comfortable. Netflix on the TV a nice bathroom and a bar downstairs. The best Thai restaurant in Sydney (spice I am) is across the road plus there‚Äôs Uber eats etc. there was roadworks right outside the last night I stayed which was

very thin window which can not prevent room from noise carpet smells, clatter sound comes from refrigerator very old building, but fancy interior nice to spend time in lobby not room. $75 per day is reseonable for single room. not more than that. too small

Great service form Iolenda when we arrived in the early morning. She was kind, considerate, prompt and amiable to make every effort to find a room that is ready in the morning to accommodate our family and allocate the other room to be ready later. This worked for us perfectly.

We strayed for 5 nights and found the accommodation excellent. We paid extra for a room with a view, and what a view it was. Out one window was the harbour bridge and the other was the opera house. Spectacular! The room was a good size. Buffet breakfast included. We were a 2

Overall nice rooms, clean and fresh. Staff was good and the location is good and central. Main issue was that there was too much traffic noise overnight. Windows should be made soundproof. Was very difficult to get a good night sleep due to the constant disturbances due to

I would stay again the staff were friendly and able to help with information or any items needed. I left my boots in the room when I remembered I was on a train I rang and a family member is to pick them up. It was an easy task to organise. Thank you ever so much

title.value: Good Stay with a good view on the rooftop

content.value: I booked 5 nights with this YHA in the 4 dorm bed ensuite. The room was clean and spacious enough for 4 people. The facilities are well-equipped, including the common room and the view from the rooftop. The YHA offers many free social gathering and events everyday. However

sometimes it can be crowded as students are also living here. Also, the location is on the hill so it is a bit difficult to get there if you have a big luggage. Taking a taxi to there and train station (circular quay) is around 8 -10AUD. I got list at first but try to look for Shiangarila Hotel

Staying here a week and have found the location to be excellent. We are on the 6th floor and can see the Opera House and harbour from our window....if a ship is docked at the Overseas Terminal then the view is obscured . Watched a cruise ship leaving Circular Quay from the

Located in "The Rocks" and has an amazing view from the roof top terrace of the Sydney Opera House and Bridge. Lots of restaurants, and shops within a short walk in this historic district, and close to Circular Quay. Friendly staff, and the room was nice. Guest laundry room was

I stayed in a 6 bedded mixed room. The room was clean and the locker was big enough to fit my suitcase - just remember to bring your own lock! The rooms were as expected for a hostel and the bathrooms were clean. The rooftop area is amazing for socialising or to simply take
time to chill. There‚Äôs also a communal kitchen available for use. The staff were lovely and the pub crawl was a great way to meet other solo travellers! I would definitely recommend this hostel!

title.value: A week at this unique, hospitable and lively hostel

content.value: Really a wonderful spot to stay in Sydney! We were lucky to stay here during "Vivid Sydney" a spectacular light show every night at Harbour Bridge, the Opera House and the Central Business District. Rooms are spacious and clean, good warm shower, facilities to make your own

tea/coffee. The kitchen area is very clean, with 4 isles to cook your own meal, a lot of place to store your own food, and to use the fridges too. nice big room to have your meal, to watch a movie or to chat with other guests. The place is a bit chilly because it is built around an excellent excavation site from the first settlers in the Penal Colony Australia. Staff is very friendly indeed, 24hours available and very hospitable!!

title.value: Review about Radison-Blu Sydney O'Connell St

content.value: This hotel doesn't worth the money, please look for some alternatives. Unfortunately their service doens't match our expectations. Basic bathroom amenities not provided, to be specific tooth brush and dental paste are not provided.

I've stayed here a number of times. To me the YHA captures the essence of Sydney. Good clean comfortable accommodation. On the site of the Big Dig uncovering 1800s Sydney life of the poor. Good pubs nearby. Shop next door...but expensive. Great location. It's a pleasure to
stay here.

title.value: Great view, clean hostel in the heart of Sydney

content.value: Stayed at the YHA four years ago with mixed results, but with more miles and hostel experiences under my belt, I decided to stay again. And my second experience here was overall really nice. Hostel is in a great location of The Rocks and the view from the roof of the harbour

is lovely at day or night. It's about a 10 minute walk from Circular Quay, which is a stop off the airport line. I was in a 4-bed dorm which was great size and enough space for four people comfortably (and with luggage). Having the bathroom attached was also a nice treat. Kitchen at the hostel is big and enough space, but I was here in fall/winter when it was quieter so could be busier in summer or holiday time. Kitchen is well equipped too, although none of the pans were heat resistant on the handles so you had to use multiple towels to handle hot cooking equipment. Laundry is on-site and powder is available for sale too. Breakfast and coffee is available too for purchase although I did not end up buying. Closest full grocery store is about 25 minutes walk away, smaller metro market is about 10-15. Hostel hosts a lot of activities too and was very welcoming for people to join, other than that, it's not a very social place, people mostly kept to themselves. My only real complaint from my stay was Wifi. It kicks you off regularly and was very inconsistent in working in the main common areas. Would recommend this place and stay again.

Location service bed and ambiance all excellent. But the tv took a little bit of time to load up. I really enjoyed the downstairs bar selection of wines were wonderful, I would recommend it for business or pleasure.

title.value: Really great stay, great breakfast, great staff and service

content.value: Really great stay with great Service. Free water each day (kept in minibar) nice gym and lap pool. Breakfast was great with lots of options and decent coffee. Would stay again for sure, very close to opera house and bottom of town but quite far from markets, darling harbour and

Awful experience here. They charged my card $295 without my authorisation or consent. Been waiting 7 days and they still haven‚Äôt given me my money back. They ignore emails, refused to explain how or why it happened, don‚Äôt follow up with my bank to resolve the issue, lied about

Very nice room All amenities were available. Tv was difficult to operate Business lounge was excellent Breakfast was very good service and efficient The hotel is in a great location in the heart of the city near the restaurants and shops . The bar was an awesome place with

Had dinner at the hotel restaurant. Food was average but the service was extremely disappointing and amongst the worst we have ever encountered in a hotel restaurant. Drinks were very slow in coming, bread rolls were brought to the table but short two. had to remind them twice

Recently stayed here again for 3 nights. The hotel is great - great location, great accommodation & food and great customer service. I stay here whenever I come to Sydney and am never disappointed, always feel welcomed and safe. Definitely will be back.

Lovely overnight stay in this 5 star hotel - very comfy bed and lovely balcony suite to enjoy beautiful sunset View was lovely however no Harbour views Dine in menu was good albeit a bit on the pricey side Biggest shower I‚Äôve ever seen in a hotel

Having high tea before in sydney was really looking foward to the indulgence again on a girls trip away. I found the initial entry into rhe hotel drab and boring almost business office look. We sat down and requested a cocktail which was part of the advertised voucher only to

My wife booked us in for one night for our 27th Wedding anniversary. They acknowledged our anniversary with a room upgraded to a premier corner room with better views of the city and had a bottle of complimentary Champagne waiting for us. All the staff we came in contact with

title.value: Basic but for the price very good

content.value: Staying with family. The room was ok but bathroom was really small. Everything you need though. Would be great to have bigger sink. Beds are comfortable and room is cleaned daily. We miss the safe but can easily be used the one at the reception. Staff always with the smile and
happy to help. It's easy 15min walk to Central station or 20min to city center. Overall was good.

title.value: Cozy , vintage style Hotel In Heart of Sydney

content.value: Close to bus stops, major metro and train station (sydney central). Amazingly helpful staff. Large number and variety of eateries nearby on Broadway. Also close to the UTS and UniSyd. Overall a great experience and strong recommend.

title.value: Value for money and super friendly staff

content.value: I stayed overnight on a work trip to Sydney. The highlight of my visit was the incredibly friendly staff who could not have been more helpful. Thanks! The hotel is around the corner from UTS and provides convenient access to many popular inner Sydney locations. Breakfast was
great. I am happy to recommend this venue as a value for money venue and I am sure I will be a guest in the not too distant future.

Just for a one night stay at the start of our Australia trip this worked out fine. Modernized room in an old building, good bed and bathroom, friendly staff. Booking via the internet was no problem at all. Recommended.

This is a small but nice hotel offering great value. The "shoe box" rooms are very small, and I ended up spending AU$20 per day for a larger room, but it still ended up being a nice value. This place is close to the Sydney School of Entrepreneurship and University of

Technology for those interested. There is a Chinese restaurant literally within 200 feet. The Central Railway Station is within walking distance. The wireless Internet Connection was reliable. One minor potential issue is that you must insert you hotel room key tag to get electric power, so you may not be able to charge devices while you are out.

Ive stayed at Ovolo during a recent business trip . Great and impressive location-pricey though .. but this would be ok if all services offered would be reality.. they‚Äôre not ! It was freezing cold in the building and little was done to make the guests stay for breakfast/ lunch

This was by far one of the best hotels we have stayed in. Everything from the friendly staff, cleanliness, room and bed was very comfortable, breakfast was delicious and all the added perks free minibar daily and happy hour drinks. Will definitely be staying here again. Location

I love this hotel. The staff are so helpful, our suite was funky and comfortable and the complimentary mini bar and happy hour was a pleasant surprise. The complimentary self serve laundry was so handy for our multiple night stay too. Nice walk up to the NSW Art Gallery so

location, staff, room, all the extras are fabulous. It is an exciting and vibrant place to stay and the only place I will continue to visit in Sydney. Once you navigate the maps it is only a 10 minute walk to the city, Kings Cross, and the beautiful view of the Harbour Extra.

Was at Ovolo Woolloomooloo while attending a conference in Sydney. First of all, it had a fantastic location on the water. In fact, from what I understand, the hotel is built from the longest pier finger in the world. From the moment I stepped in, it was smiles all around from

Very friendly service. We arrived early and were looked after very well. The deluxe two bedroom apartment was very nice. We could of done with a few more cooking utensils as we were there for eight days and with two teenage kids eating out was an expensive hobby, so we shopped
and cooked our own food. But all in all the stay was very good.

title.value: Luxory and Location - An Outstanding Value

content.value: I had a two-night stay at Mantra 2 Bond Street last week. The facilities and room were immaculate, comfortable and well-finished. The room had a small kitchen as well as an in-suite washer and dryer. The downstairs restaurant was quite good and fairly priced. I should also
mention that it was in easy walking distance to the Circular Quay and Rocks, with all of the attractions. I would definitely stay here again.

I had no idea a city visit could be so relaxing. I recently stayed at 2 Bond St and wished I could have stayed longer. The very spacious and well appointed apartments are a delight to return to after a business meeting or a stroll to nearby attractions. Having your own kitchen

whilst travelling is so refreshing ....great for either a full meal or whipping up a snack whilst watching a movie. My apartment had a balcony which was Lively for catching the afternoon sun in Winter. The service is friendly and efficient and there is a rooftop pool and gym. The location is excellent -short walk to the harbour and the historic Rocks area and also a pleasant walk to Darling Harbour. Nearby there is a supermarket and lots of eateries. A great city Haven!

Booked a Studio room for one night as my wifes 75th birthday. When we checked in the lovely receptionist Holly enquired about any special occasion? told her about the special birthday and that we were meeting family for lunch at a nearby French restaurant. On returning, found

our room had been upgraded and a bottle of bubbly and mini cupcakes along with a birthday card had been left in our room. Staff all round were so helpful, so friendly and our upgraded room was really excellent. Bistro and bar also very good with an ample variety of choices for the buffet breakfast, Cap parking VG, but pricey, though on a par with other city hotels. Will be back!

title.value: Beware their ‚ÄúPolicy‚Äù which wont issue any credit against booking errors

content.value: When Booking online the first thing you do is select your dates, but somehow mine got screwed up . And then i get an email from qantas tod@y indicating i did not book in last night today, despite my trip to sydney being next week?? I Rang the hotel who Confirmed that my

booking was for last night despite my trip being next week.?? And then they advise me their policy is no credit against future booking , so apparently very happy to take your money , despite no service being provided and of course , they were ‚Äúfully booked ‚Äú last night, yet pretty easy for me to get a room at 7 pm sydney time when i made the booking My fault,,,,,, maybe ,,,?? But How would you know Enjoy your time there people , check your bookings , but i Wont be using Mantra ever again

I felt very calm and slept so well right before the City2Surf. The bed was super comfy. The bathroom toiletries lovely. The coffee was great. It was so close to the car park down the road, and walking distance to the start of the city2surf.

Had a great bed in a great room. A little noise from I guess the heating but then again we live in the country where it can be really quiet so...... Very friendly staff. Excellent location, 10 minutes into Darling Harbour. Everything in the fridge was part of the satay so no
silly bills for the bottles of wine, beers. Welcome pack on the table and music on as you walk in. Nice.

Was a very pleasant stay with friendly staff and a clean and comfortable room in the upper floor. Good view over the city. Bathroom was big and the products where of high qualities. All in all I would clearly recommend the Hotel.

title.value: Great place to stay for business

content.value: Central location and great use of limited space in rooms, which are nicely presented and well maintained. Access to free in house movies and minibar. Courteous, helpful staff. Highly recommend if you need a comfortable, well designed place to sleep. Limited natural light so

me and my wife Tatiana spent 2 nights at the hotel in early August 2019 - was a gorgeous experience to us. ideal location - 5 minute walk from the harbor, 10 minute walk from the ferry station. super friendly and helpful staff - the guys even shared with us a couple of Opal

cards! rooms are nice, comfy and clean - and there's a free in-room minibar to make use of. breakfast downstairs is ok, could offer a wider variety of things, in my view, - but hey, in Sydney you can find a million places to have a nice breakfast at. otherwise, a perfect choice for us, deservedly one of the top-ranked hotels in the city.

I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights, I wish I could have stayed longer. I felt like a special guest. The staff were amazingly friendly and helpful, nothing was too much trouble. What i noticed most was that the staff were enjoying their work, so I felt very relaxed and happy to

be here. Freebies were amazing, and refreshed daily. Breakfast was delicious. Double glazed widows made for a quiet sleep. So many special extras, umbrella incase needed, iPad, T2 tea, lollies. Small things were noted, like having coat hangers that actually could be taken off the rack. Will definitely look it staying with this chain in other cities too. Thank you.

This was my third stay at The Tank Stream - comfy room, complimentary drinks and snacks, quiet rooms and friendly staff. Fantastic location - 5 min walk to Circular Quay or 10 mins to Opera House or The Rocks.

This hotel is clean and has a pleasant area to have breakfast. The hotel is well located for access to either Circular Quay ferries and trains, or a short walk to the George Street entrance to Wynyard Station. There is a ramp up to the reception area entrance. The rooms are not

I always stay at Coogee Sands when I stay in Sydney. It‚Äôs a brilliant location and wonderful staff all at a reasonable price. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Close to buses and the beach with great spots to eat all around you. 5 stars!!!

title.value: Excellent Customer Service and Superb Location

content.value: Had my stay from 7th Aug to 14th Aug 2019. Its my very 1st time in Sydney and the experience was superb. You can imagine having a bag full of guilt chips and snack sent to you daily and free mini bar where you can have 2 beers in your room after a long day of walk sight

seeing. It was mind-blowing to be told everything was almost free as you don't get this kind of service in other countries in general. The staffs were excellent in helping me figure out how i should plan my trip and constantly asking me if they could help in anything which made me feel i was in a house stay rather than a "Hotel Stay". Would like to commend 2 staff which are Dorthy and Vickki (not sure if i got the names right) They went the extra mile to ensure my wife and I were well taken care of. Appreciate and thankful for their professional / superb customer service. Ovolo Group, you have excellent staffs. Location wise is really fantastic. It was close to Sydney fish market where i had my sashimi daily and it was close to the harbor where you practically can take a ferry to any part of Sydney. In summary, Ovolo is by far the best hotel i have stay for my own trip and will be sure to check this hotel group out when i go anywhere in the world next time.

title.value: Great boutique hotel, with super friendly staff

content.value: We went up to Sydney for the boat show and the Ovolo was ideally located a stones throw from Darling Harbour. Its a boutique hotel, so the foyer and rooms have a quirky character, as opposed to the bland major chain hotels. The front desk staff were brilliant, friendly and

knowledgeable. A room change ... No problem, Advice on great coffee nearby.... spot on. Drinks in the lounge come foyer, very chilled. The most fun was the Alexa device in the room... a lot of laughter trying to get her to tune into the ABC on Sunday morning program. Great nights sleep on a warm and comfortable bed at a fair price for the location.

This location is so convenient and the staff are great. Will be my new go to in Sydney. The restaurant next door has amazing pizza and steak. There is also a fantastic fish and chip shop just a few doors down and a convenience store too.

Awesome location, awesome view. Lots of cafes and shops nearby, 12 mins drive to bondi beach, 30 mins drive from airport. Parking is alright, kinda tight and limited but was never full. Love the beach..

We selected the Coogee Sands Hotel as it was close to the beach and also close to the airport for our early morning flight. It also had the bonus of free parking on site. Rooms were nice, clean and comfortable and the kitchen facilities were great. So handy to everything.

Great location and reasonably priced. Very friendly helpful staff. Having parking included in the price stated means no surprise add ons. Although the room is small it is comfortable and adequate for a short one or two night stay for a couple. The bathroom had an unpleasant

We had an unforgettable girls weekend at QT for friend‚Äôs birthday! The hotel is just so funky and chic and the staff were going out of their way to make us feel very special. The rooms were luxurious but also fun, and from now on, I will always expect a coffee martini set in

QT hotel is a fantastic discovery An incredible universe! An atmosphere both elegant and relaxed Absolute cleanliness and comfort in rooms and bathrooms A different decoration from that found in other luxury hotels. A style and an universe that belongs only to QT hotel The

title.value: Probably the best hotel in Sydney

content.value: My wife and I had a fantastic stay at the QT in Sydney. The staff could not have been friendlier or more helpful. It was our last trip away before we had our first child and was the perfect place to spend the weekend. Many thanks to all the staff at the QT. We will definitely be

title.value: Awesome night stay not long enough!

content.value: We had such an amazing stay at The Primus, the staff facilities and restaurant were above our expectations and the dinner was just unbelievably delicious! We can‚Äôt wait to come and stay again for a longer visit

I really enjoyed QT. Loved the unique room style and the cool decore. Bathroom was absolutely fantastic and excellent location. You can sometimes hear buskers playing on the street outside but overall an excellent place to stay.

This brilliant hotel is created within the old Gowings building in Sydney and what an eccentric build it is - a maze of stairs, bars, levels, and hallways... My room was the Corner Suite looking over George St and stunning it was - giant space with everything you would

From a great location, to great facilities, to great staff I was very satisfied with my stay at the Primus Hotel. The lounge was also a great place to unwind and catch up with colleagues. I will definitely stay here again in the future.

title.value: Excellent hotel, great location, amazing history

content.value: This hotel is in a fantastic location, a quick walk to Pitt St mall. The rooms are very well appointed with excellent amenities and a really comfortable bed. Great bar in the lobby and wonderful breakfast at the Wilmot. The history of the building has been respected and very

title.value: Home away from home in top central location

content.value: Whenever in Sydney I am staying in the Sheraton Grand Sydney Hyde Park hotel. Everything from very friendly and efficient check-in, excellent service of the staff, thorough housekeeping and an excellent lounge offering a wide range of food and beverages paired with high class

We had a fantastic time at the Primus hotel. The staff were attentive and amazing. The hotel itself is stunning and a beautiful piece of architecture with gorgeous finishing's. We will be recommending this hotel to friends and family

title.value: Fabulous experience at Primus Hotel Sydney

content.value: I highly recommend this very comfortable, state of the art refurbished Art Deco Hotel with great bar and breakfast area. The service was highly professional, the room was very comfortable and the location very central to a number of city establishments I wished to visit. The

Spent 2 nights as a family while running the City2Surf. Service throughout our stay was friendly and efficient. The roll away bed was delivered complete with an extra dressing gown, towels and toiletries and set up with a bit of a flourish. The drinks service in the club lounge

This was my first stay at the Sheraton - as I was in Sydney for the City 2 Surf. I stayed in the City side King Room and considering this was the "entry level room" it was outstanding! The bed is a dream to sleep on and the room size, contents and bathroom were excellent

title.value: Great place, great value, great location

content.value: Very nice stay, every time we have stayed. It‚Äôs just great. Two stops from the airport, one stop from central station. Great value, very clean, great service! I would recommend this place. The front desk guys are very helpful.

The rooms were immaculate, the reception extremely helpful, the views of Hyde park absolutely amazing and might I just say that the buffet breakfast was absolutely without a shadow of a doubt, the best meal I have ever had.

Very good breakfast choice and good quality. Concierge team took care of bags straight from the airport transport. Refreshments during the meeting very good. Room very comfortable and quiet. Nice views at breakfast looking out on Hyde Park, Sydney.

title.value: Fifteen steps from Green Square station

content.value: Only steps from Green Square station that is 2 stations from International and one from Domestic airports and Central station. Nespresso coffee machine provides 24/7 hot drinks on demand is worth paying to stay there.

Great location for Transport by train to Airport and walking distance to shopping. Amenities in room were great. Just need a tea towel to dry our dishes. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Light breakfast and endless coffee available in comminal lounge area

Nice clean hotel, great location, nice touch with the grab and go breakfast. Good size rooms with perfect location. I would recommend this hotel to travellers as it's perfect location to the domestic and international airports.

title.value: Excellent stay close to Sydney CBD

content.value: Clean Modern quiet rooms very close to Green Square Station as I needed to catch early morning train to Goulburn yet previous evening was close enough to catch train to Sydney CBD for a walk I would definitely stay again

Harbour view king room on 24th floor was excellent - free standing bath and fab views. Would definitely book this room again for a special occasion. Plenty of towels and quality bathroom supplies. Great mirror for doing makeup and hair!

We were married on Thursday and arrived here for 3 days. From day 1, we felt like royalty. The Senior Butler Elmo and the Champagne Bar Manager Evan Brown were second to none. We had the time of our lives and were spoiled rotten. We can‚Äôt thank the Sofitel enough for their

hospitality and have decided to never stay anywhere else. Evan and Elmo made our stay so special. They provided the highest service and made us feel like VIPs. Here are the important things to know: - the toiletries are excellent - the food is fantastic - the service is great - the view is amazing - the bath is big enough for a ‚Äòproper‚Äô bath - housekeeping is impeccable I would never consider staying anywhere else!

Amir greeted me at the front desk and was so kind and helpful in answering all of my questions. He made sure to get my room ready even though I arrived at 8am which is way before check in time. He went out of his way to make sure I was taken care of and I can't thank him
enough. I will be a returning customer for sure, and tell all my colleagues about Sofitel and Amir!

Everyone is made to feel special when staying here. Staff are friendly and on hand to help at all times, and will go out of their way to offer assistance or suggestions to make you stay even better. The variety at breakfast was very impressive with all dietary requirements well

catered for, Little touches in the room (won‚Äôt spoil it for you!) add to the luxurious experience. The only suggestion I have would be to make late check out later than 12pm, even if there was a cost involved.

title.value: Our new "go to" hotel in Sydney

content.value: We stayed here as part of a birthday celebration. It was our first visit and it could not have been better. Staff are unfailingly friendly and helpful from first contact at the door, through to reception and hospitality staff. They made sure our stay was special. The property

is fairly new, well maintained, and has a nice relaxed but upmarket atmosphere. The beds are very comfortable, bathroom large with a separate toilet and good quality toiletries. Well located in the centre of Darling Harbour and with handy public car parking next door. The breakfast buffet had a good selection of dishes, even if it did mean a bit of walking around to the various stations. This will be our "go to" hotel in Sydney from now on.

We stayed 4 night at this hotel. Room size is big and clean. Staffs are friendly. Good location, close to townhall and paddy market. Breakfast is ordinary. No taxi stand for drop off and boarding, must quickly do on the road side.

We really enjoyed our stay here - the suites are very large with a full kitchen and the location is very handy to the CBD shops and Event Cinemas. The pool is a highlight - drop-dead gorgeous indoor heated pool with a star-lit ceiling!

Very comfortable and spacious room/apartment. Could have cooked for ourselves if we had the time, but plenty of eateries nearby. Located on a noisy street(on the night we were there), so sleep was a bit disturbed. Late check-out was very helpful and the breakfast buffet was
fantastic. Very handy to Darling Harbor precinct too.

I had a great stay in a clean and comfy spacious room . Front desk staff were friendly and very helpful . My morning coffee on two seperate occasions was disappointing , as was the ambience for breakfast . A classic place that would only improve with a little colour and
modernisation .

Can get a bit noisy as it‚Äôs the heart of town but if you close the balcony door, it will be ok! Food selection for breakfast buffet is weak (Not worth $25 per person). Since I booked with the room, we went for a quick bite and it‚Äôs very convenient!

This is a great little hotel, with a perfect fit-out for shortstays. It has everything you need, food, transport, shops, on your doorstop. Easy to walk to most Syd attractions and the Convention Centre. Great price!!

The hotel is close to Central station and the city, suiting us perfectly. Staff were lovely, we were able to leave a bag with them for 3 weeks, while we travelled interstate and they were very helpful with all our needs.

Great hotel., convenience., staffs are very friendly; near Chinatown and stations.. i and my family love it so much. ,üëçüëçüëçüëçüëç. Will take this as my first preference when go to Sydney next time. Highly recommended to all.

title.value: Fantastic space, excellent location, helpful staff!

content.value: We had a fabulous stay. Our flight arrived very early, and although the room was not ready ( to be expected) the front desk staff were able to accommodate us with a place to shower and store our bags. Room was excellent. Staff even gave us wonderful recommendations for breakfast

Enjoyed our 2 night stay here in Sydney. Easy to walk to darling harbour and very easy access to Chinatown. The staff are friendly and helpful. Room was noisy but not so bad we had to change rooms. Would stay here again

title.value: Great hotel, close to Kings Cross

content.value: George was a fantastic host... helpful, funny, and knowledgeable. He took the time to show us the best routes, and he made a suggestion of a spot to visit we had not considered... it turned out to be one of the high points of our trip. Basic room with fridge, good wifi, off hour
access, and a great breakfast.

A small and basic hotel, with, for example, limited reception hours. But the owner, George, is very upfront about this, starting with an informative email sent shortly after a booking is made. My room was small, but functional and clean, and included fridge, television and WiFi.

The decoration was a bit tired (although, in fairness, during my stay, work was being done to repair damage following a leaking roof earlier in the year). Breakfast was included and served in the adjacent cafe. This consisted of a drink and choice of cooked options (prepared to order by George's father) and provided a good start to the day. The owner was present each day and was a good source of practical information and advice. The location is great - in a quiet street, very close to King's Cross station and bus routes, and within easy walking distance of the Botanical Gardens. So, overall, a place with limitations, but recommended for those looking for a good value option in a reasonably central location.

title.value: Hotel 59 is a very comfortable place to sleep

content.value: We visited Sydney for 3 days before boarding a cruise ship on the fourth day and so needed a hotel for 3 nights. We settled on Hotel 59 in the King‚Äôs Cross region. After much research, it offered us the best (and very reasonable) price per night. It is a family owned hotel. We

did not have to share a bathroom with another room and breakfast was included in the family owned caf√© downstairs. We were two couples so we needed 2 rooms (it is a 9-room hotel). One room had a queen size bed and a twin bed while the other room had a queen size bed and two twin beds. The beds were very comfortable and there was a wall air-conditioning unit in each room. It is also only a 4 minute walk to an excellent Hop-On Hop-Off Big Bus Tour stop (which we also signed up for). Note that the rooms are on the first and second floors and there are no elevators if you are on the second floor. In both of our rooms, the fans did not work well at all, and in one room, the air conditioner worked well but was very noisy. Other than that, for the reasonable money we paid, we had clean, comfortable rooms with kitchenettes and newly renovated bathrooms. You should check out their website for more details and amenities.

We stayed here for a few days whilst visiting friends in Sydney. On the hotel‚Äôs recommendation we took the Sydney Shuttle from the airport to the hotel for $15 Aus each. Quick service and dropped off outside the hotel. We were able to leave our baggage there until we could check

in at 12:30. The room was fine with a nice big bed and fridge. Once George told us how to set the air con unit properly we had a great stay. Breakfast was included and delicious. Kings Cross station was just a few minutes‚Äô walk as well as a Coles Supermarket, but they stop selling alcohol at 20:00 hrs. There‚Äôs a laundrette just next door. George has lots of good information (get an Opal card for public transport) and, on his recommendation we visited the Koala Hospital at our next stop, Port Macquarie. It‚Äôs free to visit, but please make a donation.

George and Kathy are great hosts, the cafe food is very good, great location in the Cross close to the subway and much else. Quiet, spacious room. I hope to visit there again someday!! Many restaurants, shops and bars in the area, quiet side street with few cars yet just off
the main street.

item.hotel_name: Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Darling Harbour

content.value: Great location, easy to get to and from. Lovely and clean and neat. Friendly and courteous staff. I requested a quiet room, which it was internally. Just expect road noise from the Western Distributor Road going past the back!

item.hotel_name: Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Darling Harbour

content.value: Our rooms were fantastic, very big!! Great service at reception when checking on and out. The location was fantastic so close to everywhere we wanted to be. We will definitely be coming back for a longer stay next time

item.hotel_name: Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Darling Harbour

content.value: Took the family to the aquarium and wildlife park. Couldn't have picked a better location. The facilities were in good condition and clean. We loved our stay and weekend away, we'll be back to stay at Adina Darling Harbour when we can.

Lovely staff on check in. Excellent indoor pool & spa. Spacious & clean, recently renovated hotel room. Great buffet breakfast with awesome kids eat free deal. Nice quiet area, max 10 mins walk to action.

item.hotel_name: Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Darling Harbour

content.value: We got relocated to another Adina property the day before our stay which was disappointing and then the "complimentary"champagne was a bottle of $4.75 Passion Pop.. I think it could have been handled better to ease the inconvenience.

item.hotel_name: Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Darling Harbour

content.value: Great facilities and rooms, staff were amazing and always helpful. Location was so close to the action. Price was reasonable given the facilities and location. Needs better links with surrounding businesses and restaurants

title.value: So close to the office it was exciting...

content.value: Rydges was chosen because it was so close to the office but I love it. Clean, friendly and professional staff, great rooms and centrally located. In Sydney, Rydges is my home away from home. If you need to be close to Central railway and Chinatown - this hotel is the one for you.

title.value: Great value, comfortable hotel in good location

content.value: Terrific location close to Central station and Light Rail. Rooms are comfortable, great new bar that opened a few months ago and close to local restaurants. Easy walk into CBD, Chinatown and Darling Harbour

Stayed at the Rydges for one night, it was fantastic, the room was spacious and well appointed. The bed was made in heaven it was soft but not too soft but you felt like you were wrapped in a cuddly blanket. Not to forget the front office staff on arrival were very

Had three nights here last week. 1st time I‚Äôve stayed at this Rydges Hotel. Good location - close to Central Station and has The Sydney Brewery attached. Rooms were a good size and quiet with little street noise. Plenty of quaint cafes in nearby streets. Will definitely stay

Stayed after the Hugh Jackman show with friends. The rooms are large and comfortable with everything that you need from a hotel. The staff are friendly and helpful, centrally located to Pitt st mall, breakfast is delicious!

title.value: Fast becoming my favourite Sydney hotel

content.value: I‚Äôve stayed here quite a lot lately and will be back in a couple of weeks. The rooms are beautifully appointed and spacious with pleasant decor. The main reception floor, level 8 is a perfect entree to a great property. The buffet breakfast is superb, but the highlight for me is

This was our first time staying at the Swiss√¥tel. We come to Sydney often staying at several of the upmarket hotels. We had the most wonderful experience!! From the minute you poor up to the ever friendly valet to the doorman always wanting to chat- knowing our names after the

I stayed here for 3 nights with my 2 daughters over a weekend during the holidays and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The entrance to the hotel is a little different with reception being on the 9th floor but the concierge staff on the ground floor were always friendly and helpful.

We stayed in the penthouse with our toddler and the room was very well equipped for our needs. We had plenty of room to set up our daughters cot and her room was semi separated from our bed so it was perfect. Everything was clean and new and extremely spacious. The room was

I just keep coming back to this hotel. Not only the best location for my meetings, but it is by far the best pool. Centrifugal machine in the men‚Äôs change room to dry your togs, best steam room and sauna set up, good gym. Best team at reception and concierge at welcoming and
professional. Even found some cuff links for me when I lost one of mine. Love it. I am sure I have tried every other hotel in central Sydney but Four Seasons is my favourite by far.

Again a faultness stay in a perfect location with staff that could not be seen that they were always there - service and support and assistance was world class. the staff excelled with thier service and understanding

Located in The Rocks area, Sydney‚Äôs 5-star 4 Seasons Hotel features a signature cocktail lounge, Grain Bar, just off the lobby. The impressive decor and ‚Äúthe country‚Äôs largest whiskey selections‚Äù is unfortunately let down by the quality of the bar staff and the drinks they

serve. Somebody should tell the bartender you don‚Äôt use stuffed olives in a martini (he had enough sense to remove the red pimento but it still leaves an oily residue which floats on top of the gin). And no way was the glass or gin cold enough. So I tried a gin and tonic. Not enough ice. OK let‚Äôs have beer. It was luke warm. Let‚Äôs get out of here. $109 later! But the peanuts were fresh and the waitress great.

Brilliant hotel for us; perfect location to walk to all iconic attractions & areas, fabulous eateries & close to a selection of public transport. We stayed in a deluxe room on a high floor level with a view of the city George Street so the room was brighter obviously compared

with the standard type. The room was impeccable; spacious, clean, gorgeous window bench seating, full amenities with a top service team attending to our room. A lively, open & bright reception area with a very friendly and professional concierge team ensured that our stay in this hotel was always special. Thank you; will not hesitate to stay again.

A good luxury hotel with a perfect location. Staff were very pleasant and were happy to go above and beyond to ensure my stay was memorable. I would have no doubt in selecting this hotel for my next stay.

When I booked this hotel prior to my trip the site I used to book stated that it was close to the airport. It absolutely was not. Other than that though, the room itself was clean and tidy. A little dated and worn but definitely clean. It was perfect for a short stay for our

family of 5. All 3 kids had their own beds so no fighting there and the bed my husband and I used was quite comfortable. All in all, it was a good hotel.One last warning: read your email confirmation carefully. I did not and at about 6:30 I finally saw that checkin closed at 8. Thank goodness I saw it. I called them immediately and they sent me an email right away with an after hours check in procedure. Close call on my part!

title.value: Does what it says on the tin

content.value: Affordable,clean and centrally located. Lots of reasonable places nearby to eat. Friendly service. Downside: no lift and rooms on ground floor can be noisy because of traffic noise. Plus there is a courtyard with seating where people tend to gather making noise.

This was our second visit ... we bypassed several great venues in my tambourine and Canungra for brunch /lunch... because the meal we had had previously at central railway hotel was too tempting to repeat.... I know most will say it only a basic steak salad chips but honestly

the best pub meal we have had ... the steak perfectly cooked ...flavoursome fresh salad and beer battered chips... good price ... thnx ... oh and the staff are brilliant... friendly and welcoming...!!!

Stay here for business trip, I went check in at 19.00 and bring huge luggage, they don‚Äôt have first floor room available only second and third floor, so me and my co worker have to carry our giant luggage to third floors, the staff helped me out and so nice, but the reception

not that nice, the room are huge have 1 king bed and 1 single bed, it‚Äôs a bit weird cause I just stay alone at room, it‚Äôs old building but still nice, a bit tricky to find at night cause the hotel sign don‚Äôt have any light, but so far it‚Äôs ok.

We booked this hotel due to the price point and photos. We were interested in a different hotel but they sold out of rooms before we decided and needed to book this place due to our budget. I am not a very picky traveler when it comes to accommodations as I tend to not be in

the room very much of the time. While we felt safe in this hotel, we were not impressed with the cleanliness of the room. The room felt very dated and the carpet was super worn. While the sheets were clean, nothing else about the room felt clean. The photos made this place look better than it was in person. The staff was super helpful and friendly on check in and throughout our stay though! They even stored our bags for us when we arrived early so we could go explore before our room was ready.

Great location in CBD, Sydney Opera House and other sightseeing places in a walking distance. Very friendly staff, always smiling. Good breakfast with a buffet (international cuisine). If I went to Sydney again, I‚Äôd definitely pick that place once again.

title.value: They rescued me from a sleepless night in a dodgy hotel

content.value: Thanks to Erasha on reception for understanding and giving me a good deal at the last minute to save me from staying in a nearby smelly and dirty hotel...! The room was warm, comfortable and quiet. Food was impeccable. Team were all very polite and accommodating. Highly

title.value: Keep coming back to this hotel

content.value: Super friendly and comfortable. Large, light filled rooms with luxurious beds and bathrooms. Staff are always ready to help. Convenient location walking distance to Barangaroo and Circular Key. Great work business or leisure.

title.value: The world's best PH property, period

content.value: Marc runs a super tight ship that is truly a hallmark of the PH brand. Everyone at the property‚Äîshoutout to Jayson, Anne, Gary, Elliot and the fellow coffee addict (sorry forget name‚Ä¶) at the concierge‚Äîis full of empathy, insanely detail-oriented, and, most importantly,

distinctively professional. Everything is carried out with a sense of purpose and executed to absolutely the highest standards, making this the best PH property anywhere in the world, period. I was also amazed by the team‚Äôs ethos of deeply engaging and communicating with guests‚Äîeven pinging their colleagues when specific in-the-know information is needed (Gary‚Äôs bar suggestions were 1000x better than those from Centurion Concierge). Overall, a truly inspiring stay. Thank you.

I‚Äôve stayed here many times and for good reason; the service is superb, the rooms a v nice, the facilities great and the location v convenient. Everything seems to flow smoothly and it‚Äôs a joy to be staying here!

This hotel is in a perfect position for getting around Sydney and visiting the various places and piers. The concierge staff were most welcoming and helpful with directions, advice, booking and help with any general information

Excellent standard. Highly professional. Very clean. Fantastic location and access to Sydney attractions. Would be happy to recommend a stay at any Park Hyatt around the world if Sydney standard is anything to go by.

We stayed at the Park Hyatt Sydney for 3 nights in August and had a great stay! The location is perfect with views of the Opera house and bridge. The breakfast was delicious and the concierge was incredibly friendly and helpful. We loved the hot tub with the view of the Opera
house.

We had actually booked accomodation via air bnb at another location but on arrival at 11pm we found it unsuitable and were required to find a quick alternative. Rydges Reception staff were helpful, friendly and professional. We were offered a room at a great price. The room was

clean and comfortable. Beds and pillows comfortable. Great block out curtains. We were on level 15 which is really about level 5 and street noise was still quite loud particularly on Saturday night. The location of this hotel was excellent!!! So central to everything. The concierge was so helpful with directing us each day. The hotel bar downstairs had great live entertainment on Saturday night. Would definitely stay again.

title.value: First time in Sydney - the Perfect Hotel

content.value: My husband and I stayed at the Park Hyatt Sydney for three nights during our first time visit to Sydney in July. The Park Hyatt Sydney hotel is located about 2-3 blocks from Circular Quay station and is about a 20min drive from/to the SYD airport (30min by train). Prior to our

arrival in Sydney, I had reached out to the hotel to see if we could get some recommendations on things to do and places to eat around the area, as well as request a room with a view (since I heard the views of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge were unbeatable). The hotel couldn‚Äôt guarantee a room with a view, but was very responsive to all my inquiries.¬† We grabbed an Uber from the airport to the hotel (it was approx. $35USD). ¬† Upon arrival, we were greeted by a very courteous and welcoming receptionist and were advised that we did get upgraded to a room with a view of the Opera House and the Harbour (yay!).¬† We made our way to the room which was on the second floor (the hotel only has four floors) and walked into a spacious King room, first encountering the a huge bathroom with a an open shower (there were doors to the living area which you can close). There was a separate room with the toilet (a Toto bidet - Japanese washlet).¬† After passing the bathroom area, we walked passed our King bed, a little couch in the corner (and desk) and out onto the balcony. We were greeted with an amazing view of the iconic Opera House, it was incredible! During our stay we experienced a couple of sunrises and sunsets and they were breathtaking! The views are truly magical!¬† The area where the hotel is located is called The Rocks and it is full of history that goes back to the first settlers who arrived by boats in Sydney. The Park Hyatt Sydney is located right under the Harbour Bridge and is walking distance to many attractions around the city (as mentioned earlier, it is right by Circular Quay where you can catch one of the ferries to Manly, Taronga Zoo, Luna Park, Darling Harbor, and many more).¬† The terrace/pool area was under construction while we were there, but that did not affect our stay at all.¬† Everyone at the hotel was very accommodating (special thanks to the concierge staff for all of the restaurant and bar recommendations!).¬† The Park Hyatt Sydney truly lives up to its 5-star luxurious hotel status.¬†We had an amazing time at this hotel and are so happy we picked it for our first-time trip to Sydney. Everything was perfect and we hope to be back again in the near future! :) -Patrycja savitraveljournal.com

We stayed here for 3 nights. It was perfect. We were upgraded to a large suite with views of the Sydney Opera House. Perfect location for a morning run. Close to Circular Quay train station to go explore other parts of Sydney. Staff was great throughout our stay. Would not
hesitate to return.

This hotel has been my preferred location for business and pleasure during the last years. Great location and conveniently located to a number of places within walking distance. The staff is great and more than happy to oblige. I have been looked after very well. Highly
recommended

We do not usually stay in hotel bars but with a talented and entertaining guitarist plus the waitress Bella with a beautiful smile and friendly attentive service made it a good night out. We will definitely come again

Booked an executive king room which, the website says, are located on the high floors and was allocated a balcony room on 12. Unknown to me at the time 12 is actually the first residential floor in the hotel and the tiny balcony no bonus. Why? Because sitting out on the single

chair on what is ostensibly a lobby roof courtyard was impossible due the smell of fat frying which, incidentally, permeated the 12th floor between my room and the lifts for the entire two nights.
