It seemed to me it was wafting in from the fans above the hotel kitchens fixed at 12 floor level. On arrival at my door on evening one found an empty wine bottle in a wine cooler directly outside and, bizarrely, after moving it down the corridor found it outside my door again the next evening!! On top of all that, my room on day 2 wasn‚Äôt serviced until 3pm when I had scheduled work in the room during the afternoon, this despite my being woken by cleaning equipment banging against my door repeatedly when the shift began early that morning. All in all a downer for mid to late $500s and as a loyalty member. Pluses? Yes, there were some. Great location, comfy bed and pillows, bathroom spotless. Would I stay again? Maybe. But I‚Äôve learned my lesson: 12 is actually 1 and I‚Äôll be looking for something around 19 or 20 which is really 7 or 8. Tip: if you book high floor, make sure it is, and see which way the wind is blowing if you are down on 12.

Saved our lives. My family booked a hotel at the Sydney Boutique Hotel in Darlinghurst and we were extremely unimpressed (mould, deceptive photos, dust and hairs everywhere, noisy neighbours/thin walls, ) so we left and looked for any accommodation at the last minute. Found the

Rydges at World square and they were beautiful. Easy check in was at 8pm and they happily minded our bags until then. Clean and tidy rooms. Comfortable and relaxing (after the stress of the other place) and in the perfect location for all our needs. Highly recommend!

title.value: Quirky and Fun and in a great location

content.value: We stayed in a Junior Suite and the size was great. Plenty of room for the King Bed and sitting area and the bathroom was also quite large with a big bath. We loved the free mini bar and wine and pincho's hour and also the lolly bar - it's these little things that really set it

Booked direct with Hotel, the only way to stay at a hotel!! Converted wool classing building! Kept all the amazing huge beams & created a really good atmosphere & great vibe! Staff were wonderful! We got upgraded, got lotsa freebies including a nice breakfast with an excellent

A funky decor outlay with great touches such as the lolly bar but misses the mark with quality finishes and cramped conditions. I was confused in many aspects of my experience with a school chair, the art deco wall and tiny useless table located in my room. Space in the foyer

Funky hotel in a great spot just minutes walk from Darling Harbour. Comfortable beds and pillows, good WIFI, nice bathrooms, good breakfast, lunch and dinner and friendly staff. Ovolo 1888 has become my favorite Sydney hotel. Highly reccomended

We had planned a night at the Star City, Lyric Theatre and Ovolo 1888 Darling Harbour popped up on our internet search. Never been before, but would definitely go again. Great re-use of the old wool store building, with a mix of original features, new improvements and quirky art

Disgracefully service from staff Prepaid room was only allowed 2 nights and then was refused back into room until I paid a further $100 a night cash which they claimed was a weekend rate. I had lost my licence and credit card but received no help from the staff

This is hotel is great! Great Location.... great restaurants nearby and the staff is outstanding... I can‚Äôt say enough about how they treat their guest... I will definitely be back for my 7th visit soon!

Not good. The bed was small, sleeping on it is not comfortable. It's a little bit noisy. Next room was watching TV, I can hear the sound very clearly. There was a gabage station downstaris, you can hear the truck coming very clearly in the morning. The guy at the front desk was
not nice.

title.value: Great location, welcoming staff, personal service, big room

content.value: From arrival the service was very friendly. The room I picked (City View) has a great, western-facing balcony room, bringing in all the afternoon sun across skyline - and overlooking Surry Hills police station, which is worth noting for its value in quietening the streets

surrounding. Although it has standard setup of bed, sofa, TV, desk, bathroom, it is expanded, far more spacey than a normal hotel room, nothing is squeezed in (I did feel the room ceiling lights could have been brighter, with a common bed switch, but this is a quibble and nothing else). I adjusted the room to my liking, adding a blanket, moving the tea-coffee-making tray, and liked that room-cleaning just made my room up this way every day, rather that "resetting" everything like normally happens in a big hotel chain. The room safe could be bigger, and better located along with the fridge (both away in a corner cupboard, good from that perspective but a bit tight). The bath is not huge but it's a bath! with strong-running, hot water, like its overhead shower, so I was pretty rapt at the end of the day to rest my walking-tired body in it - hotels need to emphasis bath-availability more, IMHO. Location-wise, I often stay closer to the city, but that gets expensive. The Cambridge is only just out, a couple of hundred metres up from the corner of Hyde Park, a short way down Riley (50m?), with access to all Surry Hills has, plus a supermarket close to opposite (Aldi, though there's an IGA on Oxford Street, halfway back towards Hyde Park). Anyway, it's a place I've returned to because it does all I need it, which puts into perspective the quibbles I have. I think it's worth paying extra for the City View room, for the space and the satisfying view (it's not classic Sydney skyline but it is very nice, again, with views to sunset, and a sneaky, between-buildings glimpse in the distance down to the top of the Opera House sails). And, I'd emphasise, friendly, professional staff. Plus a bonus chocolate on checkout, which never hurts.

A good place to stay, Good staff. Just wish that the morning newspapers would be delivered to my door. I was on crutches for the stay. The room was not hoovered every time it was cleaned. I loved the discount I got for a long stay. Shame the pool wasn't in operation.

Also,the picture on Foxtel channels wasn't the best. The biggest bug bear was the thinness of the toilet paper. Use a 3 ply brand in future guys. Gee, the mini fridge was so small. Overall very happy though. It was a 2 week stay.

Another fabulous stay at QT Sydney. Perfect location, customer service, rooms and food. My only (slightly negative feedback) is some of the rooms are quite dark (but the interior design plays on this for a luxe looking room), so if you are after natural light make sure you ask

Both of us needed to work from Sydney for few days and we decided to make it a week stay to treat ourselves. As usual we stayed with our "Sydney Home - QT Sydney" at Market Street. The staffs as always made us felt like home, we got our favourite corner suites and they had put

title.value: Fantastic Stay on a romantic weekend

content.value: We had a fantastic stay on a last minute romantic weekend. Building is fantastic and the room and bedding was top notch. Only downside was the outlook of the room which was in to a shaft/alley between buildings. Staff were great and we will definitely return.

Rooms a well presented and service and room amenities are excellent Check in and check out was seamless The free movies and mini bar is something that suited me very well I would recommend the tan stream for any travel

My stay in the qt hotel was second to none this is an amazing hotel with mind blowing beautiful rooms You literally do not want to leave I cannot wait to return. The staff the restaurant the service the quality was amazing they cannot help you enough from start to finish The

After a long wedding day we were greeted by Branden/ Brendan (apologies for the spelling) on Market Street, he welcomed both of us, hugged my now wife and set the tone for our stay. He gave us a little history tour of the building up to our suite. Our room was FANTASTIC a super

title.value: Excellent Hotel for a business trip

content.value: We often stay at The Tank Stream Sydney for business. It's location for meetings is perfect, Wynyard Train station for quick trips from the airport is close by & lots of entertainment & dining options for after hours, a short stroll to Mr Wong & The Establishment, Circular Quay

title.value: My Stay at The Tankstream Hotel

content.value: Comfortable place to stay that provided fast and efficient check in and check out service. It was close to where we needed to be and the room was clean, tidy and quiet. The coplimentary mini bar was also a pleasant surprise for us.

Staff are friendly, professional and helpful. Assisted us at short notice in accessing a suitable venue for a business related conference call. Very clean rooms and facilities, excellent location. Enjoyed our stay. Thanks Tank Stream

Nice, clean and friendly hotel with great staff! And sooo close to Circular Quay and the Sydney harbour bridge and the Opera: a 20 minute-walk which I clearly enjoyed every night just after work. Not far from Barangaroo, from Pittstreet shopping area. The perfect spot!

Hotel appears to have had an overhaul since September 2016. Wi-Fi availability is better throughout the Hotel now. Ballroom Digital features available complimented the Speakers. Great variety of Food throughout the stay.

We have been choosing the Sheraton now for at least 8 years as it is conveniently located, The rooms are excellent and service from all staff consistently good. We hope we never have to choose another hotel.

title.value: Great location to stay for the City 2 Surf. would have been better if it was a non smoking property.

content.value: There was a good view of the harbour from the executive lounge, but smoking was allowed on the balcony which excluded many from enjoying it. Room was clean, bed comfortable and pool area including spa was very clean. Staff were pleasant and service was efficient.

I just had my high tea at The Gallery @ Sheraton Sydney on the last Friday. The scones were great, the tea was good too, DIlmah is one of my favourite brands all the time. Thu was my server, she was great, always came and check to see if I need anything or how was everything. I

A wonderful night, hotel's in a great location, very helpful staff, and the pool & jacuzzi on the rooftop are not to miss. Check in and check out all straightforward, and reception loaned us a phone charger

This hotel sets a new standard in service. from the moment we walked in until the moment we checked out nothing was too much trouble and we were treated as VIP's. Club Milliseme is a must try, the view from the 35th floor is fantastic. The junior Suite was luxurious. The

As a birthday treat we decided to stay here. We booked a corner suite. We received a warm welcome, checkin was very efficient and our room was ready. We were on the 8th floor and the views over darling harbour were amazing. Hugh windows and the room was stunning. The position of

From the valet parking to the corner room to the delicious meal an overall excellent weekend away. The best club sandwich, awesome heated pool, amazing choice for breakfast, welcome drink was a great surprise, thoughtful card and cake delivered to room for birthday

title.value: Quality stay a a quality hotel

content.value: Nice position, good rooms, great food, good service. Valet parking was available, but expensive. Staff welcoming. Reception staff welcoming but hard to understand (heavily accented). Overall very good.

Beautiful hotel. Room was great, can't really fault it. The bar upstairs is also great! Only a minor thing that they still need to work on is service at check in. It seemed to take a really long time to check guests in so we had to wait a while. Luckily they handed out

Had a amazing experience. the only issue I had, there was a cigarette butt on the floor of the balcony right in front of the door, I let front desk know when I left to have some lunch (I told them I can remove it, I just wanted to let them know) when I returned to my room from

The Radisson in my opinion is an ideal location to base your stay in Sydney, a 10 minute or less walk to Darling Harbour, Chinatown, Central Station, and The Rocks 25 minutes. Excellent public transport to get around the city and suburbs. A recent Smart Travel survey ranked

title.value: Excellent location and spacious room. Great for family with young kids

content.value: Location was great, we were able to walk to almost everywhere. Room was spacious and clean with 2 Queen bed which was perfect for family with young children where 2 rooms is not an option. There's also a decent size kitchenette that allowed us to make our own aussie breakfast -

Excellent CBD location (3 min walk to Town Hall station). Very friendly staff. Unique/fascinating building. Large rooms. Excellent food, except the limited after hours menu, and overpriced ice cream ($17 for 100g). Convenience shop is across the road and literally hundreds of

We had an enjoyable stay arriving mid afternoon Friday and booking out Sunday, Breakfast was very good with a mix of hot and cold, This is a very quiet hotel in the centre of the City in the China Town area, Is within walking distance to all local attractions.

We were upgrade to a 2 bed room apartment. Room is clean and tidy. Excellent location next to darling harbour, china town. Staff are nice and answer all the question we ask. Breakfast included which is much convenient to us rather than looking for food with kids.

We are regular diners at the Wilmot Room. The setting and ambience is perfect - quietly confident and elegant. Menu is inspired and changes regularly - thanks Daniel Menzies. Best of all the service from attentive and respectful staff is second to none, Sim In runs a great team.

Primus hotel Sydney has spacious rooms and bathrooms. It‚Äôs location makes it close to many interesting places like QVB, Town Hall, World square. It‚Äôs 5 mns close to Town Hall station. It‚Äôs literally central to all shopping areas in CBD. If you like to walk you can also hit

The room was modern, cost was reasonable. Location was excellent. Food was a bit blend though, especially the ‚Äòice cream‚Äô sent to my room during room service was not actually an ice cream but a sorbet, and it was so melted and small, but still costed $17.

title.value: Gorgeous Art Deco Hotel in the Heart of Sydney

content.value: This was our second time staying at The Primus Hotel in Sydney. Both times we have been blown away by the beauty of this hotel's fantastic renovation in trying to both capture & preserve the era of when this building was built. From the foyer & bar all the way to the rooms

item.hotel_name: Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Town Hall

content.value: The elevators are under repair, and will not be functioning until January 2020. Only one elevator is operational, so waits of up to 15 minutes every time you want to go up, and every time you want to go down. Suggest you book another property until next year.

item.hotel_name: Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Town Hall

content.value: This is close to everything you might need during yor stay. It is close to the Town Hall Subway, QVB is a block away, as well as Woolworth's. Chinatown is 2 blocks away. The hotel is clean, bathroom is great size and clean. Water pressure is never an issue even if we were on

floor 28. When the reception knew that it was my birthday, they secretly asked my friends what wine I prefer and when I got back to the room, a chilled white wine was waiting on the dining table with a birthday card. The suite is highly recommeded for big groups, and the area allows you to accommodate 12 guests for a nightcap. There is a kitchen, with oven and stove, toaster, microwave. They even provide an iron and ironing board! There is a great breakfast/cafe in the lobby that is open from 7am to 5 pm (i think)

item.hotel_name: Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Town Hall

content.value: Great location for China Town, Darling Harbour. Close to public transport. Suited to couples and families. Only issue was one lift not working but once the upgrade is complete should be no issue. Facilities very clean and staff were also friendly and helpful.

Booked at quite short notice. The room was lovely, spacious, and spotless. The bathroom's glass internal walls and door were odd, but curtains provide privacy during its use. Complimentary cold bottled water and tea&coffee facilities in the lobby were a lovely touch. Will
definitely be considering it as a primary choice next time I'm staying in the city.

item.hotel_name: Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Town Hall

content.value: Overall a good stay with some areas for improvement. The hearing broke down during our stay but nobody told us about it till we asked for help on the second night of being cold (the first night we were wondering if the temperature had just dropped outside during the might).
There‚Äôs a lot of unnecessary use of single use plastics in the cups in the lobby and bathroom toiletries. Would‚Äôve been good to use reusable glasses and refillable containers instead

item.hotel_name: Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Town Hall

content.value: I already wrote along review. The room was comfortable and spacious . Kitchen well equipped bathroom tired and house keeping quite poor. Not supplying toiletries toilet paper and making the beds the second day because of clean lingerie in a bag on the bed

The hotel is good location near the central station but not noisy,very relax. We went to bluemountains and the hunter valley in the early morning, so free breakfast helped us. atmosphere and music in the lobby are nice.

Outstanding location, small and simple hotel yet fancy and luxurious at the same time. Ot might not have views and a day spa but its so close to Central station you can get to anywhere. Clean and very comfortable with great customer service. I'll be recommending.

Our stay was excellent! The reception staff was wonderful! They were very friendly and helpful. They chatted with us for awhile since we were early and took our luggage. They gave us a lot of hints on what to see. When we came back our bags were already in our rooms. We have

never received this courtesy before. The room was great. It was very clean and tons of room. We had a washer/dryer in our room, which was incredibly helpful. Can't say enough good things about our stay. Will stay here again for sure.

Fabulous night at The Ultimo. Great location. 5 min walk to Central station. 20 min walk to Darling Harbour. Exceptionally clean. Lovely big bathroom. Big comfy bed. Nice decor. Friendly, helpful staff. Breakfast delivered to door was very nice to.

title.value: Easy hotel! Don‚Äôt worry! You almost don‚Äôt need any staff!

content.value: Nice decorated hotel close to everything. Easy, cheap, quirky! Whole experience was simple! Nothing special in the room, normal nice shower with old carpets. Simple cheap out, drop keys in the box without any issues!

Quick service. Was able to make a last minute booking due to flight cancellation. Just gave them a call and they sorted out a vacant room pretty quickly. Good location. About 5 mins to the train station. And about 15 min walk to Haymarket where you can find good food. Great
facilities. Good vibe. Absolutely love the overall design of the room. Modern and simple. Credits to Muneeb from the front desk for the excellent service.

One of the hotel chains I was really looking forward to was the QT brand and we were able to get a place at the QT Bondi! From the get-go expectations were high and upon our arrival I wasn‚Äôt let down one bit! I believe it was Nick the front desk guy who was simply amazing and

gave us all the insights we needed for the area and the layout of the hotel! Rooms are super modern and chic and the location was superb! Can‚Äôt wait for the end of our trip when we stay at the QT Queenstown! Thanks for your teams hospitality in making our stay in Bondi a great one!

Our room was ready for early check in as requested. Excellent sized room with outstanding facilities. Coffee pod machine, yes! Reception staff polite and friendly. They valet park your car which you can request them to get as often as you like. Short walk to the beach.

title.value: Beautiful boutique hotel and value for money!

content.value: Checked in early at around 12 noon and the lovely girl at the desk greeted us, fixed my reservation price as I was having small issues online when booking, received a complimentary coffee voucher for booking direct and got an upgraded room. Walking the hallways you can tell what

We stayed here for 3 nights recently. The hotel is in a fantastic location - short walk from Central train station (we caught the train from the airport - so easy); right across the road from Paddy's Market; right in the midst of Chinatown; and easy walk to Darling Harbour.

From the moment we arrived to when we left our experience was first class. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was lovely, very spacious, clean and comfortable. The location was also very good.

Superb location and huge rooms with a sofa bed so easy for sharing, shopping and dining out at Icebergs and North Bondi Fish üêü Dotti also very good for food. Downstairs is a supermarket and bottle shop so very convenient. Best shopping is behind the hotel rather than facing
the beach, which is very touristy.

The hotel was centrally located near Darling Harbour and the city, and a close walk to the International Convention Centre. The rooms were comfortable and well appointed and staff friendly and helpful.

Clean room, comfortable bed, close to the train station, very helpful staff, lots of delicious China Town restaurants near by, coffee & snacks available for purchase in lobby. Modern decor with limited closet/storage space. Tell them when booking your reservation if you have

really great place to stay to get a good sleep, Beds are amazing. I had a room away from the main road and it was great. Wonderful staff at reception and complimentary coffee each morning is great...‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.

Very happy with our stay. Staff ere very friendly and helpful. The rooms were great and the beds comfy. Had all the amenities we needed and wifi was easy to connect to. Only negative was our room had a huge street light that lit up the kitchen and lounge area all night.

l like the room because of cooking,shopping and transportation convenient.This way, it is very easy to visit my child and let her taste my cooking delicious hometown food. Especially thanks to the waitress at the front desk for adjusting the system for me to avoid the trouble
caused by the room change when I renew the reservation. I have a good time here,sure.

Great location we were close to everything. Super friendly staff on check in. The room was beautiful, spacious and very clean. Beds were comfy. Cleaning staff were also lovely. Overall we had a fantastic stay, thanks again.

Wonderful place with spacious setting which accommodates well for a group or family - very clean and modern! Comfortable and pleasant to enjoy a night or few nights stay!!! Central location for city sightseeing.. Beautiful serene nature setting area with plants to signal a
tranquil vibe! Lovely customer service by the team!!

The hotel's team is excellent. The treatment received was fantastic. The location of the hotel is very good very near of the business center and with a lot of restaurants in the proximity. The use of suits, with a great kichen have you a lot of freedom.

title.value: A beautiful place to stay in Sydney!

content.value: Close to Chinatown, Circular Key, the Theatre district I would definitely recommend the Meriton Suites Campbell Street Sydney for a nice getaway. The room was spacious, well presented with every touch you would expect in a high class hotel. I will definitely stay again next
time I'm visiting Sydney.

I stayed for three nights and had a wonderful stay. The location is terrific, near some great restaurants. The room was well presented, clean and spacious. Toiletries were quality and water pressure in the shower was good. I checked in early before a room was available. When I

returned several hours later, the check in staff remembered me and had my room key ready for me before I could even say who I was. the fitness centre is also great - really enjoyed the pool - it's big enough to get a proper swim in, and the sauna was nice too.

title.value: Right in the thick of fresh food shopping üçæ

content.value: If you are a foodie who loves the taste of your own cooking with the freshest ingredients, then this hotel location is just the place for you. I booked the room for its kitchen. Paddy‚Äôs Market is about a block away and little local groceries are right next to the hotel. Oh, and
the location is convenient for sightseeing too. The staff was fantastic. Would definitely stay there again!

Bed linen only changed every six days? Dirty glasses and plates not even put in the dishwasher but they say they do. Nice enough place but really basic housekeeping Bed was really comfortable and a proper king size without the join in the middle

title.value: Nice Choice, Good Location, Perhaps not as polished as other Four Seasons Globally

content.value: Great location close to the Rocks and the Harbour. Service is great and all really friendly and helpful staff all the way through the hotel. Rooms maybe a little tired and in need of some TLC. Still a good choice but perhaps not the polish and dazzle of the Four Seasons brand

Lovely hotel with very nice design. Suitable for families with multi pax and great if u need a kitchen, washer and dryer. It is located centrally but about 15 mins away from chinatown. Like that it is tucked away in a quiet street while being in central. Has a gym pass for the
fitness goers

title.value: Renovations are Loud, Concierge is Great.

content.value: The renovations are loud. Really Loud. And the water was off for a day, which I didn ªt know about until after it was turned off. They did put a little note next to my bed the night before, but of course I fell asleep without even seeing it. The food is excellent. It is better

You really can't go wrong here when you book the room with a brilliant view of Sydney Harbour. The bed was good but the pillow was far too soft. Service was excellent and the staff were so friendly and willing to serve at all time.

Great new hotel with industrial interiors and lovely staff. Netflix and foxtel available, as well as a little book on things to do in Sydney. The area was good if you don‚Äôt mind walking a little bit to get to central We found it to be a little noisy, if you are a light sleeper I
wouldn‚Äôt recommend

title.value: great hotel and facilities but please change the pillows

content.value: please offer the customer a choice of hard and SOFT pillows. On this occasion only very hard pillows were provided for the user resulting in 3 nights of poor sleep quality Thank you PS: the hotel, set up and location is great

The service was truly exceptional. The staff at the hotel were always will to assist and were courteous throughout our stay. The room also met our expectations. Overall, my mom and I had a wonderful experience at the Four Seasons Hotel in Sydney.

Great location. If flying in, circular quay station very short walk for airport transfers & no traffic hassles. Wonderful staff, rooms & facilities. Pool, spa, meeting rooms & the most comfy beds. Located at the Rocks there are wonderful restaurants & cafes all around. We will

title.value: Excellent apartment hotel in the business district

content.value: Veriu Broadway is a recently renovated historic building that offers spacious, comfortable and fully equipped rooms for a reasonable price. There is a kitchen with fridge, dishwasher and cooking facilities and everything in terms of plates, glasses and cutlery that you need.

The room had a large and comfortable bed for 2, a large bathroom with shower and there were separate washing facilities (washing machine, dryer, iron and board) as well as a large modern tv and even stereo equipment. The air conditioning unit is new and very quiet. There is a round table that seats 4 and separate easy chairs and sofa in the tv area. The lifts are comfortable and large and the reception doubles as a cosy bar where you can have coffee, drinks and some snacks. Everything is very well organised and very modern, with a lot of light and space. The hotel is in a very quiet street but close to everything in the city centre, and less than 5 minutes away from a major bus stop that can take you to the beaches and other destinations in the suburbs. The central station is 10 minutes away on foot. Cleaning is done every day and towel service daily as well. they even top up the supply of washing powder and dishwasher powder. All in all an excellent choice and very good quality for money. Public transport in Sydney is very extensive, frequent and very efficiently organised. The easiest way is to buy OPAL cards (in every convenience store), sart by putting 10 AUS$ on it and then top up when necessary. Each time you use public transport you tap the card on a card reader. There are peak periods (9-10.30 and 16.00-18.30) but outside those the prices are really low. And yes, Sydney is one of the most wonderful cities in the world.

We booked due to location for things planned in Sydney and left loving this a whole lot more. Very spacious. Excellent amenities such as dishwasher, clothes washer etc. A great little kitchenette set up. A really good work space.... perfect as I had a lot of computer time and it
was nice not to feel I had to escape to a cafe. Close to everything we needed. And most importantly, a quiet and comfortable bed. All with a funky atmosphere.

I stayed 6 nights at the Medusa hotel and it was a great stay and excellent value for money. The 24 hour reception was really convenient and the help given by all staff was wonderful. Although there is no lift, the staff were very happy to carry the bags and were fun and very

friendly. The location is excellent with local shops, metro and restaurants nearby. The walk to the Botanical Gardens was only 15 minutes. The hotel's location is excellent. And finally the complimentary morning muffin was a treat.

title.value: Cozy Spot in a Great Neighborhood

content.value: My partner and I finished our two week Australia vacation here. I chose this place because of its location; I like a neighborhood feel where I see more locals than tourists. This cute, boutique hotel is also near the gay pubs and good eats which we love. The hotel itself has

really good touches from a full mini-bar, an extra bar sink, and tasty muffins in the morning. One of the hosts gave my partner running suggestions. Super sweet and friendly host. If you want a unique experience, stay here. Loved it!

Boutique hotel in good location which is great value for money. Don‚Äôt expect luxury but it is very clean, quiet and the exceptionally welcoming staff give an enjoyable, bespoke experience. Like a lot of old buildings in Sydney, our ground room was fractionally musky but other

than that it had everything we wanted, nice to have Aesop amenities as well. Generally the design and interiors were creative and considered. If you are looking at second tier chain hotels in Sydney, steer well clear and give Medusa some support. It‚Äôs a win win and provides a rewarding experience.

Quiet location & great host had room with private balcony which made the stay very comfortable walking distance to train station and cafes and restaurants on doorstep complementary muffins available to guests.Really enjoyed my stay here

This is a very cool design hotel, nice way to reinvigorate a heritage building. Staff are very friendly and upgraded my stay to a grand room, which was huge. The location is good and some great cafes and restaurants all a short walk. Aesop products a nice extra to enjoy a
pleasant stay.

We stayed in the apartments for a week in late March, went traveling, and came back for a second stay. The hotel is convenient to many locations in Wolloomooloo and easy and peaceful walking distance to city center. My family and I cooked every night in the apartment - so it

was great to be close to grocery shopping and have a variety of pots and pans available. Quiet streets and not a lot of noise (except for the kookaburras screeching) so, we slept well - a king-sized bed for the adults and a smaller, cozy bed for our ten year-old. The free breakfast downstairs was minimal but awesome to have. We took advantage every morning. Being able to do laundry in the apartment was a bonus! The only reason why I cannot give a 5-star rating, is that the apartment itself had a terrible odor --- something like dirty socks - that no matter what we did (burn candles/incense, open windows) would just not go away. Still, the staff went over and above - we were able to store out luggage and they were very helpful in directions. The pub next door is super friendly and they have trivia night every week - ! We'd stay there again, if we can sniff the room first! Thank you!!

The staff were very pleasant and helpful on arrival and when we asked about luggage storage on the day we were to check out they immediately offered us late checkout. The location is very convenient for the Woolloomooloo Wharf area and also walking distance to the city. The

room and d√©cor were looking a bit tired and in need of some maintenance but staff told us the room was due for repairs after we left. Good location and a better deal than staying in the Rocks/Circular Quay area.

Stayed here for 3 nights. Got vivid special price direct on website. Studio apartment. Very spacious and well appointed. Comfortable bed. Easy to drive to and great undercover carpark. Very friendly staff. Great location with bus at the front that takes you to city, near

darling harbour and to the rocks. Also connects with bus to SCG. Easy walking to botanical gardens, opera house and circular quay. Another bus very close to go to watsons bay. Very quiet other than occasional drunken louts. Very secure and safe area. Awesome stay.

We stayed here four nights at the end of a three week Australian holiday. We initially had an Air B&B which didn‚Äôt work out big time so I searched Expedia and came across this place. The price was great and the location seemed okay. So we booked it and hopped a ride. I am so

glad we did. The reception we received from Brad was excellent. What a gem of a guy he really helped us out! Our room was on the third floor with a king two twin bed layout. Yes it could use a few touch ups but the room was very spacious, very clean, bed was super comfy with lots of pillows! Yeah ! Plenty of bath linens, and toiletries. We had a washer drawer combo in the washroom which was excellent. The kitchenette was clean and had all the necessities for our stay. The building has a locked entry which was comforting and the elevator can only be operated with a key. This location was very close to the marina and a lovely walk to circular key and the sites of CBD. Lots of eating out options nearby and a supermarket a short walk. We were so pleased with this accommodation. Location excellent, cleanliness excellent, service excellent. Friendly , helpful staff all around. I would definitely stay here again.

Two couples shared 2 bedroom apartment on 6th floor to be close to things we were visiting. Quiet rooms, good security, clean and tidy. Our room was looking a little worn and rooms were small but comfortable and great location.

We live in the blue mountains and often overnight in Sydney - found this place in the net and it is now a new fave. Quirky reuse of an old building with excellent facilities, friendly helpful staff and good value for money üëç

Great room, Free bar was great...but did not use it! Loved the happy hour. All the staff were so friendly with a special mention to Meghan. Location of the hotel was prefect for my meeting as well as our groups social activities. Such a great personal touch.

Stayed for 3 nights and honestly couldn't fault this place. Tanya and her wonderful staff were so obliging, nothing was too much trouble. Very refreshing to have 5 star service these days. The rooms were clean and well serviced and the food was lovely, great location also. Well

Had a wonderful stay at the Ovolo 1888 for a 50th girls weekend.Tanya looked after us very well a hard task with 18 women.Great location , happy hour drinks and free mini bar along with free lollies.Breakfast was also included and was a good variety of food available.Funky hotel.

Our stay was great! We stayed 2 nights for my birthday. Had heard from friends about Ovolo, so thought we would try it out. Rooms were clean and comfy. We booked the loft room. Loved the split level. Alexia in the room was an added bonus. Got a disco ball and balloons in the

title.value: Awesome hotel with a great vibe

content.value: The hotel decor is original and quirky which gives the place a really cool vibe. The greeters at the entry are friendly and helpful. The people at reception were great as well, very accommodating. The whole hotel has a very classy and fun atmosphere so you just do not want to

What a wonderful welcome I received at QT! From the moment I entered the hotel until the time I departed, the staff were very friendly and attentive. This lively culture permeated to the patrons staying at QT. Everywhere I went, I was greeted with smiles from others who were

title.value: I always love staying here. This is our favourite place to stay in the city.

content.value: We always love staying here. The decor is so beautiful. The staff are friendly and helpful. We often get upgraded! The rooms are so beautiful and exceptionally clean. I always love have a bath in the huge tub whenever we stay. The breakfast is always delicious. Its such a

Everything from the welcome, to the little details in the room, the bed and the gorgeous service in the cafe put a smile on my face and made me feel so welcomed. It's in a great spot where you can walk to lots of fun places (and shop!)

I have wanted to stay in a QT Hotel for some time and an event in Sydney gave me a reason to. To my delight I was upgraded to a corner suite. Helpful and friendly team. I loved the quirky little touches and creative vibe. I made use of the room service and had an indulgent bath

title.value: amazing hotel with the only 5 star service in sydney

content.value: We stayed at the park hyatt a number of times in may 2019 and every time we loved all the amenities as well as the excellent 5 star service . it is second to none as far as luxury hotels in Sydney are concerned .Nothing is a problem or an issue. The staff make it happen . Yes it

Couldn't be more satisfied! The hotle is as beautiful as it can be and the staff is very polite and courteous. If you are looking for a stay in Sydney, this property serves to all your needs and wants.

the only down side to this establishment was the dinner at its restaurant. there are better place to dine for less $$$ but no better place to stay in Sydney. Try the Rocks area, or Sake. For the best tourist experience and view, try Quay. All are within easy walking distance

title.value: The worst service I‚Äôve ever encountered

content.value: After recently staying a couple of weeks at The Park Hyatt Maldives, I decide whilst in Sydney to have breakfast at ‚ÄúThe Dining Room‚Äù with my wife and sister overlooking the harbour. BEFORE we left I had called the restaurant to book a table, the person advised they don‚Äôt take

This would have to be one of the best hotels I have stayed at. The location would be one of the best in the world. On ground level looking out towards the harbour & bridge, the room was room was spacious with all the comfort features you would expect. The staff at this hotel

title.value: A little gem in the heart of Sydney

content.value: Great hotel in the heart of Darlinghurst. Clean, comfortable, great staff! Had a fabulous stay with a couple of friends in a triple room. Value plus! Didn't have time to check out the adjoining restaurant but will definately be back.

Although we only stayed for one night we enjoyed our stay. Had trouble getting the free Wifi to work however. Used Room Service twice - service was prompt and the food was good. We would stay here again.

Old building with good house keeping and cleaness. We did like the room and the facilities. Front desk staff were all nice and helpful. We changed our coins for laundry and concierge service smoothly.

title.value: Great Location, Great Location - City to Surf

content.value: If you are planning to run the City to Surf, this is the place to stay. Close to the start, close to the train, close to town. You can back, get changed and head out on the town. Staff were great, rooms were fine. But location.

The Cambridge is a great hotel for those wishing to be near CBD but do not wish to pay city prices. The staff are professional yet friendly and helpful. The facilities and rooms are great and are reasonable priced. Location in Surry Hills is easy to get to either by car or

The hotel was small but nice. The room was a decent size and cleaned daily. Shower in very good condition. The biggest surprise for us was the little restaraunt downstairs! My word the food was good. Also ordered a pie for room service another night which was equally delicious.

What a beautiful building the Grace Hotel is. Walking distance to the subway, queen Victoria building and a vast range of other interesting points. Our room was very good and a good hearty breakfast was on offer., Comfortable King size bed was just what we needed after a day

The room was clean and well maintained. The bed and pillows were comfortable and larger towels were brought when we requested them. The staff were friendly at reception and the concierge desk. Check in and out was fast.

Great Spot & great food, very central position, spacious lobby and many food and drink options within the hotel. Fantastic conference facilities and very friendly staff. A very comfortable bed and nice shower. Would stay here again for sure...

On a recent two night stay in the city of Sydney we had the pleasure of staying at the beautiful Grace Hotel. This historic building is tastefully decorated in Art Deco style and the recently refurbished rooms are excellent with king size comfortable beds, stylish bathrooms and

Excellent Hotel with very kind and Helpful staff Members. Please keep up the good show. It would be good if more facilities are introduced for tourists also and also introduce breakfasts with a mix from different parts of the world as well.

title.value: Woken up two nights in a row with noise coming from ceiling cavity

content.value: Whilst the hotel itself was broadly okay, being woken up two nights in a row with a "drilling" noise when on a business trip is not really acceptable. When approached, staff investigated after the first night and said there was no drilling or works being undertaken. I was

Customer service is excellent, rooms are very clean and super comfortable, lovely views over Hyde Park. It is a great location, close to the major shopping precinct and easy walking distance to other major attractions in the CBD and Darling Harbour.

Sheraton Grand has a great central location, close to the station, park and shops and city offices. It was a great place to stay for a conference. The facilities were very good and the rooms were very well set up to be able to work from. The hotel is well staffed and I found

Loved staying here. Right near Hyde Park, right near St James station (on the airport train line). Exceptional customer service. Clean, stylish room. It was the location that worked so well for me, even though i normally prefer views. I still got a view of the sunrise over the

Location is very central to the Sydney CBD and has surrounding bars and places to visit at night time. Staff were extremely helpful and always great you with a smile and a hello. Room was perfect with most likely the most comfortable bed other than our own. We stay again for

title.value: Central hotel in vivid & fascinating neighbourhood

content.value: Excellent city hotel, service efficient & friendly. Food splendid, rooms comfortable with all facilities Rooftop swimming pool great asset. Staff most obliging : nothing too much trouble. Warmly recommended

The hotel is very nice and clean. If you are looking for a short city break,it is a good place to go. It's very close to everything. We got upgraded into suite which was huge for two people. The staffs and services were great and friendly. We had few cocktails neat the pool

title.value: Our week stay at the Sebel Manly

content.value: We were very happy with our week stay at Sebel Manly, despite all the renovation work that's happening on the North Tower. Our apartment was very well furnished, maintained, clean and bright. We did not lack anything. All the staff from the Manager to the cleaner were very

polite, courteous and extremely helpful. The newly renovated pool is very nice and will be great for the summer. We enjoyed some great meals on the ground floor of the North Tower with a fantastic view. We made a few day trips by ferry to Sydney which was great and very pleasant. The Sebel Manly is very well located and we can only recommend it. We will go back again. Edgard

My best friend and I stayed here for four nights and it was fabulous. The staff were incredibly professional as well as friendly and interested in you as a person. From the second we walked in and were met by the concierge until our leaving this morning our stay exceeded all

title.value: Great service, very comfortable hotel, centrally located

content.value: Really friendly service, very nice rooms with small touches to make the stay comfortable e.g. the robes, expresso coffee Great location to travel around Sydney. The food menu was great and I loved the art deco in the lobby, bar and restaurant areas. I would recommend this

The staff were very pleasant and welcoming. We requested a beach view room which was very good.Had a bit of trouble with the car parking as the park was very packed,otherwise everything else was fine. lots of places to eat in the vicinity of the hotel.We only had breakfast at
the hotel which was fine

A 1 night visit for a special event. We had stayed the year before and were treated like regulars. Nothing quite like waking with the morning (winter) sun streaming into your room. The rooms are a bit old, especially the bathroom but the location and ambience make up for it.
Parking is a bit messy, with 1 garage on site with very narrow access, and another across the lane which makes access a bit difficult.

item.hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park

content.value: My second stay at the Four Points and it didn‚Äôt let me down. My wife came and stayed with me for the end of this business trip and she found the hotel excellent as well. Attentive staff. Very clean rooms. We went for a short walk to spice alley, passing many shopping options on
our short walk. Bed is like sleeping on a cloud with varying pillows to choose from ensuring the best fit. Highly recommend this property.

Most of our Bridal party and family stayed at the Sebel for our wedding. Every opportunity that these guys had to go above and beyond they did. We couldn't have been happier with their service. Kyong and his staff understand the true meaning of hospitality. From coordinating

the unique needs of our large group, to the personalised, hand written cards in our room welcoming and congratulating us, to the adorable mirror art in our rooms, to the printing of important wedding documents and bringing them to our room without request and doing the same when our hamper arrived, to the Champagne and petals in the bridal suite to the warm smiles and genuine excitement for us. Here are some pictures of the view, I wish we had of gotten some with the team on duty but they had a lasting impact on us. If you're staying in Manly, we highly recommend.

We stayed in the building behind the Sebel, which we were aware of. Not as nice as being in the main building. Excited the main building is being updated and cant wait to stay. Location is the key here! Staff friendly, finding the parking was tricky. Price reasonable for off
peak.

item.hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park

content.value: I arrived in the morning, prior to the official check in time. I have ambassador status with SPG/ Marriott, and have never had an issue like this. I over heard the staff say that there was one room available, but it was a suite and they didn't want to upgrade me. So I saw in

the lobby working for 3 hours before they flipped a different room. I don't expect a suite every time I check in, but after arriving on an international flight, if one is available, I should at least be offered to use it to shower and get ready to go to my office. The lack of flexibility has me questioning if I should stay here on my next trip. Overall, the stay was great outside of this issue.

item.hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park

content.value: We stayed here for 4 night in our Australian trip. Hotel is near central railway station where its easy to travel around city. Hotel is new, rooms and beds are big and breakfast is decent. What else should you wish for place to sleep and stay?

item.hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park

content.value: Booked a quick getaway for the night with the hubby, check in was quick, customer service friendly, helpful and professional, every staff member we walked past acknowledged us and smiled, the room was super clean, Starbucks right outside, parking was easy - its additional cost

and there is auto boom gate opening (from your licence plate) but sometimes it takes a while for the camera to see the plate, its ok though as customer service is a simple button push or phone call away and they have access to open the boom gate for you after confirming your plate. Shopping centre (Central Park) a simple walk asay and lots of restaurants within walking distance, Uber and Taxi pick up right outside or public transport on the main road a few steps up. Great location, Highly recommend, Will definiteiy stay again.

item.hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park

content.value: From reception to bar attendant, cafe attendant, staff delivering toilet amenities, I must say most staff of the hotel were so friendly and they always acknowledged hotel guests, especially am Asian. Unlike the Hilton and other hotels in Sydney that I visited many times, many
years. That's what customer service is all about, it doesn't cost anything to be friendly!

What a fantastic Hotel. Attractions, transport, shopping all in easy walking distance. A wonderful lobby with gas fire and seating area to enjoy, a children‚Äôs corner and bar area. The Hotel has large rooms, excellent car parking, and restaurant. This Hotel has the best staff
ever, from the front door to the restaurant to reception, nothing is too much trouble for them to ensure a great stay. Special thanks to Nicolette and Felise for your help.

The rooms are large, beds soft and all amenities clean. Staff friendly and helpful with conference meals and endless water, tea and coffee. Fast check in and out. Walking distance from Central Railway and Chinatown. Very quiet as on a one way side street near UTS

The Novotel Sydney Central On Thomas Street is conveniently located near China town. Access is easy with loading zones directly out front and a large Wilson car paper adjacent the hotel. Rooms are well laid out and Well Equipped service was great at reception and for Room
Service The Room Service Food was surprisingly excellent and delivered promptly, My room Has 2 x king beds and still Room To move and set up ironing board

I booked 2 standard rooms at this hotel.When we arrived as a group of 8,5 adults and 3 kids, we were greeted at check in by an absolutely delightful male,(very sorry did not take note of your name). The check-in was seamless and informative. The very big thing was the way he

interacted with my grand children. The way he presented them with their arrival gifts, particularly after we had all just had a long flight, and an overpriced very long taxi trip from the airport. But that is another story. They kids were happy and excited with the way he presented them to them. . There was then an almost theatrical act as we were given drink vouchers. Thank you very much to this GSA. The room was well presented, the beds were comfortable. The reason we chose this hotel was it's proximity to Central station, Chinatown and Darling harbour. All are just a short walk away, especially when travelling with 8-11 year olds. The reason we travelled was to attend the Hugh Jackman Concert and do some shopping in the "Big Smoke" This hotel was ideally situated for our purpose. All the staff were very well trained and bent over backwards to satisfy our needs. Complaints. (Very minor) 1: perhaps Housekeeping could check behind the curtains and get rid of the spiderwebs and spiders. 2: The shower sounds like a diesel truck using compression braking when used. 3:Perhaps you have rooms that have a separate shower and bath that are not combined. Some of us prefer a shower that we do not have to climb in and out of Maybe we should have specified this when booking 4: The biggie. The rooms are set up to accommodate 4 people. They need more than 2 coffee cups! As a former Night Auditor of a Novotel resort (8 years) and currently a Night Manager of a resort , one of your rivals (Not in Sydney) I know what I expect in the way of Guest Relations. All your staff, from the Front door man, your GSA's the bar and restaurant staff and the most forgotten people, the Housekeepers were excellent. The very minor complaints I had did not affect my score of your hotel. All the staff at this hotel that we came in contact with exceeded our expectations.

Good location, the room is ok big enough and comfortable bed. The breakfast is good. When you doing the check in they give you presents for the kids and adults too, so is great and everybody is happy.

The hotel was nice. A good location, the decor was interesting. The service was fine (if a little standoffish). But the noise was unbearable. There were people screaming in the hallway at midnight, 1:30, and 3:15. Since I had an early flight out, this meant I didn't sleep at

Overall it was ok. Decor is pretty cool. Service was friendly. However I can't say it was value for money - definitely expensive for what you get. For that price I'd want a better mattress (it was way too soft and lacked support) and door access cards that worked properly.

Always great to stay in Bondi each year with the family. QT is relaxed, and the staff are young and friendly, not pretentious in any way. QT is quiet and the room, amenities and bedding are always clean and comfortable. Big screen TV with Foxtel allows you to keep in touch with

Best location, staff are exceptional and most accommodating, everything made so easy and effortless. Special thanks to Melanie and Jorge for going out of their way for supporting our stay! Annick & John Rochecouste

Was very disappointed that our room was not ready until 4 pm when I called ahead to ask if we could check in early. They gave us an upgraded room but that wasn't the point We needed to get ready for a lunch and had to get changed in the toilet down stairs. Great location nice

As we were departing for an overseas flight.in the.morning but still wanted to enjoy a night in Sydney, 57 hotel was a great location near Central station but close to restaurants and pubs for a great Sydney experience.

My second time staying here and I‚Äôve now decided it will be my regular go to when I visit Sydney. Close to station, cafes, bars in a safe area. Hotel staff are so friendly and helpful, coffee facilities in foyer are a treat as are pastries in the morning. Was able to leave

title.value: Small but comfortable however not a great location

content.value: The good was the free breakfast and coffee. Both were delicious and unlimited! But a kettle in my room would have been great for a cup of tea before bed. My room was fairly comfortable although musty smelling. The shower drain had a sewerage smell coming out of it which I

title.value: Great staff, great location, weird bathroom

content.value: We booked a triple occupancy room (one single bed and a large double) and this hotel served us well! The bathroom though...three adults sharing a room and the bathroom walls are glass. The only window in the room is in the bathroom, so the glass serves to let light in, and can

Great central location, just a short walk from central station and China town. Well appointed rooms and friendly staff. Great value. Complimentary water, coffee and pastry breakfast is a nice touch. Try the coffee at Toast cafe just a block away.

item.hotel_name: Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Town Hall

content.value: We have found ¬´¬†all is perfect¬†¬ª The view at Lebel 28 in the appartment was amazing The beds are very good The kitchen was convenient The localisation un Sydney is very good The parking is convenaient in the Town

item.hotel_name: Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Town Hall

content.value: Stayed in a 2 bedroom apt with 5 adults and it's very cosy. Nearby to the amenities such as woolsworth and shopping centres and Townhall station. Walking distance to darling Harbour. Takes around 15 mins walk. Walkable to Chinatown too. Hence its very convenient. The

item.hotel_name: Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Town Hall

content.value: Our second visit to this hotel and we are always made to feel welcome. Sabrina, one of the Managers, was very friendly and helpful. Our apartment room was clean and spacious and ideal for our visit. We will definitely come again. Excellently located close to Town Hall station

We stayed on the 11th floor on the West side of the building. Lovely water views and great view of the Observatory. I imagine the sun may be an issue in Summer but the sunset was magnificent. Lovely toiletries and a nice deep bath. Room service was excellent quality but food

could have been warmer. There is a $10 surcharge for each meal delivered to your room.Although the decor is not modern, it is well maintained and beautifully clean. Lovely selection of tea but only x 3 serves and when more requested was presented with a lesser quality tea. Friendly and obliging staff.

item.hotel_name: Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Town Hall

content.value: My stay was fantastic. Rooms were brilliant. Location was spot on, walking distance to and from Circular Quay, Darling Harbour and the Star Casino. Would definitely recommend staying there to others and would stay there again myself.

item.hotel_name: Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Town Hall

content.value: Wow what a view from our window in the 2 bedroom apartment we stayed in. You could see the city with glimpses of the Quay, which also meant amazing views of the Fireworks!! The Apartment was well set out and no noise or disturbances from other guests or the city. Highly

We stayed at Shangri-La Hotel in January 2019. This hotel was excellent and we had NO complaints because their staff and service was so great! The bathrooms were luxurious and so clean! The housekeeping staff always did a great job! The views of the opera house and Sydney Harbor

Bridge were a plus!! We would stay here again many more times! Totally worth the money! There is also a taxi stop right outside the hotel, so when you need to head back to the airport it is easy! Our flight had gotten in from the US at about 10am before check in, but the amazing staff allowed us to check in early. We had been awake for about 24 hours on flights.

title.value: "#58 of 198 Hotels in Sydney" is Probably About Right ...

content.value: Stayed in early August as a family of 4 adults and 2 children. The stay was a disappointment, given the reputation of the group as well as the high ratings (4.5 on TA) of the hotel. First the positives. The location was good, and the views were excellent -- especially from the

club lounge. The rooms were off good size, giving us ample space to fully open up all (4) of our suitcases. The staff we dealt with was generally (though not always, see below) friendly and helpful, and requests (opening the doors between 2 adjacent rooms) and problems (heater that refuses to heat) were dealt with immediately. These, however, were simply what should be expected of a top-tier 5-star hotel. Now to the negatives. The shower was the worst I have ever had _IN_ANY_HOTEL_, with weak water pressure -- it wouldn't be an overstatement to say that water just drips from the showerhead -- and (5-second) delayed response from the separate hot/cold faucets, which means water temperature was always wrong. On the first morning, staff at the Caf√© Mix tried to refuse us entry for complimentary breakfast because "you have already been to Horizon Club", when in fact my wife had only gone for coffee; even though the manager immediately rectified the problem and signed of on our entry, we had never encountered such a situation in any other hotel before (Don't comp us if you are going to be cheap about it grrr ...) Finally, despite the views, I was extremely unimpressed following my afternoon visit to the club lounge, as tables were not cleaned (after they were cleared of dishes, so clearly an extremely half-assed effort), with crumbs and leftover food on the tables, chairs and even the floor. The staff at the lounge -- with the exception of the manager -- was seemingly also just interested in "doing their jobs", which basically means any type of request from guests are a nuisance to them. Case in point, the response to my 4pm "good afternoon, check-out please" was a frown (honestly, I think the lady was like "argh, why do you people hate me!!!") As a Golden Circle Jade member, I did not get any room upgrade, did get chocolates (but did not get any choices) as welcome amenity, did get complimentary breakfast, and did get a 4pm late check-out. Points from the stay posted several days after our stay, which was also slower than the other major hotel groups. This was my first and will be my last stay at this hotel.

We were pleasantly greeted as we arrived on a late Saturday afternoon by the staff in the driveway, the porter assisted with our bags and we made our way in to the warmth of the lobby. There we were met with a line up of 7 other parties waiting to check in, their were only two

staff members behind the desk and we waited over 20 minutes to be checked in. Heading upstairs, we made our way to the room which was of decent quality, well maintained, clean and large - we had booked a Deluxe Sydney Harbour King room. After a long drive from Brisbane my partner and I felt like a quiet night in however the room service menu didn't offer many options for vegetarian or nu allergy guests so we ordered Uber Eats. We ventured out for the day to meet family arriving from USA and then returned later in the day. That afternoon we were stuck on our floor waiting as there seemed to be an issue with the elevator system not stopping on the way down, you literally had to catch the elevator to the top floor and come all the way down. We let the staff at the front know, yet they didn't seem too interested which for a top level hotel seemed surprising. Every little 1% counts when people are spending that kind of money on a room, food & bev. The bar on the top level offers amazing views, although be prepared to spend some money (but the cocktails are devine) All in all, the room was excellent - however some of the smaller things were amiss. Nothing ground breaking, but having travelled quite a lot, I can see how a lot of those little things could add up for someone and ruin the experience. On a final note, outside of the gent we spoke to about the elevators who was nonchalant the rest of the staff were excellent and delivered great service. PS. I know I already wrote 'on a final note' but then realise I forgot to mention the complimentary shoe shining service - give it a go, it is excellent ;)

We had an enjoyable stop over stay here before we went to the "piece de resistance" Melbourne cup, it was one of the best views, harbour bridge in one window and opera house in the other. Stayed 2 nights, a bit expensive and overrated but it was highly recommended by a friend.
City is too overcrowded.

We had a mishap with the in room dinning, the draw on the cart was in the wrong way and when it was pulled out to remove the food, the food went all over the floor. We had issues with people dropping in on the line for check out. Other than this we loved the room, restaurant

The hotel has now upgraded rooms and they are superb. The restaurant Mode has just had the head chef, Francesco, given the award for top hotel chef in NSW which is thoroughly deserved - the patissier/ dessert chef is also excellent - all innovative and with natural ingredients.

Just spent four nights at the Sydney Four Seasons. I‚Äôm a big fan of Four Seasons. This was my first disappointment. Service is outstanding, as always. The hotel is more Marriott though, complete with club lounge. Bar is meh, restaurant has no view, not even a street window.

There is no better place to have the bestest view on both the Opera and the Bridge! We love it! Great suites and amenities! Great breakfast! Not to mention the so very central location with streets of shops and all kind of activities around!

title.value: Four Seasons at their very best

content.value: Four members of my family stayed at the Four Seasons last month, and having worked in the hotel industry for over 30 years for the best hotels in London, what is going on here is quite remarkable. From the moment we stepped into the luscious front hall, the standard of

title.value: Don't go there... Top floor - Loft apartments.

content.value: I have stayed at the Adina many years ago and as such specifically asked to stay in the loft apartment again. Sadly it is not what it used to be. When arriving, the chap at reception rattled off all the info (room number, WiFi, key card etc) in one breath - as though he was in

a huge hurry. Specifically booked for the laundry facilities - but no detergent provided?! I got a kitchen with washing liquid... a bathroom with various toiletries... but a laundry with no laundry powder / liquid ?! The door to my room was ajar when I returned one afternoon... I report it and reception simply said "oh - sorry about that, we will tell house-cleaning to close the door" And... ??? The room is grotty - light fittings in the bathroom have seen better days. The upstairs light barely glows in the bedroom. The hook behind the bathroom door is broken. The bath mat (towelling) had a tear in it - don't really care... but does not look good. Toilet bowl is has rust stains - don't really care... but does not look good. I still don't know what the black marks are on ceiling near the vents - don't really care... but does not look good I hung my clothes on the coat hangers in the closet, only to have the entire hanging bar come unstuck and fall off. The TV channels were below par... Free to air cricket (The Ashes) nowhere to be found. Instead of finding a cleaner room when I returned in the evening - I actually found rubbish (not mine) on the floor as I walked in. Balcony looks tired. Couch looks dirty. Overall very poor. I doubt that I will be be encouraged to to recommend your hotel.

Stayed three nights end of February, 2019 along with my wife for a stopover on our way to Brisbane. Delighted with the location of hotel and facilities in the area. Reception staff were excellent on arrival and kept this standard up throughout our stay. Room was more than

adequate for what we required but some work on the windows wouldn‚Äôt go amiss. Bed and coverings were very good. Cleanliness within the room and throughout the hotel was very good. More than happy with our choice and would certainly stay again if we returned to Sydney.

Easy to access for public transport, convenient, good service, good location, nearby with facilities (restraunt) (market), wonderful experience to stay there. Highly recommended to all who wants find a apartment hotel

This apartment hotel is the old Post Office building. It's right next to the Central Station, but there were no issues with noise from the trains or the main roads that run in front of the hotel. The kitchen was equipped well for cooking. We used the dishwasher, washing machine

and dryer! The rooms and bathrooms were very spacious. We had a 2 bedroom apartment which had 2 bathrooms, therefore, ideal for a family of 5. The supermarket is a 5 minute walk which has everything you may need. There are so many places to eat nearby, It's a 45 minute walk to Sydney Opera House, but 25minutes to the high street shops or 15minutes to the harbourside. We would definitely stay here again.

We last visited only for a night 2 years ago and said we would stay again. This time we stayed for 4 nights in a 1 bedroom suite. Location was extremely convenient, we made good use of the trains. Staff were all excellent, could not do enough for us. Having a washer and dryer in

the apartment was a real bonus - its amazing how much washing you seem to accumulate on holiday. We haven't given this 5 stars as the decor is getting little worn, shower pressure was below average, TV was well undersized for the space - Beds/linen however were great. Would definitely stay again, especially in the 1 bedroom suite that had plenty of space for the 2 of us to move about in

title.value: Typical Meriton standard but not the best location for me

content.value: Spent one night here and then moved to another Meriton to be closer to my centre of operations which was further north. I didn't like the room much but couldn't put my finger on why as it was similar to other Meritons. Negatives: Fridge didn't work and lost a load of fresh

Very clean, convenient position for shopping and restaurants and spacious rooms. Close to theatres and Chinatown. Excellent facilities in room. Would be excellent if we had 4 cups and glasses. Parking provided in nearby carpark.

title.value: Handy location for business in the CBD

content.value: Large rooms. Reasonably quiet street in CBD mere minutes from Central Station. Some traffic noise esp during overnight George Street building works, but tolerable. Pool, spa and sauna are well maintained and always ready for use. Life three always seems to be out of service

It is a very good experience to stay in the suit with clean and tidy environment. the location is convenient in which at the heart of the CBD. The coffee maker is a very good machine and easy to operate.

title.value: Nice location, amenities, gym, but the elevators hardly function

content.value: Stayed three 5 weeks. Room is fine. Liked the washing machine, fridge, comfortable bed. But 2 out of 4 elevators weren't working for the entire stay, which sometimes included the service elevator. So entering and exiting was always a gamble. Added a full 10 minutes to my commute

title.value: It‚Äôs the small touches that count

content.value: We just had the BEST night at QT Sydney. The hotel is exceptional, the rooms are just fabulous and the decor to die for. There are so many thoughtful and surprising touches that just complete the experience from the bath bombs to the espresso martini set (complete with cocktail

The reception, service, and accommodation was wonderful. Alison gave exceptional service upon reception. It didn't feel like checking into a typical hotel on business. It felt more like being a guest at someone's home who cares. Thank you.

As a couple we often like to stay a night in the city to take in a show or just the city vibe. QT was a perfect fit. Comfortable, stylish, and a great location. The staff are super friendly and there are good options for a drink and quick bite or a hearty breakfast.

title.value: visually stunning, loved the chic design, furnishings and beautiful bed!

content.value: Me and my daughter were stranded in Sydney for an extra couple of days due to flight cancellations and we had the most delightful rest and re-invigoration in this beautiful and chic hotel . We loved the trendy furnishings and design and loved our bed and had a beautiful spa

Came to Sydney for the weekend to celebrate my 60th birthday with a few friends. We had 4 rooms. We were all upgraded and I was guest of the day. I received 2 cocktail vouchers, a bottle of wine with a handwritten card acknowledging my birthday, chocolates, a tea cup and saucer

title.value: A nice stay near Paddys Market and Central station

content.value: A boutique hotel located within walking distance from Central station and Paddys Market. (7-10min walk) We even walk back to the hotel from Fish Market and Darling Harbour after our heavy dinners. (probably 15-20min walk) The room size was great, spacious with sofa and a small
table where you can eat light snacks. Plenty of space in the toilet basin top to put your toiletries.

We stay four days (June 28 to July 1, 2019) in family room. The hotel is located in quite place in University complex. We booked room only and have our own breakfast. The staff are friendly and accomodating, we can have early check in at 12.30 and leave our bags after check out

because we had evening flight to Melbourne. Arif, the hotel staff, was really helpful with all the explanation of things around. We use Ola for transportation so we didn't need to walk to bus/metro stop. About two blocks walking, we'll find minimarket and Power House museum.

title.value: Loudest hotel we've ever stayed in.

content.value: We booked this hotel online. The location was off a quiet side street. The lobby looked great and the room look really nice. No problem at all there. But the room we were given was on the lower level and faced the front of the the hotel. You could hear everything extremely loud!

People talking and bringing in luggage seemed to echo through the room. People shutting hallway doors sounded like a construction zone. Trucks would go by and you could feel the vibrations. We could even hear our neighbors sneezing, talking and having loud sex. With all this on going noise we could not sleep. We asked to move rooms but they said they were fully booked. We couldn't move hotels because we prebooked and it was not refundable. So we suffered through the first night. Staff was kind and said they could move us the second night, which they did. The second room was on the back of the building on an upper level. It seemed a lot quieter. But you could still hear every time someone closed a door or sneezed. Or even if housekeeping came down the hall. Seems like the building need mores sound proofing or at least down the hallways. Two days later we saw a bill on our room! We called right away. We had been charged for car parking while staying there. We didn't even travel there by car. No one asked us they just charged our credit card. Now we have to dispute it and try to get it refunded. Even though the rooms looked very nice and were spacious, I would not stay here again due to these main issues.

title.value: Very confortable stay at the Metro Aspire Hotel -Sydney

content.value: This was my second stay at the refurbished Metro Aspire. It was good. I have a large room, clean and spacious. Staff friendly. Location is good, a short walk (10 mins) to Market city/China Town. I would definitely stay again.

Great location, clean rooms, parking, loved the venue. My wife and I could highly recommend this place as it was easy to get to and close to the heart of Sydney. The building is surrounded by some of Sydney‚Äôs historical buildings such a beautiful are.

Great simple hotel that is well priced and conveniently located. 28 always has pleasant staff, and everything I need in a room for a business trip. The luggage storage is very convenient, plus the 24 hour desk is great for late checkins. I will be back (again).

Superior location, just one block around the corner your can try out local food from plenty of choice, and do some shopping of cosmetic products. With 5 min walk you can reach out one of the biggest department store for luxury brands and duty free shopping. Very good services,

the staffs welcome you with smile. Free welcome drink and snack. The room is relatively big in size with trendy decoration style. They provide you with plenty of water per days, plus free mini bar. Been to this hotels twice and definitely will consider to stay again next time.

title.value: Good Location, small but clean room

content.value: The hotel is really near to the Central Railway Station. Room is small but clean. However, the bed is too soft for us. Reception staff are very polite and friendly. Moreover, there is a mini bar in reception so we can drink tea or coffee in any time.

Look.... it‚Äôs a bare bones hotel. I was after a room with a tv and a bed.... I did not intend to spend my stay in Sydney entirely in my room requiring some of the more fine aspects of other hotels. There are no coffee making facilities in the room though there is s free coffee
machine located in the lobby. On my arrival the lobby did smell of stale milk, though that disappeared after a few days. The staff were friendly and welcoming, always a plus

Close to train station therefore easy access to airport and anywhere in Sydney CBD. Price is great for such a central location. Room is small but clean. Staff are efficient. Coffee machine and free muffins in lobby are great when you have a busy schedule. The only thing that
lets this hotel down is the look of the carpet - it has a dated and tired look of an old office.

Thanks for a great stop over. Felt very welcomed and the staff was awesome. only thing is I got 2 king singles when I asked for 2 king beds. No big deal. Proximity to Chinatown was a plus and thanks for the welcome drinks.

I cannot praise the team @ Novotel Sydney Darling Square from my wife, my 5-month old daughter and myself. Our experience started with a Qantas Hotels mistake, whereby our stay at the Holiday Inn was bounced to Seasons Darling Harbour. My wife and I have travelled around the

world but neither of of us had come across a premise as decrepit and unhygienic as the Seasons. Our room would have light up like a rave party should someone be brave enough to shine a black-light through the premise. Remembering our stay in 2015 (from our honeymoon in 2015), we grabbed our bags and headed for the Novotel Sydney Darling Square at 7PM on Tuesday night (13th August 2019). We were greeted by Nicholas (the Duty Manager) and from that point our lives were improved immensely and within 20 minutes, we had a room, an exquisite meal and comfort for our infant daughter. The excellent service on Tuesday night continued on Wednesday (today) with a card from the team and a followup from Nicholas wanting to ensure our stay was perfect. I cannot convey how this level of commitment to guests is appreciated by ourselves & made us feel more than welcome.

Attended conference at Sydney Convention Centre Darling Harbour for 2 days. The Novotel Sydney Darling Square was such a great location and service was excellent. Comfortable and clean room. Breakfast menu was a lovely surprise!
