We had plans at the opera house and wanted to stay somewhere close. The Vibe is about a 25 minute walk through the Royal Botanical Gardens, which are free and worth the walk, to the opera house. The staff at the hotel were all super friendly and the view of the bay and
surrounding area from the rooftop pool and gym are incredible.

Had a very Pleasant Stay, was made to feel very welcome at check-in as was presented with an upgrade to my initial booking and the overall service was outstanding. No complaints at all. Would highly recommend the establishment .

We booked last minute after a long day at the airport dealing with flight cancellations. Staff on arrival were really friendly & listened to us complaining about our stressful day, which after dealing with grumpy airport staff all day was really appreciated! They also gave us

free drinks vouchers & late check out, which was a nice little surprise! Buffet breakfast the next morning was great & we hung around in the hotel most of the day using the wifi, pool etc. Room was clean & quiet but the friendly hotel staff really made our stay!

title.value: Nothing else matters, stay at Rushcutters!

content.value: From check in to check out, this was a very comfortable stay. I only wish it was longer than one night. Room service was excellent, both food and service and one of the better night's sleep I've had. A definite return to on my next visit.

Wonderful staff upon check in, really lovely and great customer service. Room was nice, bathroom clean, pleasant stay. Hotel is a great location. Check out wasn‚Äôt a great experience, the person was really quite rude which was really disappointing.

The room was very nice clean and quite adequate. THE RESTAURANT I COULD NOT RECOMMEND AND FOR THIS REASON WE WENT ELSEWHERE FOR BREAKFAST as I was not going to take the chance of it being as bad as dinner.

title.value: Not bad, but room for improvement.

content.value: Got overcharged. Online booking confirmation was substantially lower than actual charge. Pillows were way too soft and so spent most of the night wrestling with it and woke up with a bad neck. Breakfast restaurant was understaffed with all tables needing clearing when we go
there.

I was surpirsed to see upon arrival not only a great location but a wonderful room at a great price! I would recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone!! The Italian restaruant nearby was very good and it was within walking distance to transport and sights. I think it is

my friend and i stayed at the grace for a few nights for our friends wedding. staff were nice! rooms clean only issue we had was a coke was out of date and they never brought it up to us while we were there. pillows are really hard. other than that the Italian restaurant next

The rooms are very clean and quiet. I am always very comfortable. Room service is quite quick and the staff are very polite and professional. I always try to stay at The Grace on my trips to Sydney for work or pleasure

Great Special Rates for spacious double rooms with two double beds in Sydney CBD, close to amenities. Look up daily rares. Good Service. Only drawback was that it the deposit taken for extras was fully charged to the room although no extras was taken. So check your bills

My wife and I had booked a Superior Room at $186 for a Friday night to attend a concert nearby. Life doesn't always go as planned, my wife spent to the night in intensive care in hospital and I went to the concert and stayed here overnight. Reception staff were very

item.hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park

content.value: Situated near universities, in a central location. Darling Harbour is within 10-12 minutes walk. Shopping and restaurants nearby including a Starbucks opposite. Could tell it‚Äôs a new hotel. Everything new and clean. Room was more spacious than expected. Comfortably appointed.

item.hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park

content.value: My wife and I stayed for 5 nights in May in this hotel. This is a mid-range hotel and a Sheraton sub-brand. It is quite new and well situated in a part of town close to the universities and tucked in a quiet corner but yet sufficiently close to the city centre. There are quite

item.hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park

content.value: Spent 4N here. Check-in was swift in the small and simply decorated lobby... and not moment too soon as the front desk was soon checking-in a busload of tourists (this seems to be very popular with large tour groups). As a Plat, I was upgraded to a suite, with a large toilet and

item.hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park

content.value: Great hotel. Location is superb, walking distance from a lot of Sydney's main attractions, and still at a very reasonable price... I got an upgraded suite, very nicely equipped, but with zero views :) The food is nice and the staff are very friendly. Hit the Malt bar at happy

item.hotel_name: Four Points by Sheraton, Sydney Central Park

title.value: My Only Regret is We Couldn‚Äôt Stay Longer

content.value: My party of 7 (with 4 young kids) came in late after a rough, delayed flight. Then we had to leave at 6am the next morning. So my stay was short but I could not have been more impressed with the hotel and the staff. Henrik (not sure of spelling) was incredibly helpful in

Nice spacious appartment with everything you need. Washer and dryer makes it very complete. Looking a bit tired though. Some stains in the carpet. Friendly staff. Centrally located. Shower is too low for tall people.

Great place for a catch up with friends. The property is very central, handy to everything with great amenities. Friendly and helpful staff. Overall a great stay would definitely stay again and recommend to others.

Such a comfy bed which was a main priority for me! The room was really clean and had everything we needed! The staff were really friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay again and would recommend to others to stay!

title.value: Below par... Paid wifi and water even

content.value: The rooms are quite old and not like any of the modern hotel room. Like 8 to 10 years back dated. On the pretext of tap water being potable, none of the 3 water bottles which includes an Evian bottle is free like in any normal hotel worldwide. Basically everything you see in

the room is chargeable. Even the Wifi is chargeable with a daily fee of AUD 10. I don't seem to understand the reason for any of the above. This is the 3rd hotel I have checked in to in Australia as I have a long trip. Crazy!

title.value: Novotel Sydney Central is just that

content.value: Novotel Sydney Central is in a fantastic location, so accessible to many parts of Sydney being so close to Central Station. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the food was great as well. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in.

Reception staff, esp night staff , were extremely rude, intrusive and intimidating. Interrogated me about friends who came to visit. When I complained to day reception staff, their response was dismissive at best. Won't be booking here again.

An excellent location for anyone living outside the Sydney Metropolitan area. We live on the Central Coast and the accessibility of the train at Central is a real plus.It's also a great location for stays where there is a need to get to the airport following the hotel

title.value: Great location, good place to stay

content.value: Stayed in this hotel between 13th to 16th Aug‚Äô19, room number 1010. The primary highlight is the location of this hotel with access to Train and bus made it easy to travel around and it‚Äôs seamless. The breakfast is good, there is always one Indian cousin which I liked it

personally. Feedback to hotel, (a) check-in and check-our experience can be better. We had to wait for long in both case (b) room lighting to be better, after turning ON all the lights too the room was dull, it was really difficult to read anything after 6pm.

Perfect room for one on business travel, probably a little cosy for 2 but I'm sure they would have other larger rooms to choose from. Comfy bed with extra pillows and blankets in the wardrobe, big tv mounted to the wall in the corner of the room, good wifi and good black out

blinds. I'm not a fan of showers over the bath with no mixer tap and no proper door but the pressure and the temperature were fine. Good location for the train station. McDonald's, Subway etc right over the road. Great breakfast. Dinner was fine but not exceptional - for the price I would probably choose to head down to Darling Harbour or to Surry Hils for a bit more atmosphere. Gym is tiny, no free weights or floor space and so much condensation on the windows that the advertised city views were impossible to see.

I work in hospitality and this is the best hotel customer service I have experienced in many years. Everyone from check-in to housekeeping, breakfast and check-out, all the staff were exceptionally helpful and happy. This is our third stay at Novotel Central and every stay has

Really hard to rate this hotel, some things were good others average. The location is very good, walking distance to the Market, Darling Harbour, Capital theatre. The hotel itself is old and tired looking compared with other Novotel I've stayed at in Sydney. This is a 4 star

title.value: Perfect Location, Nice Rooms, Breakfast OK.

content.value: I stayed 4 nights at the Mercure Syndey and absolutely loved the location of this hotel. Literally 2-5 minutes (depending on walking speed) from central station, which easily got us to Featherdale Wildlife Park. Central station is also a stop on the hop on hop off bus, so you

can actually have a stop right there. In addition to being so close to transportation, across the street, you have a Sushi Hub (my go-to lunch option while I was in Australia that I wish would come over to the U.S.) as well as a Chemist's Warehouse, a McDonald's, a KFC, a 7-Eleven, and ez-marts (what we in NY call bodegas). The hotel itself is beautiful and the staff is very nice and friendly. There is a store in the hotel lobby where you can pick up drinks, snacks, and I even saw some souvenirs but I wouldn't buy them at the hotel personally. It's just very convenient having the option to grab a drink before heading up for someone like us who got to the hotel very late the first night (around 11:30PM) and didn't want to go looking for somewhere to pick something up or got back to the hotel after a long day of sightseeing and forgot to purchase drinks before getting to the hotel. Rooms were clean and, although on the smaller side when I compare it to our hotel in Melbourne, it was actually bigger than I had expected based on pictures I viewed on Expedia prior to arriving. The lack of space only got a little annoying because limited floor space meant luggages were covering what walking space there was in the room, but it's not a big deal and can easily be overlooked considering the excellent location and the rates compared to other hotels. Oh, just in case it helps anyone, in our room, we had one outlet. And between the beds, there were two USB charging ports. The only thing I would recommend to the hotel to improve on is breakfast. The breakfast buffet was very limited in options for picky eaters. And while it was nice to see that they changed the buffet options daily, for someone like my son who is extremely picky, it was very difficult finding him something he liked. On our first morning, he was content with the pancakes, but the next day they didn't offer it. I do appreciate that the staff was accommodating and made an order for him, but I would improve the selection in general. I was also surprised there was no option to order an omelette, which is usually standard in most hotel buffet breakfasts. Again, not the end of the world, but something that could improve the breakfast for guests. I added that there is parking for a fee at this hotel, but I would double-check on the official site to make sure. I just remember noticing a sign by the reception desk that mentioned parking fees for visitors and guests of the hotel (it might be a different amount depending on if you're staying at the hotel or just visiting). Overall, I can highly recommend a stay at the Mercure Sydney hotel.

My family stayed at the Mercure Hotel in Sydney, Australia in August and had a great time. The location is very good as a central location for seeing the city; next to the central train station and light rail. It is a short walk to Darling Harbour and Paddy‚Äôs market (shopping).

The staff is very friendly (which we learned is embedded in Australian culture) and the breakfast very good with a wonderful variety of food (including Asian dishes). The rooms were on the small side but clean and nice (but strangely didn‚Äôt have drawers for clothes). There was a small indoor pool and gym as well as a restaurant and pub. Overall a nice place to stay while sightseeing.

Novotel Sydney Central Hotel is located in the Haymarket area of Sydney. Walking distance to Darling Harbour, Chinatown, the UTS & Powerhouse Museum. Excellent hotel rooms are comfortable, spacious and well appointed. The hotel has a pool, restaurant and bar. The staff are

title.value: Convenience location but lots of cockroaches in the room!

content.value: Booked Novotel Sydney Central for 4 nights family holiday. I was going to use my Accor account to do the booking but found I have a lot of points left in Agoda reward so changed it to Agoda for booking. The check in process in the hotel was fast and the lady who assisted me was

The hotel was fabulous. Our room was beautifully appointed. The breakfast buffet was amazing and offered every kind of food you could want. The hotel location was perfect for us. I did think the valet charge of $68 was too much.

Location is strategic, room is spacious (it has walk in closet), amenity is good, gym has many life fitness equipments which is good. I booked for city side room. It has If you are not into the view then go for it.

The stay at the Sheraton in Sydney was to celebrate my wife‚Äôs birthday so I was really pleased that our room was so clean, well appointed and comfortable. The Sheraton staff listened when I mentioned that this was a birthday trip and added a nice touch with a small birthday cake

Hotel is a great place to stay when in Sydney close to everything shops train station opera house. The hotel is of very high standard, rooms are large and bathroom. Bed is luxurious and very clean and well kept. The restaurant is great and very friendly and helpful staff

I stayed here for work and personal. The hotel was clean, well positioned in the CBD and staff were friendly. I really enjoyed the food and overall found the hotel good value for money. I will be back

My friend and I visited Sydney and stayed here a couple of nights. The hotel was really nice, had a decent restaurant with a good happy hour, rooftop pool, and in a decent location (walking distance to Kings Cross or short bus ride to downtown Sydney). Sabrina (and the rest of

My family‚Äôs visit to the Vibe at Rushcutters was outstanding. Fantastic, friendly and always helpful staff. Set on a fantastic park on a beautiful bay and pet friendly! Our room was nicely appointed and very clean. We also stayed in a suite which was very roomy and made our stay

Very easy location and parking, we went to the Opera that evening and it was very easy to get a cab there and back. Love the location next to the park - always nice to have a walk in the morning before check out. Will stay again!

Good reliable no fuss location & service, with a bit of style. Quiet. üëåüëåüëåüëåüëå. (Nothing else to say but this silly app demands 200 characters. Fine, low price, good location , not flash but reliable.)

title.value: Fantastic hotel in a great location

content.value: I was delighted to be welcomed back to this hotel and be upgraded as I stay here regularly when I‚Äôm in Sydney. The location in Rushcutters Bay is close to everything but without the hectic feeling of inner Sydney. Great to get up and have a walk in the park and around the

The outside of this Hotel looks quite bland and maybe a bit dated. But nothing could have been further from the truth when I walked in through the front doors. The reception and lobby areas were modern and very inviting. The staff were very friendly and warm. The best though

The room is spacious and good for Family to Stay. You can walk around 15 mins to Central Station / Light Rail Stop / Supermarket / China Town. The wifi connection at the room is not stable. There is no self laundry washing machine.

Nice clean room friendly staff and helpful close to everything u need bars the wax cricket round and over the river the Optus stadium lots of stories and not so far from the centre for shopping if that what u want

Great location clean spacious rooms. clean bathrooms. parking onsight, walk to darling harbour, not your large hotel but still great location. Stunning setting for breakfast in which the water feature is a nice touch. will stay again.

Room was beautifully presented and very comfortable. Easy walk from Central station and not far to Darling Harbour either. Hotel was nice and quiet. Staff were friendly and efficient. Will stay there again.

What is the use of the Privilege Check-in and check-out counter when we have been asked to move twice to the regular counter? Im a Gold Member but have felt like a regular guest, far different from my stay at Sofitel and Fairmont.

We chose to stay at this hotel as it is 2 minute walk to Central Station. The minute we walked in to check in, we were greeted with very friendly faces. Our room was clean and comfortable. Needed another face washer as there was only one for a two person room. We had black out

title.value: Convenience area, good transportation access, near china town, paddy's market,

content.value: Hotel location is very good, it is very closed to China Town & Paddy's market. If you dont mind walking, you can also walk to Darling Harbour. As for our hotel room is comfortable & clean, good view but too bad hotel doesnt provide free mineral water in the room. Staffs

I personally think the shower over the bath in the room we stayed in was dangerous as there was no hand rails to hold onto as being short it was hard to get into for both me and my partner. We were told about the bath over shower when we booked in but didn't check until we had

The rooms are always clean, very comfortable and the staff go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. Breakfast was great, although a little noisy but that is not the fault of the hotel at all. I will definately be coming back

title.value: It started badly and no fault of Mecure Syndney amd emded great.

content.value: I travelled with my elderly parents and husband. We just got off the Pacific Explorer at 10am. We caught a taxi to the Mercure. Luggage, parents and husband unloaded. Checked all the above and phones when Dad realized his wallet was missing. The head Consige Adam went above

title.value: Good proximity to train station and clean & tidy.

content.value: Pleasantly surprised to be upgraded from queen bed studio to a one bedroom apartment. Heated pool is open from 7am which was clean and warm. The gym is open earlier and there is a spa. Room was spacious and very clean. There isn't a guide to the area or the hotel in the room

The Adina Apartment Hotel Sydney Central is perfectly located next to Central Station and within shopping and business precinct. Room was comfortable, clean and spacious, although heating only satisfactory. Would like to have had a compendium in the room with hotel information

We stayed a week here, the apartment was very spacious, right next to the main train station, although no restaurant on site, there is an array of cafes, bars and takeaways, the supermarket was easy walking distance too. the pool and spa are outside and kept very clean,

We stayed on two separate nights and on both occasions were upgraded. The reception staff were friendly and remembered us on the second occasion and the reason for our visit to NSW, and were extremely professional. The standard of the accommodation was excellent - clean, roomy

Such an exquisite place to stay.staff were helpful friendly and informative, bed very comfortable, food beautiful. Modern and lovely. A whole world you didn‚Äôt want to leave. Will stay again soon. Thankyou.

Very friendly staff, large rooms with USB charging ports, large walk in robe, good area to do work. Pool temperature was slightly too cool, would be good if they heated a little more. Breakfast buffet excellent

My family of four checked in on August 7th for 6 days. We booked two rooms with lounge access so that our teens could also enjoy the lounge. Some people have left reviews about the food and the lounge views, but it‚Äôs the people that truly made our stay great! Specifically,

title.value: I've stayed for years and this hotel is changing

content.value: This hotel has been my Sydney Mainstay for many years. It has a downtown location in the Central Business District (CBD) and is one block away from their pedestrian shopping streets. The hotel overlooks Hyde Park a most beautiful green park with a fountain and war memorial and

Quiet well appointed room with very comfy bed and pillows. My room included free wifi and because it wasn‚Äôt quite ready at check in I received a free breakfast which I appreciated. Breakfast buffet was ample with plenty to choose from, with proper barista coffee instead of

title.value: excellent stay at the Asprire Hotel

content.value: We have stayed several times at the Aspire Hotel when visiting Sydney. The location is very good being close to the Power House Museum, Tram, China Town, markets and Darling Harbour. Always excellent value for money

title.value: we chose the property because Hot wire stated it was 4 star and the price it advertised Actually the Hotel is 2 star it

content.value: we chose the property because Hot wire stated it was 4 star and the price it advertised Actually the Hotel is 2 star it felt like STUDENT DORM Please remove the 4 STAR FROM website as we will be disputing the charge

This hotel is very good value, considering its central location to the CBD, Inner West, University of Sydney and UTS. It is very quiet and my room had a balcony facing the the park behind it, which was lovely. I highly recommend it.

I enjoyed staying at the Metro Hotel - the room was terrific and it is very conveniently located in Sydney. My stay was only short but everything was very easy and the staff were friendly. It was a special advertised deal which made it very competitive - recommended.

We had a short stay to catch up with friends and family in the city. We have stayed at the Metro Aspire on several occasions and love that it is great value for money, easy to get to, has a secure car park which we can leave our car for the duration of our stay as we could

title.value: Good hotel at an awesome price

content.value: We got a 2 night deal on this hotel through Groupon and it was fantastic value. At $330 for 2 nights, we got bed and breakfast for a family of 4 in the heart of Sydney. Room - on the wish list would be two queen beds instead of double just for comfort but the pillows were

Stayed for one night (Room 1232). Room was so comfortable with a great view facing north. Staff were very helpful and most professional. The buffet breakfast was superb. Thank you for a most enjoyable stay.

title.value: Great place to stay in Sydney

content.value: Stayed many times at the Mercure. Great location because its on a transport route. Walking distance to Darling Harbour and the Markets . etc. Not forgetting the Mercure itself has a great Bar/Restaurant . Keep up the good work Mercure.

title.value: Such an amazing place to stay!!

content.value: Such amazing customer service, everyone is super friendly, willing to help out. Plenty of staff around, clean and tidy rooms. Beautiful heated indoor pool with magnificent views!! Super close to transport options. Room service has a huge selection with huge amazing meals that

We were lucky to get the Sheraton‚Äôs 1/2 price high tea special, $34.50 instead of $70 per person.... honestly would not pay full price, but it‚Äôs lovely and the food beautiful, but a buffet high tea, kinda weird not having the 3/4 tiered plate thing in the middle of the table

When I come to Sydney I always stay at the Sheraton Grand Sydney Hyde Park. The staff are very obliging and nothing is too much trouble. The restaurants are great and the room is very comfortable and clean.

Nice property located at the center of Sydney and recommended for Business travellers only. This is not family friendly by any yard or stretch. Nice property located at the center of Sydney and recommended for Business travellers only.

title.value: Luxe hotel brilliant location and amenity. Room was spacious and spa/gym best in class. Seafood buffet lunch delightful.

content.value: Recent upgrade of hotel very tasteful. Comfortable room and serviced well. Good customer service and fast check in and check out which is essential for business travel. Good coffee station. Grand ballroom nicely presented.

Very nice hotel, very nice room. But staff does not seem to be very welcoming to people who enjoy stays in hotels in a relaxed way. Nice bar, nice wine. Location very good. But not relaxed at all. Sorry.

The Sheraton Grand Hotel in Sydney offers: a wonderful location, Versace stores so near! An excellent buffet breakfast, service upstairs and downstairs was impecable. Thanks for all the effort the employees make to make me feel at home, away from home! (Although everybody forgot

The check in counter staff was very friendly and professional. However, the cleaning Asian lady was very rude, when I asked for some towels for my room, because I did not have my room serviced. The hotel room was spacious but the swimming pool was very small. The gym was

I stayed at the Sheraton for a medical seminar. The facilities were top notch, the catering awas great and the service as expected from a leading establishment. The gym is well equipped, the rooms spacious, comfortable and upgraded with the modern accoutrements of a smart abode.

title.value: Great location, facilities and friendly staff

content.value: It is our first time stay in Sheraton Grand Sydney Hyde Park, other than the location is convenient, and the staff is friendly, the most enjoyable experience is with the rooftop pool, spa and sauna. we will definitely visit it again.
